qYm4pl3KfdAQ2dISb9kbcQ.text: I love the Habanero Wings. If you are a wing lover like me Bahama Breeze provides a unique spin that you won't find anywhere else. The wings were all a good size and it's served with a nice flavored sour cream that perfectly complements the flavor of the wings and balanced the spice of the Habanero.  My server Devin was also very friendly and attentive.  I had a great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Habanero Wings

GZybjc2w9ttXd3Qz4qN1MA.text: We come here periodically when we have out of town guests.  Everyone seems to enjoy the menu and food. I finally decided to write a review of 2 visits this past week.  The first was mid-week with a party of 10.  There was a special lunch menu that offered perfect portions.  Everyone loved the salads and I love the beef empanadas.  The food was very tasty and was served fresh and hot items were hot.  The service couldn't have been better.   We went again on Sunday and got the same great service by Alexis H. and the food was again very good.  We appreciate that the service and food here are so consistently wonderful.

Wyo_Hgt8jn3tdh1-ETaykg.text: Great place! Had a Birthday reservation there and they were completely helpful, the staff. The food was really good. Jamaican food with Caribbean vibes. They were busy, but that didn't delay the food orders. Would definitely recommend.

bo9MA8cf4NCxHaBpYJFOBA.text: I had the jerk sliced chicken breast with bow tie pasta in the smaller portion. This was excellent I would order again. My husband had a burger with bacon and cheddar which he says was excellent. I also ordered a Bloody Mary and wouldn't recommend this. If the drink was better I'd of given it a five star. We will return next month.

uPIVj1gNRR0ock3c_F6vWA.text: Late Happy Hour around the fire with apps was just what we needed after a long day of travel, sight seeing and shows. The service was FANTASTIC, the appetizers excellent and the drinks strong. It was a spur of the moment choice that I am happy we made.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo Lobster Shrimp Stack
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken truck taco tacos.

TYx0rbRum_17v3GVVOPgyA.text: Never been here before, but I had a gift certificate. My daughter & I came. We started out with ultimate pineapple drink. Yum!! Ordered spinach dip. Super yummy.  Then dinner. We both ordered the tenderloin pork with sweet potatoes. It came and my daughter is allergic to mango. We thought we read it carefully. It said nothing about the pineapple salsa, which had mango.  Our server (Travis) was awesome he took it away & made her a new one without salsa. Will definitely look for another Bahama Breeze near us. Great job.

mXfrA8flDOgYNygxUqm7_g.text: I've never tried Caribbean inspired food before so when my friend took us here, I was in for a pleasant surprise. Upon entering the restaurant, I loved the decor and the ambiance in general. They had live music the night that we went, which added to our wonderful experience here. Our waitress was such a sweet heart and she gave us some very good meal suggestions. The food was delicious! I highly recommend, especially if you've never had any Caribbean style food before.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate island
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttermilk Fried Chicken Breast

Zm50nBCap45tkxsz3PqEDA.text: Luis always makes the best drinks and the happy hour can't be beat. One of mine and my girlfriends favorite spots for our night off

hPeorOW-QkO0rspCi-hsIw.text: This is my go to spot for Happy Hour! Great drinks and appetizers with friends that will not break you if you are budgeting. The server and bartenders are fun as well. A lot of my friend who come to visit are jealous because many of the Bahama Breezes don't have this type of happy hour or has closed. I also love the burger for lunchtime. Nice and juicy.  Daytime Happy Hour is Monday - Thursday, 4pm-6pm Late Night Happy Hour is Sunday - Thursday 9pm-Close

ujK4W43UTar5o3C_Kpv1bw.text: Can't say I'm a huge fan of the place, but it is ok for large groups.   I'd never heard of this place before I moved to Vegas, but my friend recommended it one night years ago for dinner. I had my reservations once I realized it was owned by the Darden Group, since I'm not a huge fan of Olive Garden and Red Lobster, but I held back on my complaints.  I've tried several dishes here over the years and some are hit or miss. The portabello mushroom sandwich lacked flavor and texture and it wasn't as hearty as I was hoping for. I tried a pasta dish on my last visit which I actually quite enjoyed, however.  Overall, what I really like about the restaurant is that it's a great place for groups. There are lots of spaces to socialize and and private places. I've even seen weddings and receptions held in the private area. They also have a great little happy hour.

R6_cBZBvXTWF2D0B1wVqPQ.text: Amazing service, my first time there & was seated down immediately and food was quick! Didn't remember the name of our server but he was excellent

uhWn7XpzHMqUdmvA_ferIg.text: We missed the lunch crowd, so it was somewhat quiet. However, after having a couple of Pina Coladas, my girl friend and I were glad we didn't have to worry about folks thinking we were laughing too loudly! I think I had some kind of jerked shrimp dish, which was excellent. The bartender was extremely pleasant and a native Chicagoan to boot! I will definitely visit there when I'm next in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zsYs5KgQ_Ab0tkgaJ1JRwg.text: Yum yum yum...  The lobster mac is EVERYTHING.  The drinks were measured and everyone knows thats not my thing...but still worth it.  The bartender told me that happy hour started again from 9pm to 12 am, so as a visitor I really appreciated the great service.  I also met a great new friend here...so what more can I ask for!  4 stars because it feels like a chain and again drinks are measured.

5DuGQ8AfnJHma0__PbrqkA.text: Ate here with the bf about 2 years ago I'm surprised I haven't written my review. Oh well better late than never right?   We ordered the jerk chicken, coconut shrimp, seafood paella and warm chocolate pineapple upside down cake for dessert. The coconut shrimp was "yummilicious" (Maggie C I'm stealing your  adjective). Just the right amount of crunchy batter on the outside and plump and juicy shrimp inside. The jerk chicken was ok, I was expecting a little more heat, but then again that's just me and my taste buds. The seafood paella was the bomb. Not as good as my grandma's but close enough so that really says a lot. Of course I had to leave room for dessert. Warm chocolate pineapple upside down cake. Need I say more? It's got three of my most favorite food in the world: chocolate, pineapple and caramel syrup. Yes warm and uber moist chocolate cake topped with juicy, tangy pineapple slice on a bed of gloriously rich and gooey caramel syrup. Love it! Can't wait to go back for more.

iO3PxCGUh1L3NJMHsQyF-Q.text: Newer items and portion smaller. Quality still good as well as drinks are strong. Price for two about 80.00. Great family place and a nice location away from strip. Still had to box home so portions that are sliced are not really that small.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New happy hour. Sun to thurs. 9 to close. Yay!

pBxQOCF87CnI3ptvzpm6kw.text: I was recommended the coconut shrimp and I was not disappointed by the coconut shrimp tacos I ordered. Yum!

dA-4vf5CzTXuVfefZpkCpA.text: Excellent food and service. The place is huge though and the noise a bit to loud for my taste.  We were quickly seated and served by Donna, which was such a nice girl! Very observant all the way!  Had a mojito which was delicious - not many people can make a great mojito, I think.  Had the shrimp linguine which was delicious too.  My dad had the lobster linguine which I tasted and it sadly enough did not taste of that much.  Ended the meal with a dulce de leche cheese cake which was soooo delicious and so sinful to eat as it contains about 900cal according to the menu card.   I also had a margarita with my dulce de leche cake, which I will not recommend unless you really like tequila as it is really dominating in the drink.   I am sad that the place was so big and loud as the food and the service was excellent.

KzWdoutmdg3CHCttdAIe6g.text: I haven't been here in about 10 years decided to try out happy hour which is mon-fri 4-6 and sun-thurs 9- to close. Appetizers were 1/2 price and certain drinks were priced lower. Got the habanero chicken wings the barbecue sauce was too sweet and there wasn't any real heat to it wouldn't get it. Jamaican chicken wings were ok very strong jerk spice might get again. Next up was the chicken quesadilla not much meat inside was ok. The lobster and shrimp quesadilla wasn't any better wouldn't get either one.  Crispy onion rings were good would get again. The crab cake was decent probably get again. The lump crab cake was a cold dish but tasty i would get this again. We also got the steak Oscar which is a sirloin steak with crab meat on top with mashed potatoes and asparagus decent. Virgin pina coladas were awesome definitely get again. The service was great.  Overall the food was blah, drinks were great and service was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R1x5NsCmq_5lS2rCSVCYlQ.text: From the outside, Bahama Breeze looks like a franchise restaurant that should've been closed in the 90s. But, their happy hour is something worth checking out. From 4:00-6:00 pm, a 20 oz. draft beer is only $3! The firecracker shrimp street tacos (3) were my favorite and half off as were the rest of the appetizers. The habanero chicken wings weren't that spicy, but you get at least a dozen wings. The lobster and shrimp quesadilla was a bit lackluster. Otherwise, great happy hour find!

R5g9I_1lHPTETuzY4-sDRw.text: My wife and I had been to three Bahama Breeze locations: Raleigh, Seattle, and Las Vegas. We  revisited the Las Vegas location yesterday.   The first thing we order, directly after the drinks, is the beef empanadas. Just as they were at every other location, they are unmatched and delicious! We went at lunch time for the first time at any location hoping to get a variation on the menu. We were pleasantly surprised. We got the lobster quesadilla combo with a caesar salad. The caesar had slightly too much dressing incorporated into the salad, but the amount of lobster and shrimp packed into the quesadillas made up for that minor hiccup. Great food and atmosphere as usual. Special thanks to the host staff at the front who were very hospitable!

B70DJcDMYy6huEbtFG3yvg.text: First time here! Our waiter Jerry was awesome! He can tell you about every item and drink on the menu! I had empanadas as a starter, followed by jerk chicken pasta and a Caesar salad. Also there drinks are so good and happy hour is from 9pm to close!

53eK8DpP4ypXIpGpqNpayQ.text: Haven't a negative thing to say, perhaps the pleasant greeting from all 3 beautiful Ladies as we entered, and Randy our server handled it well.

Ko2zTKuFl9MKG21CK8xcVQ.text: Well I missed the $10 burger and a beer promo they have going on, but I didn't need that for lunch anyhow.  I don't understand why their tables are so high. I mean I'm 5'3" I get it--I'm not tall but when I sit in their booth the table is like at my chin.  I can't even imagine what little kids have to deal with. I almost asked for a booster chair if I would've thought my butt would've fit in it [should've tried anyhow]. Strike 1  When we originally sat down it kinda smelled like cat pee, so we asked for another booth by the window-it was THAT bad, that one smelt much better; however, I was still chin deep in table.  Not the most comfortable way to eat lunch. Strike 2  I asked if they had a calorie menu so that I could at least try to eat healthy, they did not. Strike 3 next batter.  Our waiter was a little behind so another guy came over to take our drink orders. By the time he was done our waiter came over and took our order but basically asked all the same questions twice. So that was kind of annoying but we made it happen.  What saved this place today [otherwise the stars would be much lower] was the food. I got the chicken tortilla soup [no tortilla strips-extra limes] and the fish tacos, ancho cream sauce on the side.  Both were delicious and actually pretty healthy [soup is like 300 calories 12 grams of fat, tacos 550 calories not sure how but 26 grams of fat? according to their website] minus the sodium which is super high in both.  I think next time I'll go with the plain old grilled fish.  My meal with drink was under $13. whoohoo  When we left we inquired about their happy hour apparently it's 4-6 M-F but she couldn't tell us what nights or times the steel drum band guy played Strike 4.

_s9ZwUD3MgZcBkV30r551w.text: First time at one of these chains. the atmosphere was cool the service was great the Drinks Alone deserve the 5-star rating. We had the drink that they make in the pineapple and it was awesome! coconut shrimp was delicious as well the main courses were good too

Ez8bDJXlHgGh1a3MySmUAQ.text: Bahama Breeze is a chain restaurant serving food and cocktails inspired by the Caribbean Islands. There is a traditional cocktail inspired from each island. The lemonade comes with a sugar cane stick in your glass, so you can chew on the sugar cane if you'd like. It adds an authentic touch to the sweet tasting drink.  Reverse happy hour from 9 PM to close is the best! It is half off all drinks and appetizers, getting you the most bang for your buck. There are a few appetizers with shrimp, but all are prepared differently. There are a variety of appetizers to choose from, including shrimp, chicken, and beef dishes.  There is live music as well at night, adding to the comfy island feel. This is a good place for a date night or even families, being open for lunch and dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; lobster quesadillas
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef empanadas
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut shrimp

5SG_PIhRRxAoy4j__2aYFA.text: Where do I start, this place exceeded my expectations and I'm soooo glad we chose this restaurant over the sushi place next door to it.   We started off with the coconut shrimp, which was delicious (the dipping sauce is really good). We also had the chicken wings and they were flavorful and finger licking good:-)  The mojitos are by far the best mojitos that I have EVER had and I've had lots and lots of mojitos!!! They had just enough sugar and mint and they had a pretty good kick to them, not to mention they were only $4.00 (during HH). Did I mention they had a pretty good kick:-) They were so good, we went back the next day, just for the mojitos (and not during HH - they were $7.00 each).   For our main entrees, we ordered buttermilk fried chicken breast..OMG this dish is delish!!!!It's a layered dish of mashed potatoes, chicken breast, topped with spinach onions and cheese, and then layered again with another chicken breast and potatoes. On the side, the dish also included corn and black beans drenched in a wonderful sauce.  It sounds like alot and it is, don't worry about that, get a to go box if you have to. This dish is awesome and a must to try. I would order it again in a heartbeat.   The atmosphere is nice (tropical theme) and the waitstaff was friendly and accommodating.   Great job Bahama Breeze!

Veh9l9p4g9-LNe1t8t0DBA.text: Third time that I have been there this year and every time I order a drink, they water it down. I asked for their strongest drink and I was disappointed again. I asked the server if he can tell me why, and he had no answer for me.  I switched to their coronarita, same thing.  Food was pretty good, can't complain there.  Also, that party room on the west side is always hot.  So here it is, if you want to pay $12 a drink to be in nicely decorated room that reminds you of the islands, then go for it. If not, then go elsewhere.

focSE7MNkL-F8jc8QsUURQ.text: My girlfriend got me hooked on this place...  The jerk fire shrimp!!!!  YES YES!!!  please ask for the sauce be chunky and the bread that you can dip into the chuncky sauce!!! YES YES!!!   :)   The coconut shrimp is recommended as well...!!!  If you go to this place during the happy hour for $20 you can get full on the appetizers(jerk shrimp as I recommend) and at least two drinks....   And during the peak hours on the weekends, this is a place you can chill with that special someone and and enjoy a romantic eveing out...

SNOyNmBYTV9bEaA9Sc9-Iw.text: Had a really good time here the food was amazing and it was the bonus happy hours on!!!! Appetisers were 50% off the drink was good the food was amazing and our bar girl Shelly was ours standing and Louis had us all laughing the name night long

9OGbISNSwu4PJusEggR1JA.text: Not so great the only thing good i had was the drinks. Jerk chicken -dry, coconut shrimp was ok- sauce was nasty, and the dip for the chips were nasty..... Will I return hell- no EVERYTHING left on the table not really touch but empty drink glasses

ohbXK1QXWE-wRM3gOS2Ynw.text: We had a great night celebrating my parents 40th wedding anniversary, good food and friendly servers, definitely we're gonna come back here again

x7RdUJAdt_jK7UpSsQ360w.text: This is a MUST stop here if there is one close! So delicious! We came with a party of 19 and had at least 9 kids with us. They were very accommodating and everyone single person in out party loved their food, including the kids! After trying our appetizers we began to share food, because everything was seriously soooooooo good. For an appetizer, order the Jamaican jerk wings, they are the best wings and cooked perfectly. They have a happy hour after 9 with half off appetizers and special drinks, so well worth it. Fresh lemonades made with real fruit and shaken for you. Really delicious! Kids pasta is great and serving size is big. Salads are huge also. Really, nothing bad to say about this place, food came fast, great live music and friendly staff. Also had the empanadas, coconut shrimp, fire cracker shrimp (my personal favorite), ribs, jerk chicken pasta, shrimp and grits, steak and crab stacks. I'm sure there was more but bottom line everything was good. You will not be disappointed!

w0HCg7M8dlBwcjabiSwu3Q.text: I always receive great customer service definitely a favorite spot when looking for a place to sit and unwind.  They treat Vegas locals good.

JlIgoGJm_iZlR_zk4feQhg.text: Not the best food experience. Ordered churasco medium rare the outside pics were cooked food and the inside pieces looked like they were hidden in the middle cooked well done?? Not the best flavor on this dish. My sister ordered a mojito... if you are going to call something a cuban mojito at least attempt to make it correct (it tasted like cough syrup). Service was good. I have been to the one in Tampa the food and drinks are night and day.

Y9sFdatkZIyn1djYp6YHjA.text: Great for a laid back Sunday afternoon lunch!  The staff was friendly,  the food arrived quickly and hot. The atmosphere was great,  chill for an afternoon margita (Sunday,  1pm) with no waiting for seating.  Our Waiter was Gerald,  I think.  He had some good suggestions and a great attitude.  Lunch special was good (Mahi mahi).  I suggest adding the $2.5 side salad,  a great value.  Margarita was a little on the sour side (many near the strip have been to me) not too weak though : ).  Will keep this place on the laid back weekend afternoon selection.

DiiltwAMvl1PqOAb4xZKVg.text: I stopped in here because it was close to the hotel and it had good ratings.  I ordered a house margarita, a cup of seafood chowder and the firecracker shrimp appetizer.   The margarita was good.  About what one expects for the house version.  The chowder was excellent.  The fish and scallop pieces were perfectly cooked and the flavor was spot on.  The shrimp is very good.  I would definitely come back here.

MwoJYiIeACjsjr0Cw8zbVg.text: Happy hours my thing...but I do not recommend going here for it. Bartender makes a stiff drink maybe too stiff and when it comes to the menu his recommends were poor we got the two spiciest things with no warning. This comes from a person that hates spice. When I go to a bar I like a personable bartender that asks what do u like what don't you like and when you get a response of oh I mainly just make drinks that turns a customer away. This the reason we left.

GD2-MWP90-JBXRecRdjc6A.text: Had spicy jerk shrimp and almond crusted mahi. It was all very good and reasonably priced.  Cheap happy hour drinks as well.

-m3tlZ6m1dJTFDKT-IcRaQ.text: We thought we would try this place because we were close by and were in the mood for some fruity drinks.   I had the skinny mojito and my lady had the bahama-rita. The drinks were the best part of our experience. Both were awesome and reasonably priced.   We had the fish taco's and a cheeseburger. The fish taco's tasted like a sewer, but my cheeseburger was ok. The quality of ground meat wasn't really of my liking, but the avocado was great.   This place is huge and it felt like we were secluded in our own little corner--too lonely.  I definately would have preferred to sit closer to the center of the restaurant.  I don't think they clean that part of the building because we saw a lot of dust falling from somewhere right above our food. The table light illuminated the particles as we covered our drinks and plates with our hands. Ummm yeah. A few more drinks and we probably wouldn't have noticed. Unfortunately we weren't that saucy.    WIth so many good restaurants in the area, I don't think we will be back.

e6cQBnFjz1GiTmAjE3tVTg.text: Was here for dinner, onion rings were good but huge so were the conch fritters. Our waiter Brandon was funny and helpful with suggestions. Love Bahamas Breeze!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Conch fritters, yummy

mngsD_68-K0Nyg0JKA35HA.text: Jared and Oscar were our main servers. Jamie assisted them when serving the food. They all were fantastic. Constantly checked on us to make sure we were ok or if we needed anything. All the food was awesome per usual. Mu girlfriend and i love the shrimp and lobster quesadillas. And the firecracker shrimp are amazing. Thank you guys for always being awesome.

WcsN3oUgreYvUcGnq6OiWg.text: Their service gets worse and worse. I've been coming here fir years, both during happy hour and for dinner. Two nights in a row, they've taken over 40 MINUTES ON APPETIZERS! Our drinks are empty,and still waiting I be acknowledged by someone here. Leaving now, cancelling our order. Locals never coming back.

dDguB0IjNyhY4h-5GL1QSQ.text: Went here based on proximity to our hotel, no clue about what type of food it was. The restaurant was clean and staff really friendly. I tried the Jerk Chicken Pasta and my wife had the BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger. They were both delicious, I'd definitely recommend the place.

yY1m8nrWBfzU8G3lxenggg.text: Service is way too slow, arrived at 11:50 and placed order at 11:55 and it is 12:23 no food and not even anything to snack on like chips or bread.  Totally unacceptable.

CTOEIyUDKa1ADdfqutY1TA.text: From my daughter:  Our family loved Bahama Breeze. We went there twice and thought that we should go back because it was really tasty.  We thought that the mac and cheese was really good. We also thought that our servers  were really awesome and nice. We think that you would love this place.  From my son: My Mac and cheese was great and I loved the taste of the mac and cheese.

znIUnAQJnAXwFefCfovcHQ.text: The Happy Hour specials were really good.  1/2 Price Appetizers made the final bill reasonable at the end of the night.  The place was clean and the service was really good.  Carl, the Waiter, was spot on.  A really good night of service in a town where crappy service is pretty much the norm.  Food was a 3 and the service was a 5.  So it is 4 stars for this Bahama Breeze.

fHxi6iPGszKBUWYtzY64jg.text: For the service, the price, the quality and atmosphere Bahama Breeze delivers.  Have to mention the waiter named Pete, gave us great new specials to try and knew about ingredients and recipes used in the menu.  The Calamari was really flavorful and the tomato sauce thing they have went very well together.  Once again shout out to Fred our waiter because it was still happy hour and our bill wasn't ridiculous and came out to 5 bucks for our stuff.  The entire meal was great and they usually have a reggae music night for great atmosphere, lots of ladies, lots of free parking, lots of good food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside is so nice and staff is the best
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach dip. Fye
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari. Fye.

eHgqDG_A6ulrvnI48q3epA.text: Never have I ever seen a server use their own fingers to box a tables food. Just turned the whole table off. Experience ruined. You never touch a persons food with your bare hands then say "my hands are clean by the way". Totally unacceptable. We were out for a nice family dinner for one of my granny's birthday celebration. This cannot happen again. Other than that the food was good, as well as the drinks.

y6NeljJdbqOSrlOOrm6KfQ.text: Brandon is amazing, he made our experience memorable. Very calm and polite. Very informative. Everything was perfect. Thank you Brandon. Job well done.

eGYHeIchAYfbRADZWsJ4lQ.text: Our server kahla was exceptional especially this being our first time here...highly recommend her and would come back again....food was delicious

ktaaPvBGEKi6tlMODNYjfA.text: Always a good place to go. Can get fairly busy. I ordered the almond crusted fresh fish. The fish was fresh cut about a half inch thick with a salt and pepper taste with Allman crest and lemon butter sauce over.  Also my meal was served on a hot plate to keep fish warm and tasty The server was very polite and continued to ask us if we want to refills on our drinks. The service was more than acceptable. I left a 20$ tip.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bahama Breeze for lunch

qTpRizHzHw3YV1-vgIrOQQ.text: Early lunch before we headed back to Cali. We had just came in from a flight from NY and decided to have lunch before we left the area. We had saw this place a week before we left and decided to give it a try. The theme is Caribbean cuisine. Lots of jerk choices and non jerk choices but just think being away on an island. The vibe and music playing all a taste of Caribbean and reggae tunes. We had beef empanadas, fresh juicy fried chicken sandwiched by fried green plantain, oxtails chicken tortilla soup (more chunks of chicken than soup) and jackfruit tacos. The food was tasty and fresh. They had a plethora of drink choices but since we were driving we didnt partake. But they looked yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oxtails rice and mixed vegetables
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jackfruit tacos and chicken tortilla soup
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef empanadas

toOlCyGTr0kcoO4vN8XPAA.text: As soon as I walked into this spot I was impressed with the decor. I heard sounds of a waterfall and the high ceilings were matched with bridges painted with appealing finishes. I got the happy hour experience which was enjoyful. Not only was my bill very inexpensive, my server was pleasant as well. There's free wifi, and lots to choose from on their menu. I ordered a couple appetizers and enjoyed the water. Some pros and cons are listed below.  Pros: wifi, appealing decor, kind service, not too loud, quick seating time, lots of table space, clean  Cons: Waited for straws, food quality was decent, food presentation decent, small quantities  Overall: I'm a happy camper!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and shrimp quesadilla
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cakes

d9EBf5uHH14eA10uANedvg.text: Great food great atmosphere. Our waiter Devin is awesome... I never have to ask for anything he's always on top of everything and always suggests things when I can't decide... also he's polite and doesn't rush us to order... thanks Devin for your great service

_k9DWU7dDcjx2P96YbU65w.text: Amazing food! I will definitely come back! The wings are amazing!!! Great customer service!

aixKyhva2atCQEEqUurYGw.text: I stopped by here with a friend to celebrate National Margarita Day because they had a deal going on where you could get margaritas for $2.22 each. Devin, was our server and he did a great job taking care of us. We started out of course with a margarita and it tasted pretty good, but they weren't consistent tasting each time. The promotion price was deducted from our bill with no problem and I was glad since the drinks were just so-so.   Grilled Chicken and Tropical Fruit Salad ($12.49) -  Pineapple, red grapes, strawberries and mandarin oranges with goat cheese crumbles, candied almonds and drizzled with Island vinaigrette and grilled chicken. When it came to the chicken I was disappointed because it's described at grilled and the picture of it on the menu shows chicken with grill marks, but mine appeared to be seared instead of grilled and had no flavor at all. The chicken lacking flavor honestly left my mind once I tasted the greens, fruits and dressing underneath because there was a good amount of it and it all melded very well together. Good portion for the price and I'd order it again even if the chicken doesn't live up.  Rebecca's Key Lime Pie ($6.99) - Handmade with a brown sugar crust and golden meringue. I've had this dessert before and it tasted just as good this last visit. It's my favorite on the menu and tastes just right. Love that crust.    Warm Chocolate Pineapple Upside-Down Cake ($6.99) - Warm chocolate cake with a chocolate molten center topped with caramelized pineapple and served with raspberry sauce and fresh Island fruit. The first bite tasted a bit like burnt chocolate, but once I got towards the center it was chocolate heaven.   Inside was clean and they have plenty of dining space as well an outdoor patio.   Happy Hour is Monday - Friday 4:00 PM - 6:00 P.M.  Late night Happy Hour is Sunday - Thursday 9:00 PM - Close.

Mul_UwOZt5SOv5oo12jKAw.text: I went here for team lunch and ordered the Shrimp Linguini. The restaurant is very spacious and we didn't have to wait long to be seated. However, the food took awhile to cone out. We waited quite some time to get our food. The shrimp linguini that I ordered was a little on thw dry side. I wish they could have added a little more sauce. The atmosphere is very relaxing and makes people just want to hang around to listen to the Ragge music. Overall experience was good but I wish my dish would have been more flavorful.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uP39pErXMsQLdtDnhKFnQQ.text: What can I say Bahama Breeze is fantastic! The Manager Dan stopped by our table several times to see how we were doing. The service was exceptional and the jerk chicken was amazing. Will definitely come here again! Well done!

SsTkmz9VyUCGUKpzP-SORw.text: We had our wedding reception here, best prices for 65 party, amazing food,  so many drink options. Friendly and fun relaxed staff, we will defiantly be back.

8Gkozps15co0tUqNtLMxbQ.text: After a late show on the Strip we headed over to Bahama Breeze for an even later Happy Hour.  Happy is the key word:  I was happy that they're open till midnight, happy at the extensive food menu available, and happiest at the triple-flavor Frozen Bahamarita available for 4 bucks.  Having been to a Yelp event at the one in Princeton, NJ, I was pretty familiar with the menu choices.  But I hadn't tried the tostones with chicken, which our waiter recommended.  And I wasn't disappointed.  The large, thick plaintain slices were covered with an impressive amount of chicken, cheese, and other goodies.  Think nachos on speed.  My husband, the non-seafood-eater, let me talk him into the Lobster and Shrimp quesadilla, which came with pico de gallo, sour cream and, I think, guacamole (though that may have been with the tostones.  One Bahamarita is all it takes for me!).  Service was great, the food was delicious, and paying half price was the best of all.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bahamarita

S5d76Sv0QpVchuqjfRlheg.text: Tried this place for an early dinner/happy hour and it was delicious! The customer service was friendly and prompt! We ordered a few drinks and appetizers from the happy hour and it was fantastic. For dinner, we shared the large size jerk chicken pasta and it was plenty for two people. The pina coladas were made perfectly topped off with a fresh pineapple piece. The atmosphere is fun and laid back as if we were at a tropical resort on the island. We will definitely be back.

H-jxMqUh5psQ0Trtu8ml3g.text: Love this place!! Live music, great food, amazing cocktails!! One of my favorite restaurants! Jerk chicken pasta is a must have!!

NHd62HakxZbQOGcRjsq_qw.text: One of my favorite happy hours in town. Both regular & late night if I'm on this side of town. 1/2 off apps & great drink specials. I recommend the lobster & shrimp quesadillas, simply a must try for seafood lovers.

playJJy_W2sX3CB8ziJHWw.text: Jerk wing and lobster quesadillas is a must always hot and fresh.Waiter was friendly and service was quick

6GEEfxUOrxbMKrVosEkZAQ.text: The first time we went we were seated right away due to our reservation, we were seated outside, the environment was very relaxed, very roomy, played good music (sometimes a band will play) and service was very quick. The food was really good and properly cooked. We were constantly checked every 10 mins or so.  Second time was good as well, again seated right away due to our reservation, the lady at the frontdesk was a bit rude but only to her bussers, the table wasnt properly set but they fixed it right away once we acknowledge it. Same thing, the food was great and we were constantly checked. Overall, I loved it and we will definitely going back here.

WVZeZV3zHsMl22ODZiLnyg.text: If you like Caribbean flavors and cocktails, this is the restaurant for you. I would go back when in town.

I-SicYubITH46mEA3nToqg.text: Terrific place for a date! I had the Coconut Shrimp appetizer, which came with a sweet & spicy sauce! The Pina Colada drink was delicious, very sweet, & I don't think I could drink two because of that. I ordered the Mahi Mahi with a mango and pineapple glaze. The fish was cooked perfect, the presentation of the plate with the crisped banana slices inserted into the sweet potatoes with cinnamon was a fancy touch. We'll definitely be back, even though it was a drive from our house!

UXIrndLygjYyHwdkpm-cBg.text: I had my wedding reception there last week, and the staff there was amazing and accommodating. They went above and beyond to make sure my day went smoothly. I ran into a few hiccups during the planning process, but things were always ironed out and fixed quickly.   The food is OUTSTANDING! My guests ranted and raved about the food, the drinks and the service!   A big huge thank you to Momi who put up with a briefly stressed out bride during the planning process!   If you need a contracted event, the staff at Bahama Breeze is able to handle it with attention and professionalism.

co6dEC9hXEsaFGywHAg3cA.text: The manager was very accommodating.  We arrived later than our reservation but were still seated in a comfortable booth.  This is very surprising for a Friday night.   We ordered just about every appetizer on the menu.  Hands down, the jerk chicken wings, with the perfect blend of seasoning and crispness, are the best item on the appetizer menu.  I also enjoyed the empanadas as well as the crab and shrimp stack.  Unfortunately we were too stuffed to order a dessert....maybe next time!

TzijIC6IzWlx3w4sB0wGPg.text: So me and my Honey Anniversary was Yesterday 11-17-16 of 4 years. And I let him pick the Restaurant. At first I was A little skeptical because I never ate Jamaican food before. We arrive kinda late about 120 before closing. But to my surprise food was still very Fresh and customer service was on point. And by us arriving late it was happy hour as well. Omg their Drink is off the chain ... No complaints the food was everything. This place is a must!!

7weNhWk8ssY-2WIA3R5E5Q.text: Items selected: - Key West Fish Tacos - Island Hopper: Jamaican chicken wings, conch fritters, coconut shrimps, onion rings While the food quality met our minimum expectation, cleanliness fell short. Our server was throwing her towel to the table and sprayed the cleanser from a distance, the vaporized mist almost got to my table... The floor and the seat was not clean either. And no wonder, they got shut down by the SNHD right after our visit. vegas.eater.com/2014/9/5... Gross.

mbJh9LVEHCC5AyoV1TzYpg.text: Went here for a free lunch with my buddy who lost a bet. Place was pretty empty for 11:30am. Its a huge structure with a nice bar area (where we were seated). Service was pretty good, ice teas refilled 3 times during the meal.  My friend ordered conch fritters for an appetizer, a salad, and lobster tacos. I went for a salmon cooked my way, wood flame grilled and almond coated with a lemon butter sauce, side of mashed sweet potatoes, and green beans.  Food was just ok in my opinion. Portions were good. I wasn't overly impressed with the salmon because they put a lot of almond and other stuff on it, which took away from the flavor of the lemon butter sauce and the meat. The conch fritters were good, but a little greasy...never had them before so maybe that's the way they are supposed to be, but I was expecting something a little lighter.  I'd love to hang out at the bar sometime and enjoy some tropical cocktails. I don't think they ever seem to get very busy.   Not sure I'll return....seems there are more options and better places to eat, but it was a decent meal for about $18 (mine) and an overall bill of $38.

v69WRSl4ASP29SNktuubgA.text: Best Jamaican food in town. Forget the overpriced restaurants on the strip. Just go there and enjoy food, drinks, and live music for a fraction of the cost.

p_buSUryRh2GsrsUsg6FMg.text: We were starving when we left the Atomic Testing Museum. I suggested Bahama Breeze because it was conveniently close and their Coconut shrimp was beckoning me! I also love their dessert drinks.   I feel like I'm on a mini vacation when I come in here. Maybe it's the Banana Strawberry Daiquiri that puts me in the mood. The sips I took were fantastic ! My husband didn't like his Sangria (they don't serve it with fruit in the glass) so he drank half of my Daiquiri. My sister in law who is the "non drinker" wanted to taste it so I let her.    I started with the Coconut Shrimp ($9.49) for an appetizer it is big enough to be the whole meal. I just love the Citrus Mustard sauce it is served with...it's addicting! My sister in law shared her Roasted Cuban Bread ($5.99) . It had sliced vine tomatoes, basil, and Parmesan cheese. It was good ...It think it would be nice to eat with a salad.   My main entree was the Calypso Shrimp Linguine ($13.99 lighter portion). I'm glad I ordered the lighter version because it tasted okay but it was nothing to write home about. It tasted a bit bland to and I would not order it again.   We ended the dinner by ordering two desserts to share with the table. We had the Chocolate Island which is a chocolate mousse on a fudge brownie swimming in milk chocolate and vanilla bean anglaise. This was my favorite of the two! The second dessert was Banana Nut Supreme it has sliced bananas and vanilla ice cream topped with butterscotch brandy sauce. It tasted okay but everyone at the table liked the Chocolate Island the best!   This is a nice place to unwind after work because they also have a Happy Hour menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calypso shrimp
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate island

MVtPE6JidWQnsOEU8rNjJw.text: I took my wife here for her 19th anniversary of her 21st birthday. Everything was perfect. Food was phenomenal, service was friendly and attentive. We had so much fun! We even took a picture with our waitress! She was awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JU1WGq0AvKTIX9QOiPaxsA.text: Everything was delicious!from food to the drinks. Heres what we ordered.  Jamaican jerk wings - oh so good as always!we ordered extra bbq sauce!  Jerk chicken pasta - yummyyyy  Lobster mac and cheese - the sauce was so delicious.   Lobster and shrimp quesadilla - yummyyy  Virgin pina colada and mango beach!yummmyyyyyy

QPGKYXwi1NnqTqeJ1ytpnw.text: I ordered a specialty drink that I requested be tweaked a little bit. The bartender came over to make sure he was making exactly what I wanted and it turned out delicious; Mango Jalapeno Mojito, YUM!   Leilani was our server and she was great! She had awesome recommendations. I had the Lobster Mac & Cheese and Firecracker shrimp for an app. I would order both again.  They had live music majority of our visit. Great atmosphere. Will return and will request Leilani

3qb2hcHLgo0PujJgdXp9ug.text: If you like margaritas , you must try the margarita flight . Absolutely delicious!!!! As far as food the empanadas are also really good as an appetizer .

CU2AeCn7f2JOQ6sfuYCNKg.text: I kind of want to find something to nitpick about this place.  I hate being a guy that hands five stars out like they're candy.  But this place is truly amazing.  If I have to pick a restaurant outside of our usual rotation, or a place to go with friends, it'll be Bahama Breeze.  An amazing alcoholic drink menu (Painkiller, a bunch of mojitos) as well as some of the best lemonade you'll ever have (Lemon Breeze).  We typically have great service.  This last time featured a waiter that was very into his job and described menu items with words like "exquisite."  It's refreshing to have a waiter who is knowledgeable and happy to help.  The decor is clean and aesthetically pleasing.  We decided to start with the Tostones appetizer, though we weren't quite sure what to expect.  The plantains were crispy and the flavors diverse and delicious.  Despite not being much of a seafood eater, I always go with the fresh fish at the front of the menu.  Normally, it's the mango glazed tilapia.  This time I went with the Mahi Mahi as per the waiter's recommendation.  It wasn't as good as the tilapia, but it was still yummy.  My wife's curry bowl was equally as appetizing.  We left this place as we always do: with a full belly and smiles on our faces.

9MItrLGv27n1wlPbJqy3Yw.text: This place was pretty flipping fantabulous!!! Sam was our server and was hands down the best. We started with drinks, Coquitos mind blowing creamy goodness.  Our first time and we will definitely be back. I had the steak oscar which was cooked to perfection. My arm candy had the Jamaican Jerk chicken YUM! Such delicious food for an outstanding price here in Vegas and we have been to quite a few!!!! Highly recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican Jerk chicken freakin fantastic!!!
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak Oscar was good. Not the best.

usBHsFI65gBN_LoMY-kUGA.text: Where do I start?  This was our first stop (AFTER HOTEL) to eat and drink.  The food was pretty good.  My husband was impressed by the jerk chicken.  We devoured our food!!!!!  The drinks were good and CHEAP.  The staff helped our group of 25 people (many of them under 25) without issue.

jGskwgFWM1ojsBR3mQrdjQ.text: Absolutely love this place, every time my friends and I don't know what to do for dinner, we always head here. Waiters/waitresses are always nice, speedy, and the price is very good for the amount of food that they stack on your plates.

TlTFPT_3O_-oi4LOmDy6Wg.text: Absolutely great food and awesome bar tenders. I'm here for a couple weeks for work and they have been great. Thank you!!

AuF9EDAM1I_m0IFb3lIphQ.text: I love the ambience of this place! It really has that Caribbean feel to it. I ordered the Buttermilk Fried Chicken which was delicious, followed by the chocolate pineapple upside down cake which was good too. I'll be back!

q6_ytGkOxvZLasx3BSdrAA.text: First time here and I loved it! $3 Sangria at Happy Hour was awesome!  Our group of 4 all loved their food. I had the Buttermilk fried chicken layered with spinach, tomatoes and melted cheese. It was delicious.  Everything I tasted was good. I will definitely go back... wish they had this place in CA.  Also, the bathroom is really nice and they even have mouthwash which is a cool touch! Guess I'm easily impressed!

7Q3W1uFs8rH0-qRyhXxDgQ.text: That chicken tortilla soup is absolutely delicious.  Could be I am a sucker for fresh chunks of avocado.  No, the soup would have even been delicious without it.  The rest of the meal was fine, and filling.  The drinks were reasonably priced.  The restaurant itself is nice... pretty decor.  Nice amenities in the ladies' room, I love the scope with little disposable cups.  Our server did his job adequately.  Overall, nothing to complain about, but nothing outstanding aside from that yummy soup.

d2ruV4DWHGHsORkMcZJTnw.text: After getting a couple of kid free hours to get my son's birthday shopping done I needed a bite to eat. My man suggested Bahama Breeze because he was in the mood for fish. I was just hungry and didn't care so off we went.   Joanna was our server and she was lovely. I would definitely give her 4 our of 5 stars. We started with the Coconut shrimp (which is my man's favorite). It was good but I don't love it like he does. Something about fried coconut flakes just doesn't do it for me...to each his own. I ordered the lobster/shrimp quesadilla with a bowl of the seafood chowder. My quesadilla was fine but nothing to write home about...it could have used some hot sauce. The soup, however, was phenomenal. It was like a crab/shrimp chowder with little fried shrimp on top. It was creamy, smooth, not too salty and hearty enough. It was rich so I couldn't finish it all. My man was a fan and took the rest home for a late night snack.   Overall an A-OK experience. I will be back if I think about it.

CUZ_6A6qy1CMNWvJqS5jCQ.text: Took mom for her 77th birthday. Never again.. It took 15 for the servers to figure out who's table was who's. We ordered drinks. Then food. They brought our drinks with our food. It took 25 minutes to get our Drinks.. Are you serious. We were in deep family conversation so it took us a while to realize they totally forgot our appetizers. Worst part ever after I told the server it was my moms birthday they NEVER brought anything out to sing her happy birthday. I spent over $100. For crap service. Very upset only thing manager did was offer to give her a dessert to go. Really you guys ruined her birthday party. You guys should be embarrassed. I attempted to call Corporate and never got a response. Kudos

6LXvHcYwiv7thkTa0vpz2w.text: Great food and very flavorful ! Pleasant atmosphere with cool decor. Great selections on cocktails especially mojitos

ijxOI7KnhNNisTFnstJuwg.text: Came here for Happy Hour. Food and drinks were so delicious! The customer service was outstanding. Marcus was our waiter and made our first experience wonderful. Will definitely be coming back!!

SWFKu5vFQZ9dEnXtdpep7w.text: Awesome food, excellent customer service.  Our waiter was very knowledgeable and helped me make a great decision.  I enjoyed talking sports with him...even though he is a 49er fan...lol.  Thanks for a wonderful lunch experience!

I_So2kGwYKGv5lq_QdVI8g.text: We were visiting Las Vegas for relaxation... Wanted to try different restaurants and some food and drinks we don't get often where we live. My husband loves coconut shrimp, so I looked up restaurants that served them. There was  Bahama Breeze and Kahunaville, (which is in T.I.) I made reservations with Kahunaville for later in the week,... (which we HATED)... but went to the early happy hour at Bahama Breeze.(they even have two happy hour times, early and late) Kahunaville, ended up being one HUGE MESS of noise, and the food was mediocre and expensive,( I reckon because it being on the strip).    But back to Bahama Breeze. The place was great! It is in a mall of restaurants and parking was a ..."breeze"...(get it?)... It had the atmosphere with the truly tropical feel of  shutters, lanais, wood,  bamboo, gardens, fire pits, open and airy. Man, even the men's restroom was great!    The happy hour menu was fantastic! $3.00 & $4.00 drinks, and 1/2 off appetizers! Our server was Sam, and she was great, fast and efficient. We had the beef empanadas: nice and spicy, with a nice fruity salsa, the warm goat cheese dip with flatbread crisps: GREAT! The cheese comes in warm bell peppers. The coconut shrimp: you get 6 fairly large perfectly seasoned shrimp with a spicy mustard sauce... in fact my husband ordered two of them... The tropical drinks we ordered were far more superior and tasty than Kahunaville... and a lot less expensive!    Over all Bahama Breeze got our vote for BEST "Island food and drink" in Las Vegas. In the words of a past Governor of CA, " I'll be back!" I want to try it all!

t0DM8U75gaQ_wKbHPYnfOw.text: We started out wanting some good drinks, non alcoholic of course, and it was happy hour. We asked if the non alcoholic drinks were available at a discount and thy told us only the alcoholic drinks were. We didn't understand so we requested a manager. So far not so good...but the manager had a change of heart...so that was good. We shared a chicken cilantro cream dish that was fabulous. We also had some great chicken sliders, coconut shrimp, and some chicken wings. Overall it was great food, fast service, and cool atmosphere.  We will defnitely come back.

Bw3O-90aQEQ4r7qm3kAcYg.text: I loveeee Bahama Breeze !! The environment is so awesome and this place is so much fun. The food is also really great. It feels like your on vacation on an island when your in there. Love this place so much, if your looking for a great time this is a great place to go !!

HJYccyiEd-ZEFNaMcwob0w.text: My waiter was great thanks Adam, but who ever the cook was didn't know what came on the plate. My plate looked nothing like the plates of past dinners I was a little disappointed because when you have your mind set on that meal that's what you expect sadly I wouldn't suggest it to anyone unless there going for happy hour.

j7zuDWVuGvjywVveem_hrQ.text: Brought mom here for Mother's Day. Planned a day trip at her request. The one place she wanted to go for a nice meal before heading back home was Bahama Breeze. So we visited a few other places in Las Vegas, then ended at Bahama Breeze where mom wanted Paella. She says other than in Spain, Bahama Breeze makes the best Paella! So we ordered salad, which, by the way, was delicious with an array of cold, crisp vegetables with a dynamite vinaigrette, and two orders of Paella enough to serve four people. We even took some home since we couldn't finish it all. A family member and I ordered a glass of the Merlot which was a nice compliment to our meal. There was no room for dessert! Next time for sure. Definitely worth the trip. Will do this day trip thing again this summer. It was fun! Bahama Breeze is high on the "do over" list!

8OGKIn1d9k_rWvOYsM7ZVg.text: Appetizers delicious!!! Shrimp linguini delicious!!! Jamaican jerk chicken delicious!!! Cocktails superb!!! Service, ah-maxing!!! Great place for family and friends!!!

STsj2j-67W1frhfuczNY4A.text: Came here after the longest plane ride ever from Charlotte. Rode around and discovered Bahama Breeze. Me and my friend figured that since the parking lot was full at 2pm on a Friday afternoon...the food must be pretty good. We decided to order our food To-Go and the hostess was very helpful offering some recommendations. We order and we sit around chatting and people watching. After 15 minutes, our food is ready!  I ordered the Oak Grilled Chicken Sandwich with lettuce, tomato and goat cheese on Ciabatta bread....AMAZING! The chicken was tender and juicy and well seasoned. The cheese was slightly melted and the lettuce and tomato were fresh and tasty! I ordered the tomato, basil and balsamic vinegarette salad on the side. I ate that on the way back to the resort so fast..I couldnt really tell you how it tasted...so I assume it was good. After the sandwich and and ice cold beer, I slept for hours :)   Bahama Breeze?? You have a satisfied customer here! Now...build a restaurant in Virginia/DC area please!!

8s6mb4F4lzLymhImgWOx9A.text: Ask for layer pina calada 5/5* eating with coconut shrimps  5/5* and watching final FIFA world cup. Nothing else us better than this!! Germany vs Argentina 1-0.. Goal.....

bwsLzvLAsWoKLEOaQqfCMQ.text: A friend of mine hosted a business dinner here and invited me to join them.  It's been a while since I've visited this joint, so I gladly accepted.  When I arrived, they were already seated and the Appetizers were coming out.  They ordered Coconut Shrimp (Crispy large Shrimp hand-breaded with sweet flaky Coconut & a Citrus-Mustard dipping Sauce) & Creole Baked Goat Cheese (In roasted Red Bell Peppers served with vine-ripened Tomato Salsa and Parmesan Toast).  The Coconut Shrimp was OK, not great.  They're large sized Shrimp.....the Coconut Breading was a bit sweet for my tastes.  The Creole Baked Goat Cheese was excellent!  If you try the Goat Cheese, you have to slice up the Bell Pepper and eat it....it was amazingly good.  For an entree, I ordered the Jerk Chicken Pasta (Jerk Chicken Breast, fresh Asparagus and Mushrooms tossed in a rich Parmesan-Herb Cream Sauce with Bow-Tie Pasta).  They weren't kidding when they said this dish was "rich".....I think I gained 5 lbs after eating this thing.....it was very good though.  Despite being rich, the Sauce didn't overwhelm the dish and it had a nice flavor.  The Jerk Chicken was cooked perfectly and was of good quality.....you could taste the flavor that Jerk Chicken is known for....I was left wanting more.  Thank God it wasn't bottomless, otherwise I'd have to buy new clothes afterwards....ha!  Overall, it was good service and good food.  This place is a solid 4 Stars.  Return Factor - 82%

GXJNH6bjweaqLT2XJ8kDyg.text: Went here for a wedding reception. The food was ridiculously delicious. I can't stop thinking about it! Next time I'm in LV definitely going back!

zcgzTGML-Fo-JuK1Ds36hw.text: Great food and great service , love it , staff was on top of everything , made my friends and I commit to visiting again in near future

N-3gVmxcc5u7XZJhL-FDpA.text: I came to this establishment because I received a gift card from my credit card company.  I heard of it but never tried it since they are not conveniently located back home.  Upon entering I saw 3 people to my right at the front desk.  They all spoke & seemed friendly, however they took over 2 minutes to decide where to seat me because of a seating issue.  Come on guys I'm hungry.  After being seated the server came and wanted to know what me & guest wanted to drink.  She explained dinner menu, drink menu and her recommendations.  She came back in 2 minutes and still we were deciding on menu.   She said she would be back in a few minutes which turned out to be over 15 minutes.  She had a rather large table to serve which took up a lot of her time.  She finally came back.  Order came within 20 minutes later.  They had a male singer performing top 40 hits.  I guess that was ok.  Decor was decent, beachy like.  I ordered a seafood rice dish(see pic).  It was tasty but kinda dry.  They needed some sauce to keep rice from getting dry.  I used hot sauce.  Noise level was ok.  Semi crowded.  Server came back to refill drinks.  We finished dinner and were waiting for the check which took almost 20 minutes.  Another server had to take our payment.  Server apologized but she was working way too many tables.  Would I return - not sure.  Food was good but nothing that would make me want to rush back.  Service was sub par.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

isJCtmR1_z65JkGIW4r9sQ.text: Visited Bahama Breeze on a Monday evening around 9 pm, just in time for happy hour! There was no wait at all, we were seated as soon as we walked in. The service was great from the moment we walked in and our server was spot on! Ordered some happy hour drinks, a pretty tasty Ultimate Pina Colada and a Bahamarita, both blended drinks. To eat we started off with the small plate of Jerk chicken wings, they were fresh and flavorful. For our entrees we ordered the Taste of Jamaica, which was basically a sampler plate of a couple items  from the menu that were all very good and a plate of the Key West Fish tacos that were a bit disappointing and dry . Nonetheless the up beat atmosphere and nice mix of Caribbean music was great. Definitely will be back to try out more things on the menu and hopefully catch the live music they have from time to time. 8/10

NtDMZGp3Dc_xTifs-lRfyw.text: People who work here have a great attitude.  The music is great and the food?  You really need to try this place!  Our waitress, Tucker, was efficient, personable and knowledgable about the menu.  The tortilla chicken soup is a wonderful blend of flavors.  With the chicken tender and the vegetables fresh.  The chipotle chicken salad is not to be missed, if you are in the mood for a salad.  Lettuce was crisp. The blend of fresh corn, black beans and cheeses combined with the light vinaigrette, wow!  The chicken was moist with just the right amount of seasoning to make your tastebuds happy.  If you are in Vegas, a must try!

wTKtE8X8kc_c7XeLkPDGsg.text: Best decision we made coming here tonight was leaving our booth to dine at the bar and I am so glad we did! We had the BEST service from Russell & Evann. No exaggeration - these two fellas were on top of it!!! Plenty of conversation & lots of suggestions of cool things to do during our stay.  Now about the food .... WOW! Everything tasted fresh & amazing. Our appetizers were like entrees they were so big! We loved the seared sesame crusted Ahi, coconut shrimp & chicken quesadillas. If we didn't come hungry & ready to pack in some grub the appetizers would have been enough because we also had cocktails. But we also ordered bowls! The plantain bowl was my favorite!!!! sweet & salty all in one dish and I was able to substitute the ground beef for jackfruit #Vegetarian.   This may become a regular stop whenever we visit Vegas! But ONLY if we post up at the bar - the service in regular dining started off suspect & unimpressive LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. coconut shrimp
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seared Sesame Crusted Ahi - large enough to be an entree!!! YUM
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plantain Bowl AMAZING!!! sub Jackfruit!

at-3xuFaOBt6o4YBqiTVJw.text: Great food with live music plus happy hour. I love it and would definitely recommend this place to my family friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hibiscus margarita is awesome.

KsI2r2GzZGoyNHThXA6Dmw.text: I use to enjoy coming here with my husband as the food was delicious.  However I have tried to go again the past two times for dinner, and the wait times were atrocious and the hostesss were very lazy.  On the first occasion, I asked why the delay as there were plenty of clean tables and what appeared to be no shortage of waiters. I was told that section was not ready for seating yet (yet there was people eating) the first time. I left after 30 minutes of waiting.  So on my second attempt I scheduled a reservation on the website 30 minutes prior, I showed up on time and still had to wait 30 minutes (I timed it too!). Once again there was open seats with clean tables and no shortage of waiters. When I asked whats the point of a reservation if I cant get seated near the reservation time, I was told don't worry the pager will go off real soon. I waited 20 minutes and left very agitated.

7Gdz7MQsQsag4NYg4QujAQ.text: Got seated on a Friday night around 10pm with no wait. Our server (unfortunately didn't catch his name) was very prompt and immediately asked us what drinks we wanted and helped make recommendations. Since it was our first time here we had lots of questions about the menu and our server was very patient and checked on us multiple times but didn't over due it. My husband went with the Oscar steak and I went with the Steak churrasco. Only complaint is that my black beans were more soupy and didn't really have many beans and I asked for medium and hubs well done and they accidentally got it switched. Besides that no complaints, food was delicious and our server was great. Will definitely be back

r9OxjTJEJ11NrWfvLHeqqg.text: Drove by this place a million times... finally decided to come in and check it out. Neat vibe. Great drinks and a wonderful happy hour! Had a frozen bahamita and an ultimate pina colada. Like the colada better. Bartender was Jesse and he was excellent... helped me maneuver through the menu. Very helpful!!! Tried the key lime pie and it was great. Also tried the jerk wings... interesting taste that finished wonderfully. I am a very picky Mac and Cheese guy... so that one did not ring my bell. Will definitely bring back friends and family when they are in town!!!

ZRnkAsnqSd5EmIXo2c7FFg.text: One of my favorite Caribbean restaurant to enjoy the deliciousness of the Caribbean!  On this recent visit {08-11-18} the food didn't disappoint at all. I ordered the jerk chicken and it was done right but the flavor was a HUGE disappointment! I have ordered and taste better jerk chicken than the one served on this plate (see pics) just one bite and immediately I realize I was in America when I was hoping to be taken back to Jamaica by way of its food & flavor. The spice was NONE existent! The marinate was lacking and the Heat and taste of Jamaica was definitely missing from this dish!   The sauce that was served with this dish is flavorful with fruits and veggies that reminds me of being on a Tropical Island eating fresh organic vegetables and sweet fresh fruits!   The dining environment is buzzing, energetic and live! So IF you're and introvert trying to enjoy your meal in a quiet or formal environment this place is NOT for you!

Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fH5Dlof-Hs0FwJMcwEEiVQ.text: I'm so disgusted with the food I had ordered here not only did they add extra onions and put the wrong cheese it also came with a thick ass black hair imbedded in the meat and the cheese. It was an online order so not only did I go pick up our order but had to go back and return the food because the hair was so thick that it had grossed me out so much I didn't even want them to remake it . The manager refunded the money back onto the card and gave us a discount but the damage was done it made me wonder how clean they are and how a hair that long and big and thick get in my food without them noticing..... I will attach the picture it's unbelievable.

TNSNvgblV75ByhnqK8He3g.text: Bahama Breeze......OMGGGGGG where have you been and WHY isn't there one in California!?!? Stopped by due to 3 recommendations from associates and I am glad that I listened. Our waiter was cool, and took time going over the menu specials AND it was happy hour. The jerk wings were simply AMAZING!!! Let me repeat....AMAZING! They were cooked perfectly, served hot and the skin was beautiful golden brown (like me) and crispy! Those wings bring a serious smile to my face, even as I write this review! I also had the mini-margarita trio which was very very good. We were able to try their onion rings which are now discontinued but they also had a great crunch to them and were served HOT! The hubz had a Pina Colada drink that he liked it more than I did and the coconut shrimp, which was ok to me, nothing to go into detail about. Take is from me, a 100%, True wing connoisseur, you wont regret ordering them! I will definitely return here again.

x2DxPodZ1YJsi2QtEIfaYg.text: Come see Bob at the bar!! He's so awesome and cool! He made me and my girlfriends feel at home in a new place. Thanks Bob!!

GtY6jZL_b3xKS9KGxh7cpw.text: A group of us came here a few weeks ago to celebrate. Our waitress whose name I can't remember was amazing (I know, I know...I have to do better with names). To start we ordered the spinach dip which was not that good. It needs more cheese, kind of bland. We also had the firecracker shrimp and breeze of cheese balls. Everyone loved the shrimp but I didn't have any. The drinks were good. One person got the flight of margaritas and of course some were better than others. The portion was very generous. Another person got the coconut mojito which was very good. For entrees we got the Jamaican stuffed plantain bowl which she enjoyed. I got the lobster and shrimp linguine and it was okay. Overall, it was a fun experience with okay food. I would only return if a group I was with wanted to go.

4Wr3LDLu-AhO7HO0erRZ3w.text: This has been one of our favorites for the last 15 years or so coming out to Vegas. True the place has shown it's age lately, but we still love the overall atmosphere. The pricing isn't too bad since it's being so close to the strip corridor.   We generally always get the Bahamaritas and grilled salmon on greens.

9nGBAl0OFZgGssJy6DmOIg.text: We had an amazing time here on saturday. After my wifes graduation from UNLV we came in with a party of 21 for lunch. Cinthia was an outstanding server who made our lunch memorable and very special. She catered to everyone's needs, questions, and request. The food quality was fresh, quick, and unique. We loved the $15 bottomless beverage they offer as well. A def place we will return to when we are in the area. Thank you Bahama Breeze

fixcasFQiuvvu6tMZq3baA.text: Love the atmosphere and the food, we had the ox tails, the shrimp and grits, mashed potatoes with scallions and bacon, the buttermilk fried chicken, and so much more. My son and his friends tried the margarita that was shareable and it was a perfect dinner for his birthday. I must give out shouts to our 2 waiters, they were awesome.

nWp4QZTSBoxgIkoyfoPDNA.text: I loved this place- nice Caribbean decorating, extremely friendly servers, good prices and a great menu.   We ordered the  Coconut shrimp tacos-amazing Lobster and shrimp quesadilla was great Beef bowl delicious Steak was perfectly cooked  Our first night-Margo was our server and she was sweet, funny, informative and attentive.   I enjoyed it so much.... several nights later when most of my friends went to Morton's- I opted to come back with my daughter. Our server on the second night was Anita- and she was just as excellent as Margo.   We ordered the tacos (so good had to choose them again)  Protein style cheese burger- just "ok" Adler beer is INCREDIBLE   Top notch waitresses, yummy food, fun atmosphere and good prices. Can not go wrong her!

tqe5CFBcKl3Nm0YsvfmHYg.text: My husband and I usually go here with his parents for the holidays or special occassions. His Grandma always sends a gift card to this restaurant. I'm guessing it's one of her favorites. On this occassion I had the ahi salad appetizer and an iced tea.   I saw ahi on the menu and I knew I had to have it. I've been on a real tuna kick lately and the menu pic looked divine. When I received my plate... after a very long wait it looked exactly like the menu. It was stunning.   Sadly it didn't taste like they seared the tuna in sesame oil, so there wasn't a ton of flavor. Also it was an appetizer and not an entree. I knew this going in, but there was no entree sized ahi, and I wanted ahi bad. I ate it and I was still hungry. I resorted to stealing french fries off my husband's plate when he wasn't looking.   The decor was beautiful and there is even a fun little waterfall and river running through the restraunt. I had lots of time to walk around and snap photos because the service was exceptionally slow. The iced tea tasted fresh brewed and was quite good. Despite slow service, my glass was usually full so I was grateful for that.   So the bottom line... It was ok. I will be back. I wish they had a full size ahi salad, and I wish they used sesame oil to sear and maybe a touch of wasabi on the side just for fun. I've had better tasting dishes here that were more filling, so maybe next time I'll grab the entree portion of the shrimp instead.

ejNZZO-V91zUggoGsPZy6A.text: Loved it! The theme was cute and the drinks were amazing! I went during lunch hours and I had the caesar salad/ shrimp and lobster quesadilla combo and both were delicious! I ordered the hibiscus margarita and it's an acquired taste but I enjoyed it!

DKV-ELB8NyWHwZP4cBJ9jg.text: We went for happy hour on a Thursday and loved it! The food and drinks were great along with the service.

FfuvP2qEDNHSEp0NpnkQ1g.text: Came for a wedding rehearsal dinner. Before the rest of the family arrived, we sat at the bar and ordered apps and drinks. The pina coladas and lava flows were ON POINT. Thick, creamy, and not the least bit skimpy on the booze. The yucca fries and spinach dip were also pretty legit.  But then when we sat down at our table, the entrees were all appalling. I don't even remember what we ordered because nothing had any flavor. The decor is pretty cool though!

IsP6fWZvctNqY-KmHE5low.text: This Is My Second Time Calling In An Order And Driving In Over 20 Minutes To Get There To Still Wait For My Food. I Have Been Told 20 Minutes Just To Wait Over 40 Minutes On Both Occasions. The Food Is Pretty Good I Guess But The Service Gets A Thumbs Down From Me. If I Want To Enjoy The Bahama Breeze Experi I Guess I Have To Sit In

u7QvUdhR3gYHu35qwSQ8TA.text: Happy hour is Monday through Friday 4 pm to 6 pm. Appetizers are half off, some well drinks and some beer too. Sam( a lady)was a great mentor to her trainee who was learning on the Job. We had the Jamaican wings, well done. The Chipotle bowl was so tasty, the fresh fish, my mom had a Tilapia get it if you can, it's light and tastes great! The service and ambience was mellow and great, the overhead reggae music is so catchy.  For dessert we have the banana Rum cake, just deliciousness! Great spot for a birthday celebration! Go here... Highly recommended!

-CiyE8UEpQ4JMHH4K9QK_A.text: I have been to Bahama Breeze a total of 3 visits and the food has been consistently decent. I would have given them another star but during my last 2 visits, I was completely ignored and had to flag or get up & find a waiter to request service after being seated over 15 minutes. WTH?!! This occurred in the dinning area & at the bar. Once I did get their attention, their service was attentive & on-point.   They have a great Happy-Hour going on twice a day. Half price appetizers and beer & well drink specials. I recommend the coconut fried shrimp, the firecracker shrimp tacos, and the chicken wings. The beef empanadas are good but can be a bit heavy if you eat more than two. They have great margaritas also. Not too sweet and taste like fresh squeezed lime...very refreshing. I will continue to return. Good bar food with a "tropical" twist at decent prices. Hopefully, I will not be ignored when I sit at the bar or table next time!!!

hY8Jvxhb5My4A71y3-XF_Q.text: It was another enjoyable meal at Bahama Breeze!  A bowl of Bahamian Seafood Chowder was good and creamy, but warm rather than hot.  Peruvian Corn Cakes bristling with kernels of yellow corn were quite tasty slathered with butter and topped by a vibrant and fruity housemade Pineapple Salsa.  A Caesar Salad with fresh Romaine leaves and sheets of Mozzarella Cheese was graced with an excellent Caesar Dressing.  And, an abundant portion of sauteed Mahi Mahi with Shrimp Saute in Lemon Cream Sauce that was presented with fine Spanish Rice was moist, flakey, perfectly cooked, and delicious.  Once again, 4-1/2 stars overall!

zDDjUkPWhxsbdGj70Hyc8w.text: I had heard about this place but I had not had a chance to try it. I was on my way to eat brunch on the strip when I saw this place. My friend and I decided to eat here instead because there was plenty of parking and it had good reviews on yelp.  We started off ordering the panko onion rings as an appetizer, They were pretty good, I'm not a fan of panko bread crumbs but my friend is so we got them. We also got a side caesar salad, It was so light and delicious. It also had shaved pieces of parmesan cheese and the croutons tasted homemade.   For the entree, we decided to split the Calypso Shrimp Linguine, the menu said it had shrimp in every bite so I needed to see if that was True. I love shrimp so I had to try it. They gave us the plate and there was a lot of shrimp, I mean, a lot! It was awesome! The linguine was perfectly cooked al dente, the pasta was sauteed with garlic, onion and tomatoes with a hint of spice and cream. The amount of cream was perfect and not overwhelming and there literally was shrimp in every bite. Pastas are usually topped with shrimp, this one also had shrimp in between. It was so good and the price was awesome! $18.00 for a large portion which my friend and I could not finish. We left some pasta, I ate all the shrimp and enjoyed every single one of them.  The desserts looked yummy but we could not try them because we were stuffed.   I love this place, hope to go back soon.

098cYnEqq0jCLy7fPWf05g.text: Went on a Sunday for lunch and it was pretty good. Had the sirloin and it was fine. Had the ultimate pineapple drink and it was on point. Service was good and restaurant seemed to have a pretty laid back atmosphere. All the food we ordered was pretty good, would recommend to others and go back.
