pr2mYH1-TbU73_NIuTEpfw.text: Food: 4/5 Service: 4/5 Cleanliness: 5/5 Decor & Style: 5/5  I love this environment. Great bahama drinks, great food, great live music! They use to have one in Oklahoma City but it closed down. Now the only time I can enjoy it is when I visit Vegas! Service was slightly slow, but the bartender was pretty good when we sat at the bar.

3NrakWSkYoOycq70ngfdnw.text: Great quality food, customer service, and atmosphere. This restaurant feels like you are on an island somewhere- nice escape.

fhYNIvJVMPfxswTuLjUUsA.text: Just as good as the Bahama breeze I remembered in Orlando.  Food was great as was the cocktails!  We got in during happy hour which meant $5 cocktails and 1/2 priced appetizers.  Their Pina cola da is  an island twist off the norm with strawberry swirled throughout, so yummy.  Their habanero wings were great with a sweet and spicy sauce which only left a slight tingle on the tongue but still packed with flavor.  We also enjoyed the jerk shrimp appetizer which was shrimp scampi bathing in a pond of buttery broth with very subtle jerk seasoning, not overpowering like I had anticipated, and served with a French bread loaf for soaking up the flavorful broth.  My entree was their special: A lobster, shrimp, and mussel bowl with baby potatoes and butternut squash, swimming in a tomato herb soup also served with French bread for dipping.  Slightly different seasoning compared to the Italian or cuban versions I've had before, with similar seasoning as their jerk shrimp, but not overpowering.  Overall the food was great and the service started out good, but at the end we sat waiting for our server and bill, so a little let down there, but otherwise a real treat!

gy0ziWXaFb5I3PR4SVaGVw.text: A tropical island in sin city, who knew??   From the coconut shrimp appetizer to my seared tuna entree with Jasmine rice to my boyfriends shrimp & lobster linguine, my ONLY regret is that I got full way to soon... OOhh but the leftovers were oohh so good too.

J8e383qTy9_ZGbBzCh6MNQ.text: what a great place!  it has everything...tropical atmosphere, reasonable prices, fantastic menu with super good food.  nice selection of exotic tropical cocktails. we tried hard to find a blemish during our visit, and found ourselves planning our next repeat visit to try other menu items. it was like being back in Key West again.

PA7X9lOFDrsYhsgKpeuBhA.text: A little bit off the strip but was a great choice. Came here for dinner and had the Lobster and Shrimp. Presentation was good and the flavors really came out in the dish. Gave you a fresh after taste as well. Worth a visit!!  Food: 8 Service: 8

iiJnzO9HXuBp8hYFFl0jBQ.text: My man and I went here for 'A night to remember'.  It was beautiful as always, wth live plants, live bands and a clean place to eat.  However, since the last time we visited the prices have gone up. We were extremely happy to see our old barender, who make magnificent, frest Mojitos and also our waiter, who was very attentative and went above and beyond the "Call of Duty" One thing that we do suggust is getting some discounts in the reastruant, it would keep a more steady crowd.  I strongly suggust the Crab Claws St. Thomas as an appetizer, and the Shrimp Liguine as a main course.  We were too full to do dessert, but I image it would be wonderful as well!

s0j5DMAj_PE-HjkyAPdMSQ.text: An oasis in the midst of Vegas craziness. Rafael (make sure you ask for him specifically) made the most delicious Micheladas I've ever had! I was in Vegas for 3 weeks on business and found myself escaping with co-workers to the Bahama Breeze at least 3x each week. We would walk in and Rafael would automatically begin making our drinks. Clearly, Rafael was a very wonderful bartender!  p.s. nothing goes better with Micheladas than their delicious milkshakes, coconut shrimp, calamari, and chicken kabobs.

nPWNKOl5xVIm_UGtpFVWCQ.text: Great food and also nice inside. My super picky family left raving about how delicious and fresh everything was. On top of it all, the prices are very reasonable!

egQjA_QRx_h8vS3Do20D8A.text: Set up is really nice but doesn't make up for everything else. The food is bland and really has no taste. I got the portobello manchega (no taste) my girl got some sort of shrimp plate that just tasted like tomato. Ill give them this, the beef empanadas and artichoke dip were pretty good. House drinks were also very good. Service started off really helpful but drifted shortly. Having the little one with us we found ourselves making a trip to the restroom that you could smell from the bar so watch your step. Don't see us coming back

NpGLCbXO43KBeRrhnh0f8Q.text: food is ok. Specialty drinks are better.

ey0VZmEb9CLF5c_bIqLj0A.text: my husband and I come here every time we r in Vegas. delicious food. great live music. friendly and attentive staff. always a favorite place to eat.

XvJLMz8FYB7RAtj5ZtXxXA.text: This place has a lot of nice atmosphere. It's kitschy without too much.  I informed the waiter about my allergies to certain weeds (shitlantro) and he recommended a dish for me. Now, I won't die if I get cilantro, but it's kind of unpleasant to my body and it tastes like soap. I got a few bites in and he came running to the table panicking about how the sauce turns out to have cilantro in it. He sent the manager over who recommended a new dish, didn't charge me for either, and then gave me another drink which was hella strong.  The fact that they showed so much concern even though I explained to them that it's not a fatal allergy unless I get a fair amount in me, shows me that they care about their clients.   The replacement dish, the mahi-mahi in a cream mango sauce, was absolutely to die for. Especially with a strawberry mojito. (the mango one was pretty bad, but was accidentally brought to my table by an errant waitress and I just took it rather than my strawberry one)  Would I go back? Definitely. The food was good, the service was very pleasant, and they apologized profusely for their mistake, while making sure I was very well taken care of. I'd gladly recommend this to any of my friends.

cF-ss9GCvo52mavB4lsjtQ.text: Came here with my girlfriend and enjoyed every minute of it. Food was great not to mention the service.

3kpK6-8J0RJB_-f9BwxTCQ.text: I have been here twice and both times I had a good time. The atmosphere of this place really sets the mood for a laid back time. But every time I have had food her it blows. There is just nothing special about it that draws me back. To me this place is more of a place to get tootie-fruity drinks and some dip. Then it would be for an actual meal. It's almost like an upscale TGIF with bad food.   The waiters that helped us were quite helpful and were prompt. The place is clean and I had a good time. There food is just not my thing I guess.

D-sbSkUHO63PBj3Al-hknQ.text: Very nice place the Cuban sandwich is AMAZING!! And the wait wasn't bad and I went on a Friday night and the only problem was that my waiter Bob was kinda rude and wasn't very good at waiting tables he waited until I was done eating until he refilled my glass of tea but over all great place

U3L2BT8HGts_AUODht28lQ.text: I loved the dish I had!  It was perfectly spiced and the sweet tea was wonderful! Shrimp and lobster sauce lingunie was delicious, I recommend it! Only thing I think was wrong was the waiter. I hated him. He had got on his knees to talk to me and my fiance like we were 5. If you ever plan to go here make sure to ask NOT to have this waiter.  His name is Bob.

uDMnkRzZJdToqHiXxAn9JQ.text: This is one of our favorite places to eat in Las Vegas.  We always have great service and when we were there this week it was no exception. They used to serve a great chicken salad with their black bean and corn salsa, they took it off the menu a few years ago but they always make it special when we ask about it.  That is what I call service.  Prices are reasonable and the staff is always friendly.  I wish they would bring this restaurant to Portland, Oregon!

a6liLSFsKZYMOih-n9nQXQ.text: We were looking for a reception site for our wedding that was laid back and would give us more time to actually mingle with our guests.  We decided on Bahama Breeze, and it was great!  The food was fantastic!  Our reception was at 9pm so we did the appetizer buffet for about 25 people, and everyone loved the food!  The atmosphere was light and fun, and I think everyone had a good time!  The only reason I only gave it 4 stars was because a few times throughout the night the staff would come up to me and ask me what to do or what needed to be done, and I kind of felt like it should be their job to already know what should/needed to be done.  Other than that the staff was very friendly and we enjoyed ourselves!

-t-Zn_iUWjBmkV39-vc6Gg.text: YUM!!!! Can't wait to go again. Service was friendly, food was good. Easy location and easy parking.  Recommendations: -Bahamian Breeze -Bacon Cheeseburger -Shrimp & Chicken Pasta -Filet -Potato Fries (? Appetizer) -Coconut Shrimp  Basically, this is everything we ordered. And it was amazeballs.

2j9PMPX8m4DC-J901GCPfg.text: awesome spot for carribean atmosphere dining and drinks, good selection and great food, been coming here for years, always happy, favorite dish= Caribbean jerk chicken with plantains, yellow rice& black beans

fxaj2CL8WOVaSUIbaOhB-w.text: We had a work event here so everything was free. I had no idea that Bahama Breeze was a franchise because there is one in Raleigh North Carolina  Food was good, a lot of fried food though, so beware!

u8reXf13OM5QXi0Lukg3lA.text: This was an amazing experience!  The drinks were strong, the food amazing, the service top notch!  We wish we had one close to us!  AMAZING!!!  Standouts were the onion rings and coconut shrimp.

1ScObeBJBu4OJxJG2aUdSQ.text: The place is HUGE inside!!!  The food was really good... the firecracker shrimp were my favorite for the night... only downfall, the service was just a little slow!

eNIA7N6LfXGFoLPx4Kin5Q.text: I don't know if this is always 5star, but it was tonight.   Great top shelf marg for the price (especially in vegas) and excellently prepared salmon salad.

jTcpVoM0nnApg5j-W3sSoQ.text: TERRIBLE, AWFUL experience at Bahama Breeze the other day.  We were seated right away for an early lunch.  The first thing I noticed was that the TVs were playing reruns of South Park.  Now, I'm no prude, but there were lots of children around and the sound was on.  I don't know that I would take too kindly to someone playing that kind of show during a lunch with my children.  No one complained, but it kinda rubbed me the wrong way.  A small thing, but a little disturbing and not typical of what I've seen at Bahama Breeze.  Our server came and took our order, which consisted of ham and cheese croquettes for an appetizer, soup and salad for me, and the chef's special for my fiance.  Our food came out quickly, but sans appetizer.  I asked the person who brought our food where the appetizers were and she went to investigate.  I had to endure listening to loud arguments in the kitchen until, finally, they figured out that the waitress never rang up our appetizer.  Never mind that the operating system computer was literally two feet from our table... somehow she forgot.  No biggie... it happens... except that she was NOT apologetic at all.  She came over and said, and I quote, "I forgot to put in your appetizer order.  So do you still want them or not?"  She said it like it was MY fault that it happened.  I didn't wanna pay for an appetizer to be eaten AFTER my meal.  Kinda defeats the purpose, ya know?  t declined and settled upon eating my soup and salad.  I have had the chicken tortilla soup before and usually LOVE it.  However, this time it was barely lukewarm.  Furthermore, the vegetables were so crunchy that I felt like a cow chewing cud with each bite.  I get that some soups have firmer vegetables, but this was a whole different type of crunchy.  Our waitress was nowhere to be found (presumably hiding from us after the appetizer incident), so we asked another server to send it back.  The server informed our waitress about what happened, and they proceeded to LOUDLY discuss how I was just trying to be fussy and that the soup WASN'T cold enough to send back RIGHT BY OUR TABLE.  I'm the customer.  Isn't that up to my discretion?  The soup was room temperature.  To me, that's cold.  And I have to pay, so I expect hot soup.  Period.  I couldn't believe that it was up for discussion, especially within my earshot.  The manager came over and brought us a free order of croquettes and fruit salad and asked us about the incident.  When I explained about the soup, the manager proceeded to defend the temperature of the soup, the crunchiness of the vegetables, and the behavior of the waitress.  Really??!?!  Oh, so you gave us all this free food to make up for something that apparently wasn't done incorrectly?  The attitude was basically that they were gonna try to satisfy me, but that they really shouldn't because I'm the picky bitch who sent back soup I should have choked down.  Unacceptable service.    We paid our bill and left no tip - when I hear a waitress gripe about me to her coworkers, she doesn't deserve a tip.  Yet, it was interesting to watch her rush to our table the second we signed the receipt and stood up.  Heh.  Dream on, crazy waitress.  Steer clear of this place - the service is sub-par.  There are much better places to dine in this city.

Y88a7GXhkGn3iroljPYxdg.text: My first time dining at bahama breeze was fabulous.... everything was great.... service... food... and the ambiance... so told myself i'd be back again...  2nd attempt... Horrible... brought friends n younger cousins to try the place out... we'll that's the last time i'll refer anyone and will i ever go to that place...i didnt mind what my friend found in the food and the manager giving my friend the option to have a new plate of the same item or order another item but the fact that they ddnt stick to their words... the manager told us that we each can order dessert n give it to us... so i double checked with server if we all can each get desssert as a complimentary.. he went n asked and he said yes... so three ordered dessert... there were 5 of us..when we received the bill... there was no discount... just one of the dessert was taken off... the server told us that he made a mistake understandin the mnager.. when it was too late.... the manager never came back ever again when we finished.. but when i looked back as we paid at the cashier the manager went back and the server probably askin what happened...   i am the type who doesnt complain...pay it off and leave dont ever come back dont refer anyone...

nRyF1ojSyem7KmeBoOjpkQ.text: A few of my friends from work and I came here for lunch last week. I really like this place and the atmosphere. It's very tropical and relaxing. I ordered a Bahama Mama and the bar there does a fantastic job with that drink! It was delicious. My food was good and the service was very good. Our server was a very nice lady and she got us everything we wanted with a smile. Very personable. I have been here a few times and I will keep coming back.

pRCkAaaOGp7RuofOXEHd9w.text: Awesome appetizers and awesome desserts!  Unfortunately, I have been three times and cannot, for the life of me, seem to remember a single entree. Must have appetizers  are as follows: West indies Beef patties, fire roasted jerk shrimp, crab claws st. thomas, island onion rings,  jamaican jerk wings.

vWnpQF1yeY5egqt1O9jDig.text: We love going here! The Jerk Chicken Pasta is to DIE for...   Anyone who goes needs to try it out!

Oz__Uvptn5G7rRwfqwRO0w.text: Food is enjoyable and portions are big. Tried there Jamaican chicken wings and jerk shrimp. Both were average.

aFupeHpVspytMhuLGylIAA.text: We went here for dinner on 8.12.15 and had a great experience. Our server Tina and her team were very attentive and the food was delicious. Happy hour is good because you don't have to be just in the bar to take advantage of the reduced rate. We have been here several times when visiting Vegas, I wish the restaurant was close to home in California.

PH_Nf_wg0fjv-EWgW-wOgg.text: I came here with my family over Thanksgiving holiday for lunch.  We were getting sick of buffets so decided to try something different.  Food is average.  We ordered the wings (big size!), lobster quesadillas with side of seafood chowder, coconut shrimp with side of chicken tortilla soup and portabello mushroom burger.  Only items that stood out were the seafood chowder and wings.  Burger was not very good, something about all the ingredients and manchego cheese just did not work well together.  Their signature lemonade with cane sugar is very good.  Overall, the ambiance is cute and tropical inside.  Nice getaway from the Vegas crowds!!

pIVqEZ4hbZiy-KfTXtHt1Q.text: We love Bahama Breeze so much we invited over 40 of our family and friends  to join us for our wedding rehearsal dinner! Natalie's staff is amazing. Great food, wonderful staff and fun atmosphere.

5niFHLNo-xfIEobUanRh_Q.text: we have been visiting Las Vegas for a few years now and many times have driven by this restaurant always saying "we have to come here one of these days" as it looks very inviting because of its tropical flare and never doing it. We are so glad that we did it on this visit.  we were sat out in the gazebo area which added a nice touch to the evening.  Daniel was our server who tended to us with a great smile all evening long. His recommendations were on point! My wife and I had the Jerk chicken with the bow tie pasta mushrooms and asparagus in a very delicious creamy sauce. Our daughter had the Jamaican Jerk chicken with ripe plantains rice and black beans; she was in heaven and ditch the fork in order to enjoy the chicken to the fullest. Grandma had the grilled chicken sandwich which she reported there were no extra frills so it was just good.  Somehow we managed to have enough room for dessert and are now in a very delighted sureene sugar state of being. Daniel again pointed us in the right direction and we decided to have the banana nut rum bread with caramel sauce and ice cream and the chocolate pineapple upside down lava cake, do I need to say more?   If you are ever in Las Vegas, this is a place that you can not just drive passed.

nJIZz4FvICe4OHLXFk4-Pg.text: We came here for an early dinner on a Saturday evening.  I was pretty excited to try this place as it came from a recommendation of one of my friends who had been here before.  However, I found the service here to be a bit spotty and lacking.  Despite it being early, our server was occupied with other things other than checking in to see how we were doing.  But, besides that slight nuance, and a bit of confusion over us wanting soup, and then getting bread, but then getting our meals at the same time as the said bread, I still liked the food.  My paella was delicious and so was my boyfriend's chicken and yuca. Their mixed drinks were also pretty tasty too.

8Y1DTsHbbEG5q4IhKNWyvg.text: I met a friend here during their happy hour. Very pleased with the variety of items, service was very good and the price was very reasonable. We had three appetizers and a split a nice dessert. The server was attentive and friendly. Another staffer stopped by and asked how everything was a very nice touch.

K97zR5UGUzYXRWISGaGSgg.text: Restaurant seemed mostly empty. Was given a pager and was told no more than 10 minutes to wait. 20 mins later i was seated. Waiter was very friendly, but a little too sparky for me. Took a half an hour to take our dinner order. Have been here over an hour and still haven't gotten my food yet. Wait. Just came. How am I supposed to eat this whole burger with this little bitty cup of ketchup? Smh. My daughter ordered her burger medium well. It was burnt to a crisp. Food over all was bleh.  Service was friendly, but horrible.

DzgeZDAqA28WjuYJSYyPyA.text: This place fell off big time since '05.  I keep giving it a chance because they have some dishes I really can't get anywhere else, but I'm too through with thier poor service.  The last several times I dined my servers had attitudes, bartenders have made me pitiful drinks and act as if  they don't see you while they engage in personal conversation.  I always ordered thier breeze salad but the lettuce is consistently ugly so I have to peruse it first. The last straw were my parents choosing this place for a nice date night, only to have the waitress spill the drink in his lap... something from a sitcom.  No compensation, zero f**ks given ha! Step your game up you all.

_q8cuiIylr5-ilVm6meAqw.text: Not a huge fan of this place.  I wasn't really hungry when we came here, but I was really looking forward to a nice selection of tropical drinks.  The selection was definitely there.  They had well over a dozen drinks.  A whole page in the menu, and a             booklet on the table.  Unfortunately, the two that I tried were pretty bad.  The first was a zombie.  This drink didn't look, or taste like any zombie I've ever had, and I've had a few.  I actually wondered if my order got mixed up somewhere.  Whatever it was, it was mediocre at best.  I thought a strawberry mojito would be a safer bet, since that's almost impossible to mess up.  Well...almost, right?  It looked, and tasted more like a bad daiquiri.  It was way too sweet, and apparently made with Pucker.  The only mojito thing about it was the physical presence of mint in the glass.  I tried a friend's cocktail- The Painkiller, and wasn't too into that either.  The mix of rum, and coconut cream is nice, but again, way too sweet. The food was...okay.  Our friend ordered the jerk chicken, and seemed to really enjoy it.  We wanted to order some fish.  Three varieties were available, but they were out of the one that we wanted.  The salmon was cooked well, but the sides were not.  Gummy mashed potatoes, and oily under cooked green beans.  Oh well, at least they weren't frozen.   I won't be rushing back here anytime soon.

CkAdSSVXFmBXMDShfJC73A.text: If you're tired of the high-priced strip food then make your way over to Bahama Breeze. It's amazing how dramatically the prices can decrease even if you're only 2 blocks away from the strip.   Save your money for the slots, check out Bahama Breeze.   Great tasting food (I recommend the Calypso Shrimp Linguine) Large portions  Reasonable prices Fun atmosphere Clean restrooms Perfect for friends and family  A solid 3.5 stars!

bNDBs4nQwRVDUvYnlFywww.text: I received a gift card for a Darden Restaurant for Christmas.  Choice of dining at Red Lobster, Olive Garden, Longhorn Steakhouse, Seasons 52, or Bahama Breeze.  I was recommended by some Las Vegas residents to try Bahama Breeze.   Wednesday night on January 14, 2015 was the first time I visited Bahama Breeze to have a meal.  This night I had my cousin and her family from Henderson join me for the dinner.  I found out that they have not eaten at Bahama Breeze as well.  A first time dining experience for the entire family to enjoy.  A total of six individuals in our group (M1, M2, and M3 are the men.  F1, F2, and F3 are the females).  F1 (my cousin) ordered the garden salad and the ribs with fries.  F2 (me) ordered the Bahamian Seafood Chowder and Buttermilk Chicken Piccata with mashed potatoes.  M1 (cousin's companion) ordered the coconut shrimp appetizer as well as the coconut shrimp meal with broccoli.  M2 (companion's son) ordered a Portabello Burger with fries.  M3 (cousin's son) and F3 (companion's daughter) both ordered pasta.  One had asparagus and mushroom in the pasta while the other eliminated the asparagus.  Everyone finished their meal.  They all agreed that what they ordered for dinner was delicious.  Each dish was served with the right portion...just enough to make a person stuffed to the max.   The restaurant itself is pretty big.  There's one section of the restaurant that can be used for reserved parties and it had a television for the customers to watch.  There was dinner music provided by a man playing the guitar and he sang a lot of cover songs.  He was located near the bar area and right behind the wishing pond.  The ceiling fans are actually the propellers from the boats.  The restrooms were very clean and there was a mouthwash dispenser for customers to use before or after a meal....that's one thing you hardly see in restaurant restrooms.    Overall everyone enjoyed the first time dining experience here at Bahama Breeze.  Employees were friendly and the waiters made sure that the drinks were not empty. Facility was clean and very beautiful.  Another major plus about the restaurant is that Bahama Breeze passed the Nevada health inspection by receiving a grade A. For my cousin and her extended family it would be a once in every six months treat for date night or family outings since the entree items are pricey.

x-uoRDAMrl93lORH7DwMpw.text: I ordered a dish a specific way, which came out incorrect the first time. The second time the dish wasn't cooked all the way, which I had sent back. I will drink at bahama breeze occasionally and eat light appetizers, but not certain dishes.

wCO0pmU1Hga748ldr8PIVQ.text: Love this place! Hot flavorful food, great happy hour, and from the moment we walked in the staff made us feel welcome! Gerry our server hit the spot. He was attentive, and outgoing. Jerk wings and shrimp n grits are a must try! Mojito and new Major Lazor cocktail had a great kick. Atmosphere is a lively island feel. Best bang for your buck! Highly recommended

Qz_cYe9Gpbff1f0kjW0_2A.text: We came here on a Monday night to relax and take advantage of their happy hour special. The environment is pretty cool. We sat in the patio area where there was a live musician playing reggae classics, very enjoyable.   I ordered the habanero wings and a classic margarita. The wings did not seem to be habanero. More of spicy BBQ sauce rather than habanero. They were actually pretty good, but calling them habanero is very misleading. For the drinks, it appears the other reviewers are correct. They are either watered down, or have barely and alcohol in them at all. My classic margarita tasted like pure lime mix. I had to order a beer instead. Be cautious of that before ordering.   All in all, I would give this place a second try again. :)

GXsKbjzPie45ESKEyE_J1A.text: I LOVE this place. The food is so good. The atmosphere is great. They sometimes have live music depending on what time and day you go. I usually get their jerk chicken pasta which has asparagus and mushroom in it. I usually replace the mushrooms with bacon and it's amazing. I also highly recommend any of their lemonades they're so fresh and good. Other people in my group have tried the jerk chicken sandwich and said it was great as well and also the chicken with the cilantro crema it comes with mashed potatoes and corn and that's very good too. I haven't had anything bad from here yet! However the service isn't the best. No matter when we go it's always very slow. We find ourselves constantly asking and waiting for refills. The staff is very nice and I understand it gets busy but even when we go on a slow day the service is still slow. But overall I highly recommend this place! Definitely try the pasta and lemonade and try to sit in their little outdoor area it's really nice!

OofwkAGSoJ-W2XMa4I7Oyg.text: Not very welcoming. For got my drinks twice luckily I had water in my diaper bag.  Didn't seem like they wanted to help us. Christina was our server. No one got refills and we couldn't even ask because she wasn't around. People that served our food didn't seem like they wanted to work.   Food looked AMAZING just like the pictures.   I got a salmon salad and it had to much dressing.   Spoke to the manager very professional he said sorry still left a tip wish I hadn't service was horrible

nRQnbwmgTgnhIf69PNgrsA.text: First time here and it was a great experience. Hostess was able to seat us quickly on Friday night. Service was quick and delightful. Everything we ate was good. Drinks were tasted good. At the end of the night I thought it was a pretty good deal.

cFgoOprFCcjYgL9YWCQDxw.text: I came here for lunch with some coworkers. We work in the Howard Hughes center so it's a convenient place to go for lunch. I was not very happy with the service we received. My friend is vegan and asked if she could make her own salad and the waiter said no and he didn't seem like he was in a good mood...then my other friend asked him what is in the seafood chowder and he said "it's creamy." uhm, yeah I am aware that chowder is creamy but what is in it. I gave him the benefit of the doubt on that because I just assumed he was new and maybe didn't know.   I orders the tortilla soup and lobster quesadilla. I've had it before and it has never failed. When I got my food, a ton of the soup was spilled out onto the plate that had the quesadilla so my food was all wet and soggy. I posted a picture of it.  I didn't send it back because I was here for lunch and didn't have time to wait any longer because I had to get back to work for a meeting.   I've had some pretty decent experiences here and the food is pretty good. It's a shame that my last experience here was not great. It could have been that maybe the waiter was new, but who knows.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lunch combo of chicken tortilla soup and lobster quesadilla. It came with a ton of soup spilled all over the quesadilla, making it soggy.

_FrrdbYnlpwR7q7HrAGvmw.text: This used to be fantastic, every year for the past 5 years a group of family and extended family would get together and have an annual December birthday/holiday party. In January of this year, unfortunately, Bahama Breeze got a new marketing director and she decided to change the way reservations and areas were assigned. Every year we would request to be seated out where the live music was, for two reasons. 1. There is usually 25-30 of us, we're all loud and so to not disrupt the of other guests this worked fabulously. 2. It allows the kids in our party to have fun dancing to the live music, and it provides a big enough area for our Santa to come in for the kids. This year when making our reservation I was told the only way to get this area, this year was to book it in advance with deposit and we'd have to eat off of a predetermined menu. Unfortunately, the time we wanted was already booked. I talked to the Manager and let her know that we'd like to still make the reservation for 29 people for 12/15 @ 530p, please make sure we are all in an area where we can ALL sit together and if someone canceled for that area please call me.  We showed up at 530p on 12/15, I explained that the number had dropped from 29 to 23. It took them a few minutes to get the area situated, not a problem. The problem was that they had 1 table that sat 10 people, two booths down from the table and 1 booth across. Issue #1 - This is not what we discussed. I specifically told the Manager when making the reservation we'd ALL need to sit together. She said no problem, we can do that.  Issue #2 - Waiting staff was a mess, we had (2) people waiting on us Jelli & Brandon J. I was the host of the party, so I took on the job of getting the staff updated to how the billing could work to lessen confusion for them and to ask me if they had any questions. Jelli said she understood and that it would be great if we made sure for ordering reason if the people could please stay in their sits to order so they could make sure not to mess anyone orders up. No problem, completely understand. We proceeded to order drinks, we waited, and waited and waited for drinks. to the point that some of our group found it easier to go directly to the bar to get their drink instead of waiting on Jelli or Brandon. Issue #3 - Jelli's forgetfulness, several members of our group would order drinks from Jelli and she would forget to place the order or bring the wrong item to the wrong table.  Issue #4 - Brandon's attitude, Brandon was standoffish and pushy to a few of the members of our group. We had a member of our group come in as Santa for the kids in our group. During the filming, Brandon kept walking through the experience, through people filming, which was completely uncalled for, because we purposely left an area around the table for additional customers/servers to get to and from the patio. And to make sure we did not disrupt the flow of foot traffic any more than necessary. At one point Brandon told me I had to make a direct line from the patio to the bar and that everyone would need to move. Again, completely uncalled for on his part. Issue #5 - Billing & Wrapping up - Once everyone had received and finished their meals, a lot of us ordered more drinks and were talking amongst ourselves, Brandon decided it was time for us to wrap it up and it would be a good idea to go to the booth of kids and say: "Your bill is not paid, who is paying your bill?". Again completely uncalled for, as stated above, Brandon knew from my talk with Jelli that any questions could be brought to my attention and I would get them any answer or provide the plan.  We spend close to $1000 every year at Bahama Breeze during this one event. I can only hope that upper management from Bahama Breeze takes a real hard look at the way their employees handle the customers as well as how even the smallest of things (new pre-set menu/patio area rule) effects their customers. It saddens me that a place we once looked forward to coming and celebrating with our family, has let us down so badly, that next year we will be looking for a new place for our celebration.   Sincerely, The White Family & Friends

BIVAvu9ACQSn6aIXnoNqoQ.text: Me & 3 other friends come to celebrate one of my friend's birthday. We order their nachos, shrimp (scampy like) in lite dishes, coconut shrimp plate, jerk chicken. The plate comes with rice, black beans & fried banana. Sit Inside more quite than cover patio (they have live music), next time I like to sit inside because outside by cover patio to much fan at the ceilling and make my food get cold faster. We all like our food We got fun server but  I forgot his name.

WCpwykNziYaFl2w68_TSzg.text: We sent back 2 dishes and decided not to order anything else. My entire mouth was assaulted by salt.   We tried the West Indies Chicken Curry rice bowl and it was so aggressively salted, we sent it back after 2 bites and then selected the Jerk Chicken Pasta. Unfortunately, that was also crazy salty; I couldn't get another bite in, my tastebuds and mouth were completely ruined and shriveled up.  The flavor profile of each dish was also shockingly basic - It didn't offer up any of the Caribbean flavors or seasonings that were promised. The Jamaican jerked chicken was dried out and I didn't even taste much jerk seasoning - only salt. To be fair, the dinner entree portions were gigantic. One dish is perfect for 3 people to share.   Also, the appetizers were average. We tried the chicken empanadas and they were extremely doughy with minimal filling. The only dish that was decent was the fried coconut shrimp appetizer, however, I have to explicitly state that Elephant Bar and Yard-House makes it better.   The manager came to talk to us at the end and was very defensive about the salt usage in both dishes. He also offended us by suggesting that we probably didn't know what jerk seasoning tasted like. lol. I'm not even going to argue it. We ended up heading to In-N-Out and grabbing some burgers after this failed dinner.

nqLxaTJ_zVGwql0rtDo2pg.text: Super disappointed with our experience here. When we were sat down we waited for a long time to for the waiter to come to our table. When he did show up we ordered 2 sodas but never received any water. The sodas took forever as well and when we finally got them they were watered down and Flat. We ordered an appetizer and when they brought it to the table they just dropped it off without even paying attention we didn't have any silverware or plates. More waiting finally I just got up and got silverware from another table and went hunting for a waiter to bring plates so we could eat our food. By that time I was over the entire experience and just wanted to eat and go home.

a8Dr3IC4Gjzms9F-P9bwNA.text: This is a very MIXED review. We went on Tuesday at 6:00pm 11/13/18. We had a large group of about 20 people and sat on the patio area with several tables together. Let me start by saying the waitstaff was OUTSTANDING so I would give them a 4 Stars not 2. Drink orders were taken and delivered timely and correct throughout the 2 hours we were there. Most people ordered dinner. This is where some "issues" came up. The entrees all started coming out at once and many had ordered soups and appetizers which were nowhere to be seen. The calamari was extremely tasteless and rubbery...old, stale calamari is basically uneatable, and we didn't. The chicken sliders on plantains were OK but not very flavorful without the sauce that was mostly spicy mayo. The black bean soup was EXCELLENT and I can highly recommend that. The skirt steak churrasco was tough and not very flavorful at all. Cocktails were all good.  I would teach the waiters and kitchen staff that apps and soups ALWAYS go out before entrees. And you need to either get better quality calamari or take it off the menu all together.

mOeG01kXG47izpb7_5cnsw.text: I like Bahama Breeze for something a little different.  It is part of the Darden family of restaurants (Olive Garden, Red Lobster, Long Horn Steakhouse) but this is neither Italian, seafood or steak.  Sure, they have pasta, fish and beef but that is not what they're about.   Bahama Breeze is about the feel of the Caribbean.  The place looks like a beach resort that one may find in, say, the Bahamas. There are palm trees, torches, fruity cocktails and an overall laid back atmosphere.  The menu is substantial and has something for just about anybody.  It is a restaurant/menu I have been enjoying for over 10 years.    I started coming here with my office for a holiday party.  Then we came back for a retirement party.  And again for a going away party.  Maybe even two.  I've come in with family a couple of times now also.  Each time I stop in I try somthing different.  Coconut shrimp (amazing and unfortunately not an option for me any more), chicken skewers and rice (not on the menu any more), West Indies curry rice bowl, jerk chicken pasta, buttermilk fried chicken with mashed potatoes.  I've tried the black bean soup.  I've tried a salad.  I've never been disappointed with anything I've had here.  I've had some of the drinks too.  A sample of the coconut mojito which was good but very sweet.  A taste of the watermelon jalepeno margarita.  A zombie (which I seem to remember liking very much).  I did have an off pint of Guiness once.  Not sure what happened to that keg but it wasn't good.  However, I've also had a Newcastle here and it was spot on.    Service has always been consistent and pleasent.  Even coming in on Mother's Day with a 7:00 PM reservation went off without a hitch.  We were seated just before our scheduled time and were waited on equally quick.  Having taken the time to look at the drinks and food, we ordered and just got to talking.  Before we knew it we had all that we had ordered and the meal had begun.  We were out of there by 8:15.  Not bad considering how busy this place was on a holiday.

Zt8JO8I5l-x0K2lKCgTnMQ.text: I came here with my fiance and had Anita as our waitress...she said was amazing! Funny, engaging, genuinely sweet and knowledgeable! We tried her recommendations of the lobster quesadillas, jerk chicken pasta, fire cracker shrimp, shrimp and lobster linguini and the ultimate pineapple drink and needless to say when my fiance and I need a break from La and find ourselves in Vegas we will definitely be back! If you find yourself at Bahama breeze ask for Anita, It'll enhance your experience.

mOqA7MNMDBdaHwJbpPW19w.text: First time here again out with my gorgeous wifey,  great Sunday. Hung out nice lunch , took a Sunday afternoon nap now hanging in Vegas.  Life is Good

AWjLYve2T7Bn7MacRXnEyw.text: Somehow being in a Caribbean themed restaurant in Las Vegas just didn't feel so out of place as the entire town is full of make-believes.  On a whim, a colleague loved this place so introduced this restaurant to us so we came here and tried several dishes. The place felt lively, yet relaxing. I particularly liked my virgin ultimate pineapple drink -  essentially pina colada and strawberry ice in a freshly cut pineapple without the alcohol. It's so refreshing & satisfying! The Jamaican chicken was just okay and the portion was plentiful.  the waiter was friendly and everyone seemed to enjoy the atmosphere and conversations.  Another reason to dine here is that it's pretty close to the strip, has plenty of parking and easy to hail a cab or get rideshare to and fro.  I would definitely return if in a mood of something different and tropical in Vegas.

Or waiter, Jeremiah took a good amount of time with us, being our first visit. He knows his menu very well. Cannot say enough! We will be back for sure!! 1Gf2XKwaqOfJcy2nOrmT4w.text: For those who want to whisk themselves away to an island adventure in the middle of the desert, there's plenty of Caribbean-themed restaurants in town for one to sate their needs. Of these, Bahama Breeze is one of the few that would count as a chain restaurant specializing in Caribbean and island cuisine -- located in the Hughes Center off the Strip, it's a good place to unwind without getting roped into the hustle and bustle of the Strip!  I came here with my mother and her friends over the weekend to catch up after our previous get-together at the District left us disappointed -- and this time we were more than satisfied with what we ordered. If you want good service, ask for Travis by name!  We started off by splitting the Jamaican jerk wings -- and they were so juicy and flavorful, we were even gnawing on the bones after! My mother, one of her friends and I then opted to split three different dishes -- their grilled salmon and tostada salad, the seafood paella, and the braised oxtail -- while our other friend opted to get the skillet jerk shrimp and black bean soup.  When our entrees came out, we were all blown away with how delicious everything was! The salmon salad was light and flavorful, the seafood paella was filling and very savory, and the braised oxtail was rich and meaty -- again, I was sucking on the bones to get all the meat off! I also got a virgin Bahamarita to wash down our food, and it was a delightfully light counterpoint to the strongly-flavored dishes we ordered. Our friend also said that the black bean soup and the shrimp was to her liking.  The biggest surprise for us came at dessert, though -- we ordered the coconut grande, a warm coconut cake with coconut pineapple ice cream, pineapple and toasted coconut ( if you're allergic to or don't like coconut, there's plenty of other desserts like the rum cake or the Chocolate Island that are to your liking ). It was so good and so refreshing that we ended up ordering a second one because the dessert was just that good!  The main reason why our experience was only four stars and not five, however, is due to the service near the end of the meal -- we had another server attending to us who regularly forgot our requests, didn't fill up our drinks, and overall didn't give us the kind of attention Travis gave us when he was attending to us.  During our meal, we commented about how we felt like we were on a stay-cation of our own because of how relaxed the atmosphere was -- and that's really the whole point of Bahama Breeze, to encourage its diners to relax and forget about their troubles for a few moments while breeding through Caribbean fare! ( Pun not intentional. ) If you're looking for a good place to unwind on a work day or on a weekend, Bahama Breeze is a great place to go!

A_QXKt8Ybs3yxstHwNGT7g.text: Bahama Breeze is my favorite restaurant hands down.  It's always my go to when I have had a bad day or just want my favorite foods. I am so excited that they have added a new dish to their menu, Tequila Salmon. Fresh mangos and other fruits on the topping. Sweet mashed potatoes and fresh greens. The music playing made me feel like I was right on the islands of the Bahamas. We had fresh guacamole and chips for the appetizer which was slamming. Since it was my birthday I got the rum raid which is 6 alcoholic beverages on a tray. I think I drank all but one which was a little strong with ginger but the rest to die for!! I came with a party of 5. The others ordered...a honey bbq burger , chicken with plantains , some sort of pasta dish and steak. They all said it was really really good. Our waitress was super nice and kept the drinks coming!! There was no wait tonight which was nice but it still got pretty busy. They really keep this location pretty and clean! I will always come back here ! My favorite restaurant hands down

jQF7klSURaMFIV_OmHtW4g.text: I'm honestly disappointed. I brought a friend to celebrate her birthday. When we arrived, I had asked the host if they could bring a little birthday dessert for my friend, she said yes. Once the check was paid, I was hoping they would bring it over to the table. But they didn't. So I excused myself to the restroom and politely reminded the waitress about the birthday dessert. She said they were going to bring it. However, about 10 minutes later our waitress brings a birthday dessert to the table across from us. I assumed maybe they would bring out my friends dessert soon afterwards but another five minutes passed and the waitress walked by giving us a look like "why are they still here?". We ended up leaving. I was bummed that I couldn't make my friend's birthday any special. But more frustrated that the staff was unreliable to help out.

JoY5_GRozq9UXUT4b7h4lA.text: The food was absolutely fabulous. I had the jerk chicken pasta and it was great. My husband had the beef bowl and he was beyond pleased. The key lime pie was amazing. Great family atmosphere. The children's menu was healthy and delicious. We had dinner there 2 nights in a row because it was soooo good. Both nights our waitresses were wonderful. i_zPv1fvRBCM45Mawcayfw.text: I went to this restaurant with a large group of 60 people. We have the restaurant two weeks notices that we were coming. When we arrived tables were not set up, we had to set up ourselves. It took thirty minutes before our orders were taken, then it took another hour and a half to get out food. Keep in mind we were prepaid and had three items from the menu to choose from, burger, tacos, or pasta (not complicated dishes). The food tasted good, however some were cold by the time we got it. Also 6 people did not receive their food until 30 minutes after most of the party received their food. And in the end two people never received any food at all.   Over all it was a terrible experience, if you are traveling in a large group DO NOT go to this restaurant. I don't know how it is when you are with two or three people verse 60, but clearly the restaurant can not handle large parties, and should have NEVER accepted us as such a large party.

tpApgQuqu6k-BV1ays4W-Q.text: Service was nearly non-existent. Employees were noticeably disinterested or awkwardly unhappy. Quality of the food was comparable to fast food.    I keep hearing good things about this place, but I was disappointed. They sat us in the patio area. The patio is a nice open window area with a gas fireplace in the center. The fire creates a nice mood and the fresh air is lovely. However, its not the greatest on a warm day. Also you can smell the gas or propane that fuels the fire when down wind. It can be nauseating after a while. Our server is a nice guy, but noticeably disinterested. We place our order with an appetizer. The appetizer is delivered but utensils or napkins were not provided. We flagged an employee, and let him know we didn't have any napkins or utensils. A few minutes later he produced a handful of cocktail napkins. We needed to flag another person for the rest. The appetizer tasted horrible. Ahi tuna should not have a heavy fish flavor. Our main order was delivered by an individual who was not amused by our misunderstanding of what he said when asking "who ordered what". It was clear that he was quite unhappy with this duty. I had ordered a Cuban sandwich. It tasted fine, but was ordinary. You can find the same quality at any subway or port of subs. Nothing impressive. We decided we had enough and requested the check...I can still taste the tuna, it was pretty bad.

Qjv2J8Rx2Sijlnl_jkwq8A.text: I visited Bahama Breeze with my boyfriend on August 24th. A friend of his recommended the spot to us. Since it was off the Vegas strip we were seated right away. Our waitress was Jaime. She was very attentive and polite. She had asked us if we had been there before so she could properly introduce us to the menu and even made a few suggestions. I ordered coffee and mentioned I was tired and Jaime frequently stopped by to check if I needed more coffee.  I ordered their fish tacos with fries. I really enjoyed their spread for the tacos it had a nice zing to it. The entree came with 3 tacos so it is a large serving. My boyfriend order the chicken and mashed sweet potatoes. YUM! The restaurant is huge. Tall ceilings and lots of sectioned off seating areas with different decor, which made it visually appealing. There was lots of seating in the hostess area as well. I thought the wooden beach chairs were a nice touch. I would definitely return to this establishment.

FyRSkO6v7CugVxHtaUPiYw.text: If I had to choose one favorite in Las Vegas this would be it! It has the best vibe, best service and best food. If you come here ask for Tina as your server. She is the best. Happy hour is where it's at too. I can't say enough good things about this place. I've been here several times and every time it's been perfect. It almost feels like you're not in Vegas but the Bahamas, hence Bahama Breeze. :) Enjoy your dining experience, it won't disappoint!

E_GP-1qmsOY0JvCEWPzgFg.text: Allways great service and great food absolutely no complaints very inexpensive well worth it!

xsjrNBxCIvujVG5B9y1RSw.text: Awesome customer service. Not sure of his name but her had spikey hair. I wasn't sure about what I wanted and he took the time to explain the menu to my daughter and I . I had the fish tacos ...yummmy and my daughter tried the burger. We left full, happy and satisfied

v4q1naSCduf7dLUFbV3qSA.text: This is one of my favorite spots: great food and even better service definitely coming back.....our server Donna was AMAZING!!!

nrdKv9Uor2G_GLFnGruFYg.text: Las Vegas Carribean TREASURE! Love love this place. We always start with the Fire-Roasted Jerk Shrimp... AAMAZING! It has all the perfect ingredients you can taste. The shrimps are sitting in a pool of this tangy buttery sauce- garlic, tomatoes,thyme.. the sauce is so great you want to drink it but don't go for the spoon just yet, they bring out this warm cuban bread for dunking!... mmm!  Another favorite is the Jamaican Grilled Wings, they are slow roasted to get the skin crispy, but once you bite into them you will taste the tender chicken they pair them with spicy jerk sauce (which you will most likely want your own for dunking)  Drink favorite- Frozen Bahamarita! sweet, tangy and freshing.  This is a must try when in VEGAS! Enjoy!

EkBZSSltWcG1xoNmSzUvXw.text: We went to Bahama Breeze to celebrate my Son and Daughter both completing their college degrees. The food was great,  as we're the cocktails,  but the highlight of the night was our server,  Tamikah.  She made our special event even more special.  One of our party has dietary restrictions,  and Tamikah worked with the manager to make sure her dinner was perfect,  and it was.  We were a large party (9) people,  and each one of us we're completely happy with our meal and the evening.  We are now fans of Bahama Breeze and of Tamikah!

HcU4gKxuYClRhKtDCUHDsQ.text: Great food & fruity drinks. Enjoy your jerk chicken pasta while listening to a live reggae band.  Nice decor.  Reminds me of islands back home.

We stopped in last eve for a cocktail and app at the bar and had a Moscow mule which was good and an order of Conch Fritters and Yuca Fritas (fried Yuca) which is like a fried potato but better. Everything was very good and reasonably priced. Service from the two female bartenders was excellent as well.  We'll be back for sure!

cMmzxGmpjWqjWaTFUEMg7g.text: Bahama Breeze is a fun place to eat!  We came here around 7p on NYE before we walked the strip.  I was surprised we were able to get a reservation for 10, but it seemed like 7p was a bit early.  The food is pretty good, and for the price you can't really beat it.  I know that Vegas has all sorts of buffets, but there is something somewhat sad about buffets; most people concentrate on eating.  The ambience is great despite the somewhat tacky props and decor.  I'd imagine I'd give this more of a 3.5, but since they were so accomodating about adding another table (to make 10 from 8) and since I had such a good time (it being NYE), why the heck not, 4 stars for everyone!

fTUbtfjBw8d8sg5JfTfYbw.text: So, one of the reasons I am drawn to this restaurant is the ease of getting here and the simple parking lot. However, I have been pleasantly surprised each time I come to this chain here in Las Vegas. I always get the fish in season, which comes with the chef's veggies and some sort of starch - my favorite being cinnamon mashes sweet potatoes. Every time, the fish is cooked perfectly and the service impeccable. So, for a fabulous, very reasonably priced lunch or dinner, and away from the craziness of the strip, this place is a nice option. Plus, there is always good music streamed in!

xTTl3Xi5S8YosUEW0JD6Lw.text: With its close proximity to the university, my classmates and I often swing by for their happy hour that goes from 4-6 pm. (Apparently there is also a reverse happy hour that happens 9-close!) We LOVE it.  With its tropical, breezy, just-sitting-out-on-the-veranda ambience, their specialty drinks are matched to boot. We usually indulge in these $4 perfectly garnished and charming cocktails. Ultimate Pina Colada, Bahamarita, Mojito Cubano, Pineapple Coconut Martini. (I've tried them all except the sangria and margarita on the rocks.) They're so pretty that you'll want to bust out your phone and be that person at the table. You know, *that* person.  If this doesn't suit your fancy, they also offer select beers for $2-$3, wines $2 off, and the standard mixed spirits for $3.   Appetizers are half-off and are consistent with the quality of their drinks - flavorful, garnished appropriately, infused and influenced with its caribbean namesake. They offer a wide variety, so all mouths are sure to find something to pique their taste buds. The coconut shrimp seems to be a popular choice, but I recommend the beef empanadas, which is what I ordered on a recent visit.   Round up your friends, relax and take a breather at "Bahama Breeze." Totally worth it.

gOijm1cZLaOWY1pG-nCKSQ.text: I love the seafood paella it's not too salty perfect! & the sesami seared ahi taste good and fresh!

tdkxeFVsq_Y5PEeeVXQIag.text: Thanks to my boyfriend for introducing me to this place. They got a wide variety of selections to chose from. We went for lunch and prices were the norm. There were plenty of appetizers and alcoholic beverages available. So for those of you who do happy hour with co workers, friends, significant others, on a date...etc..I think this would be a great place to go to whichever the occasion is.  For those who are always indecisive with decisions, Bahama Breeze's menu may be hard for you to choose just one thing to order. I was in between a couple dishes but in the end, I went for something healthy: a shrimp rice bowl with grilled/sauteed veggies. Portions were on point for lunch. It was just the right amount to fill me up without that "ugh, I feel so fat and bloated" feeling. However, I DO get full easily though so hmm... My boyfriend got the Caribbean jerk chicken pasta. There was mushrooms in it also. Mine cost $8.95 and his pasta cost....$10-13 I think??? It's been awhile so don't quote me on the exact prices.  I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r9vP_A2OOx1u93wKcfyA6A.text: Went here for a birthday party! Kristine B And Kurt did an amazing service! The food was great. I ordered a burger and fries and it was so good. My boyfriend had a pasta that was just as good. Nice atmosphere and very clean.

ui8ZC3su9TEWgrNRflrC_A.text: This place to me is like gold in a pile of rubble.  I always pass this place and never thought of going in, however my sister dragged me here and I'm glad she did! The architecture is nicely done and reflects buildings found in tropical areas so well that i felt like i was back in Hawaii.   There is also a water feature that is in the center of the restaurant, and a bridge takes you over it to the various dining places.   We came during happy hour and got a the lobster shrimp quesadillas, skillet simmered jerk shrimp, fried chicken sliders, ultimate pina colada, and a frozen bahamarita.  I was really disappointed in the Skillet Simmered Jerk Shrimp and felt a little steered wrong by the menu. I was expecting it to have a lot of seasoning and flavor, however it was just normal shrimp scampi. The lobster shrimp and fried chicken sliders were amazing though and made up for the shrimp scampi.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried chicken sliders , Jamaican jerk&amp; lobster and shrimp quesadilla

hVA3pqdV5S9JZ2yVT3ODtw.text: What's not to love about this place?! We got a tip while around town that if you want to try an amazing pina colada, go to Bahama Breeze. We went over obviously with high expectations and we were not let down whatsoever.   I would like to mention that the service here is phenomenal. Our waitress, Tina, was probably one of the nicest waitresses I have had in along time. She was personable, she would talk and joke with us and just super nice. I have no complaints about service at all.   The atmosphere in this place is pretty rad as well. There was live music, a little covered deck with a fire pit, and a lot of cool decorations that made for a great environment. This place is mainly a seafood restaurant, so if that's not your thing then this place probably isn't for you. I'm a huge seafood fan so I loved it.   Last of all, the sought after pina colada that we were searching town for were hands down the best I've ever had! There was more to it than just your average pina colada, it was called the "ultimate pina colada" for a reason. Me and my girlfriend both were very impressed with it. We weren't too hungry so we just got some street tacos to shared and they were great as well.  We sat and hung out at this place and just talked for a while because it was such a great environment to just relax and have a great time.  If you're in Vegas,  GO TO THE BAHAMA BREEZE! You will not be disappointed.

atDVUhs5KG1rTidk_UnibQ.text: I love this place!  The atmosphere, food, and drinks are excellent!  Reasonable prices too.  I don't go to Las Vegas without a visit to Bahama Breeze.

HbklfHwb8j_vUbdK2ulE7Q.text: Loved the restaurant ambience and food. Perfect place to relax with soothing live music, delicious food and great cocktails.  Need to mention especially about our server JD. He was so fun to talk to and made our decisions easy. He made the food even more delicious with the way he described them to us :). Employees like them make a place even more special.  Definitely order the jerk shrimp and Jamaican chicken. It's not like what we were used to in other places.

sMH_pKe5FtBoPBTgQm376g.text: We've come here many times and the experience is always great!  The Jamaican Jerk Wings are so delicious and full of flavor we get them every time.  We try to get different things and every dish has been spot on!  This time I got the sirloin topped with crab and served with mashed potatoes and the steak was cooked perfectly! GsE652gdMXp92kN3zQXTSg.text: The best happy hour to go in my opinion! The food to the drinks to the service. They have their game on! Very affordable prices on happy hour menu. I'll suggest sit at the bar section because they have some amazing bartenders back there very friendly and provided amazing service. Jamaican wings and jerk shrimp is a must have. It was tasty! Food came out quick and my drinks never left empty. Good job guys!

RFZgPEZuw3WLDopikpmcMg.text: I don't go out much here but I would say, of all the bars I've been to this has been one of the best I've been to. They have this signature drink that only them have, the Bahamarita. Reasonably priced and serving is big. I love it. I also tried there jerk chicken and it taste great. The nachos that they have is to die for. Big serving and simply delicious.   Service given to us by Billy was good despite a lot of customers and he was covering a lot of tables. He was able to come visit us 2 times to check on us and he was read to offer us napkins before we asked.  Two thumbs up to Bahama breeze grille, definitely to be recommended! Keep it up!

PUFgPPCnd7diCDvw0z7qJg.text: Service was good and the waitress was very attentive. Food is ok. The "Jamaican" foods aren't necessarily very Jamaican, however the sweet plantains are good. Ambiance was also very nice.

CMcDQtM1e-EZ2iTCyM5Tlw.text: The crab cakes and Jamaican chicken wings weren't good. The lobster shrimp quesadilla was really good. The mojito is stellar and the martini was underwhelming.

d8pCAHzW7Idgmum9-FD3qg.text: Although I've only been to Bahama Breeze in Las Vegas once, I've been plenty of times in Jacksonville Florida when I used to live there, even celebrated my birthday there. So I think due time for a review.  This restaurant is actually one of my favorite places to dine; it's not "fine" dining, but it's not cheap casual. It's a nice in between kinda place, affordable but definitely appropriate for special occasions   They have awesome fruity speciality drinks but also a full bar so your dark liquors as well and standard type drinks. They have HH from 9pm-close Sunday thru Thursday which is great for Vegas! Love reserve HH!! And their HH includes food items as well.   This BB is way bigger here in Vegas than the one in Jacksonville. Bigger restaurant means bigger decor and displays inside. Pretty standard dim lighting and Caribbean decor. We came on a Friday and surprisingly it was not busy at all. They had a small dj at the outside patio playing hip hop music that did not seem to fit the theme for the restaurant but the inside music was more fitting and appropriate to the island theme.   They have a wide variety menu all incorporating an island type theme and taste, but I love how their menu is separated and really makes selection an easy task.   I'm a sucker for their establishment favorite the Coconut Shrimp. I think I get it every time as an appetizer! The crispy coconut batter on the butterfly shrimps are fried to perfection and that citrus mustard dipping sauce is almost like a marmalade glaze. Not too sweet tho and that mustard almost like a Dijon flavor gives it a nice kick! Definitely one of my fav dishes here.   My family was having seafood this night (we refrain from meat on Fridays during Lent) and this place has lots of seafood options, well lots of options period. We had the Key West Shrimp and Grits, Calypso Shrimp Linguine, the Fish Tacos, and the Island Hopper (it comes with jerk chicken but we just saved it to bring home).   The shrimp and grits was good, but I wish there was more grits that came with the dish. But the garlic light cream sauce on the shrimp was good and not too heavy, just right. The green beans at accompanied the dish were good, just needed a dab on pepper.   The calypso shrimp linguine was the best tasting of the 4 main dishes we ordered. My sisters dish so I can only comment on that I tried a little bit of it, but it was enough and tasted good enough that when I go back I want that to be my order!! It's like a light pink sorta sauce, white cream sauce but with the Caribbean flavors and spices it turns it sorta pink ish. Every good and sauce was not too heavy at all.   My dad had fish tacos accompanied by fries and guacamole. The guc was really good but the tacos shells were a bit too hard.   The island hopper actually is listed as an appetizer, but mom got it as a main entree.  Comes with coconut shrimp, coconut batter covered onion rings, shrimp stuffed hush puppies and jerk chicken. The onion rings were good and the coconut batter adds a nice twist of flavor. The hush puppies also very good. I like that they were not too dense, and nice a light almost fluffy. The dish also comes with the citrus mustard and a pineapple chutney - which also tasted like a sweet with a kick pineapple marmalade or glaze!! You can eat the chutney straight, it's so yummy.   Also the bathrooms are big and nice and I like how the have little mouthwash cups and mouthwash available at the sink so if you're going out straight after dinner, that least you good on the breath check   The place is a chain restaurant, so you get what you expect, but it's great food, reasonable pricing, appropriate for special occasions but not going to blow your wallet like if you were to eat somewhere on strip in Las Vegas and probably get less quantity. It's a good vibes sorta place and the service is good!! S/O to our server Matt for taking good care of us!!   Solid good dining restaurant and I will be back! Yay

I walked out paying $30 for my total bill with tip.  Leslie was my waitress and she was super nice and very attentive even with the large party she had to serve. This is my must come to spot every time I'm in Vegas. This is more of a local spot, but I feel like a local because I'm here everyone I come bringing other with me usually. I happen to be solo tonite, but I will bring others next time I come so that they can fall in love like I have.

QXGlMR3M_HnLDL94H38yKg.text: I've literally drove past this restaurant so many times and finally had the chance to stop by. My friend was in town for her bday and wanted to hit up their late night happy hour, 9 pm to close. The specials were great.. $5 drinks and half off apps. I also loved the decor of this place. It's a bit corny, but overall tropical fun. It sort of reminded me of Margaritaville.   As for the food my boo and I ended up sharing the fire cracker shrimp and shrimp and lobster quesadilla. Both were very tasty and especially great for such a cheap price. My favorite though was the fire cracker shrimp, it essentially was fried shrimp with a siracha Mayo dipping sauce. I'm sure it's very unhealthy, but so so good.   Can't wait to come back here again for another happy hour. My only wish is they open another location closer to the west side of town.

2-2rfBaRMTatMZOzg0XncA.text: After hearing how great the happy hour is via yelp reviews, we decided to stop in. I had a free appetizer from the Yelp Elite event that was near expiring as well! The happy hour menu was definitely affordable and they had a wide variety of options. We got the nachos, chicken quesadilla and habanero wings. The chicken quesadilla was my top pick. I wanted to like the nachos more, but they were kind of cold and mushy :( and I was really looking forward to those! I only had a few chips before deciding that the calories were not worth the taste. Drinks were strong! Service started off bad (ignored for 15 minutes) but then redeemed when we were greeted by Josh. He was super attentive and checked on us often but not TOO often. He was also very sweet to take off the most expensive app whereas most people would take off the least expensive app.

dfbQXInoa6WB0WlHCPDmwQ.text: Bahama Breeze has great food and the carribbean-american fusion is done well. The atmosphere is nice and the look of the restaurant is dope. They sometimes have live performances on one side of the restaurant.

0oRcEKu24w8WOdsQzTq6BA.text: First time at this restaurant and it was not was I EXPECTED AT ALL! The food was bland, had no taste and no authenticity of Jamaican food at all. On a good note the waitress was good on time of our food out and the appearance of the food was exceptional. For our appetizer we started off with chicken empanadas and cocktails. For our entree's, my daughter and I ordered the  Jamaican jerk chicken with beans and rice and plantains. The food was DELICIOUS and freshly hot as we were eating.   BUT LET ME TELL YOU!!! Not even a hour passed, my daughter and I both had the RUNS from this food. We had to go to the bathroom 2-4 times out the day. Which was RIDICULOUS!!! I would never return back to this restaurant ever again nor will I recommend this place to ANYONE! #ONESTAR

I definitely would come back here.

f6NtSDulsgt2BHkeY3OWcA.text: This Caribbean restaurant has been a staple at the corner of Flamingo and Paradise forever it seems.  They consistently serve good food.  I really like their jerk chicken pasta and their seafood paella.  But this time, I decided to try something different and ordered their avocado and crab meat salad.  It was so good!  All the ingredients in the salad was very fresh and I got a whole avocado with this salad. They serve the avocado cut in half for me to scoop out myself and mix with the lump crab meat.  This place is quite busy during their lunch hour rush.  Their happy hour between 4 pm to 6 pm rocks with half price appetizers and cheap drinks.  If you like chicken wings, try their Jamaican chicken wings.  Everything I have tried has been tastefully presented and very pleasing to the palate.  If you have never been here before, you must try this place out.  You won't be disappointed as a they have a wide selection of menu items to choose from.  Oh, did I mention their mojitos are to die for!!

7-EM3c0SmRy4Jbbfp1O9Hw.text: This is my second time here but it's mediocre in my opinion. I went during lunch so they had lunch specials going on. You pick an entree and either a soup or salad. We ordered the chicken quesadilla with the seafood chowder, firecracker shrimp, and the key west fish tacos.   My favorite out of the three were the key west fish tacos. but I want to say the best part of this meal was the sauce for the firecracker shrimp. It wasn't bad but it definitely wasn't great either. The service made up for the okay food. Our server was quick, attentive, and super nice.  A lot of people said good things about the Happy Hour so I might try that and see if my thoughts change.

ReO7s4hzCL2S0oZxqozeSg.text: I really wanted some jerk chicken but didn't feel like driving to my usual spot. This place was close to the area I was in so I checked reviews and went in. It was around 2pm on a Thursday so the place was pretty empty. My server was very enthusiastic and educated on the entire menu. She recommended the Taste of Jamaica after I told her what I was in the mood for and it was delicious. I normally take pictures of my food but I was starving so I dug right in. It hit the spot and I will definitely be back for more.

-UhMsw8DD8kr8SKwrzlMrw.text: The service by Everlena was awesome. She was so attentive and made our visit so enjoyable. The Cuban sandwich was delicious, kudos to the chef!

I was okay, but not great. If you are looking for something off the strip for a quick meal, then this is a good place to go.
