5DfyC1lW7KAtZ2MTEkwnCA.text: Great Happy Hour! Food is good my favorite thing on the menu are the Jamaican jerk chicken wings. They have so much flavor! The drinks are great and the servers are always friendly!

0r1otSGr0oij7kfVWW73YQ.text: Well, well, well, Bahama Breeze. I thought that I would be able to go to this establishment with some close friends to enjoy a nice dinner. Our experience tonight has truly made us never want to go to this business again. I suggest that anyone that reads this takes this information to heart. My friend had to use the bathroom and he has Parkinsons so he cannot use the bathroom on his own and needed my help. To put this as clean as possibly I was directing his stream in the bathroom when a worker walked in. He made some rude, sarcastic comment to us and walked out. I was shocked. I thought that this harassment would be over but when we returned to our tables the owner came to our table to talk to us. We did not want to scare our dates off so we just apologized but the owner accused us of peeing on the wall. He told us that it was a family friendly establishment and it wouldn't be tolerated. Now this is 2017. I don't understand why people still cannot accept someone for who they are. It has been scientifically proven that the hypothalamus lights up for certain interactions and that it lights up in a different way for one's sexual preference. They cannot change the way they are. The owner refused to believe our story and its sad that he harassed my friend due to his disability. If you have any respect for the people on this earth then please do not come to this business. They are extremely homophobic and provided a miserable experience. The food was not even that good and not worth the prices that they were. Pathetic.

bvD-uJLgCGZcTZKjm1leXg.text: In general I'm not a fan of chains but this place does it right and I've had some fun times here.  They make some really nice drinks and the food is decent.  Some of the food items aren't all that great with a few being grossly bland while others approach greatness.  The drinks generally outshine the food and are among the prettiest and most colorful concoctions I've ever seen while often being a bit too weak on the booze for my palette.  This is a pretty large restaurant that always seems to have a crowd and I really prefer sitting at the bar to be closer to the action so I don't get lost in the horde of other customers.  This isn't a place I would hang out all the time but it certainly can be fun on occasion for a little imaginary tropical flavor.

IpHLRCYiwq-emszLowoi2g.text: How the hell did I end up here for dinner?  $10 gift card and a $10 off coupon giving us a cheaper meal here than at Marie Callenders.    And better food to boot.  I got the grilled jerk chicken which wasn't jerk at all...just grilled chicken w/ a fruity glaze and some pineapple and mango underneath it.  Tasty but I could never justify paying $16 for it.  My wife got the chicken santiago which was a lot better than mine and probably what I would get if I did do dinner here again.  Its also great that they offer lighter portions so we didn't have to bring anything home in a box as usual.    The place was packed!!  I guess this is a pretty popular place?  Drinks were ok and fairly priced.  It would be a great place for happy hour if they had one.  I think doing drinks with multiple appetizers would be the way to go next time.

_K21VNCDQ8MI8ECVV6AV_g.text: I was there Saturday evening. The staff and atmosphere was great.  But the jerk chicken was merely seasoned baked chicken and my coconut shrimp was fried in old oil.

JtjA6RMAQkUBzUy6NnXs4A.text: Good food, slow service.  The ribs were not as good as the 1st time we were here. After the food was served the wait staff was more attentive.  The store was pretty empty for a Friday night.

RSnOh8mPvzg2Isu6vQk8Hg.text: My fiance and I went on a double date here tonight. We have never been to this restaurant before but heard their late night happy hour was nice. We got there just after 9 and it was fairly empty. I requested to sit outside because it was 80 outside but felt nice. We were seated in the "outside" with an AC unit blasting on us. I get cool easily so I wasn't loving it. We ordered 2 Pina Coladas, nachos, a burger and side Salad.  The drinks were good, good flavor but took a while to come. The food was out so quickly it was amazing. The burger was decent, as my fiance said it's hard to mess up a burger. The ceaser salad was, meh, limp lettuce and way to much dressing. The nachos were disappointing. Not enough chip to topping ratio, the salsa was a little bit meh too. Overall we didn't spend much because of the happy hour and we left full. We decided we wouldn't be back unless it was just for drinks because the food wasn't that great.

DSYE43x0spnWh6qA3M7H-A.text: Our family reunion was here today and must say...I am highly disappointed at the service. Ordered were confused, mixed up and our table ordered firsts, but delivered 55 mins later. All bad. All horrible. Never to return.

tNWQkfjBxphM80yWKZ-YaQ.text: I came to this restaurant during a family reunion.  I knew that we were a large group and I knew that it may take a bit longer but the time that it took for my drinks and my food to arrive was just ridiculous and we were the last table to be served when we were the first to have our order taken.  This is not the kind of service that I would wish for anyone and there would be no recommendation give to anyone ever

NULbroOE6WvpRt0ezQuRsQ.text: I was born and raised in Vegas so whenever I come back to visit I have to come to this place. They need to open up a restaurant in Arizona. My favorite meal is from here and it's a must try, the salmon tostada. The portion is huge, the salmon is perfectly cooked, and the dressing is to die for. Another favorite is the habanero wings, you get a ton of wings since it's an appetizer and the sauce is sweet and spicy. The cocktails are great here and the happy hour deals are wonderful! The service is always great, everyone is so friendly we haven't had a bad server yet. My mom and I come at least every two weeks, sometimes once a week.

qbmqzMwq8mxjmmzZOSiA9Q.text: Delishhhhh!!!!! Food was amazing!!! Service was fabulous!! Would totally recommend to a friend!

evHq0Gqkred4ADenJ4VWog.text: Walking into this place gives you a relax feeling of being on the beach. Customer service was real good from our server. Took a little long for our food to come out and it wasn't layered with Apps first then meal. Other than that service was solid. I had the Habanero wings and firecracker shrimp to start and both were delicious. Followed it with the Cuban Sandwich. The sandwich was good but tasted a bit bland for my taste. Once I asked for the extra mustard it was good. I would definitely come back when I am in Vegas. I do recommend you stop by and have try!!

uuue1v8hgUXUepkdqoZNOw.text: Love this place, nice ambience, has live music playing on the outside patio. Love the Jamaican jerk wings. The Cuban sandwiches are amazing. Everything I've tried here so far was really good. Just wish this place wasn't so far away.

BRLd-Rb3bCxM9Fvu3CAwrQ.text: I brought my husband here for a date and boy did we enjoy ourselves. The waitress was very very helpful and recommended some good ideas for us to try (it was our first time). The place was set up very nice and I love the little scenery they have inside and outside. The food was delicious and served in very generous amounts. I highly recommend you trying the Pineapple-Coconut Martini it's to die for!

STakiOZOzxQR4Wm6BpoovQ.text: My family LOVES this place, so imagine our surprise when we took company & discovered they got rid of the banana cream pie. What the hell were you thinking? NOTHING on your dessert menu compares. Ugh!

aBXzryxpHG05S-ke9HPUYA.text: Variety of food and great selection. This place is great if you feel like having a big dinner or small plates and salads. Great service and delicious food. Our server, Jerry, went above and beyond to make out time special. There was also a reggae band playing. All in all, it was a perfect experience. I will definitely come back next time I am in Vegas.

XZgAR9ubSyNBzIWaqXtqIw.text: Had a wonderful lunch. Our server Troy was on top of everything. He made sure the baby's food was served right away. He checked back frequently and was always positive and helpful. Everything we ordered, food and drink, was top notch. Really...it's not just the rum talking ;)

QlitOH645QEx50h2yGnI7Q.text: Great layout, music, etc; relaxing atmosphere.   I was in Vegas for a work convention (exciting, I know) and on the way to the airport, for the last couple of hours, I wanted something quick and easy... but relaxing.  My local friends wanted to meet here for Happy Hour.    I got here around 4:30 on a Monday.  I really love being able to just park and walk up in Vegas. Eating on the strip is a whole process of parking and walking through casinos... that's like a wasted 20 minutes there, another 20 back.  A place like this, nice and easy.    The layout is great.  It goes for a Caribbean/Cuban feel, especially outside, without feeling cheesy.  Nice shutters on the enclosed patio area, warm air coming in, sunny... just a very relaxed atmosphere where you really don't feel like you're in Vegas.  I felt like I was on vacation, actually, which sounds cheesy but it's True.  The restaurant was pretty open, though, but it was a weekday.    Now, the food...  Happy Hour is an amazing deal.  It's like $5-something per dish and beers and drinks are from $2-$3....!?  What... the... hell!  So good.     We were starving so we got almost one of everything; the jerk chicken, pork sliders, burger sliders, empandas, quesadilla, coconut shrimp, etc.  Everything was great.  My friends were a little hesitant about the jerk chicken because it was black, due to the rub, but it was great.   My friends had a pineapple coconut martini (great), mojito (they loved it, had real sugar cane), I had a hefeweizen.     So basically, you can't miss at Happy Hour - everything was great.  This is a small detail that I really appreciate. In the men's bathroom, they have mouthwash dispensers. It's a great touch because, let's be honest, your breath after eating isn't going to be the best so this is a great way to hit the reset button.   It was just a fun, casual experience... it really felt like we weren't in Vegas, but on vacation.

r-Ao5WLPo0nw1GOTEj8JiA.text: Today was our first visit. We've driven past this place for years. So glad we decided to give it a try.

z0495KcqiRoqQbqzAuBNNQ.text: Wow what a great place to eat in Vegas !  Food was soo good and service from Tina was superb.  Only thing was that the drinks was a bit light on the alcohol but they quickly fixed it with another.  The place is busy but the times with good people made it fly by.  Definitely would recommend this place to anyone in Vegas and would come back again.  Too bad California can experience this place but would do well if there is one!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LpQaBwfpINh9hQ4aIVgQjA.text: When on the fence as a rating for lunch, after much deliberation I am using a 3.. Pros and Cons... apps had two chips salsa and empenadas. Salsa on point as well as empenadas main course was a letdown. Jerk chicken left me wanting but not in a good way.  I wanted something else... Shrimp and lobster quesadillas can lay off all the spinach or rename it ....Jerk Chicken pasta should have been ordered without the asparagus... it gives and unwanted flavor...soups chicken tortilla and the bahamian seafood chowder needed some umph... now the firecracker shrimp adds back to the positives..all in all I was confused, was this a island themed or southwestern themed menu too many items take away from that island theme...I can Pass on a future visit...

pkPLeI2QAJGlmYoXu_d9XA.text: Great food. Exceptional service!! I have no complaints. We were greeted warmly, sat right near the fireplace (where they seemed to be sitting all the couples) and we had two of the most lively, and nice waitresses. Service was prompt, the menu easy to read, and the portions were HUGE for the price. Loved the guitarist playing live music and it was the perfect getaway for a cold night in Vegas. I've been back twice since my first visit.

IxSlg04sgOwRPlnzGQs_Vw.text: The food here is OK. Nothing adventurous or ambitious, but prepared well and there are many choices. The reason I give 5 stars is for the excellent service our party received from Tina. She is a sweetheart and a real pro. I won't eat there unless she waits on me. Sorry, she spoiled us.

SiU0XwVA4C5O1uGWX9V2Jw.text: They have added some vegetarian options to their menu, but it's still seriously lacking vegan options. The veggie burger is so bland... Play-doh has more flavor.   However, my carnivorous family loved their Jamaican Jerk wings & onion rings. Also, they had happy hour specials on some of their food items, so it was 1/2 off the wings & onion rings.   Nice atmosphere, lovely decor. They have live music some nights.   I wish they'd offer more vegan options.

3tuon1LYlhnIMzkygks7xA.text: This is still my go-to restaurant on my Las Vegas visits... the last couple times have been disappointing though because my favorite menu items were discontinued.  But I decided to try it again and went with something totally new: the ropa vieja sandwich with the side of fruit, no sorbet.  The sandwich was pretty good, could have used something to add flavor or spice but I would get it again.

4Hhg4F0tYTHKukrMdmDEeA.text: This place is AWESOME!! Doesn't matter what you order.   They aren't playing around here! Happy hour on point and the drinks are strong!   YEEEEE!! :)

I ordered the beef empanadas happy hour special they were awesome and the stuffed banana was amazing it was our 1st time trying new food my bf got the cuban sandwich very good. 5nOWG1Ld1NNftZiKsYwEUg.text: Service 5/5 Food 4/5 Cleanliness 5/5 Decor 5/5  Came here today and was pretty impressed by the waiter and the wide selection from their menu.  My favorites are the bahamarita, conch fritters, and lobster Shrimp quesadilla. Definitely a repeat!

MJwP3EzxJOwtF7jjYad9IQ.text: Great drinks and great food! Can't wait to return to vegas to eat again. A must stop everytime! Live music and great happy hour specials.

g5DEsK4qBmf6V4MoFY4uQQ.text: Shelly made our stop great!  We had more than two bad experiences at Satay across the street.  The food was awesome.  I had the jerk chicken and my wife had chipotle beef!  Awesome.  The ultimate pineapple drink! WOW!

eDKG8tOV2-6YtwDbN6-6AA.text: Great food. Solid Happy Hour. Tall drafts for $4 and half off appetizers! Everything is flavorful and well executed. There's a wide variety of dishes whether you're a fish monger, meat eater or veggie cruncher.  The ambiance and vibe just add to everything.

J2mlxce4APRYSKd_6NCTxA.text: I love this restaurant- so much that I had my bachelorette party there. I love the atmosphere (the decor is tropical), the food is excellent, and the caribbean music (free entertainment) adds to the overall fun feel of this restaurant. It's easy to feel good in this type of restaurant. I've only been here for dinner, but about ten times. (Twice for an e-mail member event- that was fun!) The service is really good. The location (Paradise/Flamingo) is in "Restaurant Row." It's very easy to get there from the Strip, if you are just visiting. If you're coming for dinner, make a reservation, because this is a very popular restaurant. Outside seating is nice, if you can stand the heat during the summer months.    My favorite appetizer is the Coconut Shrimp. It's now the best all around in Las Vegas, since Red Lobster's version has changed. I don't like a whole lot of breading- like how they do so often at chinese restaurants. It's definitely not the case here. Also, the size of the shrimp is pretty good.    My favorite dish here is the Caribbean Jerk Chicken Pasta. I am not usually a fan of creamy sauces, but I make the exception here. It is the perfect blend of bowtie pasta, jerk chicken (love that spice combination), mushrooms, and asparagus. It's the best thing on the menu. But that's my opinion. I've tried other things on the menu but I keep coming back to this dish.   About the prices, it's a chain restaurant, so the prices are going to be slightly higher than some restaurants out there. Frankly, I didn't think that the Planet Hollywood restaurants are anything special, but they still remain popular today for some reason. I would rather go to Hard Rock Cafe, but now, my husband doesn't think those restaurants are anything special either.          SInce I love this place, I am sure we will be back again.

S37Vre_QQ0l_g5J7LvSm2A.text: Always love coming to Bahama Breeze! I have never had a bad meal here! Today we had the Jamaican Grilled Chicken Wings as an appetizer. The wing is the full wing and they are delicious! You can order in 4's or 8's! As an entree I had the Breeze Wood Grilled Chicken with a Citrus Butter sauce, Broccoli & Mashed Cinnamon Sweet Potatoes! Yummy!! The chicken was grilled perfectly! The broccoli was steamed just right and the sweet potatoes were mmm good!  I had a bite of my husband's Calypso Shrimp Linguine and the shrimp was very tender and there was just the right amount of sauce! He also had a Barbados Rum Punch and said it almost tasted like the ones we had in Barbados! It was actually made with the same rum!   We've been coming to Bahama Breeze since we lived in Orlando,  so about 15 years. Out there we would wait up to 3 hours(it was well worth the wait) on a Fri/Sat night! Was glad when they opened the one here that it was much bigger!!   We'll be back!!

FMF4_ateMKy5cWIB6BnLiQ.text: Since I'm a huge lover of island cusine this is my go to place, not only do they have the best happy hour menu in town they have awesome drinks one in particular the Bahama Rita, reasonable price decent size and great on taste.  I've dined here on many occasions, always pleased with my visit but tonight a group of coworkers and I decided to stop in for a late meal and we were served by a server named "Tina" not only did Tina give us awesome customer service she made us feel welcomed, she was patient, and had an outgoing sense of humor definitely one of the best visits I've had.  With that being said if your ever in the mood for an awesome drink and meal at a reasonable price stop by during happy hour and ask for Tina I assure you, you will not be disappointed.

pitnZPNEk2KDyBSWu1wAQg.text: I think Olive Garden could have made a better fish taco. One ounce of cold white fish tucked into a stale flour tortilla with some cabbage. Nope! The second star is for the tortilla soup I got before the tacos, that was pretty delish. Normally I try to give a place the benefit of the doubt but my dining mates described their dishes as "this doesn't do rice a roni justice" and "seems like boiled salad." Sorry Bahama Breeze, step it up!

qFeELdBdM7RCPvLbJ0gUgA.text: I attended a group event here. The food and service were exceptional! The staff was attentive to all of our needs.  I would recommend this restaurant for group or individual dining!  Their coconut shrimp is the best I've had!

4g6jZiF0pWa09FLVZP_xyw.text: Great place. We've been here before. As we arrived and were seated we spent about 5 minutes without a greeting or drinks. I was a little upset but the manager took notice and made everything great. She took care of us immediately. Offered 2 appetizers on the house and turned us over to a great server. The rest of the meal was perfect. The Mahi Mahi was cooked as it should. Environment is lively and inviting. Great dinner. Thank you

D5TNgPSyd67fsCa2GxgRbg.text: I came here with a group of people and the service was superb.   I got the Grilled Jamaican Jerk Chicken and the meal comes with a side of vegetables and sweet potato and topped off with plantain chips.  The food was decent...I can't complain.  Maybe it was something that I am not accustomed to eating, but still well prepared.    I do love the service here.  Red was awesome and was very curteous to our party.

YdJOU9deFybItzkm9ZuBCw.text: After reading great reviews on yelp and online, my parents and husband and I came here for dinner. Jesse,our server, was knowledgeable and very patient with us as he made recommendations that would accommodate my dad's special dietary needs. He made great recommendations for tasty foods. Even though it was a Monday night, our food and service was great. Thank you! Definitely try the Jamaica sampler Platter!! It has the best of everything! The beef empanadas are also to die for!

9Ol3pX1XHIYszOh9BrAI8g.text: Excellent,  beautiful Caribbean atmosphere,  extremely courteous staff !! Husband had fish tacos, I had Cobb salad, with Ahi tuna for appetizers, key lime pie for dessert, all outstanding, can t beat price either !!! Live band !!

Zq2G_2df5J51ccmbcWvgKQ.text: Whenever I come here I come for just the lemonade. I do order food with it, typically the baby back ribs. My last visit the ribs were ehhhh. As I said, I come for the lemonade. Now the lemonade! Sucked... It used to be fresh squeezed and delicious. The bartender told me that now they make the syrup mix in the back beforehand. I came a week prior and it was still delicious. I dunno, I'm leaning towards him just being lazy. I even ordered two different ones. Both sucked and we're just syrupy tasting. Nasty nasty nasty.   The visit I'm commenting on was about a month ago. I haven't been there since and probably won't return just because of the lemonade.   To the bartenders credit, he didn't charge me for both lemonades.

Ea-3EVVeGSml8FX5-KaBfg.text: No question my worse meal ever in LV; covering 40 years of coming here each year.  My friends didn't care for their meals either.  Chicken and chorizo pasta, crab avocado salad or fish tacos- all terrible.  No one should like writing a bad review; me especially, but terrible is terrible.  Won't be back.

nCCeZLCdJlMBH8hadJZ-6w.text: Went their to get a pina colada, and was pleasantly surprised at how good it was! In fact, it was better than the ones my husband and I had while in the Bahamas; so kudos to Bahama Breeze!

P-5-QzAF2-2zT_-MDZOopg.text: Con: I didn't care for much of their menu selection but I am a picky eater. I got the Jamaican Jerk Chicken, I didn't like it. I thought it was going to be boneless thigh but it was not. I feel like boneless picks up way more flavor and as a result felt like this had no flavor at all. The rice and beans were ok but overall I was disappointed with my selection. It also took a long time to get drinks from the bar...like our food came out quicker than drinks did (alcoholic beverages).  Pros: great ambiance. Clean restaurant, live music, and decent pricing. My husband got shrimp scampi and said it was really good. We had a Carmel cheesecake and that was yummy. Our waiter, Joe, was awesome!  Great personality and really treated us well. Wait time wasn't long at all maybe 5 minutes but we did go on a slow Wednesday.   In a nutshell: I didn't care for my selection but I would try it again mainly because of how awesome our waiter was.

IfTYGDNo5T3ZdWCYsJQDeQ.text: Visited today, Sunday 2/24/18. I don' know if it's me or what but after not having gone there for quite awhile, I went a got the absolute worst waiter that I have had in a long time! First, I ordered an ice tea to drink Now I wear glasses, but, if I can see through a glass of ice tea, I know that it's not too strong, So after some wait, he brought me a Coke! Then after several return trips to see if we were ready to order, we did, so he could  go make someone else's life uncomfortable. He brought my companion's soup and when I asked where the appetizer was, he informed me that she ordered the soup ? No kidding AND I ordered an appetizer, but I guess that it doesn't come first at BB? Eventually, the appetized AND the entrees were delivered together? OK, make do! A manager (?) came over and asked if everything was OK, of course I like being served all 3 courses at the same time, it saves the waiter a trip. The waiter went into seclusion to pout and I had to walk up front to the bar to get a refill of the Coke. The waiter came to the table to ask if I needed a straw, NO I needed a refill! The food was good, as I remembered it being there, we ended up getting to go boxes. I did want to try a desert but, honestly, was afraid to take a chance with this guy! I  A terrible experience!

_MuUILixYfh0mqUD62JQzQ.text: nice atmosphere but our server wasnt the best at her job. She kept looking at me and asking for my id and my husband had it our drinks were good but took forever food was was excellant ill go back but would like another server who loves her job

wA-Wo32wJOMP6Oasod3u0A.text: The good service, cool atmosphere, and tropical cocktails earns the place 2 stars. As for the food.. 1 star. Ordered the taste of Jamaica sampler platter. The only thing decent were the plantains. Jerk chicken was so dry you could sand with it. Pulled pork was so dry you could use it as a fire kindling. The rice was bland. And the greens were overcooked. Very disapointing. Seeing as 5yrs earlier I had eaten there and the food was great. Will return for the atmosphere and cocktails. But not the food...

The Mojito is made from fresh pressed sugar cane and it muddled to perfection.  THe standard comes with a light rum.  After your second or third start to experiment with some of the other rums...perhaps a dark one.

qyVT0QF7qaugyaZkQ94BYA.text: Went there with my folks while they were visiting fun place great service and something fairly unique 2 break up the monotony of restaurants. I would definitely like to go back with a group of friends for an early dinner before a night out. They have great food and a lot of interesting and fun cocktails. ckV3oGyvuPL43SXZVO331g.text: I've been coming to Bahama Breeze since my college days and I always bring my family and friends here when they come in town. I finally decided to write a long overdue Yelp review specifically because of our amazing server today.  Tavarius was an amazingly attentive server. Answered all of our questions, gave us great suggestions when we were indecisive and made us feel great about what we ordered. Definitely made this another great experience here!

hG9bByqivVWd74tWgOg26A.text: My first time here. I came here during happy hour, so half off appetizer. I wanted to try a little of everything so I order about four items. I loved the coconut shrimp and the sauce it came with it. The beef empanadas were tasty and better the next day. I wasn't a fan of the plantains bread but the chicken was cooked to perfection. I didn't like the chicken wings. It had no flavor without the BBQ sauce. I sent it back. Lastly, I got a virgin frozen bahamarita. I enjoyed it, but I was a little annoyed they put it in a normal glass.  The staffed was really friendly and attentive. I appreciate awesome customer service.  It's in no way shape or form authentic Carribean food I enjoyed it.

aVb9kcvowFrAwGCNXIn_6A.text: They have something for everybody here.From burgers to ribs to pasta.Big portions too.Their jerk chicken is a must try and you won't be disappointed with any pasta selection.They a good selection of alcoholic drinks.A fun family restaurant.

w--4f58jD2MJVne15zaFfw.text: Used to go to this place in Atlanta but was happy to find one here in Vegas since I just relocated here. I always get the firecracker shrimp and extra sauce on the side. Then I ordered the jerk chicken bow tie pasta w/asparagus and mushrooms. I prefer much more "jerk seasoning" and more chicken. The asparagus tips would be fine but not a fan of all stalks so I put them aside. Next time I'll just say NO asparagus. If they add more spicy seasoning that'd be great. My guest got the plate w jerk chicken black beans and plantains and greens he said it was pretty good. Regardless they've got two diff happy hours -Thur 4p-6p then again I believe 10p to close (?) 1/2 off a special list of appetizers so my shrimp would have been $5 ish and discounts like $4 well drinks and $2 off certain beers. Wish it was close by-it was @ 30 min away so it's not a convenient HH for me unfortunately unless I'm already in the area which is why we went. I'll be back whenever I'm in the vicinity. Our waitress-blond older sweet lady w/tattoos was great-very prompt regarding refilling our beverage and conversation was nice. My only issues is that we have to wait, when there's clearly a HUGE open seating area that is available, meaning there are not enough servers...which is not an excuse. Just seat people before they go to another restaurant bc you didnt hire enough ppl to cover stations. The Hawaiin Manager, female is great!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruity frozen drink...def didn&#39;t taste any liquor but it was a refreshing beverage on a warm day

RCLErTcW0mTT3Pa5rGO8xg.text: THIS REVIEW IS FOR HAPPY HOUR ONLY. Tropical drinks & delicious food. As you walk in, you feel like you're on an island. Came here for happy hour with a girlfriend and it was both our first time here. We were seated outside, which by the way, wasn't really outside, just another room in the restaurant that had an outside vibe to it.   We ordered lots of different appetizers and drinks since it was 50% off. We had the Jamaican wings, crab stack, seared ahi and firecracker shrimp. The Jamaican wings were so crispy and juicy. It was accommodated by a bbq sauce (5/5). The seared ahi was ok. It lacked a little flavor (2/5). The firecracker shrimp was the same. It was just a fried shrimp with a spicy mayo dipping sauce (3/5). But the crab stack was heaven!!!! It was mango and avocados with crab meat and shrimp with a sweet savory sauce. My mouth is drooling just thinking about it right now!!! (5/5) it is definitely a must try!! They use REAL crab meat. YUMMMMM  Our server/bartender I forgot to get his name... but he was great! He constantly checked up on us and was the one who actually recommended that delicious crab stack. I had no problems with him whatsoever.   Good food & good service!!! A place worth trying. I will be back again for happy hour!!!

dj8NVwWQcSzXFz2ZdZIsSw.text: Happy Hour M-F 4-6pm and Su-Th 9-close  Happy Hour Specials are $3-$5 drink specials and half priced appetizers.    Came in for Rumtoberfest and to check out some drink flights I had seen online.  Drink flights are my fave cause I love trying everything.  Started with the Higgla's Happy Juice a 3 cocktail flight.  It was OK so we decided to order The Rum Raid an 8 cocktail flight.  We didn't realize that it had 3 of the same flavors as our previous flight.  Most of the cocktails tasted very similar, surprisingly we only liked a few.  We finished off with a margarita flight and that was by far the best drinks of the night.    For food we ordered Jamaican Chicken Wings, Key West Nachos, Coconut Shrimp, Firecracker Shrimp and Lobster & Shrimp Quesadilla.  Food was good.  Nothing amazing but a great price at half off.  Portions were large.  I was disappointed that the nachos did not have plantain chips like it said on the menu.    Service was average.  We had multiple bartenders in the few hours we were there.  None of them were very personable or friendly.

guJt3Yb-VcqV3l8zx0PkcQ.text: 11/11/18  Worst experience at a restaurant in a long time.  We placed drink and appetizer orders and it took almost 1 hour and many apologies to get to our table. Three tables that came in after us all got their food (entrees)...and we only ordered chips, guac and calamari. They also screwed up on on my husband's drink order. Input error they said, so that came only shortly before our appetizers. The server asked if we wanted to put in an order for main entrees and my teen daughter literally laughed out loud. It took so long to get appetizers, can you imagine how long entrees would take! We're in Vegas...I wasn't planning on spending the entire day at Bahama Breeze. They ended up comping our food, so we only had to pay for drinks. Honestly, they should have compensated the whole meal.

5WXM6dWLlWPTtS1ban9QEA.text: When you have to explain,  then assist the goofy server on how to open a wine bottle because she doesn't know how to use a wine key, what's really going on?? Goofy broke the cork in the 2nd bottle. My party was just celebrating some great news. All the while, Goofy continously called us, "my loves", " my babies" and "my loves." Way too frequently, my loves. You get the point.  Anyway, Bahama Breeze has changed their menu once again. Easy come, easy go. Of course we'll be back, they have tasty drinks. That's all she wrote, "my loves"...

KmoDTJ8WPpeScVbg6KuMRw.text: This has always been one of My favorite Vegas restaurants. We always have a large group of people when we visit and the service doesn't disappoint. For my most recent visit, I ordered the stuffed crab shells (definitely my new favorite) and an order of beef empanadas which I ordered to take home. So, I got full off of mango lemonade, lol. Did I mention it's served in a glass and the extra is served in the mixer? When I got around to the beef empanadas with the mango chutney (breakfast), I was pleased with the amazing flavors, even as leftovers. This restaurant is a great place for happy hour. They have amazing drink & food specials.

ofC8DmMza7rXlW7KJ_Guvg.text: I love their food. Caribbean style love the drinks. The meats, the pastas chicken, salmon. I have tried it all at this place been coming here the last 15 days and still love it. Never disappointed either for casual dining or romantic dinner is the place to go.

rVBJ1F6ukSwOM7-3oQeIQA.text: I chose Bahama Breeze due to the Yelp reviews and the proximity to my hotel. I had the coconut shrimp. The meal was great the shrimp were delicious I'm guessing about 10 nice sized shrimp the yellow rice was good and steamed broccoli was good. The service was very attentive but not bothersome. I would definitely recommend and will come back on the next trip to Las Vegas

KUjHwqLXed1eajJQsCR-SA.text: I was looking forward to trying bahama breeze after passing it quite a few times. I saw that they have happy hour and was finally able to go with my sister and her BF.   Lots of parking and a really great environment with live music. We weren't in the main dining room, but we were in the room with the live music and beachy feel which was great. I enjoyed the atmosphere.   Our server took a while to come by, she might have been on break or something. By the time she came, we had already looked over the menu and knew what we wanted to order. Our food came out quickly after we placed our order.  Lobster and shrimp quesadilla: unfortunately it was our least favorite dish. I didn't get to taste much lobster and I felt it was lacking some flavor or spice.  Coconut shrimp: their most popular appetizer but it wasn't crispy enough for me. It was pretty good but I was hoping for a stronger coconut flavor. My sister loved this dish.   Seared ahi tuna: 5/5!!! I could eat an entire plate (or 2) but unfortunately I had to share. The ahi tuna tasted fresh and the salad went very well with it. The mango glaze wasn't over powering either.   Habanero chicken wings: we probably should have ordered the Jamaican jerk wings. While the portion was really big, we did not enjoy the wings. It was spicy but the BBQ and habanero didn't mix very well IMO.   I had been wanting a frozen bahamarita all day and it did not disappoint me. I'm pretty sensitive to alcohol and yes... I'm one of THOSE people who get super red after half a shot but I managed to finish my entire drink without getting tomato red. Drinks here seem to be watered down because I also tried my sisters classic margarita and it didn't taste like it had any alcohol in it! I loved it but she did not.   The next I come back, I'll be ordering their seared ahi tuna again and I'll be trying their empanadas

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uA6lnc5kPoTTNMAc3Os-fA.text: I'm not a fan of Caribbean food but do love the food offered here! The portion sizes are great and most dishes you can choose small or large.  I'm a huge fan of their coconut shrimp tacos (choice of 2 or 3). The tacos come with a generous amount of coconut shrimp and an added spice is added with their house style pico. Last night I ordered this dish with a side of their beef tomato salad. The tomatoes were tossed in a vinaigrette and topped with fresh basil. Bold fresh flavors in every bite! My boyfriend always enjoys the Jamacian jerk chicken pasta. I've never tried it but it looks delicious (if you like jerk chicken). Bowtie pasta is tossed with asparagus, mushrooms and of course chicken. This is another dish you have the choice between large or small. We came late and took advantage of their happy hour. We don't drink but they offer half off, full size appetizers. If you love quesadillas you have to try theirs! Cheesy, bold flavors and deliciousness!! Our server last night was Fred. He was so nice and very attentive. Our drinks were never empty and our table was always manicured. He was extremely friendly but allowed us to enjoy our meal without being overbearing. Thank you Fred! I really appreciated your service last night.

ekVoiuUZdUTxB0biTQ3Ylg.text: My husband and I use to come here often but then we started noticing that the quality of the food went down as well as the service so we stopped coming. Fast forward several years (4 yrs) some friends of ours said BB had been revamped and it was worth it to give it another shot. So a few months ago we tried it again and felt that it wasn't much better. Then tonight we decided to give it another try and we took our kids and we're beyond disappointed with everything we ordered. We ordered an appetizer and 3 entrees. Both my husband and I ordered the Key West fish tacos which were a comical. They barely contained any fish let alone any filling, the tortillas were gross store bought flour tortillas that were soggy by the time we got them. Our kids sliders weren't anything great. In the end, we left saying we'd never go back. We gave it a few tries and it's not worth the drive nor money.

VeNO4JDIrMacXAMNIDoGig.text: Went here with my girlfriend for the first time. Pretty much become our go to spot for date night (we're married now). Food is awesome and service is equally so.

LHn6PfeFB9gA-ib5Mr7wNA.text: I'm here at Banana Breeze for the first time for lunch. I'm here on buisness and I saw this place. I stopped into the parking lot and the first thing I did was search it on YELP. It had 4 stars so I went in. I ordered the Cuban sandwich and seafood clam chowder. I have to say I was not impressed with either. The sandwich was made with deli sliced ham and deli sliced pork. Not what I expected! That alone gives the sandwich a cheap quality. They need to use real pork from the smoker or rosted. Same thing with the ham. The chowder was a little watery and lacked a bit more flavor. It also needs to have bigger chunks in it. The service was pretty good. It's nice and cool inside. Need to beat the heat! I like the ambiance in this place. I'll be back to try other food items. I want to give it a fair chance. 2 stars for now. More to come stay tuned. I'm here for the next two weeks.

6j-URygE1q9UEgRX1j2_zQ.text: I went on Monday later in the evening around 9. It wasn't busy. The hostess was very sweet and pleasant.  Our waiter Jerry or Gary (I can't remember exactly sorry) was also very pleasant and very helpful on recommendations. He was attentive and nice. I appreciated the service I received. The food was delicious! We ordered the beef empanadas and omg!! Bomb! A must try! Best part the appetizers and  select alcoholic drinks were half off! Score! We got the frozen margarita. Can't remember the exact name but it was colorful. So pretty and delicious! Our dinner came and my husband got the jerk chicken pasta. It wasn't too spicy had a kick and tasted yummy. I ordered the coconut shrimp with rice and garlic mashed potatoes. The shrimp were cooked to perfection and really good as was the rice. The potatoes were ok not the best. Order something else instead of the potatoes. Overall had a great experience with great service and delicious food. Highly recommend! Wish they had one in California.

kEV8sHjVF6HKjXZzs-p_Mw.text: Haven't really been to Bahama Breeze in years....but thanks to a Red Lobster gift card (both restaurants belong to Darden), and a Valentine's date for some KISS Mini Golf (review on that later), we were hungry!  Got to say, restaurant is still not bad for a Caribbean-themed chain.  Place was hoppin'!  Very, very busy.  Folks must like their congo music, eh?  Breezy.  Luckily even with no reservations our wait time for a table was less than five minutes.  Like the place - open, airy, noisy, and boy do I love the smell of Jerk chicken on the grills.  I'm really hoping that it's cooked on an open charcoal flame, but I'm pretty sure it's probably not.  Can't have everything I suppose.  After getting seated and giving our drink order (Bahama Breeze using bottles of Republic of Tea - Ginger Peach is tasty but a tad pricy) we were ready to view the menu.  It really is a bit of a mix, some Jamaican, some Caribbean, some American.  Fortunately a lot of it sounded tasty.  Wifey couldn't decide so she settled on the Island Hopper ($19.99) - appetizer sampler platter of sorts that included their signature Jamaican chicken wings, crispy coconut shrimp, onion rings, and conch fritters.  It came with sauce sides of jerk BBQ sauce, citrus mustard, and a roasted pineapple chutney.  For the most part she enjoyed it.  The Jamaican chicken wings were a bit smaller than she remembered but they were still very tasty with a peppery kick.  Coconut shrimp were indeed crispy, but light, with good hints of sweet when dipped in the pineapple chutney.  Conch fritters were only OK, a bit forgetful because they tasted more of a hush puppy with very little conch inside.  And the onion rings, well they were just onion rings.  I ended up getting the Cuban Sandwich ($10.99) and while I did like it, I should have read the menu better.  Why does Bahama Breeze put lettuce & tomato in a Cuban sandwich??  And salami???  Very, very strange.  Just do it like the Cubans guys - marinated roasted pork, good ham, Swiss cheese, pickles, and mustard between buttered Cuban bread then smooshed in a plancha till golden brown.  Simple!  Thank you Jon Favreau of Iron Man and Chef fame!  I think I would have enjoyed this sandwich a lot more without the extra fluff, but did applaud the effort of Bahama Breeze trying to make the sandwich their own.  Next time I would just order it with no lettuce & tomato, or just put it on the side.  Overall a good experience at Bahama Breeze, the atmosphere was inviting, and the service was stellar without being pretentious.  The food could use some tweaking but that's par for the course.  If this place wasn't so far from where we live I would be likely to check out their menu further or at least come down for their hoppin' Happy Hour.  Jamaican me crazy!

FhU5vSFi0BuS5ph8sABiYA.text: I've been wanting to try this place ever since I moved here. I finally made it and I wasn't disappointed. We started with the panko/coconut onion rings, they were really good. Not to greasy and the coconut flakes gave it a nice flavor. I got the avocado and crab salad. Very very good. I ate every single bite! No run for dessert, but my two drinks were sweet enough. They were a specialty drink, kinda like a pina colada but without being frozen, very good! I definately will come back!

o-pCUJHt2iHL3g7IgumBfA.text: We went here for a birthday party for a co-worker of a friend of mine.  It was not my first choice to go to..honestly I'd only seen this place in passing on my way to the airport.  From the outside it doesn't look like much, nice big building on the corner of Paradise and Flamingo on the Northwest side.  Walking in, however, you feel transported to another place with the Caribbean theme of the restaurant and bar.  However, like a friend has told me, you can't necessarily paint something to make it what it ain't.  The food here is expensive for what you get.  We ordered quite a bit of food for the party: Spinach Dip and Island Chips, Island Onion Rings, West Indies Patties, and Creole Baked Goat Cheese to start.  None of these, to me, were particularly good.  The Spinach Dip was not even touched as my friend ordered it and then tried to pass it along to everyone else because she hated it.  The entree's were a little better: Cuban Sandwich and Margarita Chicken.  However for the $10 and $15 plates of food, I've had much better.  The service was slow for a slow Wednesday early evening dinner.  It was nice that we were able to sit in the atrium outside that was nicely cooled.  All in all, this seems like a poorly done chain restaurant based on a Caribbean theme.  My search shall continue (though how hard I look is yet to be determined).

Avi9C-B7FQm1ZxFb38j4tg.text: I have a soft spot for Bahama Breeze.  The whole island theme is kind of tacky, but the food is quite good and this place is a nice break away from the places on the strip.    My good, ol' standby here is the Bahamian Grilled Kabob, which is fantastic.    Prices are reasonable (esp. compared to the strip) and the employees have always been friendly.  I definitely recommend going here!

eczxyDbAwXL4uktkVJAgDQ.text: Good food for a decent price.  The pinapple upside down cake was chocolaty and amazing.  Our server, Rand, was great too.

zUgZVx34YfhRUYW_xZPXsA.text: I wanted to find a location for the "meet & greet" on the first night of our destination wedding weekend, and I was totally disheartened by the pricing of any and all on-Strip locations. While driving around, the BFF and I happened to see Bahama Breeze. I know, I know, it's a chain -- but it has a fun, vacation-y appeal, so we called from the car to ask about group events.  Options from the low $20s per person? Cash bar available? Sign us up! We swung in for lunch to try as many menu items as we possibly could. The tostones and coconut shrimp both made for very tasty appetizers, although the tostones were a little dry -- but once you add all the cheese and toppings, yuuuuuum-ola. We both agreed our entrees were good, although now I can't remember what Jess got (some sort of chicken sandwich?). I tried the tilapia and was pleasantly surprised at how tasty it was, and it came with cinnamon sweet potatoes! We even had dessert, fantastic dulce de leche cheesecake (with an excellent graham cracker crust).  I will readily admit that I would probably only normally give BB more like 3 stars; however, this location was so upbeat and fun, the staff members were all so friendly and helpful, the drinks were so cheap... that I'm bumping it up. AND, it looks like it will be the perfect place to host a meet & greet, so if you're looking for a group event place, I'd definitely consider it!  P.S. One other reviewer mentioned the bathrooms, and I will ditto that. They're beautiful. Weird, I know.

7fan2WLs9s4jpXxdhCDMKA.text: Came here on a weekday for an escape and catch up with my uncle and was very pleasantly surprised. I'd been to a Bahama Breeze near Seattle a couple years ago and it screamed chain. So did this one upon first inspection, but a few things stood out.  First, our waiter was top notch. Friendly, engaging, knowledgeable, and even engaged us as we asked about how the local dining businesses were faring in the current economic state. He was actually a PT waiter at another restaurant, and he helped us pick our dishes.  The food was surprisingly tasty. I had the jerk chicken bowtie pasta, which was slightly spicy but in a good way.  Although I might not go actively searching for this place next time I am in Vegas, I would recommend it if you're looking for a reasonably priced, tasty meal.

Ceo1Uczh-G2039X7e2T7LA.text: This place was really good. Stopped by with friends for lunch.  The building is huge inside with a cool water feature as you enter. Two bars to choose from. I ordered the Cuban. it was great. Tho I can't really recall much detail because I forgot to review right after I ate there and it's now like two months ago. BUT ! I can say we all enjoyed our meals and the customer service was great.  I recommend stopping by.

pZWTGQGcbtMl4YMk78LMzw.text: I would like to formally thank Bahama Breeze and their staff for their sincere efforts towards RUINING my family reunion dinner on Saturday, July 23, 2011.  God Bless my mother and my aunts for their hard work in putting this thing on and for keeping everyone else patient while this disaster was taking place.  This was by far the worst6 display of service I have ever seen and several formal letters are being sent to their corporate office as I write this.    My family had made arrangements with their business office to hold our reunion here for a buffet-style dinner.  We do not live in Las Vegas (none of us do) so we did everything via fax and phone.  We have been to this location on several occasions over the years, so we are familiar with the food and always had really good service here.  I also always enjoyed the food, so we thought this would be the perfect place to host our family reunion dinner.  Anyway, so the contract we made was for three main entrees (seafood paella, baby back ribs and Jamaican grilled chicken) , three side dishes (yellow rice, green beans, creamed sweet potatoes) and their signature green salad.  This was all to be served buffet-style with unlimited choice of soft drinks, tea/coffee and iced tea. The price negotiated was $35 per person.  We brought in our own cakes for dessert which they kept in the back refrigerated for us.  This was a group of approximately 31 people.  Kids' menu items were to be paid for separately as well as cocktails, beer and wine. Each table would get their own bill for those things separately (and for anything else you want on the regular menu).  From the beginning, service problems began.  There were two servers who primarily came in our area.  Over the course of the evening, we had to literally chase these people down for drinks and just basic service.  It was horrible.  I noticed that the buffet serving containers were quite small for the amount of people in party and they emptied very quickly.  Nobody was there to replace to food.  People sat with food while others had to wait a long time before being able to get food.  The salad bowl probably could serve about 6 to 8 people, so when that emptied (no other food was out or available at this point), people just sat their for a good 20 minutes before they brought out more.  This was the ongoing theme of the night.  Need a refill on that ice tea? Be prepare to never get it unless you run around trying to find the waiter to get some.  Nobody was attending to our party.  Nobody was busing the plates so we literally had pile them in the middle table.  Kids' orders were not brought out in a timely manner so the kids were eating like an hour into dinner service.  Remember the tea and coffee? None was offered to anyone and we paid for it!  And to top off , when the staff did make an appearance, they had really nasty attitudes about it.  No apologies.  So where was the manager in all this? Certainly not rolling up his sleeves trying to help his clearly overwhelmed waitstaff.  He was somewhere else, making excuses that there were other big parties going on.  NOT OUR PROBLEM.    Look, this was clearly an understaffed event and the lack of attention to ANY sort of detail shows that, but come on! It was just blatantly bad.  Poor attitude and unapologetic staff is just a reflection of the management's nonchalance for literally pissing all over this party.  We had babies crying from hunger, we had piled up dirty plates, plenty of empty glasses and annoyed family members.  Thank goodness we are good spirited people, kept the party going and did our raffles and announcements and passed out cake as planned. We tried not to let our experience at Bahama Breeze ruin our getting to catch up with each other and have fun, but damn! Work with us here! We could have just gone to a buffet at one of the casinos for this and we probably should have.   Oh and I haven't even gotten to how salty the food was!  The paella was nearly inedible even though they did not skimp on seafood, does it matter if they pour a whole container of salt in it?  Dry chicken, hard to cut with my knife.  However, the ribs were decent as were the green beans and sweet potatoes..but wait..something was missing.  Mom did not realize this until after but they forgot our yellow rice.  We have a few people in our party who are allergic to seafood so the paella was out, hence the reason for the yellow rice side.  I guess everything else was so bad we forgot about the missing side. Anyway, my mom called their business office and got it refunded.  Either way, I could think of sooo many other places to host a dinner like this that would have gone so much smoother.  They really should be ashamed for doing such a sloppy-ass job.

TmGaw9kOeWY1RXoiBfwWWg.text: even thou BB is a chain eatery  really like the food. i try to visit when in LV and really enjoy the food and service. all the appetizers are very good and if visit during HH are worth the money for sure. plenty of beer, wine etc buy i like the Bahamarita. 1 more tip........ ask for CHRISTINE  to be ur server. she has served us several times and is always friendly, helpful and a JOY to be around while in LV and the BB.

1IDsToNJWMCIYB1svMcg7g.text: I wanted to like this place.  It had a great atmosphere and a good vibe.  We went here because it had a claim that it was "Gluten Free." Something I have to look for because of my wheat allergy so I was excited.  They didn't have a special GF menu which is not a big deal to me because typically the waiter will just fill me in or make his recommendations.  This waiter didn't know much about what foods or sauces had flour.  He didn't really have any enthusiasm to find out and come back and make some recommendations. So I had to McGyver my own meal which typically means I have to eliminate the sauces. I tip very well when waiters really know the foods and can make recommendations or atleast have the eagerness to find out for me. I don't typically eat out and this was going to be a real treat for me.  I ordered scallops in butter sauce and the scallops were burnt and then raw in the middle. When I sent them back, they replaced only the one I ate half of.  I asked for a dinner salad instead and they gave it to me with croutons.  He took it back and picked off the croutons as crumbles were still there. What part of "I can't eat flour don't you understand?"    I sent back the salad and refused to eat as I swore someone would have spit in my food by now.  And let me tell you, I'm a very passive person when it comes to any problems with my food.  So I wasn't mad or anything and I didn't give the waiter any attitude. By the way, the waiter never apologized for any inconvenience or was concerned.  There was a huge two parties going on and every staff member kept coming in and out the patio doors fussying over the parties and most people seated were ignored and were very openly upset about the service by stopping random staff members for drink refills and to check on their food.  I was with two other people who swore it tasted nice but I don't know if they were just being polite as literally "utter chaos" was going on around us and we waited 45 minutes for our table when we called in advance for a reservation.  I was treating my friends so I was shocked that I was given a "$10.00 charge" for food that was returned!  I hadn't eaten anything sat and drank myself silly over the ice tea and left more hungry than I came in.  There was absolutely no apology anywhere or from anyone and I couldn't believe the waiter was serious about this charge. So I didn't tip him.  Probably the first time in a really really long time that I haven't tipped a waiter.  Still feeling a bit guilty over it but it was a very bad experience and it wasn't me that night it was everyone else around us too.

GjDejxeFKlGOR_tbRp78uA.text: I always love going here with friends for fun and yummy food and great island cocktail concoctions!

k7cvbnezWeI-X7tOEj_SwQ.text: I just had my wedding reception there and the food and atmosphere is amazing! I was more than impressed with the quality of the food and wonderful service from the waiters that worked our party. I will definitely be returning.

ZyAuNOtYlcxlU8PvFt2yUw.text: Last night I went to Bahama Breeze it is one of our favorite places to stop and eat when we're in Vegas we've been going there for years. I ordered the special last night it was Creole chicken and chorizo sausage pasta. it was good very tasty not a whole lot in the bowl thank God because it gave me food poisoning. its been about 24 hours right now and I am so sick you can't believe it and I know I got it from Bahama Breeze because it was the one meal I ate the entire day and I feel great prior to that. I hope other people will write a yelp review and talk about the same problem if they have it and I wish Bahama Breeze would get its act together with it comes to taking care of food in the kitchen at the right temperature. It's not a good idea to try and kill their patrons it's going to be awhile before I go back there to eat again

1EkC7IRGthELLddoO6BOhA.text: I LOVE BAHAMA BREEZE!!!  Bahama Breeze has the BEST margarita's I've ever had!  Mmm, mmm, mmm!  Um, it's triple flavored and sooooooo good!!  I used to go to the Bahama Breeze in Austin, TX all the time (now shut down).  When I moved back to Cali, they didn't have one on the West Coast!  WHAAAAAAAT?  Luckily, they opened this one up in Vegas!!  Not that close to me, but only a 9hr drive or 1hr plane ride!!  Oh yes, I like the coconut shrimp too!  Not all the food items are that good, but the atmosphere is great.  Okay, the atmosphere is not-as-great at the Las Vegas location, but there is no way I can give this place less than 5-stars based on their Margarita's alone!  *yum!*

nSDGU8ZQPcDnfRwqviFKFg.text: We decided to veer off the Strip in search for something different and not "Strip-priced" and ended up at Bahama Breeze.  We were pleasantly surprised at their menu, as they offered some of our favorite types of food!  I ordered the jerk chicken wings (of course!) and my daughter ordered their West Indies Patties.  Both were awesome!  The service was also good and our drinks were never empty.  We will definitely keep this place in mind next time we're in town!

PQDEce1T05qFnnEMHGFEPw.text: I LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! We were a group of 10 and we didn't really have any problems with our orders. The food is delicious! The staff is really nice, depends on what time of the day you go to, though. We went during lunch, and it was packed but nothing I couldn't enjoy. I really wish they had this place in California!

q-d6xXh9ulc3wr4HVz2FwA.text: As a local, one of my favorite places to go. 2 happy hours and mojitos are amazing. The only reason I didn't give 5 star is the lack of big tv's, sorry but I am a big sports fan. Also I had been a long time costumer, I usually arrive alone to meet my husband later after work and the hostess stuff are far from friendly, is like if you arrive as a woman sitting at the bar does not deserve to be greated!!!. The rest of the stuff are very friendly, from servers to bartenders to supervisors on duty.:).

36TNgyudKoZZADqA-hfSog.text: I love BB.  They have a great weekday Happy Hour.  My co-workers and I would frequently organize last minute Happy hours after our super long and stressful shifts (nurses).  Anyway, aside from happy hour we've been several time and it's usually pretty good. I'm an appetizer junky, so I pretty much enjoyed everything so far.  My absolute #1reason for going to BB is for their Ultimate Pina Colada!!  AMAZING!!  I will not go to BB unless I can have one...or two, okay sometimes there.  So good!!

V7U8iXQjPSYJK5YKzHah2A.text: It's freakin' 100 degrees in Las Vegas today, so my co-worker says "let's try this place" because he'd been here before and enjoyed the food.  I had to agree that the food was really good.  I ordered the Chicken Club Salad.  Fantastic and DELICIOUS!!!  Right amount of salad, bacon, cheese, dressing and chunks of crispy chicken!!!  Yum yum in the tum tum!!  For dessert, I had a slice of Dulce De Leche Cheesecake.  It was too good.  I could not finish it because I was full and it was very sweet.  This is saying a lot because I ALWAYS eat all of my cheesecake (I'll be working out a lot tomorrow morning in the hotel gym!!!!!).  Our server was friendly, polite and always checking up on us to see if we needed anything else.  Next time I'm in LV, I'll try the clam chowder.  I hear it's very good.  FYI - bathroom was clean.  There was even mouthwash and hair gel near the sink.  Really.

6FXnZPFP_buExXPHdUnXig.text: I was pleasantly surprised!  Honestly wasn't expecting much, but my chicken tortilla soup was really good.  Very flavourful and featuring a lovely broth.  My server, Victor, was delightfully snarky whilst demonstrating waiterly competence.  My lunch companions were equally happy with their meals and we all wished we could stay longer to enjoy the island ambience.

pn2S5bgDIJTXsu9PCTb4oA.text: Happy hour is throughout the whole resturant and every appetizer we ordered was better than the last! We had so many we didnt make it to the dinner!  The empanadas and crab stack were amazing loved this place and will  be coming back again tomorrow!.

C3hY0bwbxT3tv4NzdeQN5Q.text: Came here for my mother's birthday. We all regret it, especially mom. Mostly because the extremely slow and at times irritating service. Our waitress was obviously not having a good day, and she made sure we knew it with constant eye rolls and poor excuses for the delays. The drinks we ordered took forever to arrive, and after being there for 2 hours, I only managed to order 2 drinks. I would've happily had another but service left me without a drink for about a 45 minute increment. Spent over $100, wasn't treated like it however. The food was ok, but not worth the subpar service. Will not return.

6xWzxbMgshBOZ26g5WW7ow.text: A chain.  Ate at another one in a different state. I had a seafood paella that was dry and didn't have much flavor.  Expensive too for  the quality. Didn't seem fresh but we are in Las vegas as far as fish goes.  My husband got the shrimp and lobster quesadillas and they seemed ok.  Drinks weren't very good either. The Yelp happy hours weren't right.  It said 3-6, but didn't start till 4-6.  They should have honored the price due to wrong advertisement!  Anyway, won't go back!

FUer3HHl33dQCuTfwj_v9A.text: The lunch specials are great for a great price. I would not recommend sitting in the outside "covered" area because it has poor ventilation and it always hot and muggy. Other than that, great

CDDpK7Q8v2_IcQ86Khd6FA.text: I am from out of town and wanted to try something new! Yelp brought me to this gem. Service was fantastic. Food was perfect. I definitely recommend this place.

gH73bJtzFl3CIf0zjLGPCA.text: Work dinners - you want to go somewhere affordable, has something that everyone would like, and have okay food. That's how I feel about Bahama Breeze. Affordable and OK.  Our server was fantastic - bright and bubbly, recommended a handful of items. It took us about 20+ minutes to get ready and order, yet she checked on us ever 5 minutes to answer questions.  I personally got the Jerk Chicken, with cinnamon sweet potatoes, green beans and a mango pineapple salsa. I didn't taste much of the jerk seasonings - but then again, the menu DID say "mild". The sweet potatoes very very sweet, but it balanced with the salsa and chicken.  One of my co-worker's dish was forgotten by the food runner, so our server came by and said the manager comped the dish and a hot plate would be coming right up. Good service!

auEt61qp4PLqowYGo83GnQ.text: Delicious food but this review is solely for the rum cake dessert. OMG, the tastiest and strongest butterscotch rum sauce (came w raisins) I've ever had. Thee best. Didn't even need to order a cocktail after. Amazing, ha. Mini bundt rum cake is delicious and moist as well - they might even inject it with a rum simple syrup after it's baked. YUM

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sit in the fire pit room! Cozy and fun atmosphere.

a8NxZv5u2SsXFHIVTL5NxA.text: Very reasonably priced food.  Lots of seating and a good size parking lot.  There were 18 of us.  They waited until we were all there; then we got seated in the outdoor patio.   A husband/wife team took care of us.  And they took the initiative to ask how many separate checks did we need.  How often does that happen?  I ordered a new item - mahi mahi and shrimp with lemongrass rice bowl.  Great ratio of seafood and veggies.  I would order it again.

5NvuVBOt4gYtlQE__bRJUw.text: Every time that I've come get I have never been disappointed. For all those looking for a restaurant that has a great atmosphere, excellent service and bomb food, you have to try this place.  Happy hour at this place is worth the money!!! But when its not happy hour, its still worth coming to no matter what. Let me recommend a few things on the menu:  Habanero Wings- OH MAN, I don't eat a lot of spicy food but this one is so delicious! It has a mix of a sour cream and pico de gallo dipping sauce. All I can say is all the flavors is like a party in your mouth! I was cleaning up the bone and I never do that lol! The blend is perfect! This is a MUST ORDER when coming here!   Jerk Chicken- Love the seasoning on this. I know they marinade it overnight and put it in the frier to give it a lil crunch. Lemme tell you this, they know how to season this to perfection. Love the sauce to add too, its a touch of sweetness. The combination together is like heaven  Beef Empanadas- Great starter, ALWAYS good to order before the food is coming, they use the same sauce for the habanero wings. Still, the pairing is always perfect when it comes to their sauces and food.  Calypso Shrimp Linguine- All the flavors pop in this dish. My 3 yr old son who is a picky eater will share this with me. The portion size is enough to feed me, my 3 yr old and my 8 yr old. This is a popular dish at this place, I've ordered this numerous times coming here.   Jerk Chicken Pasta- YUM!!! it may not look as appetizing when you see the plate but DANG this one is a must order also. My husband would order this when we would come here until he discovered the....  Chicken Breast with Cilantro Crema- you have to eat each bite with the chicken, mash potatoes and the sauce. You will be craving this.  For Dessert: Order the Banana But Bread Supreme- you will not be disappointed!!!!!   Can't go wrong with this place, you will never leave disappointed. The ONLY thing I don't like is that every time we arrive, we are always greeted by a homeless person asking for some money. Seriously EVERY SINGLE visit. Other than that, I have no complaints!

NT3uSWGFoupXwrXfsgV3vQ.text: Took the kids on a Thursday night to try a new restaurant!  I was very surprised by the size of this place.  The decor is super fun and you feel like you are on a tropical island!  Maria was our waitress and she was awesome!!    Food reviews: Skillet simmered jerk shrimp - the sauce was delicious, the shrimp was ehhh! Habanero Chicken Wings - My husband and the kids loved them! Grilled Jamaican Jerk Chicken - A lightly grilled chicken with a light marinade-lacked flavor Seafood Paella - The husband said it was good.  Large portion. The kids had sliders which they enjoyed.  Kids meals are only $4.79 Yaka Hula Drink - Super strong! Bahamarita - Yum Yum! Chocolate Pineapple upside down cake - Awesome!  I will be back to try other dishes!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Frozen Bahamrita (Cuervo gold tequila, kiwi, strawberry and mango)!

zBgdY34WrTjQT0-6V5K6GQ.text: Delicious shrimp and Mahi, vegetables,sweet peas and yellow rice- combined in one perfect mix, just the right Jamaican spices! Delicious mojitos and exotic island drinks make for a perfect touch with sesame crusted Ahi tuna!! the Jerk chicken is scrumptious.  The Lobster and shrimp quesadilla should not be missed- enjoy the island music, the superb service and the island ambience!! Special thank you to Brandon and Dan for making our dinner extra special. Happy hour is great and the fire pit always adds to the perfect island setting.

CjFujXt8m5Kqh7t__R-Q6w.text: The ribs were burnt but the music outside was cool.. The bartender was very nice. The place is very clean. I lost my id there but overall the place was okau

rXFobomuThza7DrzwdN6yg.text: Ok I get the customer is king thing but this was over the top...the waiter was at the table so much that we couldn't  hold a conversation fish tacos were good lunch special was a great value I ordered Mt Gay and coke...and received coke only... I don't think he knows the brands of rum.Lol...but all around fun place good food...affordable...sorry not picture worthy lmao

QpNy4Ejao9GZLdn5SXCQ0g.text: My wife and I have dined here a few times and thought we had found another favorite.  The Habanero wings are good. The Key Lime pie is very authentic. However when we decided to go there for my wife's birthday we were extremely disappointed. I ordered Jerk Chicken. I ate about half of the chicken when I realized it was getting difficult to pull the meat from the bone. This generally means chicken is undercooked. When I showed our server he called over the manager who insisted she have it remade for us. I told her I didn't really want a remake. So I opted for it to go. I was really disappointed when I told them it was my wife's birthday and ordered Key Lime pie expecting they would make her feel important with some sort of Birthday thing. But what we got was a waiter who said " pretend I sang for you and then you blew out a birthday candle then walked away.  I will never go back to Bahama Breeze nor do I recommend them to anyone else. I can see now why they were not busy near the strip on Friday night. Diners Beware!!!

VMQC2iUnnLH-0n7L2jeouQ.text: The girlfriend and I stumbled upon this place last week. I live close by and we wanted something small to satisfy our appetite. We started off with some cocktails. I got the ultimate pina colada and she got the painkiller. All in all good but could maybe use a splash of rum to bring it all together. She likes spinach dip so we got that to start. Very creamy, hot and great. Like I said, we weren't really hungry and we shared the lobster Mac and cheese dish. Absolutely amazing. I've been in the restaurant industry for 10 years and it's hard to find a great spot without picking at everything but this was the exception. Well balanced flavors that can make you come back for more. We will be sure to keep coming back and bring more people with us.

dQYQwFkp7DRb2rhtc7SmKA.text: What is not to love about this place, we usually come in for the happy hour deal, my favorite are ultimate pina colada, shrimp with lobster quesadillas, jumbo lump crab stack, Jamaican chicken wings and sesame crusted ahi, the price is so reasonable and they are very generous with their portion. Theirs waiters and waitresses are always upbeat and happy.

ug6qMYGROiEqVb5jlUDhsA.text: Good food, Good service, Great environment and Fair Prices. Last minute reservation and they were still able to get us a table for our party of 11.

S1l6Gq7OS-l9KidU9GYiew.text: Great place for a date not too expensive the drinks are great appetizers are great my favorite is the lump crab stacker.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wcUlAv4M2unI-MaH6ZgWpA.text: Great selection of food and drinks and always friendly service. They have a very good atmosphere for any type of event. Sometimes the service can be slow but that's the only downside.

hDVgtw02zj_O0eDaxmFsuA.text: Came here with a whole bunch of people but we sat around in different tables.  Someone on my table ordered the tower onion rings.  That was heavy, greasy, and alright.  I ordered a jerk chicken pasta which was good and had the right amount of spice.  But the grease built up quick and could be toned down some.  I was able to try my friends chicken breast and I liked the mango salsa that came with it.  So far we have:  Appetizers:  Onion Rings (3/5). Entrees:  Jerk Chicken Pasta (3/5) and Grilled Chicken Breast (4/5).    But the best was yet to come!  I ordered a chocolate mousse dessert, the chocolate island.  It was made with a perfectly baked brownie!  Taadaa... Dessert:  Chocolate Island.(6/5).   Service was alright, the restaurant was busy and the fan above our table wasn't working.  -.-  I didn't really feel the Bahama vibe but it could also be because I didn't order anything that that could be found outside Bahama Breeze.  There is that cool firepit thing to the left of the restaurant when you first walk in, i want to sit there next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pjjeSlzmAuLJuGNBf0IPNA.text: Tina and the assistant manager were awesome! They took care of my gluten free diet and served a tasty  meal. Tina was very attentive, personable and just so much fun! She even brought a bag of ice for our friend's knee. Our guests loved their meals and cocktails too. Even though BB is a chain restaurant, this place rocks!

RRKPnZw_OzTUqEnbn69GzQ.text: Great place if your ready to get off the strip, reasonable prices and the service is top notch, the atmosphere is great. Our server Josh was superb, full of fun and knowledge about the menu. Would highly recommend

EUPCqi9cID_vi_-hzKzuxw.text: Paella was super flavorful and filled with substantial amount of seafood. Was way too much but our waitress quickly boxed it up for us without having to ask for it!  My husband had chicken kabob and he lived it. Love the ambience and lively Caribbean music. Our servers were attentive and on top of all our extra requests. Only advice for 5 star rating is up front hostess needs people skills. She's not well trained OR she needs to be reassigned to different position where she doesn't get overwhelmed with minute issues!  Chocolate upside down cake was amazing!!!!

cSgrrxqwe9uMCuNect4ZiA.text: Again i experienced a well prepared meal here at bahama breeze!.... It all began with my servers aley & jason they both displayed professional & vivacious attitudes!.... The service & food are always prepared to perfection. I strongly recommend anyone to come in and experience a wonderful time!

2HFF-S7KSArqET-gDPBzaw.text: This is a place that has been here for a while and although off the strip a bit it is a nice place to get some food and a drink without all of the drop froo crap that resides in the strip these days. They can make a good steak and it doesn't cost $60!!! Drinks are pretty basic, stick to the menu. Lindsey was great and tried to fulfill my more exotic drink requests but just doesn't have to back bar to be a real cocktail bar. She does make a very respectable Manhattan

J26qJCr1Nql5hYVZo7iYfA.text: Went to dinner before the JT concert...had the mahi mahi with a light sauce. Nicely done, very moist pan seared.   Ordered a makers mark whiskey sour, enjoyed that too. Drinks came out timely...all our meals were ready at the same time and prepared well.   Gold star for Brandon, our server, thank you!

tg-yHA9POlsxBDfeMBwFoQ.text: The place was packed. The drinks were fantastic, so was the food and not to forget great service!

PGZ-4w1K-EndG8FrsHq_oA.text: Not too impressed with this place. For a restaurant in this area it should be a whole better. Our waitress was nice , but not too attentive to our table. The food had a lack of seasoning. The first dish I ordered was $18 , and had to send it back. Talk about bla! No taste. The second dish I ordered was a chicken Spinach dish. Same thing really could if used some salt and pepper . I would of rather gone to Applebee's! If your going to eat in this area ...go to another restaurant. This is the place of fine dinning and great food. No need to waste your time with this place.

9qNrCJNvqInCT6p0Nx9CJA.text: Came here for lunch on Sunday & Monday (2/13 & 2/14)  I absolutely love this place.  I think I love the service more than ever. They have the best friendliest staff ever! (I know I sounded like a little kid over exaggerating) But, honest to God. You cannot find that type of service in LA.  This is like my favorite lunch spot in Vegas.  The plates are a hit and miss. Depends on what you order and if you know what you're ordering.   Good luck and enjoy the good food. Cause there sure aren't any in LA.  *Get the cilantro cream sauce for dipping its grrrrrrrrrrrrreat!*

P9jpGSvgRspMh1qjDyRW2g.text: I really would like to give them a 4.5, but I really can't give them a 5.  We started with drinks & appetizers:  Rumrunner for the wife, a mojito for me, with coconut shrimp and conch fritters.  Rumrunner was delicious, but the mojito was not tasty and not well executed (mint wasn't muddled, lime wedges were un-squeezed and rock-hard, and it had crushed ice instead of cubes).  Shrimp and conches were both delicious, but they had the same sauce, which is a very minor criticism.  We had our minds on paella, which we ordered, and after all the fried stuff, we wanted something vegetable-y, which was not on the menu (unless you count salads, which we were not in the mood for).  On inquiring we were informed that there were broccoli, green beans, and asparagus available, of which we ordered the first two.  To our surprise and delight, the vegetables were nicely cooked and delicious.  The paella was awesome, especially considering they did not skimp on the seafood.  My wife didn't like the style of rice, but I thought it was appropriate.  It was also too much for us, and we ended up taking it home.  Since I'm writing this the day after our visit and I just had a fairly large portion of paella leftovers, I can report that it was maybe even better the next day.    Back to our visit, we were too full for dessert, so I just ordered an Irish coffee, which even after I verified that they would make it the proper way (coffee, Irish whiskey, and whipped cream), the waiter came back with this drink that he said had Kahlua in it, which I summarily sent back whence it came, which I felt they could have been a little more apologetic about.  The real drink, when it came back, kind of had an aftertaste like bottom-shelf spirits.   The ambiance was nice.  There was a musician playing tropical-themed music, which we quite enjoyed.  The service was fairly good but not superb; no complaints.

YxlfBOlKi8N-TYlj6m-4AQ.text: BBQ ribs were pretty tasty.  Also the mens bathroom by the bar smelled like trix cereal. I was oddly satisfied.

S2eHcXht-RVxf5Lri4768Q.text: Maybe it was a bad day, but hardly anyone in here, chicken crema was so over cooked, couldn't eat it. Bacon on a cheeseburger was almost raw. Ultimate margarita was not flavorful. Service was also slow... Wish it could have been better. Florida locations are much better!
