hMZxK-cHny8N5Twb8ocJqw.text: Foods great happy hour even better! You can get your drink inside a pineapple, or coconut!  How awesome is that, even procing isnt outrageous considering how close they are to the strip!

7D166-qjL0q56t1eL82eMw.text: We came for late night happy hour.  We had two shrimp dishes.   They were excellent.  The service was great.  Good casual ambiance.  Lindsey was our waitress.  Lindsey did an excellent job.  Thank you!

bQY9l4eVbapJwmZSSv5B8g.text: We came into here, while in Vegas, off of the YELP reviews!  The inside is very cute and tropical. I had a frozen specialty drink and it was delicious.  My husband got ice tea and it was horrible.  So, they brought a fresh brewed glass of tea, and it tasted bad too!   It tasted like old coffee.  We thought maybe they brew the coffee and tea in the same pitcher. But he assured us that doesn't happen.  We left and did not order food. We figured if they can't do something as simple as tea, that there could be more disappointments!

hO7ljyyVoa6VIdCbpmnGDA.text: My Island oasis in the middle of Sin City.  We come here every time we come to Vegas.  I know you have no clue who "we" are.... but my whole family.  We plan where we are going to stay, club and when we are going to eat at Bahama Breeze.  Let's start with the Cons.... there isn't a location in Southern California.  Then again, id probably spend my rent money eating there all the time.    The Service: Is always wonderful. Haven't had a bad experience yet.  The staff is always helpful and pleasant.  So cheers to them!  The Atmosphere: Wonderful!  For someone who has been to the "islands" this place is a good representation.  From the ceiling fans to the music being played.  Not loud, but mellow music.  Helps the food go down better... screw the sugar.  The Food:  OMG! Even if everything else was horrible the Food is so good you'd ignore it.  Jerk Chicken- my mouth is watering just thinking of them.  They have the perfect amount of jerk flavoring and are fried or baked to perfection.  Crispy on the outside but tender and juicy on the inside.  We made a mistake of sharing an order. Bad idea.  These are too good to share.  Beef Patties- Yummy! If flavor and good food aren't you thing... steer clear of this option. Truly a mouth satisfying appetizer.  Seafood Paella-So I have had Paella at a number of locations and this is one of the best.  The whole dish is a burst of happiness in your mouth.  I've had this 2 of the last 3 times I went here.  Everything else just doesn't seem to catch my eye.....  Always too full for dessert..... maybe next time.

hHU24eJx6ito-VdxXL8_WA.text: Great food and a great happy hour menu! Perfect for 104 degree weather!!! Their bahamarita is the perfect frozen drink and their sangria get a two thumbs up!!!! Happy hour is the best time to come and get the best bang for your buck!! And the crowd is pretty great!

zUJH4pxUZkT4rbyQ2kj9KQ.text: Eh the place is alright nothing to exciting . I had some jerk wings and I was expecting more spice to them and got nothing it was pretty disappointing . Drinks where okay . I was surprised that had a dark beer as a happy hour . The only good thing was our server Randy was amazing very knowledgeable . If I ever come back I'll  come back because of Randy .

0vifqnkDUuVQiK971vy7NA.text: You must visit this place when visiting Las Vegas. They have the best onion rings and portobello burgers. This place has a reputation of quality over quantity and the price for their meals are not too bad.  If you want good food off the strip, you must check this place out!

kDA03GINwVHeQQLEQpoY5w.text: My girlfriend and I stopped here for drinks yesterday. The bar staff was super friendly and we got our drinks quick. The first round was very strong but the second round tasted extremely watered down. Everything we ordered had the same Dark Rum in it so I'm not sure how the taste differed so much. When I told the bartender we were ready for the check he acknowledged my request then ignored us for at least 10 mins. I finally had to ask another staff member for the check.

3hIfeArA0slN5FPGAQaphw.text: Ate here about a week or two ago and I got to say the food here is pretty good I had a party of 4 people with me and the service was exceptional they always came by to ask us if there was anything we needed they came by to give us refills each time and they were very friendly and courteous which made me feel really comfortable as for the food it was really good I had a couple of my friends appetizers and some of her dessert I also had the fried chicken sandwich and it was really delicious and I might think of trying it again overall I see myself coming back here as the atmosphere it really comfortable and I like the setting and the energy of the servers it is pretty pricey in my opinion but it is worth because the food taste that good.

P3cKYGegBs3YjVCsBA6Qdw.text: We LOVE this joint and make a point to go every time we are in Las Vegas!  The food is consistently good and the service has always been wonderful.  You can't go wrong with anything on their menu.  I had the scallops on corn cakes (a special that day) and my husband has had the Jamaican Jerk Chicken the last two times and loved it.  Also the Cuban Bread appetizer is so good.  At then end of dinner I ordered the Almond Mocha coffee drink but had them add their brandy butterscotch sauce in place of the chocolate syrup. OMG the drink rocked!  You have to like sweet coffee, but it was soooooo good!  Casual dining, awesome atmosphere, great servers; a bit pricey but worth every penny!  Enjoy!

BKyS9w_6tdM1XSBGFI1jpQ.text: It's like a TGIF type deal w/ tasteless generic food w/ some "islandy" decorations. There's no real carribean taste and no dishes that stand out. Two things to try though, are the tostones w/ chicken which is like plaintain nachos, the plaintains are deepfried twice and the blended island margarita.

wnFtL4WLma7dFyVjjHrVTA.text: I wanted to try something new so we decided to give this place a try. It was such a great experience and a nice change to all the all you can eat places in town. The menu was mouth watering and so was the food. I had the Calypso Shrimp Linguine and the portion was so big that I had it to go. The waiter even added a little hand drawn picture of a sailing boat on top of my to go box which was kind of neat. My hubbie and I had the linguine for lunch the next day. I added green onions, sake and garlic to it and it was delicious! Our drinks were great too. Its not a surprise that this place was packed for a tuesday night. The only downside was the garlic bread. It was a little soggy. In all I think that this is a great place to hang out with friends or your significant other. Can't wait to go back...

LImARg-2n7KIB93h6LnxtQ.text: Unique dishes with beautiful presentations.  Decent prices.  Virgin Bahamarita is a good drink.  Good for groups.  2 Blocks from the strip.

88X1jYBfYPEy5KJeTYRUKA.text: I just don't get what people see in this place. I guess the food is just bland enough to appeal to the masses, and it's just cheesy enough to be "fun" (read Tchotchke's in Office Space). From the music, to the decor, to the food, this place is just packed with epic fail. I wanted to shoe the bargain basement Jimmy Buffet square in the nuts, not that I enjoy the real one by any stretch of the imagination.  We had the calamari appetizer, thinking it was a safe bet, and it was astonishingly rubbery. I mean, there's rubbery calamari, then there's this; it's like the difference between vulcanized rubber and the stuff they use in rubber bands. I ordered the seafood paella, and the waiter remarked that it was his favorite dish and it was just fantastic. The guy's nuts. There couldn't have been more wrong with it, save for the fish showing up raw (it was overcooked instead). Absolutely no flavor. They must not put any salt in the pot when they cook the rice, because I don't think there's any other way to make rice this unexciting. I suspect the origin of its yellow-orange hue didn't come from saffron, either. Don't remember what my fiance ordered, and neither does she, but we both remember it sucked. Bland, unexciting, chain-wide recipes aside, this kitchen had some serious issues seasoning their food properly.  All that, a beer, and a margarita for $53. What a gyp.

44wDTiilS8O3KErvFiESkA.text: Great ambiance, good drinks, good food, average service, chaotic kitchen. Our local Bahama Breeze closed several years ago so when we were in Las Vegas we dropped in. We love the ambiance, we loved the specialty drinks. We ordered our salad, entree, and desert. We waited about 30 minutes before they finally bought out the entree before the salad. I told them to take the entree back and start over by serving the salad first, then the entree, then the desert. While waiting for we started noticing that all the orders in our area of the restaurant were wrong. The servers were running around like keystone cops trying to correct everyone's orders. We finally got our food and it was delicious. However, they need to organize their kitchen.

mXfjEWLn1w7l5oVd507kOA.text: I don't even live in Vegas but every time I'm here I have to hit this place for Mojito's!! its a great place to have happy hour before heading out for Dinner... I haven't eaten there.. I only get Drinks.... shots of tequilla and mojito's  ( a deadly combo i know ) ... maybe next time I'll actually try the food..

aNQivzxnFC-dXWnw9g3rTw.text: Bajama Breeze is a cute little themed restaurant that I went to for a friend's birthday. They accommodated us last minute for a party of fifteen so that was nice. We started off with the firecracker shrimp, coconut shrimp, and the fire-roasted jerk shrimp which were all pretty tasty. (Although I did prefer the coconut shrimp over the other two.) For dinner, I ate the lobster and shrimp pasta, without mushrooms, which had very little sauce, but was better than the one at Red Lobster. Our waiter was hilarious and also gave the birthday girl a long sugar cane, yes, sugar cane which was talked about for a good minute. My drink also came with a sugar cane inside of it, the Lemon Breeze, which I added strawberries too. Overall, the place was chill and the food was good, but not great. I think I would go back to see if it deserves that last star..

_LeROASJaRpx5j0-PD7Bxg.text: I went to this restaurant because of all the hype that their paella was getting. Unfortunately, I was not impressed. You could say that I was disappointed with the paella. The flavor was a little bland and the rice was a little bit uncooked. The shrimp did not seem fresh to me. I was really disappointed because I love paella. The atmosphere is nice and the service was above average. They have a good lunch menu and some of the specials looked really appetizing. My experience would have been better if I did not have such a high expectation with the paella.

SmyI2QB-TbdAgLtU7_5wjw.text: I had the very bland fish tacos and my husband had the fried chicken. The service was friendly but the food is was very disappointing, because it didn't have much favor. We asked our server for various sauces trying to add taste to our meal but it didn't improve much. We won't be back.

MtRtquEIn7PVEmvQxIdiYQ.text: It's worth it just for the bathrooms, but this place is excellent for groups. If you're looking for a place to take a work group or hold some sort of work-related event, this place is great. The variety in food will please everyone. The atmosphere is great, and the price isn't too steep.

n7Pb87QyzHf1UQ8WLQjV9w.text: We love this place. We go each time we are in Vegas. They have our favorite ribs. It's a full rack for $20 including fries. Note: the ribs are coated with a guava-based BBQ sauce, so don't expect the typical smoky southern barbecue. They have a full bar with a complete catalog of mixed drinks, although the drinks are pricey. Located on Flamingo road just east of the strip, but not walking distance. Lots of other Caribbean inspired dishes, but we have never tried any other items because the ribs are too good to pass up.

CrFI7HuTcTDXcpb-aSkfvQ.text: Bahama Breeze Grilled Chicken, TO DIE FOR! So so good, and my boyfriend ALWAYS orders, Calypso Shimp Linguine....LOVE BAHAMA BREEZE MY FAVORITE!   VERY DELICIOUS!

teamZc-l8t_hF40YMGYfgg.text: Good food, though a little overpriced.  I usually get the Carribean Jerk Chicken Pasta, which has a fabulous cream sauce, chicken and asparagus.  So good.  I also love the West Indies beef patties and the Ultimate Pina Colada.  I've heard other dishes are just so so.  The service  is usually outstanding.

eTIzI3rehDsuUWtzqxkddA.text: My half tried their mahi-mahi, it wasn't to his appeal.  The jerk chicken is so good.

vQE7WewWI0wbMoDbyAX50Q.text: Strawberry Mojito: If they hadn't packed a half of a pint glass with crushed ice (instead of the cubed ice they put into their glasses of soda or water) it might've been fine. It watered the whole thing down. My opening cocktail was a minty lime water.  Appetizer of West Indies beef patty was delicious. You could probably buy them in bulk at Costco. The mango salsa served with it was also tasty (I usually don't like mango salsa)  Chicken and steak skewers were ok, but there was nothing very Bahamian about them - served with grilled peppers and mushrooms. The rice/beans served beneath the skewers were dry.  Our server was a really nice guy. He recommended my drink, but I didn't have the heart to complain about it.  It's a chain restaurant, meaning not truly ethnic. Can someone recommend a sweet hole-in-the-wall?

tj0PwUXKbQNkkSRZiNl3sg.text: Ok so I had to "live in Vegas" for a couple weeks while working on a Casino and my "home" ended up right across the street from this place. Which in case you were not aware, is apparently in a bad neighborhood. I was warned by 1) the cab driver dropping me off from the airport 2) a co-worker and 3) another cabby taking me home from work--that I should never walk alone after 5pm. The menu looked pretty good, so I was excited to try this place. The service was so slow. We were seated immediately and then ignored for like 20 min. then our order taken and then ignored for 30 min, we asked what was up and they had made the order wrong, but no one told us. Finally after being in the restaurant for about an hour and a half we got our food. It was okay, but definitely not worth the wait. It was the type of chain like food one would expect from a Chili's or TGIF and they got the order wrong. We talked to the manager and he did not seem to care. Moral of my story--this place is no breeze.

mmkwkuaeMpvQ1_zAgBjJew.text: this is a cool place. . i went the people that were there for the wedding the food was good i liked the pasta ordered .  the survuce was fast  and they seated our large groups quickly. they had a good tropical look. like i said in a bast review i would not have gone there if i was by myself. i wanted to do stuff more unique to Vegas

NW5vp3DxuaGHRooNQwJLRg.text: Came here with a local after needing a change of scene in Vegas.   It was still prop-ish but atleast you did not feel overwhelmed with so many people like in the hotels.  Food was decent, not the greatest just somewhat different and there was live band.  Not really some where I would come to Vegas for.

FgYCKn7hA8Y2nkigD0fA0A.text: Great restaurant .. Amazing food and happy hour $3 -20oz beers ...Local place , great for your budget Dione our server was one of the best serve that I have had...if you want to eat and drink cheap this is a must ... Don't spend money on the strip go here it's well worth your money and it brings you to the Bahamas

l-XLEYFURbNUpuU9mTGxRw.text: Really enjoyed the firecracker shrimp, the outdoor seating is very breezy and nice. The staff is very friendly and helpful would def come back again

7bDIhrb5V0bKDiObMun-jw.text: My boyfriend and I wish we had tried this place first when arriving to Las Vegas. Excellent, friendly service! We loved the environment. Felt like we were in the Bahamas with how it was set up. Delicious salmon and shrimp quesadilla. This is a place everyone should try when in Vegas. You will not be disappointed.

BijXqHVAK961r2rr_b7M7w.text: 40 minute wait, non full restaurant on a Friday night. Waiter, Mike, came right away, but just said hi, he didn't ask for drinks before leaving. Came back in 10 minutes to take order.  Had a sweet tea. Mid drink he topped it off with water.  I questioned him about it and he said it was tea.  Took his time with things, cleaning tables before even being our drinks initially.  Food was ok. Won't come back.

_xatecSb-0PpqMfHMtd1AA.text: I had my wedding reception here and it was an amazing experience!!! Great food and wonderful staff, I'm so glad I chose this place!

SWb85NxwHVYWyXveyGoPZw.text: Lobster and shrimp pasta was the best pasta I have ever tasted.  The server was knowledgeable about the menu and offered several suggestions. Lemonade was best I have tasted. Portions were too much for me to eat. Enjoyed the rest of it in the morning in the hotel room. Overall awesome experience.    I visit Vegas for all Mayweather fights so this place is definitely on my short list.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and shrimp pasta= 11 stars

RKh8zB0FOXW6kxABAqWhGA.text: I really had very high expectations for this place when I first found out we were attending a wedding reception dinner here. I have had great authentic food on the islands so I was excited about Bahama Breeze ( island grille ). Well I would like to say it is more like an American breeze with a Bahama inspiration. But after getting over the fact there is really no authentic food here this place is pretty good. We had a party of around 30 and were seated privately in a covered patio section of restaurant. This place is huge, nice and spacious. Seemed like everyone really enjoyed their drinks, I had the Bahamarita and it was very good. Ok so menu items we tried were beef empanadas: their version is good and the sauces that came with were very good. Coconut shrimp: I have had better but it was good, the sauce to dip was the winner. BBQ ribs: very good like rib joint good, Seafood and jerk pasta I was told was excellent, plenty of shrimp and lobster. The portions here are pretty big too, most guests had to go bags. I found out after the fact from a local that the one authentic item they had was conch fritters, man one of my favorites so can't wait to try them.  Our great, very patient, and very nice waitress Christine informed us about their happy hour, so we will be back since we visit Vegas frequently.

VwtLYlBeQyUpZ-GHpkUZwQ.text: I hadn't been there in years because I remembered spicey food, which I am not crazy about.  Obviously, I didn't know what to order.  A friend and I went there for lunch, and I had a memorable and fabulous meal.  In fact, there was so much food, I had three fabulous meals, and everything was almost as good as leftovers the next two days.  We started out with a virgin cocktail combining layers of slushy kiwi, mango, strawberry and margarita flavors, followed by an excellent house salad with a tasty citrus vinegarette house dressing.  The Shrimp and Lobster Linguine with mushrooms in a cream and brandy sauce was mouth-wateringly delicious. For dessert, I had the chocolate mousse on a brownie base covered with whipped cream, toasted almond slices, chocolate sauce and Creme Anglaise.  I'd go back just to have that again.  It was a little pricey for lunch, but would be reasonable for dinner.  Our server, Tim, went out of his way to be friendly and helpful.  We had our choice of indoor or outdoor dining.  It was a delightful experience in all aspects.

_7jJ8CLLmlmwThIawlDLzw.text: Service without a SMILE.  2 nights ago I visited this restaurant (Bohama Breeze) based on a recommendation of a friend who said that it would be a fun and tasty experience.It was neither......I left thinking that I have  more fun at Denny's or Jack in the Box.,  i was prepared to just talk about the under par service my group received, but I looked in the faces of the staff and did not see one smile on one face.  Then I wondered if the theory was correct "A staff treats the customers the same way the management treats them.... then I am glad I do not wor here.     The service is fair.... by that I mean all the appropriate words were spoken at the appropriate time..  The food was not  worth returning for a second taste..   Skip this experience you won't miss a thing.

XxdfolN1kBQ6aPrpfsk08Q.text: If you wanna feel like you're on vacation come here! Tropical drinks, amazing food, & atmosphere that makes you think you're eating on an island. I'd recommend to everyone! This place is huge & the layout is awesome. Also good service.

_gJZgOBl9XPEbr0QntTeww.text: So we were looking for a place to eat Caribbean food at Vegas and found this place... Just out of this world!!! The food, the ambient, everything is amazing!!! You have to try the coconut shrimp, margaritas, and mojitos. I had the Carnitas rice bowl, it is a blend of all caribbean flavors... A party in your mouth!!! At the end we had the banana nut bread dessert, it is amazing!!! Try it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana nut bread
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carnitas rice bowl

onNd3LKfmJDH8bXWGuhAkQ.text: I love this restaurant! We went for lunch one day of our stay at Vegas and we liked it so much that we went for lunch again the next day! lol. We had: - onion rings yelp.com/biz_photos/DYuO... - this is really a must get :] huge onion rings stacked up high! w/ 2 kinds of sauce.. but we asked for ranch too and it went so well with it :] - crab, shrimp, avocado, and mango stack yelp.com/biz_photos/DYuO... - this is a must get too hehe it had some other things in the stack too like apples and red bell peppers.. mix it with the red sauce around it and it's so gooood~ - mahi mahi yelp.com/biz_photos/DYuO... and yelp.com/biz_photos/DYuO... - there are 4 ways to have this prepared.. I got it wood grilled with lemon/garlic/butter mix and it wasn't so good.. the fish was kinda dry.. but when we got it the next day (pan seared w/ sauteed shrimps) the fish was drenched in a yummy cream sauce with lotsa shrimps.. it was good :] - 'Chef's Special' tiger shrimps w/ shitake mushroom orzo yelp.com/biz_photos/DYuO... - huge shrimps, good sauce, and I loved the orzo x] - chicken breast yelp.com/biz_photos/DYuO... - came with cilantro crema, corn w/ 3 cheese, and mashed potatoes.. everything was good on this plate.. and this was the most moist and soft chicken breast I've ever had! and that cilantro crema was SO good.. we all ended up eating all our food with that sauce on it.. HEHE - angus burger yelp.com/biz_photos/DYuO... - it's a burger.. :] - coconut shrimp yelp.com/biz_photos/DYuO... - big shrimps.. not a fan of coconut so didn't like this one :P - cuban sandwich yelp.com/biz_photos/DYuO... - w/ fresh fruit salad.. the mango ice cream on the fruit salad was so damn good! Service was top notch! Best service ever. The guy we had the first day was really nice but I forgot his name.. and Vicki was extra friendly. I really really really LOVED the service here!! Price isn't bad either.. it came out to about $75 for the 4 of us.. with 2 appetizers, 4 drinks, and 4 entrees.. :] Oh, and I almost forgot! they have like.. the best restroom ever! Mouthwash, nice hand soap, and good lotion?! damn.. :] Now, every time we're in Vegas.. this will be the spot to go to for lunch :] All thanks to Jenny J. and Mike L. :D

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. mahi mahi w/ sauteed shrimps and mashed sweet potatoes
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. coconut shrimps
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken breast w/ cilantro crema

9eI318xZIoI1L3SLlRNNLw.text: This place is a nice relaxed feel with live music. The shrimp and lobster linguine pasta is good and they give you a lot! You can share 1 plate with 2 people and the drinks are good and fruity!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and Lobster linguine with bahama mamas drinks!

qHBcb1R6U6Ttx3jKiC7HoQ.text: Looking for a light lunch and found the lobster shrimp quesidilla on the appetizer menu. Tasty!

WF2FufNbhaObEwFgwFd7Sg.text: Great, beautiful, and perfect priced! I do reccomend the Jerk Shrimp Appetizer and the Banana nut covered in brandy sauce for dessert.. So delicious  The service here is very calm and assertive to your need and delivers well. Sunday through Thursday they have happy hour after 9 til close and all appetizers are half off great deal!! Come and try it yourself #jerksauce is good on everything

i51K-CG9CqlEKy5e7p9cNQ.text: Excellent food, Thursday night (service industry night) had good music and a 9pm-closing happy hour. Service was also very good, definitely a place I will visit again in Vegas

hNMTZSFS0Hh5dfLbvIuOkg.text: Came here for their happy hour after work on an extremely hot day since they have frozen drinks! Definitely an extensive tropical drink menu which I can definitely appreciate. The passion fruit mango white sangria is awesome! Definitely recommend that! The chicken quesadilla was a bit much for me, but still okay. BUT the beef empanadas were AMAZING! Definitely an interesting crowd depending on what you're looking for. One of the bartenders we had-Jason- was awesome! Super personable and great service!

-5tvHy-XlRw8vWozLr19Ug.text: My wife and I went for a 9pm dinner.  It was a slower weeknight and we sat out on the closed patio area.  There was a guitarist playing some light guitar to some background islander music.  The service was excellent.  All our drinks were quick. The waiter made some good recommendations which we accepted, and we we're glad we did.  He was also personable.  He stayed and chatted for a bit, and we didn't feel rushed at all.   They recently changed up their menu to include rice bowls.  And boy, the Carnitas bowl is pretty amazing.  I will be ordering that often;  It's a new regular dish for me.   The reason this place hasn't earned 5 starts, is because their key lime pie leaves a lot to be desired (both my wife and I agree on this).  This should be a staple of a dessert for an islander themed restaurant, and it is a main dish the staff suggest for a dish.

OrC1bpoG36vzik1IEbUT-Q.text: One of my favorite places to eat in town. I love the variety of island dishes. Highly recommended the fried Yuca cheese bites, buttermilk fried chicken and the Mac and cheese is amazing. Drinks are tasty and the staff is usually pleasant aside from occasional unhappy employee but they definitely do their best to provide hospitable service.

A82BGHB00dHYyom1_GvydA.text: My girlfriends and i came here for hapoy hour it was My first experience here and I loved it. I ordered the beef empanadas, jerk shrimp, firecracker shrimp, pork street tacos, chicken tostones .... I will definitely be coming back.

nqfNqThfhZh36QU0AvyrUg.text: Love love love this place! I will definitely recommend this place to everyone. The food was excellent and the waiter was great. My pina colada was one of the best I've ever had, I will definitely be back.

DWU66KPvwOKL8lJSPcxxSQ.text: Love Bahama Breeze! Lunch menu is not too bad. It's a little pricey than normal, $8-$10 range but Bahama Breeze is a little more classy than your typical restaurant. And the island ambience is relaxing.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0jIsOpex7WdOw2Z9oM3dkQ.text: I went here Monday night with girlfriend's Cuban family with high expectations because someone recommended it to us. Exterior was very fancy, and beachy. The restaurant is bigger than I thought with many sections.   I scrolled through Yelp to search for references of what to order. My family end up ordered Cheese Curds (cheese stuffed fried yucca) Jamaican Jerky Chicken, Seafood Paellas, a stack of Short Ribs BBQ, Cheddar Burger and fries sweet plantain. We loved the Cheese Curds. They were crunchy, cheese oozed delicious. We ended up with two orders of that. The Jamaican Jerky Chicken was delicious, the portion was huge! Half a chicken grilled with special sauce and yellow rice with fried sweet plantains. The plantains were thick cut and fried to perfection. We Cubans loved it. The Seafood Paellas were not that great. The consistency wasn't really True Paella but the flavor was there. The seafood wasn't as fresh, mussels slightly overcooked, though fish was flaky and cooked well. Paellas weren't impressive, average, but portion was also very big! Each can easily feed two people. My sister-in-law's burger was good (you can't go wrong with burger they should all taste how they should taste). My BBQ ribs were ok, again, they tasted just like how should taste. Sweet and smokey. There wasn't any special twist or spin added onto it.   Overall the experience was meh. With the bill $120 in total, we expected more. It was filling but wasn't satisfying. I heard good things about it, but maybe we ordered the wrong things because everything was just ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried cheese curds (cheese stuffed fried yucca)
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheddar burger and chicken soup
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of Fried sweet plantain

dKCrb-OF7EX3uJEOYDPTew.text: We went to Bahama Breeze again last night...This makes about 7-8 times now.  They do not disappoint. Service was great and so was the meal.

8FPXBfL3QRJ1xqVFnZrsKQ.text: First dinning experience here. My wife is leaving 80% of her plate on the table. No flavor on the steak, under cooked broccoli, and sour mashed potatos. Save your money and dine elsewhere.

9Z4_vxOm5unxFMFlvE1_Mw.text: I've been coming here on and off for over two years and the food has retained its quality as well as the professionalism of staff. The food is still great and I'll be back again and again.

CEX8y2O7yScWVcwBeR4kfg.text: Happy hour provides great specials so make sure you sign up your email to hear about upcoming events. Staff is friendly. I've not had good luck getting fresh fish (fresh?) but have enjoyed everything else.

FYavxmHDBNy0IEcLrQ79Fw.text: I loved everything about this place! The food was great and the service was even better! Thanks Tamika!!! You made our dinner a great experience!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything was amazing! The service by Tamika was amazing! She really gave us an awesome experience!

yaxsgR9lSpAHyfIheTA_bg.text: Bahama Breeze is located conveniently on Flamingo and Paradise road. It's a great place to meet for cocktails, dinner etc. We had dinner Saturday night for a friend's birthday. I ordered the Caribbean chowder and the pineapple coconut martini. I also sampled a friend's cheeseballs which were excellent. Our server was very accommodating to our group, we had a party of 7 but each person arrived at different times between 730pm and 10pm. Our server did an excellent job of keeping track of our orders and the separate billings. We really appreciated that. The price of the food and drink is reasonable, I noticed that the menu has changed since the 5 years that I was last there. They have a lot more options and they are keeping up with changing tastes. We will return especially for happy hour

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paella
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese balls

ME1rGqh1YkFLVr6LJIVV1g.text: Had the most amazing 1st time experience! Amazing food and customer service. Maurice was my server and he has excellent customer service!! Most definitely will be back! Thank you Bahama Breeze

GbJdYI5ZUKuP2vQuBlgXfA.text: Listen.  When you have a group of 18 to 21 people it can never be easy.  I'm sure the wait staff do not enjoy.  Plus issuing separate checks and keeping it all organized this cannot be an easy task.  Saturday night we were there and it was a very large party.  Jerry and I cannot remember the gals name kept up with us all night.  Very accommodating.  Very courteous.  Very attentive.  It was nice.  The food is ok.  It can cater to a lot of different tastes.  Pasta to steak to hummus and nachos.  Drinks were good.  It can get loud but we've obviously made it one of our stops each time we come into Vegas.  We always have a large crowd when we do our annual trip and this place just gets it.    Thank you BB.

29oKu9YIGXGD9Hzr7ZIODQ.text: Literally had bugs in my salad not once but twice! They did apologize both times and were just as surprised and weirded out as I was. Let's just say the second salad I trusted them and ate half the salad then boom a bug the same kind on my fork!! Only reason for two stars is because the manager and our server were great, clearly the kitchen needs to get it together! Asap...  at your foods smh.

fxlUUbjiICXQHxrlC9AGiw.text: I was looking to get away from the Strip and all the pretentious,  way overpriced food there, when I stumbled upon this place. It was Tuesday afternoon, at least in the 80's. This place is a tropical themed place, with nice covered outdoor seating - perfect! There was a nice breeze & it wasn't  crowded, although I'm sure it is at happy hour & prime times.  Nice menu with carribean influenced items, and drinks. I had a great margarita, coconut shrimp & salad ( lunch special). Good value, and delicious. If I lived nearby, I would be a regular.

NSaD4q0Ntqt7nS5YWpcmNA.text: Came back tonight & Tina waited on us. The food tonight was to die for. I took pictures of everything we had. I don't know what they did but everything is 100% The music was on point. I will bring friends and family to this location.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. onion rings
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FlgNVkyRIC3t8f95O2WyIA.text: The food tastes like a cross between something out of a can, low end buffet food, and frozen mass produced microwaved dish components.   I had the grilled chicken with cilantro sauce. It was slop. Nothing tasted fresh. The sauces were definitely from a gallon can or barrel.   I've had a salad here my previous time which was edible but not great, hence the 2 stars and not 1star.   Also, prices are very cheap for the area, and many office workers from walking distance go since there is a discount for Howard Hughes buildings employees.   For the money I'd rather drive or walk a few blocks more and get something I'm going to enjoy.

Q9N1vF-BAPEvdB6vwBqm5g.text: Went there for a drink during happy hour and sat at the bar.  We ordered 1/2 price apps and $5 margaritas until we couldn't possibly eat any more.  The portions were huge.  I will say the Margaritas and mojitos were a tad on the strong side, but I prefer them that way.  The bartenders were fun and the atmosphere overall was easy going and fun.  It's the kind of place that melts the stress away.

oDbycKHS2pD9pxyp-yKtgQ.text: Live Music on the Enclosed Patio, while eating Carribean food near a fire pit on a cool December night...... Loved it!  Great waiters and management shows passion and professionalism at this location.  At the time of visit, our Restaurant dot Com certificates were honored and made the experience even more enjoyable.  Black Bean Burger (vegetarian style) and Rice Bowls were on point. Virgin Pina Colada was a bit on the sweet side, but no complaints!  The pineapple salsa....  a MUST have with Sambosa.   Great location, away from the strip, but close enough to main streets.

0MDvmE23EexKIGcu7AIoIw.text: Yum! Happy hour is the best! 9 to 12 midnight! Th empanadas are so tender and flakey! Oh my! Love the drinks and with happy hour!!! I will be here every night!

LzY2eF8VCJ4SUhg51O04rQ.text: The first time I went here I thought it was amazing. The second time not so much, it could be due to the fact that my mom was vomiting in her napkin(alcoholic) and it just killed it. It just didn't seem to deliver like i remembered. Not sure I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. jamaican jerk chicken, sweet mashed potatoes, green beans and fruit salsa

8tTAyDWcnux_QR6vVNI9EQ.text: If you like pina coladas and getting caught in the rain, this is your spot especially during happy hour!! My friend took me here since we both were craving for refreshing pina coladas. Happy hour deals are great. We came in at 5 and the restaurant wasn't so busy so we got seated right away. Our waitress took our orders and was very enthusiastic. The only thing was that she didn't commit to her promises. When she asked if we wanted lemon with our water, she did not provide the lemon. And many times she visited our table of empty cups, she did not quickly respond to refill them. Other than that, food and drinks were bomb and I also really like the set up of the restaurant. It's nicely jungle/exotic themed and they also offer patio seating for lovely fresh air! Will be back for more

xsi2c04EJOx4cg9fNS90CQ.text: I liked this place. The decor was nice, reminded me of elephant bar for some reason.  We got the coconut shrimp for our appetizer. Good size shrimp with a delicious sauce. A hit of sweetness and a hint of mustard. I'm not fond of mustard but this was an awesome dipping sauce. Truly enhanced the shrimp.   For dinner, I ordered the lobster/shrimp linguini. Decent amount of lobster but a crapload of shrimp! Every bite had shrimp and that was well worth the 20 dollars! The sauce had the right amount of creaminess to it which was a plus!   Yes, I'd go here again. YES YES YES. Especially for the coconut shrimp!

mciSc8dpWcZKXeEHFyi62w.text: We love this place! Our family of 5 tries to eat here whenever we are in Vegas. The food and cocktails are awesome, and the staff is always friendly.

MsyV6X69PvfPpkbbDirMcw.text: What a fun restaurant!!  We came here after we prepped all our models for a show and it was a fabulous place to eat.  It was more of a carribean type dining experience!  We asked to be seated outside since we smokers and their deck was still sort of indoors.  But airy enough for us to smoke.  There was live music playing, a bar in the deck area, and another deck for larger reservations/parties.  I was impressed on the decor already.  I'm a sucker for restaurants that are interesting to look at, sometimes I go with not so interesting people to eat. hehehe  Anyhooo...as soon as we sat, we were asked about drinks.  I ordered a mojito, but I should have gotten the Bahama Mama margarita...It looked dramatic as it tasted. DAMMIT!!! But nevertheless, my mojito was still delicious!!!  Apetizers:  Coconut shrimp....HOT AS HELL (temp wise) which meant it was freshly cooked!!! HMMMM to die for....  My plate:  Chicken Kabobs!!!  OH my god it was the best kabobs ever.  Chicken was cooked with red and green bell peppers, whole mushrooms, and red onions.  The kabobs were served over "island rice".    SO GOOOD!! I toook it home to the hotel and saved it for the next nite!!!

NkmuAygMexeQeXn16m8vYw.text: Take a trip to the Carribean and enjoy coconut shrimp with a Bahama Mama drink; clean atmosphere, friendly staff, relax with Reggae sounds and marimba music. The menu is simple and reasonably priced. Sit outside and chill and meet new people.

fJ-NOn9BkFZURpVrIwTJww.text: A favorite of mine. Bahamarita martini is a must and signature drink. It's refreshing with their coconut shrimp pasta. Customer service is always friendly.

dL7AVngzJNjXapqxAs1cQg.text: Wandered into Bahama Breeze on Memorial Day Weekend and were seated right away. The restaurant is fabulously decorated in a tropical island theme and overall is a good place to go and avoid the chaos of The Strip.    Whether you sit outside or on the patio, you will get the feel of the islands. Although the food is good, it can get a bit pricey for what it is. I had the Jamaican grilled chicken and it was $18. Tasty but $18 is a bit steep. My wife had a sandwhich for around $12.  The signature Mojito, "Mojito Cubano"  was overly fufu.  They pack the drink with ice and make it like a slushy.  I asked for my second with significantly less ice and it still had too much.    Given the ambiance and good food, I have given 4 stars.  I look forward to going back.

lBXAKaVXUpbVMjj7gg2KXQ.text: Love this place off The strip. Fab happy hour on weekdays from 9 to closing with half Price delicious appetizers ( Coconut shrimp and onion rings favorites but all was good) bbq baby ribs also a good choice to share ( large portions). Cocktails hit The spot at 3-4$ happy hour. Been a few years back and came back twice this time.

q9-h080O6NiUZV1FwIK9oA.text: I was there a few months ago but thought people should know if my experience...A few people in my life know I am allergic to seafood and I have to be careful where I eat and drink. However, I sometimes take chances when there is something I have a craving for. One recent night, I went to Bahama Breeze (bahamabreeze.com) because I wanted their West Indies Patties. The friend I was dining with can't eat spicy food so she asked our waiter Jay for a sample of their jerk sauce but Jay didn't know how spicy the sauce was so he went and got a sample for her and the chef Dan Strohecker came with him. Since the chef was at the table I figured I would ask if they use the same oil to cook everything. Dan said he couldn't guarantee that they didn't but especially when a rush comes on. He graciously offered to cook the patties in new oil for me in a skillet. I was floored because that has NEVER happened in any restaurant I have ever eaten at. He said they will do anything within reason to ensure their guest enjoy themselves and any allergy issues are addressed. I thanked him and he went and got started on my patties. Jay brought them to the table and a short time later Dan came back and asked me how they were and he looked down and laughed cuz the plate was empty. He said there's my answer! He said he had never cooked them that way before and didn't know if they would turn out light and crunchy like they do when fried in the deep fryer. I told him not only were they light but the crunch was unbelieveable. Not too hard and not to soft. Just perfect! I thanked him again and told him I would tell all my friends and blog about it. Bahama Breeze is one of the more successful restaurants in Las Vegas and now I know why! The food is exceptional but the service and attention to customers is phenomenal! Beyond anything I have ever experienced before. They are better than 5 star in my book. When you are there, tell Dan what a wonderful chef he is and request Jay as your waiter. You won't be disappointed at all!

bk31gfFHUW3CT_aatjz-wA.text: overall pretty good.. applewood bacon & cheddar burger was so bomb..   they use fresh ground beef so don't be scared 2 order it a little red if u like it that way...  service was fast and always attentive..

dPoqWBLK5NIeiVYSqn6XSA.text: Not as terrible as you would expect~! The drinks were reasonably priced and tasty ($6ish for a decent fruity mojito). Coconut shrimp were tasty, and the skewers were great as well.. came with a good sized portion of meats and veggies. Atmosphere is nice and tropical (as one would expect).

AKsNjPkag49yFFH927CEyg.text: Delish! I had fish tacos which came with huge chunks of avocado and super scrumply seasoned black beans and rice.  Service was good, if a bit phony.  Bathrooms: Lotion, hairspray, AND mouthwash. I was bitching all weekend about how bathrooms should have lotion and voila! Also mouthwash is a totally nice touch, more places should have it.  If for any reason i'm lurking this part of Vegas again, I would return.

vB46rV28VROMqmnNesmhbw.text: Great atmosphere and food  awsome selection of cocktails.  Daniel is an awsome server

SIJGj_nFlHp7pRkUjB7wjA.text: As locals we love this place, its really good food, the fish is always fresh and delicious. Staff is courteous fun and knowledgeable. Close to the strip without the strips outrageous pricing!  We repeat at least once.

wuKdP0Cs6SHCnH6wjZezLw.text: Good food, great drinks and yummy deserts - its like Olive Garden for the Island Fare.

YO1PKuj72dRAIMxHEjjLOQ.text: Never thought we'd eat there as it's a bit off the Strip for some reason we ended up there for lunch on a Sunday afternoon. Employees were extremely friendly and accomodating, offering us advice on what's good on the menu -  The jerk chicken is awesome and so was the salmon salad. A lot of food for what you pay too! It was a Sunday afternoon so the atmosphere was pretty mellow - overall, a great find for lunch.

UmxsD5HwJlzvYO_f20M1BQ.text: Came to Vegas for my Dirty 30 birthday celebration. We had a party of 18 and I was trying to find a reasonably priced place with a large selection of choices. Thank goodness I picked Bahama Breeze! I tried to make a reservation a week or so in advance and was told to just call the morning of. I was a little skeptical but thought, ok fine, let's see. Called the morning of and got a reservation, no problem at all. Had to wait about 20 minutes once we got there for the table to be ready, and had to have them add more seats 3 times, for some reason they kept counting wrong. But all the staff was very sweet. Had two servers, one was named "Red", both were AWESOME! Took a while to get drinks out, but with 18 people that can be expected. My hubs and I had some Mojitos, the avocado crab stack, coconut shrimp, fish tacos and side salad with fruit vinaigrette. Everything was DELISH! I mean like super, awesome, very, very good!!!!!! They also let us each have separate checks which made paying SO much easier! Thank you Bahama Breeze for making my birthday dinner amazing! All 18 people loved their food and drinks, and that's not an easy task!

nKdwZViKFejEwJeM3BblDw.text: Love Bahama Breeze, whether it is in Orlando or Las Vegas. However, the first time I ever dined at one was in Orlando.   This is a fabulous restaurant and it has a great ambiance. It truly reminds me of a meal in the Bahamas. The only thing missing were the geckos on the walls.   Food is great, service is ok. Decor is perfect.  and yes.....  I know it is a chain.  I typically shun chains and like all chains it will probably go down the big spiral.  But for now, I like it!

8Cg-P0GgoE9cB5cHFSCspA.text: Dining here with my husband during a non busy time .Very disappointing service - Kurt ( name on the receipt) was our server and I ordered the fish tacos after specifically asking if the flour tortillas could be substituted for corn - at first he said " we don't to that" and the. I said - I can't east wheat could you ask- and then he came back to say he could have them made with corn. When the food came out I started with my soup, and then  went to take a bite of the tacos and realized the tortillas were flour. I quickly empty the content of tacos I to my soup bowl right when Kurt was walking by to ask how our food was - I told him that the tortillas were still flour and he said " let me take them out of your way ' wow no attempt at service recovery ,no offer to bring out corn tortillas and no apology! We are locals who would have been back as This was our first visit and based on this experience it will be our last - please teach your team how to make things up of they make a mistake - everyone understands that things happen but staff need to know how to make it right when they screw up

_8MfT1lJQBBxlrB4T82EhA.text: Always consistent and always good. Not to mention a very nice host and good service as well.

V0hfQyUxIIgsoV5d_sGQWw.text: My first BB visit was down in Tampa Bay, FL, where I was impressed with the decent food items and the margaritas. So I was sure glad to find one in Vegas while roaming around for a supermarket.   Eh, who am i kdding. Come here for the kickass margaritas, then take a taxi to the strip to party!

dEoyS3QryUUMfIKDT19Eug.text: Came for happy hour and it was great! I recommend the nachos, seared ahi, and spinach dip! The nachos were really good compared to yard house nachos.. they tasted like curry lowkey but i didn't mind LOL. Drinks and service was good! BUT MY FAVORITE THING WAS THE DESSERT. I forgot its exact name but it was the banana nut one. It was like banana nut bread with a butterscotch sauce, vanilla ice cream, and candied almonds. Our server recommended it and I was so glad he did. Definitely coming back for this dessert 10/10

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BEST DESSERT EVER. 6.99 BANANA NUT BREAD DESSERT

wayGN3IqYpPN7MtbTdEWbg.text: Came in to try something new and I wasn't disappointed. Right off the bat, our server was great. We ordered the jerk chicken wings and coconut shrimp, we made it for happy hour so that was a great deal. The chicken wings were delicious, the seasoning was def jerk and not over powering and the sauce was really good. The coconut shrimp were tender, not over cooked and juicy. The sauce on that, although they say it's the sauce that sets it apart, I've actually had that sauce somewhere in Alaska with coconut shrimp- but still very good. I tried ordering the Calypso Shrimp Linguini but the server instead recommended I get the Shrimp and Lobster Linguini instead due to the base of the sauce being oil vs. cream. I like that he suggested something just on that basis, I like servers that are knowledgeable about their own food. My food came with a generous helping of seafood, I couldn't even finish it. My husband got the Lobster Mac n Cheese, which he didn't find special. I took their Key Lime Pie home. It was pretty good, tangy and not too sweet and the crust was really good. Overall environment was chill and can be used for a romantic evening or just to hang out with friends. I love that they play island music - the music of my people, you would think it was just Jamaican, nope there's Jamaican, Hawaiian and Samoan artists on the cuts. I'll be back with friends!

cYLvVETYTsLaB4DWVlwgzA.text: Our favorite in Veggy!!   I love the Salmon Tostada salad! The lunch portion of the Fresh Fish Combo is also perfect! Love the cinnamon sweet potato mash!!   This time we did the cocktail flights. I had the Hooch and Holler one ... It was so good. I hate drinks that have stupid names but this is basically like 3 shots. It was so good : ) lol.   No wait on Friday afternoon and so much parking!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with Green Beans and Cinnamon Sweet Potato Mash
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Tostada Salad
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cocktail Flight

iPKp7j0aru6Gd7K5X4yUig.text: Seated right away. The quesadilla....delicious! Always a good meal when I visit. Wish we still had a location in Phoenix!

y_d0zd3nGbxDb5pFOgB7uQ.text: The live music made the night! I had the jerk chicken pasta with a pitcher of mango Margarita, everything was excellent. The service was fast and very helpful, I have nothing bad to say. Perfect Sunday dinner if you are looking for something different and decently priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 25$ for a Margarita pitcher - mango was pretty good.

RNahjjCTItax87hR0wHazA.text: This. is. my. spot.  I have been here several times and each time is not like the other. In a good way.  I absolutely love coming to Bahama Breeze!  My girls and I frequent this place. We planned a Secret Santa gift exchange and planned to come here. I called ahead of time to see if they can help us remain anonymous with our gifts. They allowed us to bring in our gifts and keep them at the front desk. When the time came, they wheeled all the gifts and handed them out to who they were supposed to go to. So awesome. They made our party fun.   One lady who works there, I want to say her name is Denise, but I could be wrong. She is great! Every time we're there, she's there and comes to say hi, When we met her, we had found out our friend was moving overseas, so we were upset. Then when we came back for her going away, she was there too and stopped by. She even remembered the night we all had tears in out eyes.   I love the food here! The firecracker shrimp and jerk shrimp are my favorite. I like my food with a little kick and these deliver. Firecracker shrimp comes with a really good dipping sauce, while the jerk shrimp comes with Cuban bread. Also love their drinks! I get the Frozen Bahamarita. I recently tried the specialty rum drink they had, and got a souvenir glass.   For my birthday, I had planned on coming here for lunch after some activities. After telling my mom, she later told me that they were going to take me there for dinner! lol they know where to take me, that;s for sure.   Some nights they have live music, but there are always different parties going on.I really enjoy coming here because the food is good, staff are friendly and I always have a great time coming here.

RjEI0KOTa6qKfveYvLGvtw.text: Good food but the waitress ruined the experience when she rushed us to place our order because she was ready to go home. Then you can see all the staff talking crap about each other. So unprofessional

yaYV6Aut3Nlbz4Gxu6HFLg.text: One of the best restaurants in Las Vegas. The food the service, atmosphere and drinks were excellent we were there for our 10 anniversary and we decided to go there instead of Stratosphere. The  meals were affordable-and the dishes were fascinating went there 3 times wish they had breakfast. Bahama Breeze has everything that you need that are all nice, music,food and service you want have to think twice.

GwJxqAcwUXvx47AGweUMww.text: We came here for date night, but unfortunately left disappointed. We ordered the chips and "salsa" but what we got was chips and bruschetta. We both ordered steak -mine medium and my husband got well done. We were served our meals that look small, but were almost average size on huge plates however the steaks were undercooked (we were given a medium rare and a medium) the steak was tough, chewy and under seasoned. My husband and I were both upset because of the great reviews but we both ultimately left dissatisfied and still hungry.  Also, double check the bill- they calculate the tip after taxes are added.  I'm only giving it 2stars because our server was really nice and the drinks were great (ultimate pineapple and pina colada). Probably won't come back.

BhYWAkGmUMc7FkcUbzDT3A.text: So I normally love this place when it comes to dinner but I came here for lunch today and I liked everything except the Conch Fritters    Let me first say that I'm from the Virgin Islands and know what good Conch is... that's when it's actually included in the food. After eating three fritters I decided to open he last two since I didn't taste anything but bread and vegetables.  They were devoid of Conch and it was only tons of filler breading and diced peppers.    We enjoyed everything else so just stay away from the Faux Conch fritters and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Bahamian Seafood Chowder Soup and Hush Puppies disguised as Conch Fritters.

BLKD5L4ccmjpIgZLPIfWDA.text: Great place for happy hour. Half-price appetizers with big portions. Nice atmosphere.

QY-JRfbKw9cKPZv-8ish0g.text: First time here.  I stay at Candlewood Suites across the street a lot but have never eaten here.  I love curry and ordered the goat curry bowl and the chicken empanadas to go.  Order was done on time and staff was very friendly.  However meat was overcooked and the curry was very spicy.  Empanadas were actually pretty good.  Will try it again sometime as I like to try a restaurant twice.  Hopefully my next visit will yield better results.

ImZXye_fWLBgISVkGlbxjg.text: I came in here with one of my co-workers for their late night happy hour. Their appetizers are half off during happy hour and the portions are what make it worth your while.   I got the crispy onion rings, the lobster & shrimp quesadilla, and the Jamaican chicken wings. For a drink, I just stuck with the coconut water.  The crispy onion rings have a panko-coconut breading that's fried to a golden-brown. The coconut flavor is really subtle, but you can't go wrong with this classic appetizer.  The lobster & shrimp quesadilla was pretty amazing. Who would've ever thought that cheese and shellfish would be a perfect match? They came with pico de gallo and sour cream on the side, which go perfect with these little triangles of cheesy goodness. The lobster seemed a little sparing, but the shrimp was definitely there.  The Jamaican chicken wings had the perfect marinade to it. The jerk spices added a unique zing to the wings that blast your tastebuds with rich flavor! The spiciness factor isn't too hot. It won't burn your tongue, but it definitely has a noticeable kick.   I'll be back to try their entrees, but their appetizers are really something special. Any place that has amazing deals for their happy hour is worth it to me!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. interior.
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican chicken wings.
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. crispy onion rings.

XGpIbM5R-7QxHPTQzf509Q.text: Did the happy hour which is cheap and appetizers was really good specially the avocado with shrimp and crab meat and mangoes delish!!!!!! We also ordered chicken wings with BBQ sauce dip, spinach and chips and shrimp poppers... and my favorite drink was Virgin Bahamaritas (strawberry and kiwi slush yum)

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frozen bahamaritas!!! So good! My favorite
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!!!
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zoXVA7FNpzUJUxQ5_aDabQ.text: I am notoriously picky and to go to dinner and have multiple courses come out with no issues is amazing. Service was friendly and quick to refill a drink. Conch fritters were crispy a flavorful. Caesar salad with their house vinaigrette- citrus flavor was fresh and light. And the paella. THE PAELLA!!! To die for! Amazing flavor with enough spices to keep things lively but not too much so. The pineapple crene brulee was unique - almost more of a pineapple pudding with the sugar glazed topping. Definitely worth trying. All in all, 2 thumbs WAY up.

EWGM3FNgyAGwS5QfYOx00w.text: A fun neat place to eat!  Had lunch here and found the food to be tasty and pleasing to the eye.   Restaurant was clean and wait staff was friendly, courteous and helpful. Restaurant atmosphere is light and fun. A good place to eat. We will be back on a future Trip.

uC8NBHLRG6oEDo6FLvB1Uw.text: Had a fun lunch with friends, had the artichoke dip which was pretty blah but the buttermilk fried chicken was amazing.  The prices aren't bad and the sizes are huge.  However if our server called me 'hun' or 'babe' one more time I would have lost it.  I am not your hun and I am not your babe, that is a pet peeve and enough that I can't be bothered to come back.

jDT7cSVIkMut0cWo1N6-tw.text: Thanks to yelpers we had a very good experience at this funky place.  I was sold on the mixed drink pics (didn't have one).   I did have the most delicious black bean soup (Cuban style) and so tasty.   I also had the lobster and shrimp quesadilla which was very good.  I did share and every one said it was their fave.   The service was excellent and the Bathrooms were very cute ...  I would love to return here.  Good food good service and cute atmosphere... winning combo

q9uKi8UcMeMLzIZ68elAgw.text: Great atmosphere on enclosed patio. Server disappeared too often. Coconut shrimp tacos huge and very tasty. Taste of Jamaica excellent. Skip the chocolate pineapple upside down cake and the key lime pie.

UxEAE3IO3Nu-8_1_Lv0BwQ.text: Fun atmosphere! Great service and delicious food! Extensive drink menu, and lots of different appetizers and entrees to pick from. Would absolutely recommend.

lYdsQnDKPo7-Jr2ke-CNZg.text: Our 1st time here and we LOVED IT!  The food was delicious!  The drinks were delicious!  Our server was Jelly, she was so sweet, prompt and accurate. We will definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me and my husband
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ropa Vieja
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buttermilk Chicken Jabiritos ( I think that&#39;s what it&#39;s called lol)

kfp7ChUlUmFl6X_gEu_tUA.text: We decided on Bahama Breeze after our return from San Diego California. Hubby went down to pick up some surfboards. We were hungry and indecisive on where to eat. Anyways, Bahama Breeze is located just east of Tuscany Suites & Casino.  When we arrived, we were greeted by a very nice young lady. She offered us a booth/ table which really threw me off. When I saw it I was like Oh okay. Auntie took the booth side. Hubby & I took the table side. Our server told us about the drink specials. Bahama MaMa's $3. Since I couldn't drink. I talked Auntie into having one for me. Guess what, she ended up having 2...Lol.  Our order, Delicious Grilled Salmon & Mixed Greens with corn and black beans, avocado and drizzled with island vinaigrette. Aunt Marilyn Loved it. Was enough to have for lunch the next day.  Hubby ordered the Seafood Paella. A Caribbean classic with sauteed scallops shrimp, fish, mussels, chicken, and chorizo sausage with yellow rice. I could tell it was a little spicy. John was wiping his nose.  I had the mouthwatering Grilled Chicken Breast with broccoli that was cooked just right. The broccoli wasn't too mushy nor too hard. Plus Plus, it actually came with cheese sauce. Unfortunately, I was so full that I didn't try the asparagus.  The Two dived head 1st into the Coconut Grande. A coconut lovers dream. Warm coconut cake topped with coconut-pineapple ice cream, fresh pineapple and toasted coconut. Served in a fresh coconut.  Auntie thought this was a great place to dine and to come back to again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Grande
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Chicken Breast w/ Broccoli &amp; Asparagus
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Paella

Pf1FEJqL8I5yPdfUNw42OQ.text: I had a great time at Bahama breeze! It was such a relaxing atmosphere with live music on a Thursday afternoon! We luckily went on the week where they had select drinks for $2, $3, and $4 and they were all delicious. I highly recommended the Bahama Mama!! I had the jerk chicken pasta as my entree and it was huge! The food was so delicious I couldn't resist but finish it all. It is on the pricier side of a sit down restaurant. I'll be looking forward to coming back but it will be on certain occasions not just casually.

BlM26BHbD0cj22I6Xp3B-w.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants that I make sure to eat at whenever I'm in Las Vegas. The food is usually on point but my visit here this time around was just ok. I ordered the skillet jerk shrimp which was delicious. It comes with warm Cuban bread to dip into the jerk sauce which was soo yummy. It's very filling and I should have just ordered that. I also had the fish tacos. A waste of my money. The fish was cold and had absolutely no flavor at all. It was so bad, I didn't even finish it. It came with a tomato salad that was good, but it's very hard to mess up tomatoes. My friend ordered the Jamaican wings that she said was very good. I also had a coconut mojito that was just ok. The lemonade which is usually very good was way too sweet this time. Everyone has a bad day once in a while so I will definitely come again and see if things are better on my next visit to Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qs1C9YJDSfNrF_PTCoF_Kg.text: Let me just say it was not a Breeze to get out of this restaurant earlier today. Family came into town this weekend and they wanted to enjoy something off the strip and new to them. We decided on Bahama Breeze because we had a good experience with food and service before.  The Inside of this restaurant gave them an Islands Burgers kind of vibe so they were liking it so far. Once we were seated (less than 2 minutes) we had a while to look over the menu so by the time our waiters came by we put in our drink and food orders. Drinks came out and they were delicious, I got the Mystic Margarita and it was wonderful. Waiters had to be reminded that they forgot one drink but it was a big table so it was forgivable.  After the waiters were asked how much longer the food was going to take and a good 40ish minutes, the food had arrived! Everything was looking great until there was a hair found in one of the burgers. YUCK. The waiters took it back and we really didn't have time to wait for another 40 minutes, the waiters came back to let us know it was going to be a minute and they would be able to box it up and take it off the bill. Greatly appreciated by the way. But once it was time to pay that's when the "okay" experience took a turn for the worst. The checks were brought and given back for the waiters to do their thing. Once a good 10-15 minutes go by and we see our waiters serving and taking orders we ask ourselves "so did anyone get their checks back because we have to go?"  By this point one of the cousins was irritated so she went to complain to a random employee to ask about our bills, he hunted down our waiters and BAM our bills were brought to us! And to top it all off...... The time stamp on the final check was 13 minutes before we received it. Sooooo I don't know who dropped the ball there but it was enough to not want to come back to this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mystic Margarita
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I love the drink menus!

o283RRWrylZ4ORAMSauTEg.text: This place has an awesome happy hour! Not only do they have drinks ranging from 4-6 dollars (including tasty pina coladas and bahamaritas) but also half price all appetizers! We came for not only the happy hour, but for a friends birthday dinner, and the staff accomodated us very well. As the appetizer, I had Jamaican jerk chicken wings, they're a little dry but flavor is good! And the wings are large, so you definitely get your bang for the buck. For dinner, I ordered the Baja fish tacos, which were delicious! Wish I got the rice and beans, but that was on me. Nonetheless, the food was great. My favorite drink is the pina colada because it's not too sweet but nice, smooth and just sweet enough! Only reason it's not five stars is because some of the servers and waitresses are kind of unfriendly. The waiters and waitresses that we had this night were amazing but there are a few everytime we come here that don't bring the best customer service. Not their entire staff is like this, but some of their staff could be better. Other than that, come here for a good happy hour and good food!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baja fish tacos with fries
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican Chicken Wings
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday dinner!

4bVbpkopX5IF1JWVQaGZMQ.text: Happy Hour is where it is at!!!! I'm so sad I did not take a picture of the food! But it was great! Half off appetizers! Everything except the sampler! We had jerk chicken, lobster and shrimp quesadillas, chicken quesadilla, goat cheese bell pepper dip, spinach dip, chicken jibaritos, beef empanadas, coconut skrimps, firecracker skrimps, skillet simmered jerk skrimps. And oh my gosh!!! It was amazing !!!!! I hope you guys definitely try it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hRbVE4DMqBePB6Cg3EYNmQ.text: Tried this place out on behalf of a friend that worked here. Now we went to happy hr on a Wednesday. First things first the staff was friendly and helpful. Although there were a few times the service of food and drink was a slow they made up in friendliness.   The food was decent and good at times. The shrimp is something to order. We had fire cracker shrimp and skillet jerk shrimp and that was on point. The chorizo meat balls were a dissapointment. The meat was bland itself but the sauce was good. Overall I could come back and the atmosphere was nice.

_usxLz3IwpnrZ0M5K13F8Q.text: Ok it's a Thursday... but no napkin, no utensils... and after I asked for some, nothing. So here I am eating a salad with a spoon for The soup I ordered... no thanks...  Didn't get any better. I'll not come back to this horrible chain...

_qDVzTZlFepd5rirwht3GA.text: I'm in love with the shrimp at this place and the happy hour! You can get so much food and drinks during the happy hour for under $50 and that qualifies as a great place to eat. They also have a great ambience with great music and a nice island vibe, on the weekends they have a live band that plays in the patio .   The food is really good and I personally love all the shrimp dishes but the jerk chicken is slamming as well. I actually was very impressed with the variety of food and the quality of it. I would definitely recommend this place for a relaxing evening full of good food, drinks, music, and at a great price.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2k-V2aY9NDz1SNiEiLvaOw.text: Ate there two nights ago with a big group from a seminar. We had around 28 people. We'd made reservations ahead and they were completely prepared when we arrived. The waitstaff was unflappable! The way they handled so many orders (drinks, appetizers, then mains) and split checks was impressive. The manager came around to personally check each table section to see if we needed anything. The food was tasty, well prepared and attractively plated. You're in good hands here!

cIpAJz4CzFao7eiltNZdZw.text: The happy hour is amazing but the food has always Ben mediocre. The service is also hit or miss depending on who you get. If you're looking for a cheap ppce to drink and catch up, it's a good spot. Don't come here if you're looking for gourmet food or a great dining experience.

dY5JKUHJSggeulFkck__Ng.text: I've been to this restaurant a handful of times and it is always very good! Really enjoy the atmosphere!  Today, was a bit of a hiccup as my order was wrong twice but our waiter was quick to take it back. He noticed i was picking the tomatoes (gag) off my salad one by one on the second salad delivered and quickly came over and took it back again. Only complaint was the pulled chicken on my salad was hot (was told it's cold, I prefer it cold) & it was rather chewy/hard to pull apart the large chunks.  Most likely it was just slightly over cooked and fresh vs. prepared as it was early in the day. If the chicken had been tender I'd have given a 5 star. Even with the order being off a little.  None the less, I'll be back. Really enjoy their food.

2nEgz6kxPWmI96ic7Z4VrA.text: This is a favorite of ours in Vegas when you don't want to deal with long waits and spend tons of money on dinner. The casual, off-strip (but walking distance) atmosphere is relaxing and enjoyable. The food is great with tons of options for the pickiest eaters. And then there are the rum drinks, ah, the rum drinks! You must try the rum drink flight - worth the bucks - and fun to sample and share! Delightful find off the beaten path.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rum Raid Flight
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8 different rum drinks - yum!

sUMV4anrpeTprbQJReQdug.text: Enjoyed dinner with the family tonight to celebrate our daughter's 19th birthday. Food was amazing and happy hour prices were great. We had the crab and avocado stack, which was amazing, the coconut shrimp was really great, too. Jerk wings full of flavor, applewood bacon burger cooked to perfection and the lobster quesadilla was good, too! They were busy so you may want to set a reservation. Overall, we loved it and will go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab &amp; Avocado Stack is so good!

Ej6X36zKLT9eGD24T76YLw.text: Omg! I went here with my colleagues during happy hour and i would say it was the bomb! Our server was very approachable and he actually split the orders and the bill even though we never told him to! He definitely knows what he's doing and I love how he made the payment process easier for all of us! I ordered calamari and i only paid $7 since it was half off! It was very filling :)

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour :)

K9M_zgLJjTHrAkfPDPOwLw.text: A good place for a group. Drink menu was extensive and had a food variety of tropical themed drinks. I chose the Blood Orange Margarita. It was enormous and enough to share with 2-3 other people. We shred the Jerk Chicken Wings. They were hot and very flavorful even without the sauce. I decided on the Caesar Salad and the Lobster & Shrimp Linguine. It was delicious. The server was really helpful with menu questions and was happy to make recommendations.  It was late and the food took a little while but it was with the wait. I'd definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster &amp; Shrimp Linguine
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blood Orange Margarita.

wJPt5t64OW2HXp5m8XO_zg.text: They stole my AirPods I called after I left realized I left them Them I called 30 minutes later will never go their again

4JXoeF6Iws7jrNkbUS-xrQ.text: Some things never change... and in Bahama Breeze's case, that's a great thing!  I remember coming here years ago and I loved the ambiance, vibe, food, and service. Til this day it's exactly the same!  Food is delicious, especially their Jerk Chicken Pasta. And their Key Lime Pie.... seriously the best!!!!  If I lived closer to this side of time, I'd be back more often. Dining here makes you feel like you're in the Caribbean

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Chicken Pasta
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Key lime pie.. seriously the best I&#39;ve ever tasted!
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican Stuffed Plantain Bowl

McK5ztdJTVN291gJIBWlpw.text: Service started as "forced friendly", after we got our drinks it took a while to place our entree order, and when we did it took a long time to get it (45 mins for a pasta and rice dish).  The rice dish did not look very appetizing, as it looked crusty as if haf been sitting yhere for a while, the server never asked if we liked it, then when we left the rice plate (pretty much full as ordered), the waitress did not as why we didn't eat it or even of we wanted a togo box. We were never asked if we wanted another drink or even if we wanted dessert, just brought the bill and seemed like she wanted us out of her section (probably the end of her shift)  Very disappointed because I guess since we told the server we were locals she didn't when try to give good service.  Will not be going back. Too bad.  Server name: Taylor

1AyHALVAVsxXTUBHWAZXhQ.text: Loved my food and my drinks.  Yolanda was my waitress and she was nice.  I loved their margarita sampler.  It was more than I expected it to be.  Chicken empandas, the house salad and the chicken bowl were awesome. I wish there was a location in Southern California.

EyjYWiGuN-wbQAPi5caoDw.text: The food was bland and lukewarm. I got Cajun meal and the only flavor was jalapeno. Even worse, my bf's black bean burger had bacon on it! He's been a vegetarian for five years!! Luckily he noticed and sent it back, which left whole table preoccupied with when the waitress will come back to check on us and bring back the meal. Then the manager came by a very uncomfortable, aggressive and disingenuous apology. They didn't even have the class to take it off the bill! Oh and no complimentary bday desert either. Going there was a huge mistake.

c8UAaAMNb6hiWRQHffsi7Q.text: Bar/drinks review only. Great happy hour prices. I like the Aruba Red (beer) which is only at Bahama Breeze. I haven't had the food in a long time just because I tend to opt for healthier choices at other places, and I can't remember it well enough to write any opinion on it. I love to stop here for a drink from time to time.

O58U8kRlGWoLm2ezjfLZiw.text: Their happy hour is the best!  You don't have to sit by the bar or at a particular area of the restaurant to get their happy hour specials, which is a huge bonus!  Happy hour is from 4-6 pm Monday - Friday.  Their prices are outstanding, and the service is awesome!  Drinks are strong and the food is tasty!

B9xiL-0c1FFthQLc1NIv1g.text: Ugh, so many people that I know like this place, but I don't get it!  I've been here a handful of times because it is right around the corner from my office.  Located on the corner of Flamingo & Paradise, there is indoor and outdoor seating and a decent amount of parking.  I came here last week for lunch with 5 of my co-workers.  They ask where we would like to sit.  We asked if we could sit in the "patio" area; its this big round room and the windows can open when it's nice outside.  So they take us to the table; there are only 3 seats.  We look at the guy that brought us to our table and we say "this table is a little too small, there are 5 of us" and he says "yes, I know.  I have no idea why they brought you out here.  Unfortunately, there isn't any tables out here big enough for your group."  We tell him no problem and sit us wherever there is room.  He takes us back inside to the room behind the bar and sits us at a table that is set for 4 people, but enough room for 5.  We ordered a handful of appetizers and each of us ordered entrees.  I ordered the combination chicken & veggie quesadilla and a caesar salad.  The caesar was barely dressed and wasn't that good anyways.  Now, I've had the lobster quesadilla here before and it was gross.  So I thought chicken and fresh vegetables couldn't be that bad.  Well, it's not good.  I don't know how to put it.  But the flavor sucks.  We get a discount to eat here because of where our office is located and I would STILL never come here again.

kXH4Wkunsfh-p99kgxbEZg.text: I have been here a few times and never was the biggest fan, but I will laud Bahama Breeze on my experience today: my friend Susan D. dropped her business card in while at lunch a few weeks ago and won a free happy hour party for 10 people (drinks we had to buy at happy hour prices, which is $3-$4) but it included all sorts of appetizers...and it was seemingly unlimited...for TWO HOURS!  Happy hour is 4-6 PM Monday through Friday, and there are lots of drinks but it looked like only 5 or so choices for apps.
