Well, our bartender Melissa hooked it up with more than that and even though there were only 5 of us, she furnished a second round of our faves and almost ordered a third round...of FOOD...and we had to turn her down!  To drink I had the bahamarita, with strawberry, kiwi and mango slush and margarita on top with a side shot of cactus schnapps...interesting and almost like alcoholic jamba juice.  I tried a variety of apps (beef patties which were really empanadas with creole seasoning, coconut shrimp, spinach dip, chicken wings, and chicken sliders) and they also brought out cheeseburger sliders, chorizo sliders, and pulled pork sliders, none of which I tried.  My conclusion is this:  1) a good deal for a free meal, 2) the empanadas, shrimp, and wings were good, the dip not so much, and 3) THE CAT IS OUT OF THE BAG: the chicken sliders tasted like MINI CHICK-FIL-A sandwiches! I hardly ever eat fried food but I had 4 of these, 2 each round.  Hearty juicy fried white meat chicken, 2 pickle slices, and a tasty bun (that probably has less butter than CFA, a good thing!)  I might die tomorrow but I have to say that after being away from Chick-Fil-A for quite some time, Bahama Breeze solves that craving.  Now if only I can find good waffle fries ever since Caribbean Cooker went out of business.  Moral of this story: Go to Bahama Breeze between 4 and 6, order 1 happy hour priced chicken sliders app and 1 drink for $3 and you will thank me later.  and get Melissa as your bartender, she rocks!

O2JZH4xqr09Fmjd8faEPFA.text: Service was extremely slow on a slow night. Food was absolutely horrible quality. Sitting at a business dinner, my boss sent back his epinadas. I ordered the pork tenderlion, and no joke, it was like a cheap flat iron steak. I choked it down because I was hungry. I would give this place negative stars if that was feasibly possible.....

hSeulu3Teg0Ojxp7Fiy1rQ.text: drove by here so many times thinking I need to try that place out, finely did. Sat outside enjoying the band, dinner and a couple drinks. bartender gave great service and the empanadas were good. not quite as authentic as Jamaica but very close.

Ery928fYNuLns2zNtVkk_A.text: A friend treated me to lunch recently, and a treat it was.  The food was fresh, hot, service was good, and I will return, and don't mind paying.  The prices are reasonable considering the quality of the food, and location.

q2AFlTTnyyaHiMaxiPLCCw.text: I rarely give 5 stars but Bahama Breeze was just perfection to me. For a chain restaurant the food was really good and our server (Steven/Stephen) was awesome. He represented the food and company very well.   I have ate at many places on the strip and Bahama Breeze far exceeded them.  My only suggestion/complaint is that they update their logo and the color of their restaurant. It blends too much and can easily be passed over.

riVMwgClS3KEzilB_5D1zA.text: The food is good here. Anita is a very nice and attentive server. I would come back forsure.

53VjmqGcJLWvPqtI2k_lyg.text: I am never disappointed when I come to Bahama Breeze. The food is always quick, hot, and DELICIOUS!!! MMMMMMMMMM! the customer service is superb. My favorite dish, well appetizer, is the Jerk Shrimp! It's comes with bread for you to dip in the sauce and it is absolutely delicious!!! You gotta try this place!

sjxp0D1msfIu-gAMjP6puA.text: My wife and I just stopped by this place and we checked the reviews on Yelp and we came for lunch. We definitely enjoyed this place. It is a mixed of Caribbean food. Really good. In addition my wife order a pinacolada. She loved it. It has a little splash of run. If you don't like too much alcohol this is for you otherwise you can order something different. I ordered a margarita mango. This one, I really don't recommend it. Not a good taste. I couldn't found the taste of the mango. It was more alcohol than anything else. Next time I may tried something else. Very affordable and great food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The ambient seems to be nice. I will let you know about the food later.

7p42kE_v9w8E5WYTOJm7Sg.text: Located on Flamingo Blvd, just east of the Las Vegas Strip. Ok so it's a chain, I have no problem with that. This is a great place to take visiting family if you want to avoid the strip. The service is great, the prices good, and food is fun. Oh and they have a great selection of drinks as well. What else do you need? Nothing you say? Good, then stop on by. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

0lKaKvE5_VUoub8qNrpkkg.text: The drinks are the best part of this restaurant they are all good but I suggest the The frozen drinks Their so good I like the Ultimate pina colada. The lobster Mac and cheese is rely good  also the jerk chicken

BSyLCxL1JeXHlM1qK0qvMw.text: First time here my first experience was not so bad the food was great the service was decent and the price was a little out my budget but it was to be expected hey we're in Vegas gotta live it up!!!! #heyyyyy  I had a mudslide yummy yummy yummylicious lol #heyyyyy #turnup #girlsweekendout #05242014

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Girls weekend out #05242014
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was my jerk chicken pasta meal yummy

4k71MyFX6eoS-zPR8sHauA.text: Best Caribbean food in Las Vegas. The entire menus is spot on. They also have awesome drinks. The staff is friendly and offer spot on service. Very efficient at keeping the food and drinks flowing. Good location close to the strip for all visitors.

J6cCNsd8PiUJV7iNecTYbg.text: I was here for my friend who through a party over here. Utter Disappointed with food. The drinks were fine but the food is no Caribbean or freshly made. Just tasted like frozen food. Never going to any of this chain restaurants again.

8WO-UN7ArFOAuKD8rOt64A.text: Outdoor seating feels like your in Key West. Good, solid Caribbean food, happy hour starts again at 9:00, reasonable prices, good drinks.

IIAfC-H0ERPiUTmcxPCLPA.text: I came in here the other night because I wanted to try Caribbean food for the first time. I was lost looking at the menu because everything looked so good. Tamikah was my server and seemed to know exactly what I was looking for. She suggested the key West nachos and I swear she read my mind. Then she told me it was happy hour and that the food was discounted so I decided to get a drink she suggested an ultimate pina colada I thought it was too girly but she insisted it would be great. I ordered it and it was so strong very good. I was so happy with her passion and knowledge of the food and restaurant in general. This girl deserves and award with the way she treated me and my family. I will be a regular here from now on. Thank you tamikah for a great experience.

29tTt6VcKuzVaQXK7Se9eA.text: The food here is great...I loved almost everything we ordered.  Especially good was the jerk Jamaican chicken...annoying to eat the wings but the spices made it worth the bother.  Their seafood Paella is very yummy.  Drinks are pretty strong...especially the mojito.  If you want something sweeter, try their coconut pineapple martini.  For appetizers, I liked the coconut shrimp, calamari, and spinach artichoke dip.  Their bathrooms are really nice too.  They have nice smelling lotion and mouthwash.  Service is pretty good.  There is a large patio which is very convenient if you have a big party.

CG6epT68UG0oQKSRArUJgA.text: So, I finally tried Bahama Breeze for the first time this past weekend  and it was "Off da Hook"!!!  My father kept telling me about this place when he's in town.  I came with my entire family (20+ members) while vacationing in Las Vegas.  They booked us a private room and the service was very helpful and friendly.  We all ordered the Bahamian Seafood Chowder (recommended by my dad and now I recommend it to you), it's a Seafood Chowder w/Fried Shrimp on top.  We also tried the Coconut Shrimp, West Indies Beef Patties (curry empanada, Simmered Jerk Shrimp (soooo gooood!!!) with a warm roll and the West Indies Ribs (huge slab and the best I ever had!)

iv9x50RfcD39TYwfhp9Aig.text: We loved this place! Great atmosphere, great food, great service. I had a drink called something like "Bahamacardi" and it was so good! The shrimp linguine was delicious, and my sister said her fish was too. I can't wait to go back on my next trip to Vegas.

oWz90365SfYyZCWqH_7Akw.text: Setting:  Tropical.  They did a good job with the decorating.  Very nice, very clean.  Nice bathrooms as well.  Food:  The food was great.  I just had an appetizer (yummy habanero wings), and it was big enough for a meal.  The food all around was tasty (tried my friends' dishes as well  :).  Service:  Very happy-go-lucky, especially the person who seated us.  An upbeat group of folks.

mydz_h2ncinllKeAbW5Mdw.text: It has been a few years since we have eaten here and were looking forward to our favorite sandwiches for lunch. First let me say, that service here is hit or miss. Sometimes it is fabulous. Other times, horrible. There is no in between. This was a horrible time - waitress would not shut up, did not accept that we did not want alcoholic drinks or appetizers and tried to push them on us, she pulled a menu one of my party was holding and started flipping through it, insisted on telling us the "specials" despite we knew what we wanted.... anyway - we were looking forward to the Grilled Chicken Sandwich and Portabello Mushroom Sandwich. Both were a disappointment - chicken was like rubber, bread tasted bad (not ciabatta anymore). The portabello sandwich was mashed flat as if someone sat on it and the vegetables were diced small and indistinguishable. More so - for a Saturday lunch it was dead... not the normal for this place. Usually it is busy. Looking out the window we got to watch a drunk/high gentleman purusing the parking lot, and then when we left we were confronted by a man who "wanted to ask us questions" and when we refused he started swearing, dropping the f-bomb and being obnoxious. It was very unsettling to our group - family members from seniors down to children. The place has not been kept up - although when we entered there was a young girl cleaning the windows, the table was dirty, the ledge where the plants are was full of dust, the menus had food on them. No reason for that.   The area this restaurant is in has certainly changed tremendously and as well, other restaurants in the area seemed to have changed hands/chains as well. If you are on the Strip, I would advise you to stay there and eat. It is not worth the taxi ride over there and I certainly would not advise you to walk down there from your hotel.   This used to be a popular place for lunch for the UNLV crowd, and possibly during the week things are different. But don't waste your time.

QZ5lsRpniD6KndaSRLYCoA.text: Came for Happy Hour. The bar was full but as we were on our way out, a bartender, Wayne, stopped us and said he was setting up outside. Wayne, couldn't have been nicer he knew exactly what we needed (drinks, food, water, check) and we never had to ask for anything.  I'd definitely return.

3hwxzc0lHzRIexsgtT6ahQ.text: I love this place..we come here everytime we go to vegas..jamaician wings are delicious..there my favthing on the menu..crispy and full of flavor!I tried the butermilk fried chicken sliders....they were good....husband had a salmon pasta that he loved..lots of salmon in it.alcohol drinks are great too..all of them! Enjoy!

c9JEP3Z56aT3Ag23jR3T4g.text: I love place! The first time was many years ago, where I had seafood paella for the very first time. I think that dish made this restaurant memorable, plus the island decor. I think I had a mojito, which was strong, and I couldn't finish it. I don't go to Las Vegas very often, but when I do, this place was always in the back of my mind, and I do get a little sad when we don't get to go eat there. Service had been great for the times we went. We even brought kids with us one time, and they enjoyed the food. I'll be waiting for the next trip to Sin City, and soon so I can use the coupon they sent me by email.

DKj2YyC1YNAWzc-clfrNNQ.text: Food was pretty good. Our waitress Sandra was great.  They were missing some of the items on the menu. Overall a good experience.

Y_iETLDXXcGGKvjq1CpzTQ.text: pretty good, very standard food, but not so standard decor. I went here with my dad after a convention at the las vegas convention center, and saw lots of other convention goers there too. Service was good, food was decent, and you get raw sugar sticks in your ice tea. I forgot what I ate, but the pina colada was super sweet.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qflAz5a3ThbBLmjyizxNPA.text: I just  moved here and my sister came to visit me.  I wasn't familiar with the restaurants  yet, but we found this place on the Internet.  We went on a Sonday evening after making 'call ahead seating' reservations.  When we arrived, we were seated right away.  The service was immediate and friendly.  The menu has a good selection and a huge drink menu.  The atmosphere was  very  authentic  and casual.  Easy to find and  their own parking lot right off the street.  My sister had a fabulous tropical drink, suggested by our waiter, that she not only loved but only cost $6.00.  We both had seafood which was fabulous.  When the bill arrived, we were pleasantly surprised how reasonable it was for all we got.  We will definitely be going back again and I will recommend this place to everyone!

gWAthS7xW8gLiPiwVcsU2Q.text: Maybe we got the wrong dishes. I got the chipotle beef rice bowl and my girlfriend got the fish tacos. The rice bowl was horrible. It was cheesy rice with beef smothered in barbecue sauce. I didn't eat very much of it. The fish tacos were OK. The sorbet served with the fruit salad tasted very good. We also got onion rings as an appetizer. Those were good as well. This might be a good happy hour place but I don't think I would suggest any one to come here for a normal dining experience. Service was OK.

1djMBo01H27HjFMQsvjksA.text: went beyond my expectations!!! food,ambiance and service was awesome. I highly recommend the firecracker shrimp and the grilled chicken with cilantro cremation. we will definitely be back.

QFWCPi9OUil1Tvsvb26xyg.text: This is my second trip here and my first in quite some time. The food was really good and the drinks more so. I had two Bahama Mamas and we ordered the Fire-Roasted Jerk Shrimp and Crab Claws St. Thomas for appetizers. For our meal my wife and I split a hamburger. Our waitress was fun and paid attention to detail. Too bad the kitchen staff didn't. A friend of ours ordered the Chicken Sliders. When they came they were do it yourself. The buns, chicken and toppings all came seperated. As for our hamburger that we ordered everything on the side and sure enough it came all assembled. Hey, kitchen, here's a clue. Listen to your waitress. They usually know what they're doing and when you don't listen you wind up hurting them and your business.

6fHPYP84qB6wDoUzagaiCg.text: Great fruity island drinks! Seafood dishes are absolutely fresh, not bad for a chain restaurant. Quick service, neat island style decor.  Try the blackened anything.

NahuNYEu_VwdBw6h1olcog.text: This place is located on the corner of Flamingo and Paradise in a little plaza. I came here for my cousins b'day. We wanted to stay away from the strip for a change. To start off the night we ordered some frozen bahamaritas and appetizers. Warm spinach, artichokes and cheese, with a hint of nutmeg. It hit the spot. As for dinner, I ordered the Seafood Paella with seafood, chicken, sausage and peas with yellow rice. OMG...you can't go wrong with this dish. For dessert we shared he warm chocolate pineapple upside down cake. It reminded me when I was back in the Caribbean.  yum-yum in my tum.  Our waiter was awesome.  He always topped off our drinks and was very attentive.

ebmItZ4R70NJVfpfpnm_OA.text: We loved the Cuban Bread appetizer but they stopped serving it. The rest of the food is ok. The best thing about this place is the Chocolate Island desert. The wife likes the Mojitos.

UTXJKLJjNuWCb0FKEiDVrg.text: The hardest thing is deciding where to start, especially considering I never write reviews.  We had never been to Bahama Breeze before and with trying any new place there is always that slight worry. We walked up to a restaurant that looks as if it was flown in from the Caribbean up to the hostess' stand and were warmly greeted. We were shown our way to the table and were given their menu which has an extensive selection, especially the house cocktails. We were delightlfully greeted by our server Sandra and we informed her it was our first time and we would need a moment to take in the vast menu. She was truly polite and gave us some suggestions and brought us our water while we mulled everything over, that's when our excitement started going up as we looked at the specialty drinks.   I'm not a drinker and the fact that these drinks caught my eye is a good sign. We started off by ordering a truly delicious Bahama Margharita (an infusion of pineapple, strawberry and kiwi with tequila) and my girlfriend a Strawberry Banana Daquiri. Both drinks made to perfection. We started our appatizers in a simple manner with wonderfully crisp coconut shrimp as well as chips and salsa, both which were brought to us very quickly, while we continued to look at the menu. All the while Sandra keeping an eye on us and ensuring our satisfaction. Finally we decided to settle on the Baby Back Ribs for myself an the Filet Mignon for her.   The meal was astounding. The ribs were falling off the bone and well sauced, and the mashed potatoes I requested with them were delicously creamy and flavorful. My girlfriends filet was cooked to perfection and her sides were enjoyed with gusto. We ordered another round of drinks (keep in mind drinks aren't my thing so they must be good for me to order another) but we decided to try something different. My girlfriend tried The Blue (something, I don't recall the rest of the name sadly) and I enjoyed the Berry Berry Good. Both of us would share drinks to try more of a variety and we fell absolutey in love with the Berry Berry Good, as i quote my girlfriend, "next time I'm getting five of these.'  I'm confident I will as well.  Next we go on to the dessert. When we are as stuffed as were at the end of a meal we don't even consider it, but we figured this place has been so amazing how can we say no? Dulce de Leche Cheesecake and a Chocolate Island (a chocolate cake with chocolate mousse sitting in a delicate sea of a vanilla bean sauce) I didn't want to take it home, i just wanted to eat everything there and get another order to go, it was that incredible. We were so delighted at the end of the meal and asked to see the manager (Jesse is his name) and couldn't begin to describe how happy we were.  All this alone provides something worth noting, but what will truly brings us back beyond anything else is Sandra. We can confidently say that she is without a doubt the greatest server we have ever had. Truly charismatic and professional. When were were looking at our menus in the beggining we saw that she was busy but never once did she let that bother her nor take away from the quality she was providing not just us but everyone. We had great conversations with her and never once did we feel rushed or neglected, it was the exact opposite. She made our night, so much so that on the drive home we were still talking about how amazing she is (plus the quality of the restaurant) We will absolutely make sure that when we go in next we will request her (and if there's a wait we will not mind at all) I cannot stress enough how she truly is the greatest server we have ever had. She is a gem that must never be lost.   Everything about this place is remarkable. They took two first time diners and in one fantastic experience made us die hard fans.

Hnj3TCiz6j0BVIW0Jc2Uuw.text: I have family that lives near there and we seem to eat at Bahama Breeze every time I am in Vegas.  Pretty good 'island' food and a fun environment for the money, and you will definitely not leave hungry, I have had leftovers each time I ate there.  You HAVE TO get their Cuban Bread for an appetizer, it is pretty simple but my mouth waters just thinking about it.  I have had the paella, coconut shrimp, a chicken pasta dish, and a lobster/shrimp pasta dish and I would order any of them again.  There was something about the chicken pasta dish that I REALLY enjoyed, a tangy garlic cream combo flavor and really tender chicken and mushrooms.  Their red beer is satisfying and for only a couple bucks for a 20oz mug you can definitely throw back a few with no damage to the wallet.  They also have a lot of frozen mixed drinks that looked good but I cant comment on them as I mainly stick to beer when I have a drink. Enjoy!

xmMWLgY35u67Xwp-kqWH8A.text: What a treat. During my one day stay in Vegas for business and personal, my sister and her hubby took me here after they picked me up at the airport. With the name, I was quick to be like EGH...boy was I wrong. This just proves the saying, "Don't knock it, till you try it". For appetizers, we ordered the Coconut Shrimp and Tostones with Chicken. OMG, both were absolutely perfect, especially the Coconut Shrimp. Its considered one of their house specialties. As for my main order, I had the Chicken Santiago. YUMMY !!!!!!!!! The red roasted pepper sauce sealed the deal. I know this place is a bit off the strip but Yelpers if ever your in Vegas and need a break from the endless buffets, stop by this place, if you lost or possibly won in Vegas, at least you could go home full and satisfied.

8LbtYiavABDhhvatykRG4g.text: i havent had bahama breeze in like 6 years, but my fiances cousin had her wedding reception there and their food was definetly better than the last time i had it. the DRINKS too. delicious!!! I had a jerk chciken pasta which was bomb i also had a strawberry margarita and a flight but cant remebr the names of the drinks, but they all were good and there was no holding back on the alcohol. the waiters and waitresses that served us were really polite and attending so thank you all for a good time and good food.

o-VOSMWHRG8UUC_h8ESrvg.text: Love love & love! Welcome to the Bahama Breeze where you are transported to an island and served cocktails out of pineapples. The building is beautiful. Quick tip If it's a beautiful day outside ask to sit on the patio! My server I forget her name but she's the lady with the braids wrapped up, I love her! I have had her as my server about three times and she really is the sweetest thing in the world. She makes this place feel even more cozy! This place also has a really good happy hour! If you're lucky you'll get to see live entertainment! I always get the tacos, fish or coconut shrimp. Get the firecracker shrimp ! Don't get me started on the drinks. I love the Bahama mama, the pain killer and the ultimate pineapple! You will feel like you're not even in Las Vegas but instead a tropical get away. Definitely head here if you're in the area!

Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coco shrimp tacos with fruit salad for side ! Yummmm

e2iY5fmgakQs_lNd8jhPCQ.text: Dionne took care of us. She was very nice. Kia was pretty dismissive of us and an issue we brought to her attention.   The Breeze cheese bites were nice and light, not oily. Loved the creamy (not spicy) dip. "It's like a cheesy donut"  Wife tried lobster Mac and cheese.  She removed breading? But otherwise thought it was a good dish.   The Bahamarita virgin was refreshing.   The key lime pie was super!  A nice merengue crust   The seafood chowder was way too spicy for us (we are wimpy about spice). I definitely tasted Cajun spice. The manager took it off our bill no problem.   Our friend loved the mojito and said best in her life. She also liked Vieja Ropa sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breeze Cheese bites

Um9eDNdt6WmcZ5hwuWW4Wg.text: I made a reservation about 10 days ahead for my mother's birthday dinner. I specifically asked for a table not far from the entrance so my elderly mother doesn't have to walk far. I arrived at the restaurant 15 minutes early but they would not seat me until half the party was there. We ended up on the "porch "which was not too far of a walk but it was freezing in there. I asked one of the hostesses if she could improve the temperature, she did not respond to me directly but just spoke into her radio. The conditions never improved and everyone at the table was freezing. LJ was our server, he was pleasant albeit a little slow. Perhaps it was busy in the other part of the restaurant but it did not appear so from where we were sitting. My son is a vegetarian and ordered the jackfruit tacos - they were inedible so he sent them back in exchange for a salad. My brother-in-law ordered the grilled chicken, he indicated the chicken was rubbery and tasted frozen. I had the skirt steak which was slightly dry but otherwise tasty provided you have the chimichurri sauce which I asked for twice. The other dishes were just OK and we did not elect to stay for dessert. Maybe it was an off night, I'm not sure.  a manager never even came by the table to talk about the food that was returned. Will not be returning to this chainy sub par food and service joint.

nHMLfdn6OE5PQ07_MrYnlw.text: My favorite place to eat and drink .Been there a few time and never had a bad experience bar tenders and waiters are very friendly.and the drinks are amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite place! Always gr eat service ,food and drinks

_u6SxFnRASRDakQyzfS1Ew.text: It's so lovely here!!!! The inside is beautiful. Came here for the first time with a friend on Cinco De Mayo and I will say it felt very tropical here. We got there during happy hour so all appetizers were half off and the regular margaritas were $5. Everything was delicious. We ordered the nachos and the jerk chicken wings. Everything was enjoyable and had much flavor.  The bad news was as we were paying for our check, the couple in the booth behind us frantically got up stating there was a huge flying roach on the window seal. I didn't stay long enough to see it. My friend and I both got up and paid our check in the front of the restaurant.

pfLMt6LYUPaMpLFbgspdWA.text: Food was good. I ordered the Cuban with the fruit and mango sorbet...the fruits and sorbet were amazing! My husband had the jerk chicken and the white rice and black beans were delicious. The empanadas were very tasty. So were the onion rings on the sampler (I'm allergic to shellfish, so I really couldn't eat anything else, but my husband loved the conch fritters). Great customer service.

KoCipVgKpiZvPFxMfZPAIA.text: I love be the patio here!! Great service, very polite and attentive. They have a Jamaican hot sauce to die for and a great happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinco de Mayo at Bahama Breeze with $5 classic margaritas and one of my favorite hot sauces

FtXkQ2Wd-i_uEmL66Hcmqg.text: A return to Vegas is not complete without a visit to Bahama Breeze, one of our all time favorite restaurants along with Lee's Roadside Grill in St. Maarten in the Caribbean. Last night we had: Jamaican Jerk Chicken marinated with authentic jerk seasonings and then roasted, served with yellow rice, black beans and ripe plantations. Chipotle Beef Bowl Seafood Paella With sauteed scallops, shrimp, fish, mussels, chicken and chorizo sausage with yellow rice. Add live music and its a fantastic atmosphere and dinner. m.bahamabreeze.com/locat... leesfish.com/index.html

KRrsYAeZTaKRHt_9NqlXyQ.text: For a Bahamian off strip restaurant we had a great lunch at Bahamas breeze .   Service : Service was attentive and good .   Food: we had a bunch of plates for two people. We started with the tostones which were great but very filling . We also tried the seafood chowder which was very good but very creamy . I had the shrimp and cheesy grist which were good and loaded with calories . We also added plantains and a side of beans .   Drinks : drinks were amazing and one of the reason we will be back . We had the coconut mojito which was amazing and also a margarita which was pretty standard .   Overall experience : The patio is a great place for a lunch and is enclosed to keep out the heat of the desert . We will definitely be back for a lunch in the future .

LD0srVQmVQ02FoPzSr1FiA.text: Came in here with the wifey on a Tuesday around 7pm randomly because one of our favorite Italian restaurants was closed on Tuesdays, and I personally was taken away by how great our experience - both service and food - was.  This place was made both inside and out to be as if you were somewhere in the Caribbean, and it definitely reminded me of how it'd be like. The folks dining there even looked the part with most even wearing 'island tiki' type of tops and dresses.  I was also surprised by how decent the menu pricing was with majority of the dinner menu around $18-23/25 and that's with steak/seafood items!  Our server was also a nice and attentive man, with whom I forgot the name of (sorry!).  We both really enjoyed the ambiance of the restaurant, slightly dimmed with a mini waterfall running upon entering the restaurant that you hear along with Caribbean pop-type of music.  And the entree portions were good enough to get us full but not TOO full. We'd definitely be back to try some of their l drinks from their extensive drink menu next time!   Thanks Bahama Breeze (You made the experience way better than my prom experience couple years ago lol).

CpAVs1nvQ-h0w2F7ETj-VQ.text: After leaving Fremont we decided to grab a drink. My friend had previously tried out Bahama Breeze so we headed in that direction. We ordered: Bahamarita, Virgin Margarita,  and Ultimate Pina Colada.  We also ordered: Firecracker shrimp, Jerk chicken wings, Lobster shrimp quesadilla , and Beef empanadas.   The Food was ehhh. We did not care for the empanadas. The lobster and shrimp quesadilla was the real winner. The firecracker shrimp and jerk chicken wings were just ok.  The Drinks were better than the food. The drinks had a light alcohol taste. Service was fast and we never had to look for the server. He was always prompt with refills and checking on us.   Not impressed overall with the food. Great thing is everything we ordered was on the happy hour menu so half off.

uvbvsae_tRWCM1Qbf9bHTw.text: Love thier empanadas and the best best best paella ever  I only come about once a year  But the paella is good

I've never tried the Carribean food, but I really loved chicken past which I ordered. Also, hibiscus margarita was amazing! The server was very nice and polite. I'd love to go back again next time.

qRx9FZw4Y6Rj6d1i0iXJeQ.text: I like their happy hours. I've been there twice recently and I liked their service and food(even we ordered from Happy hour menu..it was very good). I wish they're close to where I live..I would go there more often. Our table server was J.D(usually I don't really remember names but ). He was very friendly and nice. We got our food pretty quick and he took care of everything so quick even they seem so busy. I would definitely recommend this place! Good place for big group.

9DGfxEs-QtaGNn0vRTcyGg.text: My first trip to Vegas for business. Stopped by with coworkers and got to meet server Derrick. Hes awesome!! Come by and see him! We're like family now!! #RollTide

b6nbx8oE7C6xX3KZ7QbBxQ.text: My bestie & I had passed by a few times as it was near our hotel. I was looking here on YELP for good places, and this was in the top searches. We saw they had fried lobster tails, so at that moment our minds were made on where to have dinner. I ordered the jerk chicken pasta but sent it back because it was too lemony. I hate to be that person who sends back food, but I couldn't get through the dish. They were very understanding about it and let me switch it with no problem. The food was great, service was great, and prices were reasonable. I highly recommend going!

e5MTllutyF-_npqOzimVPg.text: Great Happy Hour!  We visited during Reggae Fest and it was a blast.  We came back again.. sat at the bar.. asked for the Happy Hour menu and proceeded to order.  It wasn't until we received our bill that the bartender told us there wasn't any Happy Hour.  That was SO NOT awesome.  Aside from that hiccup..  I really like this spot.

GDOT3jjWekeilkn7FPckdg.text: I love this place! The food and cocktails are awesome.... Table service is better than bar service

NONwU-5h6Kjj9S3K1RBFEA.text: I have never been to a Bahama Breeze before this and I was in a 3 hour layover in Vegas.   I enjoyed the atmosphere at this location, it was a huge restaurant with a large menu selections. The ambiance with the island feel was really cool to see. The menu also had island dishes that I never heard of before but I loved everything I ordered.   The ice cream served in the coconut bowl was also tasty and had great presentation. It was easy to make dessert and menu selections because out waitress was very knowledgeable and had great advice to give :)  Loved this place!

NE5IPb1MglPu_GF1ehbEZg.text: This place takes me back to 90's South Beach... the bar is prob my favorite spot in this whole establishment. Great customer service by the day time bartenders... food tastes great, just wish the servings were a bit bigger.   Lunch hour is prob my favorite time to come there...

YhrRH-wBFGZ1nQeiDicd0Q.text: This place was exactly what I was looking for while I was in Vegas. I had just checked in for my marathon (it started at MIDNIGHT), so I was a little thrown about how to do my calorie intake ahead of time since I'm so used to my breakfast routine with marathons! This place was across the street from the hotel and had good reviews, so I gave it a go.   They have inside and sort of sunroom seating, which was a little toasty, but there was live music going on while I ate which was kind of nice. Even with the marathon, I decided to try one of their cocktails and it was delicious! Though I usually wouldn't like this, it was a plus that it wasn't super boozy. Their menu is very extensive and honestly a work of art. They have tons of pictures with all of the items so you know what to expect. I ended up getting salmon with sweet potatoes and veggies (great pre-marathon mix), and the portions were huge! Definitely more than enough food. This place was exactly what I needed food-wise. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is because the service was not great. To begin it was fine, but once I started eating and said I wasn't going to be ordering any more drinks, I didn't see my waiter again for almost 40 minutes (seriously). I was reading a book, so it wasn't a huge deal, but I was done with my meal a full twenty minutes before he brought the check, and I was in a bit of a hurry at that point.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

njMqGDEPCIUe_ByTw5hhFg.text: I was really surprised by this place. It's designed to feel like you are on an island. There is an indoor and patio seating where there was live music (the patio seating is still indoor but it is created with an outdoor, beach-y setting). I went around 7pm for dinner  and we had the Rum Week special drinks--drinks were $2-6 during this time. I tried the bahama mama and painkiller, both tasted like coconut. Painkiller was creamy.  I would recommend this place for Happy Hour. The appetizers (around $5) and some drinks were half off. Thursday-Sunday 9pm to close and Monday to Wednesday 4-6pm.  I enjoyed the food and someone was often checking on us. I tried the tequila burnt salmon. I didn't really taste the tequila but the mango salsa truly made the meal. Sweet potatoes was delicious and green beans were cooked just right.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tequila Sunburn Glazed Salmon*
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Painkiller , British Virgin Islands
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tequila ila Sunburn Glazed Salmon* and Jerk Chicken Pasta

mQuCJRrvP85gPCCqNBSXhg.text: Bar gets five stars Bob is the best bartender ever. We had a large party of 12 so there was a small wait. The atmosphere was good very island vibe and cozy. Our server Brandon was great he was very attentive and professional. He had excellent customer service skills and with a large party he never missed a beat.   So the four star came from the food. The fish tacos and  calamari  were just so so. Wouldn't order them again. The jerk shrimp was very tasty as that was the favorite at the table. I had a tropical fruit salad, no meat just fruit lettuce and a very tasty vinaigrette and that was also very tasty. The jerk wings on the small plate menu was bigger than a small plate. They were four jumbo sized jerk wings cooked crispy with jerk sauce and those were really tasty. So Overall five stars on service (thanks Brandon and Bob) and four stars for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

crdl0NjecXyv3kAWgnnK0g.text: Menu change & difficult server.  No more Jack Fruit, Entree Chicken Caesar, out of corn tacos for the fish tacos, a few other changes as well.  Roger, our server, was unhappy from the moment he took our order so I apologize if he was having a bad night before us.  Asked him to please split the four checks early on as a courtesy, before we ordered our drinks, instead of at the end.  He had attitude & said he will see what the manager says?    Asked for no bell peppers or onions in the quesadillas, he said it's already mixed in.  I said ok how about the Veggies & Coconut Rice, no bell peppers.  He says they can't do that either... I asked him to please ask the chef.  He said he knows he can't but will ask.  Instead he has the manager, Moma come over?  She said I heard you have some questions.  I said we'd like the checks split, we have four coupons for $10 & no bell peppers in the Vegan Entree.  She said no problem to that... I said Roger should have said that instead of telling me no, he should've said 'let me ask the chef' or something instead of no & send the manager over.    We ordered a few items & tasted is variety.  The Skirt Chimichurri was dry & horrid.  The Rios Vistones something or the other was plantain cups stuffed w/ beef.  It was hard as a rock.  I had to use the steak knife to cut it.  The Veggies over coconut rice was a soup.  I said I'll need a soup spoon please Roger, he said it's not soup it's veggies w/ sauce over rice like a Asian dish not a Caribbean dish.  I was shocked cause it was served in a soup bowl.  My friend ate it instead.  It was Soup.  I ordered the Coconut Shrimp Tacos w/ Flour tacos of course since they were out of corn.  It was good, along with The Cobb Salad, only good items.  Would have sent the other three back if it wasn't for the fact that the dining experience was already difficult.    Overall, horrible dining experience, stomach ache afterwards & glad we used up our coupons as we won't be coming back for awhile.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita Flight reminder for next time!  Mmm!
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mom&#39;s Apple Bacon Cheddar Burger was delish!  Cooked perfecto!
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love this Avocado Real Crabmeat Salad!

d1UDwoUcSSPYpyHoTyIdxQ.text: The restaurant itself is really nice. It's huge with plenty of seating and this location is an excellent choice for large groups. They also had live music which was great.  My group of three was seated right away with no problems. The service was really good. All of the staff was very helpful and courteous.   We ordered the Braised Oxtail, the Chipotle Chicken Salad and the Tequila Sunburn Glazed Salmon. The salad was good but that's pretty hard to mess up. The Oxtail was just OK in my opinion. I had the salmon and I really didn't like it very much. It was very dry and over cooked.   The highlight of the dinner was actually the dessert. We had the Coconut Grande which was coconut cake and ice cream served in a coconut shell. This alone was worth going for. It was so delicious!!!  I would come back if I was in the area but I wouldn't get the salmon again. I'd try a more traditional dish.

0LhTIL4N6TGRRVPYvPgNSg.text: They have this restaurant in Seattle which is where i first tried it and I enjoyed it so I decided to try it here in Vegas. I've actually been to the one in Vegas a couple times but that was months ago. I went in today during lunch time and was seated quickly.   Today, I ordered the seafood paella because I've been eating way too much red meat and needed to switch it up. It is a pretty good amount of food so if you aren't too hungry you'll definitely be taking home leftovers. The rice was very flavorful so we were off to a good start. The shrimp and scallops were good as well however, the mussels, chicken and sausage were all dry and the fish didn't have much flavor. So I was definitely a bit disappointed.   My service was amazing and the waiter was very attentive. Refilled my drinks and brought me a box without me even needing to ask. He also gave me a soda to go without me asking which was great. I am going to give this place 4 stars because the other times I have been to this location my food was really good (I'll attach a pic from my last visit) & the service was also great those times as well. Next time I visit will either solidify the 4 stars or bring it down but we will have to wait until next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Paella
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caribbean - Style Lobster Mac &amp; Cheese

AL3aUy4YnxXKpQRTCLlUlQ.text: The atmosphere is suitable for all types. There is a section where those coming from the strip in hardly any attire can sit and enjoy themselves and plenty of space for those more conservatively dressed.   We had an appetizer that was amazing. The beef empanadas were really good. I had seafood soup and Cesar salad. My friend had the fried chicken breast. Everything was good. My friend wants to go back and get fried chicken for the ride home.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cesar salad with dressing on the side.
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood chowder
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken wings and fritters

_H0yfAa0hYzoEndMLJYTSA.text: I am pretty open to tasting many types of food at least once. You would also think since I tried this place, which I found in Florida when I took a trip down there, the food would be the same. However, this was not the case.   The original Bahama Breeze started in Central Florida (Orlando), which caters mostly to Caribbean food. So I decided randomly one night, when staying out in Florida to give the place a try. Also, why not, it was also my first time eating Caribbean food ever in my life. After tasting the food out in Florida, Caribbean food became my top favorites.  Fast forward to now living out in Vegas, we decided to try it finally after over a year. My fiance was also beyond happy as well since he's never tried Caribbean food ever. We came in the middle of the afternoon, place is located off of the strip, but in reach of those staying at the Hard Rock hotel. Located directly in Hughes Center. We walked in, place was pretty empty. We were seated right away, but the table appeared to be sticky and gross feeling, so we had our waiter wipe down the table again.   Since I have not been back to this establishment in awhile, we decided to get something that we thought would be on point. We both decided to order the classic platter. This had Jamaican Jerk Chicken, pork, plantains, pulled pork, collard greens, rice, beans, and empanadas. Awesome at first. Then not in 15 minutes in, we got our orders to eat. I thought this was kind of usual, because it was already made to order, it would take at least double the time with the amount ordered. We were starving, so we dug in.   Chicken was okay, was not as juicy or fall off the bone, nor was it like the Jamaican Jerk seasoning that I tasted back in Florida. Pork was greasy and tasted old as well as the collard greens. I ate about half of it and knowing my fiance, he wanted to take the rest home and not waste it. The entire drive home, I felt sick and bloated. A couple of hours later I started having major cramping to the point where I was using the heating pad. I thought it was a stomach ache and took something for my stomach. However, that did not work either as I did get to sleep the entire night. My fiance, then also decided to eat the rest and ended being sick to the point where he vomited the rest of the next day.   Never ever again, will we be returning as this is by far the worse case scenario of food poisoning to even get. Let alone the first place, where both of us almost ended up in the ER. Looks can be deceiving as well as the taste. So make sure that you check the establishment is clean and not contaminated. It may have been that one time, but will definitely not step foot in here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Both platters
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Welcome to Bahama Breeze

lBXn_hg2JkEjLBqiuzcJqA.text: This is my second time at this restaurant and both times the experience has been great!  We came this time with my mom and our cousins from AZ. Mom and I ordered the Ropa Vieja tostones. The beans were not very warm so I asked our waitress and she brought me back a new plate with nice hot black beans. My dish took about 5 minutes to get back to the table so I was able to enjoy my meal with the rest of the group. The meat was so tasty, loved the beans and the rice. The only negative on my dish were the tostones. I was expecting them to be made out of plantain but they tasted like corn. Other than that the meal was delicious! My husband had the coconut shrimp and our cousins had the mahi mahi dish which based on their expressions and comments they loved, too!!!  The restaurant is large, they play caribbean music, service is great, bathrooms are very clean. Nice place if you want to take a break from the huzzle and buzzle of the strip. I definitely reco

a6ECegP_pcK1gsembCx8fg.text: Food was good, customer service was excellent, drinks not so good...but over very nice place.

_gv4qqDrcU1IbOz-FW5lOQ.text: We got an awesome waiter! He was so knowledgeable and helpful and we were never wondering where he went. The food came out quick and the drinks were very good. However, the food was not very good. It was our first time here so we wanted to get appetizers to try everything. So we got the chorizo meatballs, fried calamari, spinach dip, and the empanadas. Now when we were first sat down we were told they were a branch of Olive Garden so we weren't expecting fresh food. But the food was not very good. Maybe it was just what we ordered but the only dish that we thought was half decent was the empanadas. The chorizo meatballs tasted like ground beef in an odd BBQ sauce. The spinach dip had 3 full artichokes in it like it wasn't cut up enough. And the calamari was very chewy. We were impressed with the service and drinks but the food we ordered was nothing impressive.

gDPL2HzpRw4DGoWYs_HZyw.text: Everlene (I think that's her name) was our waitress, and she was the best waitress we had during our entire trip. She didn't make too much small talk but she gave us a run down of the menu and how it was structured. I don't really care for the tutorial of what's on what page of the menu but I just thought it was nice she actually cared about her job.  The food was pretty good. I really don't have anything memorable to say about it, so it was neither fantastic or awful. We arrived during lunch and had an unusually long layover in Vegas. This was one of the closest places to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ewSEYt7dEhgfRhZkM3uDZw.text: Came in last night with a bunch of girlfriends for a late night happy hour. The host at the front was the coolest and have a wonderful smile. It was my first time going so the decor shocked me. It was just like a beach bungalow so pretty. They can accommodate large and small groups. We were seated towards the front on the right right side at a large round table. The waiter was from Oregon and had pink hair that we all loved. It's cool people get to have personalities there. It's very diverse and inclusive. We ordered a few drinks off happy hour that were strong! Good but strong. They have half off appetitizers that are large portions. The food was amazing! I could have stayed longer if we didn't have work the next day. Overall, I'll be back!

fYWu2F9PA-Re23JEK9QROg.text: This is one of my favorite go to restaurants when you don't want to deal with long waits or Las Vegas traffic. It's off Flamingo and Paradise behind the strip. The food is always amazing, I tend to get the same thing every time, the Lemon Grass Mahi Mahi and Shrimp with rice.  Our server was Kahla, AMAZING service! Please ask for her if you can. She kept us laughing, kept our glasses full at all times. We went twice in three days with a large party and the second time we asked for Kahla. The second time with out even asking she remembered our drink orders and brought it to us immediately! Now that is service. Oh wait did I mention her great smile? Best service I have received here. But then again it's always been good.   I recommend it strongly if you want good food at a good price!

S0us0ZtVm_N2A63gDnF0rw.text: I'm giving this a 3, because our waiter was eh. Besides that, my friends and I went last night for happy hour. I ordered the Lobster and Shrimp quesadillas. Yummy!  To drink, I got the Ultimate pina coloda and the Pineapple-coconut martini. Both good! Will order again. I also got a side of fries and the kids mango sorbet dessert. This place has an excellent happy hour menu, plenty of food and drink to choose from! I will be back!

xaCfly6wIhQWhcDn7KvH4Q.text: Coconut Shrimp Tacos- highly recommended! Refreshing, crispy, tasty, salsa goes well together, great portion size  Buttermilk Chicken Jibaritos- would not recommend! This order looks delicious in photographs but the chicken is over cooked and dry, tasteless. Chicken is sandwiched between two plantains which are also very dry, and difficult to chew. Comes with a side of sauce to add taste but does not do justice.  Banana Nut Bread Supreme- delicious!!! Not too sweet, bread is moist and goes perfect with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream with is included. Perfect end to a meal :)  Great for family gatherings!

bLMwu0BtaAoJhWT_7sMaKw.text: This place is so cool. I love the atmosphere, the water feature inside breaks up the noice and adds a cool feel to the room. I almost feel like if I was in a mini version of pirates of the Caribbean with out the pirates. The Service was top notch all around me.  The tables were being bussed quickly and my servicer was super attentive. The food was awesome. I had the ahi tuna salad and it was huge!!  Not with just lettuce but it had lots of tuna which was perfectly cooked and had a delicious seasoning on  it.  My daughter had grilled salmon which looked good but the surprise was her mashed potatoes. They were real  potatoes with some of the skin left on it.  I have to say their mashed potatoes are one of the best in Las Vegas. So creamy and with the perfect consistency.  I can't wait to come back and try the rest of their menu.

SzOMY6USpShbd4ZCGkI31w.text: Great afternoon with the rum flight. Tina was amazing and made our lunch even better.  Thanks for the awesome service! We will be back to see you.

JrKWssuLjZznnaak0g3llw.text: #JerkWings..#HappyHour..Great food and service was on point as well..Must stop by if you are staying in the area.

-znk4NHJrwrkVbawpjgnww.text: Service was great, food was great and not very expensive, atmosphere was very nice. The only downside was the drinks were a little pricey which considering its Vegas, probably very common. We came on a Friday night at 630pm and had no wait. Definitely worth coming

tkeOAUXg8FA34Xt-sfSqDg.text: I was there yesterday for mothers birthday had such a great time minus some waiting but we caught happy hour was amazing Steven was awesome thanks for your services!!,

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uChRWsMnOmIaQBkUjeavSQ.text: Ten minutes into my farewell to sobriety(I had been on the wagon since 2004, but exigent circumstances had bent my arm), I was approached by a fellow pilgrim who asked me if he could help me hold up the bar. "Indeed, sir, I can use all  the help I can get." It was a sound decision and my new friend acquitted himself well. Our conversation was the faire you might hear in the watering holes frequented by other raconteurs like Oscar or Tark or Stephen Colbert(bring it on Colbert, I know  a lot of big words too.) But don't let my account give you the impression that the Breeze is a toilet populated by drunks boring the rest of the drunks with stories they've told too many times. The Breeze is an island with all of the amenities you would find in a tropical locale. Stout, jerk chicken, dirty rice, cuba libre, huachinango veracruzana, and conch fritters are all spoken here. When's the last time you had a bowl of Paella Valenciana? Never? Well we got it here, mon. They've also got the Cajun equivalent, jambalaya.  The Breeze is online and you can check  the menu out anytime you want to. They have take out too. My new found friend and I had a great time and you will too. Check it out.

xp_DqfGswiqH8M8jhTxVqQ.text: So we usually enjoy the drinks here, but rarely eat there.   The food was decent, BUT the Tuna Poke (or something similar) that I ordered had gone bad.  The waitress was really cool about it and I just got a different appetizer, but I could have gotten really sick.   Everything else has always been good.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna stack

eOojzcGsoDRcYWInBmX0zg.text: great happy hours!! Firecracker shrimps, spinach dip, sesame crusted ahi...soooo delicious! Drinks are amazing deal and prices are so cheap. But more than anything, the staffs working there are the most friendly people working at happy hour. Just super nice, fast services. My boyfriend and I love the place. We definitely recommend this restaurant!! If u r tourists and staying on the Strip. It's rally worth to come here rather than going to overpriced bars on the Strip with snobby servers.

A_po89KuGSD-HjCb8WzwuQ.text: Okay, I came back again to give this place a second chance and since I'm staying in a hotel across the parking lot for two weeks.  Plus all the other restaurants nearby were pretty crowded.  This time I sat at the bar, thinking I would actually get served this time.  And I did.  It was okay.  The food was alright and the happy hour prices I lucked into were awesome.  However, I was forced to sit on the side of the bar nearest the kitchen giving me great insight to this place and after sitting here for an hour I just can't help, but feel like I'm on the set of "Waiting" the movie.

_19bD0v1b8TqZ57WdTthTA.text: Management sucks! Manager placed me on hold for over 15 minutes. Never ever going here and I will never recommend it.  2 thumbs DOWN!

8D19juFpVjU4E8Sv4txtEA.text: Decided to try it because it was within walking distance of our hotel. Started out strange with the host commenting that we were different because my wife and I sat together in a booth instead of across from each other. Didn't get much better from there, server had to be asked several times for the beer that had been ordered, two rounds, two sets of excuses why we had to remind her. We were in a booth near the POS and got to listen to the disgruntled servers the whole time we were there. The food didn't make the experience any better, lacked flavor and seasoning. Would be hard pressed to recommend it based on this experience.

FxK_us09-F_DYhcrNL5Jnw.text: Worst service ever. Came here with a group of 8 people from work. Came in the girl (blonde hair) said it was happy hour then charged us for our drinks and said "did he tell you that?" She must have been training but she was the one who said it. Then she didn't offer to fix anything and continued to have a dirty look on her face the rest of the time. Thanks. Never coming here again!

za98Ne7aGLlFGutnwUtc_A.text: This place rocks! The service is fast, the food is delicious ~ try the jerk wings :) The drinks are tasty.. we have never had bad service or meal coming here. The atmosphere is awesome!

t9ZAdCjAIjtnXfSSgA971g.text: From the moment I walked in and was greeted by Tiffany I knew this would be one of those "memorable moments"! Tiffany was awesome! Very professional and willing to address all my questions considering this was my first time. Once my guest and I were seated at the table our waitress Anita blew me away with her PHENOMENAL customer service! She was so knowledgeable about the drink menu, the appetizers, and the background of the different foods that I literally felt as if I were in the Bahamas and completely forgot I was in Las Vegas. After ordering our drinks and food came out quickly and everything was DELICIOUS! What truly made my experience amazing was Anita! She was fun, personable, and really demonstrated the epitome of what I consider a phenomenal customer service experience! Because of her service this will now be my go-to drinks & appetizers choice when scheduling my weekly hangouts with friends and coworkers. And yes, I will be requesting Anita every time! I was so impressed with Anita's service that I literally chased the manager Sean down just to rave about Anita. To my surprise, considering he was busy, my interrupting him didn't phase him one bit. He was very professional and equally as enthusiastic about Anita as I was! He genuinely thanked my guest and I for visiting and guess what else....genuinely invited us to come back and visit again! I can't say enough great things about this place!!!!! Thanks Tiffany, Anita, and Sean.

tdiC9nO44PETLqBigbfOow.text: Most of the time, this place rocks!  The happy hour specials work!  The Bahamarita is, by itself, a reason to come here.  One recommendation that is a have to if you like this place: sign up to get their emails.  Once or twice a year, they have free parties.  You can RSVP for up to five people.  They serve free food and drink.  The last one, they only gave you one free drink (in the past it was unlimited).  BUT I won a gift card to come back and dine. For regular dinning, the coconut shrimp or the seafood paella.  Yum!

jiER27CwjbSHu9FQy-FOZQ.text: Such a great place for happy hour. Ask for Taylor, she was the best! Jamaican chicken and firecracker shrimp

bnlAYLp5SlDX0p6mlfiJiA.text: This place reminded me of Yard House.  Similar food items.  We had the wings, beef empanadas, shrimp quesadilla, and the ahi.  The ahi was the most tasty thing.

IOT0H0P5BO0FrVDzIlfYKw.text: I don't want to admit this...but I am actually addicted to this place. In particular it's the coconut shrimp and the chicken empanadas. I guess I am ashamed because I know this is a chain and there is a great Jamaican restaurant in town which serves much more authentic food,but I am also a New englander who loves red lobster, so what can I say.Maybe it's cuz it's own by Darden. I'll figure it out later.  When I come here it reminds me of my trip to Barbados. I love the atmosphere, music,it's so much fun. I forget for a little while I am in a desert. The food is always on point.

o6WFKqWwtI8x_eGGisNoJw.text: Good food, good service, nice decor... I'm having trouble thinking of any bad things to say about this place.  Located off the strip near the Hard Rock Hotel, Bahama Breeze was a delightful place from beginning to end.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  I ordered the Seafood Paella without the sausage, which our server said could be done.  One of the chefs came out a few moments later and said that the paella was made with the sausage in it and that they would be picking it out, which was fine with me so long as there wasn't any sausage actually on my plate.  I really appreciate this gesture because I know that not a lot of vegetarians would be cool with that.  When it came, I devoured it, which wasn't easy because it was a big plate of food.  My wife had the Fresh Pan-Seared Salmon Pasta, which was also amazing!  We had a couple of their specialty mixed drinks, which are not on the on-line menu so I don't recall the names.  But they were also very tasty.  Seems to me like most of the good food in Vegas is off the strip, and this would be a perfect example.    We shall return!

_Qnw3_iIPF_7oT6j7lr70A.text: I've been here a few times.  It's a convenient place for lunch.  I think what this place does well is drinks, desserts, and service.  The mojitos tend to be a little sweet for me but they get the job done.  The banana bread dessert was amazing the last time I had it, as was the pineapple upside down cake.  And the servers have always been fun and friendly.  Oh, and free wi-fi.  Gotta love that!  The entrees need some work though.  They all tend to be really greasy.  I did not see one pasta without cream sauce, except on the kids menu.  You can make some ok food here if you are creative, but it'll take you about 5 minutes to order with all the special requests.  My favorite is probably the chicken kabob with steamed broccoli instead of rice.  Yes, even the rice was too greasy for me.  But the servers have always been willing to put in special requests and get the meal just the way I want it.  The problem is that it has taken a lot of experimentation to get there.  They used to have a lemongrass chicken sandwich that was decent but they took it off the menu. Oh well, I can always just stick to a liquid diet.  :)

vhoU_34_XIFi6G7CcQd4QQ.text: I am staying at the Residence Inn right behind this establishment.  My roommate and I were hungry but did not want to venture off too far.  We went here and were blown away.  Not only was the service great, thanks to Luis and Jason behind the bar, but the food was AMAZING!  We got there at exactly 9 p.m. and that is when they begin their happy hour.  I had the jumbo crab lump and shrimp tacos, followed by a mojito.  The next evening, I returned.  I had three of their Aruba Red beer and that was delicious.  To eat, I had the jumbo lump crab and the empanadas.  I was not disappointed!  Great place, music, ambience...it has it all.

GYC2NFvUiqtR3M6f0Hi5qg.text: DELICIOUS BIKINI APPLE-TINI, fyi :)  I had the salmon pasta that came with bread. It was decent, not terrible. Hubby had and enjoyed the jerk chicken pasta. Hubby's grandma had the seafood chowder and loved it. We all shared the key-lime pie (which was my first time having it) and it, too, like the apple-tini was DIVINE!  If I'm ever back in Vegas (we came here right after we landed in Vegas), will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Key lime pie!

6hp-ZjUV-G5engAVNKBQtQ.text: Very nice place. very delicious food. but no traditional cuisine. This is a common food for Americans. Fried shrimp...., it's too simple American menu. the Cuban menu or the Caribbean. This kitchen has a different meal choices. But if you're not a gourmet Caribbean cuisine. This restaurant quite a come down.

0bH3tsJyhiGTq_KZbl6FfA.text: We started with Cuban Bread and of course it was so delicious and my favorite app of all time. I am trying to transition into some non vegan foods and this was a fair start. It was a great decision. Next I had the curry rice but asked for veggies it has a chicken broth base but was told to me so I tried it and although I wish it had some coconut milk instead it was filling and huge and the chef and waiter were super accommodating for me! Last my whole family share everything thy had the ribs were a huge hit and the fish both salmon and tilapia were cooled perfect. Every plate was empty but mine and that is coming back to my suite with me :)

8FTdyLWeuSpI3raf_EBMJA.text: We went there for a wedding rehearsal dinner. So from the top, it was a very large group. We were also very spread out.  The building was laid out nice with nice decorations. Our table was pretty good. The bench cushions were  a little low for some of the older people in the group but our waitress was really nice and accommodating.  For such a large group, she did amazing. She got the orders right and was very attentive.   I ordered the firecracker shrimp to start. It was so good. Seasoning was off the hook. Large serving for an appetizer. My beer was nice and cold also.    I then ordered the fish tacos. I have been a little spoiled living in California I suppose. The tacos were okay. Not enough pop and flavor for me. I was looking for that citrus pop of freshness but it wasn't there. The tortillas were a little chewy. Food alone would have gotten them a three, but when you throw in the awesome service, you can't beat it. The waitress made a fresh pot of coffee for us and the DJ gave my daughter  a Bahama breeze pen.  Everyone loved their food and there were no complaints. Decent price for what you get.  I would go back easily.

vy2x6CjNcdrH6_etbBc1iw.text: Food was good. Hospitality and service was great. Got a table right away. Food tasted great. Great food variety. I just feel like I have to go there a few more times to try different foods.

r9lzEEUOvJIVjPylE5SptA.text: I had dinner at a Bahama Breeze years ago in Orlando Florida- great experience and good food.  So while visiting LV, I learned there was a location there and had to go! HUGE mistake! It started with a very nice waitress who came to my table... it started like this,   'Today's specials are A, B, C, and D. We are out of A and B, and if you want C, we no longer have chorizo that goes in it but we can substitute it for something else.'  Um what??!   So we asked her for her suggestions and her 'most recommended' items were the Lobster Linguine and the Key West Shrimp and Grits. My husband and I ordered both dishes. Disgusting. You know what this reminded me of? It reminded me of something premade that comes in a bag and thrown in boiling water to heat up.  Really disappointed. We had just wasted money on food that tasted nasty and we were walking out hungry. Never, ever, again. Visited this location June 2014.

Tit-ipzKFoJ6AUNXf-_hBA.text: loved their chicken wings!!! coconut shrimp was yummy!  love the caribbean theme!--
