Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bahamarita.
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vJuje3wCEMBWUQCfFMBzCQ.text: I got a $50 gift card for my birthday and I haven't been to a Bahama Breeze in ages so I thought I would check this one out. Our server was very very friendly and attentive. Beef empanadas were freaking delicious. I ordered the spicy shrimp I guess it was more of an appetizer so I got a small side salad as well. Salad was very good best part was the croutons. I didn't get that much shrimp unfortunately. If you're looking for a fruity drink try the Bahamarita. Drinks were priced fairly. Dinner for two with a drink and appetizer was about $53.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bahamarita
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp and salad

kg67V9VT2WtvaXYCIL8MNQ.text: This was my first time here and I had a pretty good experience. Our server Randy was great. I ordered the Jamaican Jerk Chicken (a bit too salty though) and when I cut into it, it was still pink on the inside so he took it back and brought me a new plate, one that the chicken was fully cooked. While I was waiting for the new plate, he brought me a salad to snack on, on the house. Then when we finished eating and asked for the check, I realized he didn't charge me for my plate. Free dinner. Awesome!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican Jerk Chicken
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk Chicken Pasta

g0Kwz3LAbAaQGZqz3dxMWQ.text: I love Bahama Breeze. I've eaten at several in the U.S. and this one is just as great as the others. The tropical drinks put you in a real island state of mind. I love the Rum Runner on the rocks. Reminds me of laying on a beautiful beach in Florida! The jerk chicken is great. Just like the jerk chicken in the Caribbean that I've tasted. Also the empanadas are very good too. There are a lot of great dishes here from full plate steaks down to specialty tacos and of course wonderful burgers custom made! Save room for dessert. Rebecca's Key Lime Pie is homemade and tastes like you're in Key West! Such a good place to go when you're craving food from anywhere in the Caribbean islands.

gqLePOd8Ic1VNlaSJ7AiQw.text: I had a great time. I ordered the paella and it's delicious even though I know I make it great if not better at home. The beef empanadas was slightly greasy but still yummy. The shrimp and crab with the toasted bread was above mediocre. The coconut shrimp was amazing and so was their fried shrimp. The baby back ribs was falling off the bone tender and my 3 year old ate one after another. The jerk chicken taste way better than it looks. The nachos were a classic fave. I know you are reading this and must be like wow this girl eats a lot but FYI I'm pregnant so I have a big appetite. The singer played and sang me Happy Birthday and he sings great music. The waitresses were on point, friendly, and nice. The only thing that could've made this experience better was if my husband was there but I understand he had to work. Someone has to make money but I definitely would go here again and my sister loved it so much she wants to come here on her Birthday. Oh and last but not least the mango beach drink is to die for! Best drink I ever had(non alcoholic)

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Making a wish on the wishing well

6oVVWFxrkR7O9tBiTuSPGg.text: Had an unexpectedly delicious meal this evening, which hubby and I thoroughly enjoyed. I went for the Steak Oscar which came with the most amazing dressing/sauce. Our server, Alexis, was extremely friendly and accommodating and made our experience all the better. Great value for money. Can't wait to return for happy hour!

jcRLQAYAMbT7ZGhYTiOKWg.text: I find the food to be simply overrated. Service is okay. The table was sticky. This would be my first and last time to eat at this place.

iQtZcRvXA0287MK-vpxvvw.text: I am trying to like this place but twice I am asked to wait 15 minutes for a table when the restaurant isn't busy and there's no one waiting in front of me. After waiting they tried to sit me in the large dining area where no one was sitting. I traveling for work and dining alone so I think they are trying to force me to eat at the bar.   My first visit was mediocre. I ordered a beer which came to me in a bottle that a runner just dropped on the table and ran away. The beer was warm inside but the bottle was cold and the label was about ready to fall off. I guessed they tried to ice down  a room temperature beer. The waiter at least offered a glass for my beer.  I ordered the grilled chicken with cilantro cream. The chicken didn't have much taste since it seemed to be grilled then some bland glaze added on top. There was a bed of mash potatoes that was smothered in a  green 'cilantro' sauce which I liked but I'm a sucker for any thing smothered in gravy.   So overall I would go back here but I don't expect great good. It's is reasonably price but nothing special.  If you go during happy hour you can make out like a bandit with half price apps and drinks for dinner. Happy hour is 9pm to midnight.

vgsl_9Sg0HPPX-aS3Y61tA.text: Happy hour is m-f, 4-6. $3 cocktails. $4 specialty drinks. $5 appetizers.

mFYBcEIbZYpaZfpc97efwQ.text: Ahhhh their happy hour is amazing!!! My boyfriend and I usually go for the late night happy hour because it starts at 9pm Sun-Fri. The app specials are delicious and the drink specials are great. We're both able to get pretty drunk for under $50. I also love how the place looks. It has a very tropical theme!

s0YS8RYPCgrDyVYhnrYD1w.text: The staff is really polite (5 stars) and the food is OK (2 stars.) I went with 4 because food is more important. The drinks are good if you're looking for tropical stuff (duh.)

MxQadf30qRYZh3wcslxzYQ.text: I had a gift card for Bahama Breeze that I got on my birthday and I had forgotten until one day I drove by and decided it was the perfect time to use it. I was solo so decided to seat at the bar and blend in into the party ambiance, although not planned that way I landed there during happy hour which gave my gift card extra buying power. As I waited patiently at the bar a couple sat by me and were instantly acknowledged and asked if they wanted drinks, they ordered two mojitos and the bartender left to make them, when she came back with their drinks she asked them if they were ready to order, it was then that I realized I have the power of being invisible if no one is looking. I sort of interrupted and asked if I could have a drink and that I was ready to order, she took their order and then took mine giving me that "can't you wait for your turn? look" I ordered the paella which was very good although not authentic for it was made with long grain rice but the result was the same, a delicious zafron rice dish loaded with seafood! I also got the coconut shrimp with some kind of sweet n sour sauce that was equally delicious as the paella, there are also many more items on the menu that I would love to try like the Jamaican chicken or firecracker shrimp they both sounded good I just didn't have the belly space but I'm working on expanding. The setting is also very nice, the building is like a large plantation house very spacious with high ceilings and nice breezy caribbean atmosphere with indoor and outdoor sections.    The waitress returned to ask the people by my side if everything was ok, they asked her if she could take their picture and I took advantage of the opportunity and asked her for my check hoping not to interrupt a perfect customer waitress relation.  I'm definitely coming back..what else can I ask for? Awesome fun and clean environment, excellent delicious food and outstanding service...........for the couple sitting next to me!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood paella 17.9?

3nr4PhFC3Yh10KDuvHbyEg.text: Bahamas Breeze really is a local gem for Las Vegans. The ambiance is laid back and tropical. They even have a small water feature running the length of the Restaraunt. The staff are all polite and I have never had a bad experience here. In addition, the staff will do anything to make your visit enjoyable (including singing and dancing for my crying 3 year old).   The drinks here are reasonably priced for the size - they are quite large! And not to mention mixed very well. They taste like kool-aid and, according to my husband, are quite dangerous on the intoxication meter as you can drink and drink as of there were no alcohol - until you stand up from your seat.   Food: I personally love the jerk chicken pasta. The asparagus and mushrooms work very well with the spices of the chicken and the pasta sauce. The husband loves the chicken salad, and the burgers here are also very good. The portions are large, so a single entree is enough to share between 2 adults, which is nice.   I think Bahamas Breeze is one of the best restaurants in Vegas. Off the strip. Not too expensive. Good for families. And the food quality is high.

C6pdN7q_ACvlqXRzJZnaUw.text: This place is big and decorated beautifully. The ambiance is very settle with a Caribbean feel. Our waiter was friendly and made sure we were content. I ordered a Calypso Shrimp w. Bahamarita and they were delicious! The food portion was big. It was big enough to go home and eat some more! The prices are very reasonable (very cheap compared to NY prices). I recommend this place and will definitely go back whenever I go back to Vegas!

fG3do66i1yQEKYh2WTLtag.text: My party shows up, we tell the hostess we have a party of nine and after I said I didn't have a reservation she seemed like she didn't want to deal with me. Reluctantly she said the wait was fourty minutes. A few minutes later another member of my party showed up. After I said the weight was 40 minutes, she went to go ask again to double check. When she came back she said the hostess rolled her eyes and was sassy when she said the wait was still 40 minutes. They seated us in 40 minutes, I didn't mind the wait because we did have a big party but I thought the service was bad. I've been here several times before and I love the ropa vieja sandwich and any of their flavored lemonades. I ordered the ropa vieja sandwich again. It came out in a reasonable time, but it tasted awful. The bread tasted like it was old or like the sandwich was microwaved. Normally the meat is tender but this time it was tough and it almost hurt my jaw to chew it, and certain parts of the sandwich were cold. My raspberry lemon breeze tasted like it was powdery and way too sweet. Our waitress was nice but she didn't come back until it was time for dessert. We ordered a key lime pie. If you like eating straight up sugar, you'll love this dessert. The crust tastes like hardened brown sugar, it melts in your mouth. Which I would like, but it was way too sweet.  Needless to say, I'm not sure I will come back to Bahama Breeze. Or at least not with a group or when it's busy. But I'm not sure if I want to pay for rude service and bad food with decent dessert and drinks.

qsEPqCv2yJ9-13Bhc8hwyw.text: Great place to go for happy hour, apps, drinks and beer are cheap, they got some great food too and I love this place, they have a few sides for a patio with palm trees all around to give you the island feel lol

WXiUwXZ-X53VOkIDdvFTpA.text: I could live off the buttermilk fried chicken breasts, so good. And don't forget my bahamarita!!! My only complaint is that there not one closer to my house. Devin is a great quick and friendly server. The best! Gotta come back for happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

q9cRW_VBRdCE6NDbTmLC0Q.text: Last night 2 friends and I were looking for somewhere to get food and drinks after the fireworks on 4th of July. We tried to go to Herbs & Rye but it was closed! We eventually ended up at Bahama Breeze, and it was honestly a great experience. I have been here a handful of times before and have always enjoyed it. I really love their late night happy hour, although we could not take advantage of that last night because it was a Saturday, oh well. Without a doubt my absolute favorite thing about this place is that every single item from drinks to food to dessert has the CALORIE COUNT on the menu! This is super helpful for me since I log all of my calories daily. I chose the Painkiller cocktail which was delicious, for dinner I ordered the Grilled Chicken Sandwich on a brioche bun for only 400 calories, and I added avocado which was a generous portion and perfectly ripe. My choice of side was the Vine Ripened Tomato Salad which came in a balsamic dressing and was very good as well. I also ordered a glass of Cabernet and it was great. My friends had the Shrimp and Grits which looked incredible, and a steak with mashed potatoes which was perfectly cooked, and a nice looking Caeser Salad and Clam Chowder. I would have liked to order a dessert but there was nothing even remotely low in calories lol. Service was great and we were all pleased with our meals, and I like that they are open until midnight every night.

puCvGEITfgWuMSgJIyEWqg.text: Staff is super friendly! It's definitely a throw back to the 90s when these big themed family restaurants were all the rage. Along with mom jeans.  For portions were massive! So definitely a good deal. I got steak with plantains and beans. Flavors were great but my steak was kinda cold. My husband got a cream cilantro chicken dish that was absolutely yummy.  Dessert was molten chocolate cake with pineapple. It was good but nothing really outstanding about it.  They also offer happy hour and late happy hour. I'd recommend catching those. Their appetizer options are all half off which makes that lobster quesadilla only $7 yum!

P4oYO74BuJ5tQ1pSv07Cpg.text: It was a really nice place.  Everything was reasonably priced. The atmosphere felt warm and it can be a social event or it can be a privet date , anything works. The service was also great. No complaints. It's off the strip and not in the safest area but, it's not bad. Worth doing !

wEcm3XCzNiNMDrZIy70t6Q.text: Were really excited to go for my daughter's 30th birthday.  We enjoyed the drinks and food, but service was awful.  The server never came over after the last person in our group arrived to order drinks.  We had to call him over from where he was talking a group of employees.  Once drinks and appetizers came and dinner was finally ordered, it took forever.  No one came by to see if we needed any additional drinks while we waited.  Once dinner finally came, we mentioned to the server that we planned on ordering desert.  He never came back for the order.  Dirty dishes on the table, empty drink glasses, and no server.  We were really disappointed.  In addition to the lousy service, there were bugs flying around the table.  I think they were coming from the plants on the side and end of the booth.  A member of the group thought they were coming from the kitchen.  We ended up speaking with a manager when we were finally ready to leave.  The response was "the restaurant provides an island atmosphere."  I can completely understand that if the table was taken care of.  I don't feel the island atmosphere was having the table ignored and swatting at bugs for two hours.  Did leave for a tip, hoping they are shared with the bartender and the kitchen.  After a disappointing evening, we won't be returning.

PSVUMYngZFm0RP8k2gzhJA.text: Great service! I came on a weekday after the lunch rush and enjoyed fast service.  I sat at the bar with Bob. Enjoyed a coupla tasty mojitos! The coconut shrimp are awesome!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Shrimp with side salad

CY9DyDk1nVruON6WQC1NQQ.text: I'm not too sure about this place. I might have to go back and try again. But here's what I am sure about.   Service - very good, the redeemer of this place.   Drinks - all of their signature cocktails were just sugar bombs with not of lot of depth. Cheap tasting stuff.   Food - I got the coconut fried shrimp as a appetizer, and it was really tasty and well done. I ordered the fruit and chicken Caribbean salad and it was ok. The chicken was of the same quality you get in those giant frozen bags at Sams club, and it was just gross, it really felt like fake chicken, like they boiled it, idk. Don't order any of their chicken dishes. The salad was overdressed but was yummy at first. It's a very pretty dish.   Someone at my table got key lime pie and really like it.   The prices here are reasonable, if you don't expect above Chili's level cuisine. I will go here again and update this review after trying more of their "signature" dishes. 2 stars for now.

qxNQ1E48_keEH6OHLk5UDw.text: Another great meal at Bahama Breeze!  Stopped in with my family to have lunch and as usual, everything was just Great!  Nachos on point, Margaritas Amazing, Seafood Chowder hit the spot, and the Steak was great, love the sauce!  The service is always good there, and I love the decor!

Wimy2h9h6l7N27QnavuaMQ.text: Went on a Friday night at 7:30 place was about half way full and we were seated in front of a live singer, music was good, food was great and staff was even better.  Crowd was a little on the older side 45+ so next time we might come later.  Spinach dip was da bomb!

crn0sPGdiqI8uwLhFPhsIw.text: Don't get me wrong, but this place was OK. The portions for what you pay is just ridiculous. One of my group members had ordered a Jamaican flavored chicken wings or something and it came out with like 2-3 wings. I ordered mildly flavored chicken wings and it looked like the microwaveable chicken wings from WalMart or Smiths. I had about 3 pieces of wings and a little bits of rice spread about to make it look whole on the plate. Idk about everyone else, but wouldn't go here again..

syDjuV3C-ZDWL83jutNBDQ.text: Food is fairly average. Nothing special. Slow service. Took almost 30 mins to get our food on what looked like a slow day.

hV_NEMh0bPPCvj5qVgRhSQ.text: I was so disappointed with both the food and service!   I ordered grilled halibut with mango sauce.  When it finally arrived it was no longer hot, and even with the sauce, it was so dry it was like eating a crunchy newspaper.   The two other people with me ordered starter plates that sat in front of them long after they were finished.  Presumably this was when our order should have been put into the cook? The waiter came to ask how our food was when one person had already finished and the other almost so.  I told him what was wrong and he offered to replace it, but it was too late.  : /  Sad to have not enjoyed my meal - but the company was GREAT!

166hZM_pRL5CVAr_9OXi5g.text: I've always loved Bahama Breeze and this location is no exception.  The coconut shrimp and seafood chowder soup is my favorite.  The fish tacos looked awesome and is on my list for next time.  The service was friendly and quick too.  Love the tropical drinks especially the painkiller and coconut mojito.

a_Tg-ac7Fq2q1QYwof97_g.text: For anyone who takes the time to read my reviews, you know I'm critical and somewhat unforgiving.  That being said,  Bahama Breeze knocked my socks off. We started with the beef empanadas, then I ordered the chipotle beef bowl and hubster ordered ribs with garlic mashed taters.  The app was flavorful and so delicious. I had agreed to get the full order beef bowl to share, but, after I tasted it,  I wanted to protect it like the last package of Twinkies in a zombie apocalypse. Hubby loved on his ribs while I shielded my bowl from his wandering fork.  There's no room for dessert, but, my flashy green drink was good,  too. Our waiter was attentive and the water was flowing. Thank you,  BB, this meal was such a pleasant, last minute surprise.   Mwah!  Hugs and kisses....till we meet again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum, nom, yum
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My flashy green drinky thingy.

LpntXYR7hZAtbHh14PO3-g.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants to come and spend some time with the wife is love how thay decorated the whole place to have a tropical theme along with the live music makes it that much better  there happy hour is the best thay have so much to choose from and the drinks and food are amazing  today my waiter was amon he was always making sure my cup  was always full great customer service is love everything about  Bahama breeze

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite

kr_JU7LBFidjW7clQdAzAg.text: One of the BEST restaurants in Vegas! This West Indies Curry Chicken is delicious and reasonably priced. Umbrella drinks make you escape from reality. 4 stars for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3zp3lq4gV0u8r0oaCO34aA.text: Such a fabulous happy hour deal!  The bahamarita was super delicious. Order it if you like tropical goodness, margarita style. If you like coconut..like the malibu rum coconut, you would love the Pineapple Coconut Margarita. Not my cup of tea, but could be yours! I wouldn't recommend the Mojito Cubano unless you're looking for an average glass of mojito.   Recommendations off appetizers: Coconut shrimp- Perfect balance of shrimp and batter. Flavor was on point as well.  Crispy onion rings- JUMBO sized onion rings Jumbo Lump Crab Cake- Crab can taste a little like the sea, but the shrimp avocado and mango salsa made up for it. This dish tasted really fresh, I would recommend it if you like crab and shrimp.  Warm spinach dip, chips, and salsa- The salsa was delicious! Artichoke was mediocre.   Chicken quesadillas- Nothing special Buttermilk Fried Chicken Sliders- This was okay, wasn't extra savory or anything.  Habanero wings- Disappointment. Wasn't spicy at all.   Interior very spacious and our waiter was friendly. Will be back if in the area.

SOwH65SISL19b_mJDSwNxg.text: We went here for lunch and drinks. We had several appetizers, drinks and entrees. It was all delicious! Our server Joe was awesome as well. Will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frozen Bahamarita

mbsdh5PwZoa5Ilki2c5GHA.text: We decided to try this place after reading the Yelp reviews. This place is really fantastic! We had an excellent waiter - Marcus.  He helped us with all our questions,  suggested we come back for happy hour. .and was extremely attentive. We had the ahi tuna and jamaican chicken wings - both were delicious..the wings are FULL wings too - all 3 sections. I had the salmon and fresh greens tostadas and my husband had the salmon.  Both were so good..nobody was talking during the meal. .we were so absorbed in our meals! And lastly - THE MUSIC...Live music..music by Bob Marley, Jimmy Buffet and an easy, grooving island feel to the entire restaurant - which can easily accommodate large groups.  A new LV favorite for us! We will definitely be back for happy hour!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled salmon, garlic mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna appetizer
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mai tais are fabulous!

tx3No6x1ukqR3q39c91LiA.text: Mahi Fish tacos were bland and boring...no sauce ($11). The Salmon Special ($13) was dry & tasteless too.  We've loving this place for 5 years because of the amazing flavors and sauces.  Food today didn't have any of those amazing sauces and was void of flavor. Asked the waiter if they forgot the sauce but he said they no longer include the mango sauce with the tacos. I think hospital cafeteria food would have tasted better than what we had today. New cooks? New recipes? The table next to me complaining to the manager about their food too. Sad that one of my favorite restaurants lost it's mojo....but I'll give it 3 stars because the staff was nice and restaurant was clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boring Fish Tacos - Where&#39;s the sauce?

k0jVRIGPoGKkHbJ6czO_Yg.text: Went here for a company Christmas party, so I understand the service and food might not be as it would for say 2-4 people... With that said....  Appetizers were cheap: Chicken quesadilla was just bland, edaname was good but c'mon. Fun, but cheap. Same thing goes for the meals. I had the fish tacos, TERRIBLY FISHY. I'm a HUGE fan of Wahoo's, so this was such a disappointment. My husband had the cuban, I had a bite of it and the bread was grilled and pressed, but tasted so dried out.  The drinks were amazing though, for that it gets 2 stars. =o)

WuEDADCn2-9H3dzVBTb8kQ.text: Everything I got was packed with flavor and my taste buds are a happy camper!   My brother lived in Vegas and this was one of his favorite places and I'm so glad he took us there.  The Beef Empanadas make you say MMMMMmmmm after every bite and for the main course I got the chef's pic of Stuffed Crab, Rice and a savory sauce.  I was so happy that I literally had to go one more time before I left!

ex-AzuB_x3eh1wOxFsIPZg.text: At first they were friendly but the guy who took my order forgot my food. Drinks were good. Won't be back. Thank you

yoWHVYqgcj-Vpvq-NYNUtQ.text: Ok , this review is just for their happy hour, which is probably one of the cheapest and best in town !!   3$ large draft beers and half off selected appetizers , hell yeah !! They also have 4$ and 5$ cocktails using decent brands as well , and happy hour is available anywhere in the restaurant, which is great for people with children!!  Some happy hour highlights are the spinach dip , a large bowl of gooey goodness served with warm chips , also their wings are amazing no matter which you choose ( the Jamaican jerk , tho are an acquired taste ) and the large portion of coconut battered onion rings are crispy and delicious ! So check them out !!

eeddJA2IpUIpumrMXJZ57Q.text: I had the "fresh fish" salmon with mashed potatoes & asparagus.   Was actually better than I expected, no fishy taste and the potatoes were very tasty. They should be with all the butter they add.   Excellent meal if you're not looking for something heavy.  Now about the SERVICE.   - We sat at the bar and were greeted with an obnoxious bartender.  - When asking for water he just had to say "so you just want good ole lake mead?" Tackiest way to try and upsell. I wish he would try that at a fine dining establishment.  - He tried to memorize our two simple order and of course he messed up. Use a pen and paper next time. - forgot to put in our appetizer & never realized it.  The guy definitely had a few drinks before work.   If I ever return I'll grab a table.  FYI I love lake mead water.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon with mashed potatoes

_LYYYYJT8qyI_6ZbiRpeSQ.text: First time here around 1 pm on a saturday. When we walked in we were told a 15 min wait although there were a ton of empty tables. When I asked why the wait the hostess said each server could only have 3 tables. Maybe management should learn how to staff. The food sounds great on paper but none had any flavor it was very bland. The service was ok I wouldn't rush to eat here

F77QiCKhhtOMosfAQ3xhBw.text: Came here for dinner on Saturday night.  Easy to get a table and the service was perfect, never felt rushed and never waited for a refill or a dirty plate to be taken away.  Food was delicious and the margarita was the best I have had in quite awhile.

yFLgMeZf34em851jLNp9Ew.text: Happy Hour is the best time to go! The beef empanadas and coconut shrimp is flavorful.  The ultimate pina colada is refreshing.  The warm chocolate pineapple upside down cake is to die for.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm chocolate pineapple upside down cake.
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo lump crab stack
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef empanadas

qr82hp-iur6pwSoeFLfG-g.text: Good food and drinks. The wait staff was great but the server is kinda d*%#.  I ordered coconut mojito drink and I asked for straw. He said " that's the straw" pointing to 2.5 inches of sugar cane stick. Next time I'll dare him to suck on that for $100 to finish my drink.

QBr0lBJQUf6HMX1r4a-3DA.text: Overall not too bad.  Nice service.  The pulled pork had a weird taste.  That is my only complaint.  the onion rings were hot and crisp.  The fries were also hot.  The yet of the meals were ok.  The price was a little high.  We had 6 appetizers, 1/2 price, and 3 drinks, 1/2 price as well, Happy Hour.  The bill was $55.00.  At full price would have been over $100.00.  There was not a meal.  So overall ok food, but the price is little high.

_1H9rgOCLt3GAlJiDay7sw.text: Less pricey than hotel food and just as good! The drinks were pretty good too. The waitress was a little slow, but she did have quite a few tables.

1Zf4P9-mvK3i__MB5z6brw.text: Best food since we have been in Vegas. Family friendly, affordable.  Very friendly service.   The coconut shrimp was to die for.   The coconut shrimp tacos blew my mind.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SEYlSD2cVkSA75WuwlhNpA.text: ok so after 2 years of searching I finally found Jerk Chicken, I ordered the Jerk chicken wings and Jerk Chicken Pasta and as I was smashing I forked up a long ass blonde hair atleast 12 inches long didn't notice it until it was in my mouth, talking about gross that meeker up the entire meal for 6. We were out celebrating my sisters bday and no one felt comfortable eating their food. I also ordered a long island drink and it was weak. I'll never return 2 this joint again.  Oh an the waitress said this happened to someone else 2 night with the same dish. Dig that.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

botuYHCX2QsrkAubqLqYPw.text: The portions are huge! Ambience is nice and casual.  Had a Spicy Mango Mojito minus the sugar cane juice, and it was very good and plenty sweet.  We ordered the Firecracker Shrimp which was delish!!!!  About 15 shrimp very lightly breaded with Shiracha Mayo drizzled on top and a small bowl on the side. The mayo was so good we used it on everything after this course!   Then we had the Jerk Chicken Pasta with a side Caesars salad and the Island Hopper appetizer as a meal.  The pasta was loaded with asparagus and mushroom with some chicken all cooked well.  The light portion was huge, so no need for the regular portion.   The side salad was fresh and tasty, but absolutely too big.  The Hopper was tasty with great coconut shrimp, huge crispy jerk wings, big onion ring and conch fritters.  WAY too much food!!  Everything was good, but the 3 sauces on the platter can't hold a candle to the Shiracha mayo!  Would definitely return here, but wait for happy hour to get 1/2 off appetizers and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calypso Shrimp - tasty!
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango Chardonnay Sangria - meh

bbc1esdtZBmu-oH-8704Hw.text: The food was alright I had a burger however I had better. The drinks were pretty good I have to say. That's the only reason I'm giving them 3stars the drinks

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cuban Mojito and a Piña Colada

wmUpQKu1V8YmEyGXEOGaow.text: We had taken a drive to get to know the area and to wander for an early dinner. We found Bahama Breeze and after a warm welcome, a peek at the menu and a 3 minute wait we were seated and ready to go. Christine B. Gave a great fun evening- humor, promptness, very helpful explanations about the meals and drinks. I had the mango caipirosca drink with vodka and mango, the sriracha fish tacos with tomato salad ( light meal so I can protect my dear spouse from anentire key lime pie slice) and he had a great shrimp rice bowl. Delicious!!! Big portions. The pie was excellent and almost tart enough to be killer- with a perfect crust. The service was individualized and professional. You know if my tough reviewer husband wants to come back, this was seriously very good!! I have my next assignment: stuffed plantain with crab on top!! One tip for management: we were both stunned to see that waitresses must bus their own tables. Now the plates and bowls here are large and very heavy stoneware. This is wear and tear on your very important team. We are hopeful that our concerns reach the ears of big cheeses. Maybe an undercover boss is needed- I can see no CEO working anywhere near as hard as did the staff tonight. Docking one CEO a star for a really dumb move.

t2DqMvXPQRcnpGeVKDl2AQ.text: Came here for a a last minute dinner.  The waiter was very funny and nice.

WlszKSkYHFztnuFwXSj7WQ.text: Food, service, and prices were perfect! Lindsey was a great bartender. Only thing I didn't like here was the terrible shirts.

BLuxVQKWE5YY3l5ngi5FMg.text: Was in town and stopped here for lunch. Good food, clean, great service.

ZwUKYtahSRiF7l_OKR3zJg.text: Can you believe this was my first time here after living in Vegas almost 20 years?! This is one of my new favorite places! When we walked in I felt like I was on an island getaway. We were greeted by 3 very friendly staff members who escorted us to our table and introduced us to our server Deja who was the sweetest! She welcomed us and gave us their daily specials as well as made some recommendations when we weren't sure what to order. I love the atmosphere here it makes you so relaxed and they have the best selection of tropical vacation drinks, you know the kind with the little umbrellas haha. Our food came out lightning fast! Our appetizer was the Breeze Cheese Bites which are crisp fried yuca stuffed with melted cheese and cilantro crema dipping sauce. It was ok, to be honest it wasn't something I would order again because the "melted cheese" wasn't melted it was just a stick of cheese inside a fried yuca ball. For my entree I ordered the coconut shrimp tacos (2) and Deja recommended the fresh fruit with sorbet for my side which was amazing! The fish tacos were good but they were really spicy! I know it came with sriracha aioli but wow they were hotter than expected. The coconut shrimp had good flavor and the size was good too. The tortillas were cold and kind of hard. Ill come back because of the excellent service but order something else next time. This would be a great place to come with a group of friends they have a pretty big selection of food and drinks!

Jz-kcjLGK87oS8ZivPQJGA.text: I have been a Las Vegas resident for 13 years and have been coming to this restaurant since I was a student at UNLV. We recently went to this restaurant to celebrate my sister's birthday, sad to say it will not be a birthday that we look back on fondly. The service was just AWFUL! Along with this, there were bugs flying around the restaurant throughout the meal. Our server, although friendly, ignored us and made us feel forgotten. We had wanted to order more drinks and dessert, but after sitting there for two hours we were all ready to leave.   We spoke to the manager, who did not seem to be concerned and gave us the excuse for the slow service that they were trying to "provide and island experience." I have been to the Islands and I can assure you that there is a difference between "Island experience" and just BAD service.   Unfortunately I can say for certain that my family and I will not be returning. I do hope that the manager shares our feedback with this team and that no other patrons go through what we went through.

Uwn54S3Imjar_pYWslvGCw.text: The ultimate pina colada is SUPER YUMM!  We enjoyed everything we ordered.  Jamaican jerk chicken dinner was good and so was the pasta.  Service was friendly Bf efficient

k4SpvP6uVDZt4XK6cd9-oA.text: I came here for happy hour around 4:30pm on a Friday. My server Alexis was great! Very kind and friendly. I ordered the Frozen Bahamita and Jerk Chicken. Both were so good. I would highly recommend trying this place out when your in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hmb0RWc9Kpbgnhl3YSfXVQ.text: LOVE IT!  The atmosphere, food & staff have been great so far!  We came here for my daughters birthday dinner & she loved the atmosphere. She loves water fountains & water falls so she loved seeing a wishing fall right when you enter.   Our food was amazing, I ordered the Stuffed Plantain and it was so good. All of their plates are pretty large, great for sharing or just taking the rest home. Our kiddos ordered the kids Mac n' Cheese and it was pretty good, they ate it all. Once again the plates are pretty big so our kiddos shared that plate and it was more than enough for them. My husband ordered the Skirt Steak Churrasco & enjoyed it, he as well ordered a Coconut Mojito which was fresh with a hint of sweetness. I ordered their Mango Lemonade for myself and the kiddos and we loved it. A little on the sweeter side but it comes chilled so it tastes good, I'm not big on sweet drinks but this was pretty good.   We plan on going back for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Plantain

V6IdAX-Ei17-1nab-A_BIg.text: Ms. Tina made the visit worth it.  I had shrimp and grits.  I think,  forget I know this is tge best shrimp and grits I've had.  I was pleasantly surprised!!! And did I mention my waitress Ms. Tina.  Best shrimp and grits also there's Ms. TINA.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goomba smash, Bahamas
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smothered pork skillet!

VhyFCzL_Jxq9PwdXVn0ilA.text: Hidden gem, love this place. Empanadas & tortilla soup were legit as was the fried chicken. Service was also excellent, definitely recommend!

JmkD_Tx0qSc8bfeOkCgekA.text: Finally got to try this place out. So long over due. Came here on a Monday night was a great time there was essentially no wait. This place is pretty big in size, there is bar, indoor and outdoor seating. Thy have good HH specials 1/2 off apps 9-12 and a lot of $5 drinks. Ordered the jerk shrimp app it's like a scampi def not what I expected but very good. The jerk chicken and rice meat was amazing and I just had to get the paella.. man it was amazing I am so pissed I didn't have a bigger appetite. The service and staff were all kind and attentive. All in all I'd go back for sure, so sad they don't have this place in Los Angeles.

Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scampi appetizer
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Drink special- got to keep the cup

a3pdVUSTRiGD0ZNgFmDOVw.text: I've come to this restaurant several times and have always received very good service and food in a good environment. My last visit was on a Wednesday night at about 930-10pm. We were greeted and seated well.   Then came the most flamboyant black male waiter ever. For some reason he completely lost it when I inquired about the chicken quesadilla. He told me they weren't that good and I still decided to try them. He then, while rolling his eyes, said," so you're going to try something and then send it back if you don't like it, AFTER I just told you it's not that good?" I replied,"yes!"   So the food was bought to the table and the food was freshly cook, and quesadilla was good. There were two male waiters that for some reason were extra loud and at times inappropriate. For example this waiter at my table continued to make it obvious that he was addressing my girlfriend alone, right from the moment he first approached the table.   At some point, I'll return to the restaurant but they lost points with me. We were having a great night and this experience with the waiter messed the vibe up, completely.

W1Kr4wolq3PeHvjSFdLvcw.text: Bahama Breeze is probably one of the best casual eateries to eat at in Las Vegas for a mid-price point. It is two blocks from the Strip, just far enough to spare you from the chaotic traffic but close enough that you can ride-share to it; and if location isn't enough to sell you, their happy hour will.  With $5 Wines, $5 Well Drinks, and half-off appetizers what is not to love? My highlights were their Jamaican Chicken Wings and Coconut Shrimp paired with a Frozen Bahamarita. They have something for everyone, their menu ranging from dishes of all sizes.  TIP: If you're going to eat here over the summer (which is like May through September in Las Vegas) make sure you are seated in the main dining room and not in either of the patios because while the tropical decor is to die for, you will literally die from the heat

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Island
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Frozen Bahamarita + Lava Lava &#39;Rita
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flight of In-house Pina Coladas

a_AJ2nuc3j2xmBdGiJVekg.text: Food is so good here. I had the swordfish last night and it didn't disappoint! The coconut grande dessert was amazing as well! We love the ambience here. Island flair with live music that makes you feel like you're on vacation.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut Grande Dessert

0p2wbzn4lgSvnof5ZWqzTg.text: Our server, Fred, was the highlight of this experience. I am a vegetarian, and my husband and son are pescatarians. We don't expect people to completely understand these dietary restrictions, but Fred did. He let us know exactly what to order and not to order. (Fyi... the black bean soup has pork in it).   I had the linguine. It was very good. The sauce had a slight spicy kick, but just enough. My son had the tilapia, which I was grateful to see on the kids menu.   Summer is reggae time. I wish we knew this Saturday night. They have a 5 piece Jamaican band Saturdays, but we missed it. There was a live musician though, who was fun and friendly. Loved the music and the atmosphere at this place.   The Bahamarita was fun and delicious. Even better, they have a virgin version, which made my daughter's night.   When my daughter melted down and wanted to leave immediately (it was late), Fred was super fast getting us out the door. This goes a long way in my book.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the atmosphere

ZzxzOzmNmKWa-SmDbBLzGQ.text: This food was beyond good. It took me to my happy place. It was so seasoned and moist. I will be coming here more often.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This dish is called Taste of Jamaica. Jerk chicken, pork, beef empanada, kale, black beans over rice. Substituted plantai for asparagus.

or3EU1ICcl1UXBfuYC5nRw.text: Bahama Breeze is conveniently located on the corner of Flamingo Road and Paradise Road. Keep it in mind that entrance is from Flamingo Road. There are plenty of parking at front of the restaurant. The building  reminds me of the Caribbean Islands. Love the posts with fire like effects, the huge beach chairs at the entrance, and the music.  Bahama Breeze is open for lunch and dinner, and it stays open late. Love the Happy Hour specials, on week nights 4pm-6pm and 9pm till closing. They are offering 50% off appetizers and reduced price beverages! You have to be lucky to get seated immediately! This place is very popular with locals and tourists. When you signed up for a waiting list, you have to provide your phone numbers and then they'll be text you when the table is available for you. Usually it doesn't take long. Host/hostess is always very polite. They are asking you if you were dining here before, remind you to watch where you step up or down ... the restaurant has lots of little stairs all around. Waiters/waitresses are also very polite, very knowledgeable about their food and drinks.  I'm a kind of person who is always looking at the menu for minutes and then I always get the same items over and over again. My favorite dinner is the Shrimp and Lobster linguine ... It's a huge portion! Never left dissatisfied or hungry! Perfectly cooked pasta with lots of yummy seafood and creamy sauce. I always ask for freshly grated Parmigiana cheese to add. It really enhances the flavor of the meal. I also like to add an order of Caesars salad. If you add the salad to the entree, it only costs $2.99. My other favorite item is a Seafood Paella. Lots of shrimp and oysters and baked chicken on top of Spanish rice. This meal has lots of flavor! Also a huge portion.  My daughter ordered Lobster and shrimp quesadilla from HH menu. Very tasty appetizer, lots of shrimp and lobster pieces with spinach and cheese on flour tortillas. It is served with very mild salsa and sour cream. The Coconut Shrimps from HH menu is our other favorite item. It is served with mango salsa, very yummy!  Their specialty cocktails are very well made, always garnished beautifully. Sometimes I order the Original Cuban Mojito. The only problem I have with this when it is made with way to much ice. I have to ask for a "less ice" version of it.  The Original Lemonade is very good here! It's non-alcoholic, but it's coming from the bar, so it takes forever to get it, sometimes! Other drinks, like soft drinks or iced tea ... never had a problem to get refills. Service is always good, servers are very attentive.  The restaurant is very casual. Happy to return again and again!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab stack
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut shrimps
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate Piña Colada

Aixq3TGAze5FAC7PCnm2YQ.text: This place is casual .....next to the strip I took my friend there for his birthday lunch because that's where he wanted to go... This was my first time here it is a Saturday we went at 2 PM no reservation was needed it was not packed however we were unable to sit outside because the servers had closed it for some reason so I was a bit disappointed. The reason this place gets four stars is because the server was great the service was amazing she was super attentive super nice and gave us a lot of recommendations. We ordered the Caribbean lobster and Mac and cheese plate the lobster was fried and it was oh so delicious... I made the mistake of getting a Caesar salad which was good but my eyes definitely went for the spinach dip and chips that we ordered as an appetizer... As far as drinks get the Hibiscus Margarita !!!tasted like juice yum!!! Or the Tamarind margarita with 1800 Reposado !!!...the whole meal for two with appetizers and drinks and even a chocolate dessert and $20 tip came out total $113!!!! Pretty good for all we ate !!!

YlOvECfqo6OEopXvHNNs9Q.text: I've lived here a year and never been to this place.  It's been on my radar  It was great.  Good food good drinks.  We sat on the patio and had a great lunch   KAT the manager came and talked to us and was so friendly.    Ryan are server was great. Super nice   Only complaint would be to have to pay $1.50 for the bread with my pasta.  I've never seen that anywhere ever

TGzbaSV3NElCjeTJDMaPTg.text: Came in for happy hour on a Monday night and there were still at least 7 other parties dining. The decor is definitely Caribbean inspired. We ordered the bahamarita ($5 during HH) which a very nice fruity frozen treat with a very subtle tequila taste. It comes with a shot of cactus juice schnapps which was not very strong either. We ordered the lobster and shrimp quesadilla and coconut shrimp appetizers from the HH menu. The coconut shrimp was amazing. The butterflied shrimp were not overly fried and there was just enough coconut in the batter. The quesadilla was a bit lukewarm and there didn't seem to be very much lobster. I could only really taste shrimp. It was a decent quesadilla but not impressive. We also ordered the seafood paella. There was a generous amount of seafood mixed in and the rice was flavorful. The sausages were a bit too salty and the chicken seemed so out of place (some chunks and shreds that seemed to just be tossed in as an unappetizing afterthought - what's it doing in seafood paella anyway?). All in all, I think it's worth visiting during happy hour to try some of their appetizers and drinks. Staff was super friendly.

Lo-09-8NjUvpq5kerG2RMg.text: The lobster shrimp quesadillas are the best! All of the appetizers and specialty rum drinks are also top notch. We are definitely making it a point to come back. We have also been to the Tukwila WA and location many times and it's just as tasty.

1h95K_cyndbhxPKrB6HjhA.text: The tranquil setting and delicious fare at Bahama Breeze was a perfect selection for a lunch outing with my husband. This location was a hot spot for refreshing beverages and appetizing eats for night outings during my time in college, and never disappoints. I love the lunch specials, dinner selection, and island  ambiance here. Our server Dave was really nice and attentive. We will return!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster and Shrimp Quesadilla with Seafood Chowder lunch special

HJFxAsldJ4vFVFgN9_rt4A.text: Tasty food but way overpriced and literally took 30 minutes for my jerk chicken sandwhich, whichwas a little dry and bland but a little sauce made it much better. The Painkiller was one of the best I've had and the jerk chicken wings and bbq sauce was amazing. I'd definitely come back to try some of the other dishes and drinks but not on a budget. If you like tropical rum drinks, bring a friend: the rum flight on Yelp is incorrect and it is now 25 bucks for a flight of 8 drinks but you a required to have at least 2 people to order it.

F_OPKae-P_mpohI16tslBg.text: Love their Lemon Breeze Drink.. Ordered one Chef's special salmon for lunch..

FNLQ_ljVcSS8i6yv0MHG5w.text: This place was eh.  The menu is not the best and the food is ok.  We shared the Spinach Dip which was good.  This item was the only thing we shared and a few hours later we all had some stomach issues.  I got the lunch combo of a salad and a qusadilla with lobster and shrimp.  It was tasty but nothing to write home about.  The salad dwarfed the quasdilla. It was a lunch portion though.  My colleagues enjoyed their meal but they have had better.  The waiter was ok, he had a little attitude.    I would not recommend Bahama Breeze as there are many better chain restaurants in the area.

rmbnXEZQZdLUJobb0BJ56w.text: great happy hour specials, this place makes you forget about the desert

AHFiM_NcWChcnZ9SOJr6oA.text: Caribbean inspired cuisine. Great service great food and Great Service .  I always stop by when in Vegas. A must !!!

3WvSFmo8oInSNVxMQrA06A.text: This place is a total joke. Our server was an absolute jerk who refused to give us menus because we sat down in the bar table area without getting menus from the dimwitted hostess. Then he went off on a tangent about how there was a miscommunication and we should not have been seated without menus. He is the definition of a low wage uneducated worker. So then i go to the bar and tell the bartender i want two drinks for me and my date (who looked better in her photos ) and he says he will let our server know because im in his section. I go off on the dude because i just want to get two drinks and carry them the 2 feet from the bar to the table right behind me, but he refused to do this cause it wasn't fair to the server. What a bunch of degenerates at this chain hell. The manager came over and eventually offered to buy me 2 drinks, but hell no because he defended his erver. Ended up walking out on my ugly date, who was sitting at the table wondering what the hell she should do and also this Bahama Breeze forever. Letter to corporate also sent, but a canned response was received. Punks.

VVxYEsKwcyL85ODzApMz4g.text: When will you put a Bahama Breeze in SOCAL? I love this place! The appetizer cajon shrimp platter with bread is the best thing I've ever tasted.  I have been writing letters to the company to expand westward for years, but no feedback and no outcome :( BEST FOOD EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

SHCtiDxW7Y0P7Ch6parm2w.text: My wife and I wanted to find a restaurant that had good ratings, was something that "locals" would eat at, and was OFF The Strip.  This restaurant fit the bill perfectly.  Service was speedy, both in seating and in getting our food.  Our server was Sam and she was quite pleasant and knowledgeable, even joking around with me after I made some of my usual sarcastic comments.  I had asked her what was good here and what she'd recommend and, when she told me, I said that I'd trust her and that it would be her fault if my dinner wasn't great...all the time with a smirk on my face.  It turns out that she was right.  One of her recommendations was the seafood paella.  It was the first time I'd had paella and it was awesome!  She asked me later on why I hadn't left her any so that she could have some dinner that night and I said that it was just too good to leave behind.  We both chuckled and she said she was glad to hear it.  The pina colada I had was really good, but stir it up first.  Most of the rum goes in first and is then swirled in with the rest of the drink which resembled a very thick milkshake's consistency.  Yum!  I can easily see myself returning to this restaurant the next time I'm in Vegas.

bYLOIeMavfEiysuTq_Ntig.text: Last month was my first time checking out their happy hour. & let me just say.. amazing!! Great prices on great drinks and food. Bahamaritas are my favorite. A must try! The sangria was ok.. not the best, but hey I drank it anyway. I also got a Blue Moon which I love. As far as food goes, we ordered most of the happy hour menu. Lots of food! The only reason I'm giving them four stars is because the service was pretty slow. It took foreeeever to get the check and then even longer to pay. But overall, very nice happy hour experience. I've been many times not during happy hour and I always get the jerk chicken pasta. It's soooo good!

2fuwZ-ihosns1r5rcF0isQ.text: I made a big deal to my wife that we had to go to Bahama Breeze this time while we were in Las Vegas.  We went Monday night and a lot of reviewers commented that the concept for the restaurant and it is terrific...it really is nice.  But for us, that was where it ended.  Our service was very good (Thanks Sparky!)  My wife had the curry chicken for dinner...it was so dry and lacked flavor she could not eat it.  She ordered a strawberry magarita and she got a mango margarita instead.  We sent it back and this time it came back with only a little mango in it.  WTF?  The bartender could not make a most simple drink?!?!  To top off our drink issues...The pour on the tequila had to have been a 1/2 ounce if that...it was like drinking mix only and then it was served in a martini glass!.  If you don't have margarita glasses put it in a hurricane glass, those they had..  I had the paella and a couple of beers...it was a safe bet .  My daughter had the jerk chicken pasta, again, just okay, kind of lackluster in flavor.  To drink, she ordered a Bailey's and coffee...served in a regular ol' coffee mug.  A place like this I would have expected a clear mug to showcase the drink...nope, didn't happen.  I know some of this may seem like petty things but...our bill was close to $100 for the 3 dinners, drinks oh...and an appetizer.  The entrees did not come with any type of salad offering either.  Over priced and the Monday night bartender(s) needs a bit work.  We did voice our comments to the manager (actually we were going to leave and our server sent the manager to us!).  He said he will talk to his staff and try to fix things.  He did give us 3 comp drink tickets to use anytime.  One thing we do not do is complain to the manager in order to get a comp meal, we usually will talk to the manager AFTER we pay.  Getting comp'd is not the point, bringing issues to management's attention so they can resolve the problem is the larger issue.

FO4rgWDYqHmS-L7ebp0Ddg.text: VERY GOOD. I had the jerk shrimp appetizer with the cuban bread and LOVED it. The service was ok, but then again, we had a party of 23 and I dont think they were very well prepared for that. The reason I'm giving 5 stars is because the food was SOOOO good. and the conch frittters; TO DIE FOR.

56WgzjL9w6v4LZ2M56aKwQ.text: I just love this place for lunch!  I work in the Wells Fargo Tower, which makes it so convenient.  The service is always great, and the food even better.  It's a must-try!

fMpm0KSZRM_GAjcO9XYBjQ.text: Nice place, love the tropical ambiance.  Service is usually good. They have huge onion rings and the beef patties (like beef curry in little pastries with mango salsa on the side) are great!  Food always tastes fresh.  Desserts were yummy, too!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So yummy!

HTiEHE8LiOGLVU2F3ImlEw.text: When in Vegas I love eating off of the strip. Just to get away from all the chaos of the strip.  Walking into this place not only are you away from the strip, but its like walking onto a small island. And u can smell the great aromas as soon as you walk in the door. Now i;m not a big fan of spicy food, but I enjoy some good flavor. Those jamaican jerk chicken wings are phenominal. Its the right amount of heat with the the best amount of absolute great flavor. They were amazingly good. The chicken tortilla soup was just as good. I can't wait to go back and try something else when I have a bigger appetite.

W72rYffSVg0pIaOpRgNniw.text: This is formula fast food with a menu you look down at and pay too much for. Almost not worth writing a review, The Special Jerk Chicken is not even close to being a jerk. The mashed potatoes were beaten into a sticky gooey glue-like mess. The wife asked for Jerk-style ribs and got what the waiter said was a mango based jerk sauce. The Onion Rings were rock-hard tasteless hoops and the chicken wings were over-done and leather like. The high noise level made for difficult conversation. However the margarita was over-the-top and presented well. Go for the drinks and skip the food.

T1h-_yYVKZGmDIDFaLujiw.text: I entered this restaurant's name. I chose the number of stars it shall receive from me. I clicked my cursor in the review box. I shrugged and shook my head. See, I've been to this Bahama Breeze a couple times before, because I discovered it's a place I can get a bowl of some really yummy chicken tortilla soup, complete with freshly sliced cubes of avocado. And, it's certainly nice to dine in a restaurant void of video poker machines and giant flat screens displaying every single game you can bet on. The decor's nice -- they certainly did an excellent job of creating the outside indoors. The service, plain and simple, is just nothing to write home about. Or write about at all. Last night, I met up with a group of friends there for dinner, and they seated us on the patio. Why the patio was even open, I have no idea. Even with the heater towers, we were freezing. The hostess relocated us, and it took quite a while for our orders to be taken, and took days for our food to arrive, without so much as an explanation or apology. In fact, our server completely disappeared after our orders were taken. A food runner delivered our plates. I did notice, however, that the complaining stopped once we did receive our meals. The food certainly is pretty darn tasty, and the presentation impressive. I'm just going to convince myself that it's been the luck of the draw as far as service has gone on my previous experiences, and give it one more try.  Sure do love that soup. ,': )

JpwaIyCIMsSC1kbf_2hEjQ.text: Bahama Breeze sits in the vicinity of corporate circle....aka Howard Hughes Pkwy. Its got purty decor like they got that tropical theme going. They make FLAMING DRINKS! Had a Flaming Dr Pepper here. The coconut shrimp is pretty good. Like the fans on the ceiling. It's purty too. Makes me feel like when i took the mirsus to hawaii...well not really it. was mah backyard and my cuzin Stu turned on the fan with some salt water to give us an ocean breeze.  Food ranges from Paella - to burgers - and yummy sammiches and jambalaya pasta, woodplank cooked fish and chicken.  I think one time I had the conch soup! I HAVE THE CONCH IT'S MY TURN TO SPEAK!

OPBC7x7clqhYjQs-03sZQA.text: oh so good. I came to Vegas and ate at Terribles, Ballys Buffet, and the 24 hour diner at Hooters so I was dying for some decent food. The spices in the dishes here are unique and really refreshing from the typical fare you find in the big casino restaurants. The service is uber slow, but it's almost fun just watching other tables' dishes come out since they all look so appetizing and smell like heaven- even though 90% of them had meat in them and I'm a bloody vegetarian. I think that says a lot. Or speaks volumes about how terrible Hooters food is?

-tG6l1T63a1vdSFC2rRp7Q.text: When this place first opened I probably would have given it 4-5 stars. The food was delish, service was excellent, and the had a bunch of good signature cocktails. Like alot of other places when they get popular, food, and service suffer. Went a couple days ago after not going for like 2 years and I just wasn't impressed with anything. Im mean it was still OK; but not as good as it used to be.

XZz-PSn6t0eQSMH05Bfo6g.text: bahama breeze escape, friendly waiters, knowledgeble. Prices are fair in this current economice. But a laid back spot with alot of ceiling fan blowing tons of breeses . My wife and i will go again. 4 stars. Because Bahama Breeze i think can be cozer with better chairs and seating. and small tv's at the tables.

RtkNR47zrg_ScHzpIpAJyA.text: i just love the customization of seafood you can make. how you want it cooked, what sauce, what rub, what sides..it's an amazing restaurant with fantastic environment and great service. top 5 restaurant in vegas to me..along with capriottis and secret pizza at cosmo.

VKemCDe4FcLiAzqAKwBzjA.text: Usually we are pleased with Bahama Breeze. ..However we made reservations a week and a half ahead of time for a going away party and when we show up  early for our time slot and are still standing waiting 40 minutes passed the time the only response we got from an employee when we asked what the hold up is was..."Obviously we get a lot of reservations here! " very disappointing!

vKPotXbLIbEpZQcu3-EX0Q.text: Celebrating the wife's birthday we decided to come to Bahamas breeze. Some of our group had been here before so we were expecting a great experience. For the most part our server did her job well, but we received some drinks that were watered down. The food took a while to get to us but it was busy so that is understandable. What killed the night is my buddy pulling a 12 inch blonde hair out of his mouth while chewing his jerk pasta. Everyone's apatite was ruined after that.

treluhGs_jgivHjuLBmqTQ.text: Food was great drinks were great...if you like jerk chicken try the jerk chicken entree...amazing!

QiclyIqtc4NI3FlU7Z_zzA.text: This place has great happy hour specials! Plus they start at 9pm which is earlier than most places in town.   The appetizers were all really good and the selection of drinks is pretty extensive.   My only complaint would be the drinks are more sugary than strong. I need a little more liquor! But I still come here pretty often.   I would definitely recommend checking this place out.

_7NFpvpEzSzW4wWk5-mY7A.text: Food is good and consistent. Great happy hour prices. Servers had trouble with our 10 top and paid more attention to the smaller parties.

E2qCzT3ctPlfJ7fgIo6YBw.text: This place is kinda depressing. I would normally never go here (or a place like this in Las Vegas) on my own but 'had to' because of a group of business folks I was with. They had live music but it was very drab. Happy hour had decent prices but the food was very underwhelming. Service was pretty horrible so we are assuming the girl was new or trained horribly. I don't recommend unless your car breaks down in front of it and you are starving.

SDogLTCjijXd-SHID9gzIw.text: Every time we come to Vegas, we come...  Delicious Food... Great service and the cocktail's very creative ;)))))

p9MVlmJB4oTs42taT2GQZg.text: You can't beat their late night happy hour!  My friends and I have become regulars.  So good and super cheap!  Nice easy going atmosphere.  The service is pretty slow.  That is the one drawback.

g_jqZ8GQY0sfhz2SVdjmTQ.text: The breeze is cool. Not too fancy. The drinks are a little watery but the grub is decent.

UwEIhrVt-h4r4UYj_NFRdw.text: Very good food selection and a very laid back atmosphere. Does give the feeling of being in the islands. Prices are in line for the casual atmosphere. The wait staff and hostess are very helpful and pleasant.

YD1PjKEKf_FOrgiZMAlLTw.text: Love this place!!! Great place for visitors from out of town or for special occasions. Food and greats are exxxcelent

jF0ay62k79_tDz3h59DD7g.text: I am a frequent regular of Bahama Breeze and I love this place ! The staff is always so friendly and the food is amazing ! Feels like you are on an island. The coconut shrimp, the seafood chowder & the grilled chicken breast dinner are my favorites. Ask for Jarrod he is so sweet and a great server !!!!!!!!

iYDbjsHgummR652VH9L64g.text: We decided to avoid the craziness of the strip & come here for dinner last night, thinking it would be less busy. It was a lot less busy but very understaffed. We had to wait almost 40 min for a table for 4 at an almost empty restaurant. We were seated at around 10:30 pm.   To be fair - the food was not bad. What was most upsetting is that I ordered the rice bowl with shrimp & fish. A few bites in, I bit into something hard. I thought it was a fish bone but it was a sharp jagged piece of a plastic - probably the remnants of a food container about an inch long and wide. I told the server & she asked if I wanted my dish replaced and I said no as I did not want to wait for another plate at that time of night as our kids were very tired. She showed the plastic object to her manager & I was waiting to see what he/she would say or do. Well the disappointing outcome is they did nothing. No apology from the manager & we got charged for my dish. Very disappointing.    This is not the first time we have found unwelcome objects in our food at restaurants. In fact once at BJ's my sons Mac & Cheese had the corner of a plastic bag in it but we did not say anything as it was large enough to see & not harmful. The sever saw it as she collected the plates & reported it to the manager. She came to our table to apologize & said we would not be charged for the dish.   So to the manager of the Bahama Breeze - your management skills need some fine tuning to say the least. Your food quality control obviously needs some work. It's not OK to find sharp plastic objects in our food & it's especially not OK for you to ignore it. Very disappointing.

xBH9DhuI15p9GZ3_x9tidw.text: do not get the non alcoholic Bahama mama! nothing really special here. maybe there happy hour is better. I got the cilantro cream chicken and an order of onion rings. the onion rings were better than the entree. it was an "OK" meal. I had high hopes for this place. even my waiter was rude. but the interior is clean and so are the bathrooms. that's a plus. I wouldn't come here again though. I rather go to cesars buffet.

bRegbHUdEy96q99ka644Pw.text: Tempted by Caribbean food we headed to Bahama Breeze.  What we really found was very bad Caribbean inspired chain restaurant food with fake enthusiastic waiters.  Everything is god awful.  Tasteless processed shrimp, fried chicken straight from the freezer bag, fake Caribbean food, obesity sized portions, to over bearing super enthusiastic waiter that just wants to sell sell sell... it was a disaster.  You could stick a knife in his gut and he would still smile and say that was the most thrilling fun he's had he ever had and then try to sell you a tasty signature yummy cocunut piss flavored drink.  For the first time ever, only half the food was eaten and doggie bags were clearly declined.  I felt so cheated, I honestly thought this was a non-chain, real caribbean restaurant.

4E7kwGZ3Gay_KxZM0YUMEQ.text: Messed up all drinks. They tried to fix but to no avail. Food is good though. Don't expect this to be like the ones in south Florida.

DnKxpOiS1rKwCjUYzIorVQ.text: Absolutely delicious! Jamaican wings are HUGE and the sauce is sweet and yummy. I got the guacamole and goat cheese burger- to die for! I can not wait to come back!

7ga-zi-hyUFiH4t4eD6AhA.text: Heading out of Vegas after a nice weekend we wanted to grab a bite to eat off of the strip. It's my job to choose our restaurants so as we drove by Bahama Breeze something made me say say "stop, turn here!" I'm glad we did.  It's your typical chain restaurant with oversized booths and waiters in tropical shirts, but we were both pleased with our meals and our friendly waiter. We had the beef empenada appetizer, the chicken kabob over yellow rice and the fresh jerk salmon of the day. The food was seasoned well and the menu has plenty to choose from without being overwhelming.   The food was reasonably priced for lunch and the portions were great, not too much food it was perfect. Our waiter was so sweet and even gave us a tip on a great place to go shopping! The tropical drinks looked great, so next time I visit I would like to try one.  It was a nice relaxing comforting lunch to end our fun trip in Vegas.

YY1GcN2xdO5gN2s0GktDFA.text: Love coming here for there happy hour every week. It has great appetizers. I highly recommend the beef empanadas, so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy hour! Love coming here I visit once sometimes twice a week just for there beef empanadas. So good.

S8uP8Tyu7DTq524i5r1l6g.text: Loved the Bahama Breeze in Tampa so I tried this one when I moved to vegas. Service was horrible. I never bring it up but it was so bad I told the manager since I had the same waitress twice. He said that is just how she is. It took forever to get anything.

jolrAdKtETMI95sMW4lZtA.text: First time eating at a BB. Food was okay but I think under par for the price the demand. The best thing we had were the Beef Empanadas. otherwise, it was just Meh. Would I go back? Yes, if I was given a gift card. Otherwise, there are too many other great places in Vegas for a lower price point that deliver better food.

nt41QvPhLaR7k2aDWyCxew.text: I officially love this place! Came on a Tues night, sat out on the deck to listen to live music by the featured Reggae artist who was performing. My son and I absolutely loved him! Great vibes. Great song choices. Just leggggggit. The food was great and the service was absolutely awesome. Travis was our server, was completely on point the entire night!  We will definitely be back. :)

yeskGoIO8HikAJoKqugpJg.text: Family atmosphere. The food was amazing. The customer service was impeccable. I can't wait to return!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coconut mojito! Yummmm with a stick of sugar cane

StZTdptx1PRMji7jiEXktw.text: Just average nothing to write home about. Very expensive average food. Onion rings ok. I had a steak just average.

w44AhpQXAEIPa9m5de3CgQ.text: Came here with a group for a gathering.  Sat in the enclosed patio and the service was fantastic. Jason and Brandon worked hard to ensure all of our needs were met.  Some friends and I took advantage of the happy hour menu.  I agree with all of the reviewers that the coconut shrimp is amazing!  The Jamaican jerk chicken wings were also awesome.  I'd also recommend the empanadas that were such amazing comfort food!  The $3.21 cocktails for their birthday wee great as well!  All in all I'd recommend this place!

qRiBC4VBtk6tCII_UGShpQ.text: Love the jerk chicken pasta and fresh lemonade!!! That's a must have with any meal. Food is always good and customer service is great! Always a nice treat for the family, especially when you have small kids since it's kid friendly. Always nice to have dinner in the outdoor patio area. Oh and make sure you attend happy hour!!!! Yummy!!!! Definitely a favorite spot.

eBdQhedds42NJN6uZ1AH9w.text: As a Vegas native this place is By far my absolute favorite for happy hour!! My favorites are..Best mojitos, best shrimp skillet with fresh Cuban bread, & best Jamaican wings! Sun-Thurs. 9pm- closing. A must try place with great atmosphere!

aFp4GrvRwXh0tdQwH_kGCw.text: This place has always been a joy to eat at! My favorite dish is the Chicken & Cilantro cream 'a and the best appetizer to choose would be the full order of the Tower Onion Rings! Yum! On this visit they weren't that great :-/ I mean for $9.79 they could have been a hell of a lot better, were basically on the verge of being burnt! Any who the main dishes of the Coconut Shrimp and Chicken dish were amazing! The customer service was just OK this time. Idk they are slippin' just a tad. I will give them another try in a few months from now. Hopefully this was just a fluke!

52UUu_32JoluteCEgx5u0g.text: HAPPY HOURS!! Overload $7 Key Lime Pie margarita is my favorite lol   My boyfriend and I loved this place the first time we went and every other time after that. We just went yesterday and there was a 45 min wait. Probably the only downfall. But what can we expect if it's so good? We had an AWESOME A-1 server named Tamikah who came to check on us every chance she got! Never forgot to see how we were doing no matter how busy it was! We loved it! Will be continuous customer.

8eFj1Q86EEy-e6UHaPrL1Q.text: We have been to Bahama Breeze twice so far. I would have to say their seafood is way better than their steaks. The drinks are reasonably priced and the staff are always friendly. Going there reminds me of visiting the bahamas.  Overall, we really enjoy this place and would definitely recommend it.

WfSgvXjR9iTu7ZVb4IE3qw.text: Where do i begin, this place is FANTASTIC, the decor is beautiful. Takes up the corner spot in a large shopping center, big parking lot. Came in Fri 1/15/16 around 8:00pm, the lot was full but to our surprise there was no wait, the restaurant is huge. The staff are great our waiter Fred came over within a minute of our sitting down and gave us a rundown of the best & most popular drinks & dishes since this was our first visit. My daughter that doesnt drink, loves strawberry lemonade and orders it whenever its on a menu, she says this was the best shes EVER had. All i can say is this place is now in my top 5 of places to have a great "experience" meal. To me, the prices are low for the quality & quantity of food we received, if it were more i wouldnt complain. We were so stuffed couldnt try dessert. They do have small plates so we might do that with drinks next time so that we can try those delicious looking desserts.
