JCYG3nDa8ByBlCPpG59DNw.text: Such a fun and tropical and happy feeling environment. The service was very good, although not very personal. The food is a little better than average. The cocktails are delicious.

hLRcLQaEZnlp1A-YRjpgbQ.text: This is now the 3rd time we have been here and they have again failed to disappointment. First of, our waitress was wonderful. Her name is Tina. She was wonderful and friendly. She took her time to explain each item to us. When we did not like a particular drink, she immediately changed it for us. What wonderful service!

xawxd_ClT5jqHi16O-PUJA.text: A new favorite!  We were looking for a casual seafood restaurant not on the strip.  Very happy we found Bahama Breeze and will definitely be back.  Our only complaint is there are no BB in Arizona where we live!   I had a salmon tostado. Delicious with lots of greens on the tostado, topped with the salmon.  DH had fish tacos which he liked very much.  It was just before Mothers' Day and I had their special Mothers' Day cocktail. What a trip. They put Cotton Candy (yes) in a martini glass, and dropped some raspberries on it. Then, at our table, they shook together rum and fruit flavored liquors and poured them over the cotton candy (which melted)  It was very sweet and really fun to have.  Service was very helpful and friendly and time waiting for food was fine.

ACX-sO4JjRNQ67S80-cMjQ.text: I love the Jamaican jerk wings and butterfly shrimp. Happy hour is pretty much the only time I go there but it's the best time . You can sit at the bar and try a mojito, the bartenders are friendly the hostess are ok too. Will recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jamaican jerk wings

sH85gvxoSyDv8XAaXMhHNQ.text: My favorite happy hour in Las Vegas. Half off appetizers and $4 cocktails. The Ultimate Pina Coloda is my fave its so refreshing. The jerk chicken wings are a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ultimate Pina Colodq

cUViz0zDWy_eQpC9avxSqw.text: Nice Find!  We just happened on this restaurant during the lunch hour while taking a walk (far off the strip near our hotel). It has a Jamaican theme to most of its dishes. I had coconut shrimp that was to die for (though only four, needed at least two more) and the house salad with the house dressing (very fancy, delicious salad). My companion had a jerk chicken sandwich and soup (can't remember what kind) he said was good. Lovely atmosphere (played island music) and nice wait staff. Lots of rum specialty drinks in the offerings, but since it was 90 degrees and we had to walk a bit, we didn't indulge. I'd go back for sure!

1gk_8WQX5ft84kvTYWnzgw.text: Excellent service, nice atmosphere, good food, and great drinks. This restaurant was next to our hotel and we went there on more than one occasion.  Nice "at home" feel while you're on vacation.

8m0o83hzUuYFLHdnyNfTFA.text: If you like spicy, I recommend that your try the skillet simmered jerk shrimp. It's cooked and served in a hot skillet smothered in butter and herbs and has a nice spiciness to it, but it's not too spicy. It's also served with fresh baked Cuban bread which is great to sop up all the juices with. For an entree, I ordered the baby back ribs which were decent and came with fries. I'll definitely come back just for the jerk shrimp!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby back ribs
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk shrimp appetizer
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk shrimp appetizer with cuban bread

glb1lOVxygZgcHOWBeOu0Q.text: Monday Thur Thursdays they have awesome happy hour specials. I love the coconut shrimp and artichoke spinach dip. The wings are huge but looks too spookie for me.  The drink special are yummy too. There house drink is slushy and yummy. Great place to get your happy you on with friends or family.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The front of the restruant where outside patio dining.

Pq4-djVAzlBGEbsCx7bYzw.text: This is now one of my favorite places to eat in vegas.. I have eaten here dozens of times.  They have amazing drinks, and their food is like none other.  Unique, flavorful and just WOW. We have eaten at various times of day, and have always had A+ service and food. You MUST go there.. Love their Bahama Magarite with a sweet shot on the side.  The bread pudding was so good and love their specials..

Ja2-yeQ3CJ2TLboTzDXmxg.text: Had a business mixer here and loved the staff and atmosphere. The waitress always made sure I had a drink and never went without. Will definitely return!

DBA2Fof-R7fq1ukoaeAHIw.text: Scott was the best server/waiter  ever, he was very nice and consist And he also helped  me pick my drink, food, dessert . Best customer service ever!!! I absolutely love this place. Awesome food and drinks.   I wish there was one in Los Angeles, but I will definitely come back.

NvrukepXSDHQMC0GlkmMhQ.text: The happy hour is absolutely fabulous. Always have a nice experience when I eat here on layovers. Friendly staff and fresh warm food.

h7lnag3JV5kv0raFUnwjMw.text: Ate there on Sunday with Cousin and his wife.  Love the decor, wait staff great & the food is good.    I had the lobster quesadilla.  It was good just not great.  I had part of my cousins cuban sandwich and it was good.  I tasted the fish from the fish tacos & they were good.    OVerall the experience for me was just a ok.  There is a lot to choose from the menu and I am sure there are some great items, but I just didn't get great food.

z0r1jcByho_BJSpeS-IM7Q.text: Happy hours prices are VERY good, but sit at the bar.  I don't know if my waiter was new or what but service was very slow.  Never came by to check if we needed more drinks.  Only stayed for one round and appetizers.  Food was pretty bland but cheap.  Probably won't be back.

-IamKHZJ9KLbvK3MAhmfDQ.text: This was the third time we have visited the Bahama Breeze in Las Vegas and it has been stellar each time.  The food choices are great and the quality excellent.    Our service has always been outstanding and the food delivered has been fresh and hot.  This is one of our favorite places to stop at when we are in town and the prices are very reasonable, especially for Vegas.  Very enjoyable and the service was excellent.

h4dFAazvda8b8Aj_bK-a2w.text: Coconut shrimp. Good!  Mahi fish tacos ....even better. Best Goombay smashes since we were in Key West...... Ding ding ding!!!!   Great job!!

gp7GuF-ra_isoQQW9cvvbA.text: Haven't been here for years. Don't know why we've waited so long to come back. Great menu and great atmosphere. Prompt and friendly service. Outdoor seating with this weather is perfect.

wxq3fsAHWAIK87Gl47eccg.text: First of all I have loved this place over the years! This restaurant has been one of my favorites. We went there tonight for my sister's 61st birthday!. The food was pretty good as always but the service was probably a 2 out of 10. Your server can make or break your experience and our server broke it. From our initial greeting to leaving it seemed she was going through the motions. I noticed other tables had a candle lit. Ours was unlit. I waited 15 minutes and finally lit it my self. Our server just did not want to give us the experience we deserved. Maybe our server was having a bad day or just tired as it was 8:30-9:30 pm. She just didn't smile or seemed enthused about serving us. I was also unhappy that they did not sing to my sister and charged 8 bucks for her birthday desert. I have never been charged before at any establishment. My Mojito was all ice. I think the bartender needs a lesson from Havana Grill in Henderson on a proper Mojito. Seafood Paella, wood fire chicken and burger were good but not great. I hope our next experience will be back to the standards we expect from Darden and especially Bahama Breeze.  UPDATE: The manager called me today 03/10/13 and offered to make it right.He also stated his first priority was to ensure that i will have a good experience...I want to thank the manager for the phone call and glad to see Bahama Breeze cares about the satisfaction of their costumers.......

hrtpD5a-p06_ka7MDlN9DA.text: Tasty overall! Came for lunch. Sister had the habanero wings and the jerk shrimp, very good! Daughter had the chicken tenders, mediocre. I had the chicken curry over rice with naan. The naan, eh, nothing special. The coconit curry sauce and rice very flavorful and decent amount of spice. Chicken was over cooked and hard. Service was just ok.

0Vg1hHjuDrXMBwAtCoVKpw.text: I love this place and there's a lot on their menu I really like.  I decided to try their new hummus appetizer.  It came out VERY thing and served with some sliced veggies and some crispy pita bread sorta thing.  The side items were very good, and I did actually like the hummus but it needed more carribean kick in the flavor and not be so thin and bland.  I tried their new Shrimp and 4 cheese grits.  The dish was made perfect and so were the grits but again everything was bland. It needs more kick in the flavor dept.    The pineapple upside down chocolate cake was soooooooooo yummmy though.  Their seafood chowder is always good, and I've had their black beans and fish tacos many times and it is definitely yummmy.    I will definitely keep coming back to this place again.  I just prefer more spice/flavor in my dishes. (spice doesn't mean spicy, just fyi)

dhFxj17a7d4u2S7SPpCbxg.text: I always get the Caribbean jerk chicken pasta.  I love it ! YUM

YTqGh-8RDt0xxrdj5Rc9hQ.text: Good food - service could be a little bit better - but they have great food!  I had the Shrimp, avocado and crab tower and it was delicious!  Nice place in Vegas that is off the strip and a nice place to eat when in town for business purposes...

AZ7mPGA106ezpq66L4vxxQ.text: The seafood chowder has one of my favorite elements - conch! Reminds me of the Carribean. The ultimate pina colada is DELICIOUS but low on the alcohol content. Tasty nonetheless.   Lots of food for not-that-much-money, compared to the rip-off food options on The Strip. Our waiter even itemized our menu for each person, so we could easily split the bill in our group. Awesome service, good food, definitely coming back here again with friends!

YyOSl9Fu78RINhlkGCxB_Q.text: Great food and great service.  Always a pleasure to eat here.  Staff are very friendly and quick on service. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.  Me and my wife have been here several times and we have not been disappointed once. If you get a chance sit at the bar and ask for Doug he is very knowledgeable, fun, and can tell he really enjoys helping the customer with making decisions on food and drinks.  I must say every time we have come in and he is here Doug hasn't let us down with his recommendations so kudos to him. Great place keep up the great work!!!

FR2u8DR_Uwu3c_rQC0mnzg.text: This was an amazing restaurant. The jerk chicken was as close to authentic as you can get. The empanadas were delicious as well. Fun environment. Cute setting. Definitely a great place to eat!

0LxXloFBfeIaRjKMO3V1-A.text: Though I am neither a big Caribbean food buff nor a Caribbean food connoisseur, I am proud to say that Bahama Breeze has hit all my five-star-diamond standard.   The food is absolutely fantastic, and the service is excellent. It is a fairly good-sized restaurant, yet the food and the service are delivered at the great speed.   Unfortunately, I'm not quite cool with the seafood. (I get allergic to seafood from time to time.) I did taste my friends' seafood dishes for a bite, and they were yummy. I personally liked to order BBQ Ribs and Pork Tenderloin. Great choices though.

iAgWh3Sk68sOLUaETPmfNA.text: Service was fast and food was great. The menu provides a wide variety of food. I would recommend this eatery to anyone that enjoys islands.

NotWJsgSkSVEKWazqxZxWA.text: Our server's name was Lindsay. She had a smile very unique to her. Warm and calming. She lightened up the entire establishment with her kind smile. She was very attentive and gave us our space at the same time. A quality and skill that not too many servers possess.  Although I don't remember the manager's name, he provided helpful suggestions to wonderful food and ways to prepare it which were not all on the menu. He personally checked back with us later and offered other options... Including wonderful desserts.

9pHnCnOGgYv3fY5Fg9mBpg.text: Thank you Bahama Breeze for helping make our Wedding dinner better than what we excepted!! They went above and beyond to help make our wedding night the most memorable night of our lives. Great food. Great drinks. Great accommodations. Friendly staff.   Ps. They even moved tables so we could have our first dance and father-daughter dance. So nice of them. Yes, I did cry at my reception.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ninja picture of us sharing a moment.

90BLgXP3szbdRpIpQbhANg.text: I came here while one early afternoon while visiting Vegas. The food here is so flavorful. Seems like a great place for groups because there is a lot of space. The service was great as well. The waiter made sure our drinks never ran dry and that we had everything we needed and was very friendly. I got a sampler plate with empanadas, jerk chicken, and rice, and other yummy choices. Also tried the baby back ribs. Sooooooo good! I would love to try their seafood here.

fhplnnZLEXYUFk_7Gta1Pw.text: i had my wedding reception here. i purchased a food and beverage contract. the booking process was some what painless. the wait staff was very friendly. the food was pretty good. my reason for 3 stars is that it was very apparent the wait staff had been told to slow serve the adult beverages as it took many times to order a beer or glass of wine during my paid for 2 hour drink window. you could absolutely tell they were dragging their feet. piss poor tactic to try and save a buck at a girls wedding reception. shame on you.

kHjSAtHyw9BABQ8vo1yYrQ.text: This is a popular place,here for fish tacos, they were very good  Been here several times and would come here again,they have patio seating if you prefer  to eat outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pic of the inside bar
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outside pic

x0mSvlgHBRPWUByfqgcNFQ.text: Wonderful food, I highly suggest the fire cracker shrimp or Habanero wings. Great service, shout out to Chanel for the amazing first impression and Donna for the outstanding service as well. Bahama Breeze the place to go! I wish we had one in Arizona!

4lKovUjO9OvYGcIVEYhFhQ.text: Had a good dinner out. There was half price appetizers and drink specials from 4-6.  Isha was our server and she was very nice and on top of everything.  Will definitely be back to try some of their drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plain butter linguini with shrimp

CuXlONKj5YUn3klXJ888JA.text: Friends in town from Australia. Took them to one of our favorite restaurant and everything looked the same, everything sounded the same, but nothing tasted the same. What happened to the Bahama Breeze. The starter, Jerk Shrimp, was a sweet garlic white buttery sauce with a small loaf of bread. What happened. Not the same. Our guest had Pork Medallions and Sweet Potatoes. She also ordered some Shredded Pork. It didn't agree with her. Has Bahama Breeze changed owners or is it just my imagination.

PrrGZv1BstD7vuzj7UcSZQ.text: Absolutely amazing. Damn good food. Every dish was delicious. The drinks were perfect. Great service. Great atmosphere.  Love this place.

g40Rs2Gdaw2ebRkKmjzk7w.text: Nothing special today but wanted to try something different, it had been a while since we had tried this place.   Walking in, not a lot people here, about half full, we were seated and it was a while before our server showed up. She got our drink order and away she went.   We finally got our drinks and we placed our app order, we got the spinach dip and chips, spinach  with artichokes in a creamy cheese dip was good! We also got a nacho made with plantans, this was good and a bowl of seafood chowder, also good.   About here, I decided I wanted one of their specialty drinks so I picked out the blue hawaiian or something like that but after 25 minutes we had to ask for it again and when it came, tall skinny glass, I think maybe four sips and it was gone!   For main fair, I got the mahi mahi. It was good but our food and drinks took so long coming we both felt like leaving! My husband got the shrimp and cheesy grits, it was good.   Finally when she came to ask about dessert we just handed her the bank card and said bill please!

Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

z2SMeOM0Gt2u9kzgUUTFhw.text: Awesome place located on paradise awesome drink a must to visit.  The food is very good to, parking is ok.

zF6LgTvvGco1W6kyi5fr-Q.text: This place gets 2 stars for their drinks and appetizers. Every hot dish we ordered came to the table at room temperature, at best. The only item that arrived hot was the empanadas. We also ordered the stuffed plantain and it was super salty. Sadly we won't be returning.

x34PsV1YBpgXpEcvk5tqeA.text: Good location away from the middle of the strip. Ample parking. Went with a large group and was seated in the outside patio. Had a fire going and there was live music. The atmosphere was very nice.   The waiter took our drink order right away. Great selection of fancy drinks.   I had the Coconut Shrimp with extra broc instead of the rice. The Coconut Shrimp was outstanding. It came with 7 very large Shrimp and I could not eat them all.  Would be plenty large to split with someone else. It came with a salad that was good but nothing special.   The rest of my table had the Chicken that was served with mashed potatoes and corn. They all said it was very good. The serving was enormous and easily could be shared.   Overall a very good experience. I would eat here again. The atmosphere is casual, the service is good and efficient and the food was tasty.

IX7TvAWGVDonMVRMntlOOA.text: First of all our waiter Charles T. was one of the best. The atmosphere is very beachy. Loved the food! We got an appetizer of lobster and shrimp quesadillas that were awesome. The hibiscus and mango margaritas were decorated so beautifully and tasted great. Very good prices for being so close to strip.

dF2MxB6D4h2-15w2sSPQyw.text: Place rocks so much food and service was great I will definitely be back here and special drinks they make are wonderful

UPTTSzcd-cQGhoqv5a33uA.text: Good vibes. Great food. Phenomenal service. Counch fritters x Reggae Punch for the win!

T_pjGBTnr2yi9a5OzSlqPA.text: Have always liked Bahama Breeze, We love there pasta dish's and of course are big fans of the Half price happy hour Sunday - Thursday.  You can not go wrong with that deal. Being a member of the email club you will receive a $10 off coupon about once per month.

fuYfycO5QjClNZ9fkCFdYw.text: I come here once every year...once out of curiosity and the rest I was forced to do so because I was threatened with a free meal. This place reminds me more of San Diego and not the Bahamas. Service here isn't consistent. Good servers, bad servers and the in-betweens. The food is quite average. I've had great meals when I went to Bahamas so I'd always hope they'd remind me of my trip. They have conch fritters but it's disappointing. I must say their drinks are pretty solid though. Here's some that I've tried:   Yaka Hula Hickey Dula: Riesling, pineapple juice and dark rum. I like pineapple/pineapple juice, I like Riesling, rum is ok. Nice fruity but strong drink. 5/5  Ultimate Pina Colada: Captain Morgan rum, strawberry and pineapple ice and dark rum. It's like drinking a smoothie - not much alcohol here. 4/5  Crispy Onion Rings: Large onions rings breaded with Panko and coconut flakes. The sauce is a sweet mustard...I'm not a fan. 2/5  Coconut Shrimp: Shrimps breaded with coconut flakes, citrus-mustard sauce on the side. This is supposed to be a best-seller. I'm still not a fan. 2/5  Beef Empanadas: Fried dough filled with beef and potatoes.  Comes with mango salsa and a dipping sauce. Forgettable. 2/5  Tostones with Chicken: Fried plantains with sweet peppers, mushrooms, chicken, cheese and tomato salsa. Biggest mistake and probably the worst item on the menu. I love tostones and this was a major let down. There's so much going on with this dish. 1/5  Shrimp Creole Bowl, Chicken Curry: Nothing to write home about. 2/5  Chicken Tortilla Soup: Chicken breast, tortilla strips, carrots, roasted corn, avocado and lime. This is my go-to menu item when I don't feel like wasting my calories. 4/5  Big Island: Chocolate mousse, brownie, milk chocolate sauce and vanilla bean anglaise. Chocolate mousse and vanilla anglaise are yummy...the brownie, not so much. 4/5  Warm Chocolate Pineapple Upside Down Cake: Warm chocolate cake with a pineapple ring on top and a molten chocolate center, raspberry sauce and fruits on the side. I love pineapple, I love chocolate but I do not love this dessert. If there's rum in this cake, it would've been delicious. 3/5  I've come here and have tried a lot of things on their menu but I just couldn't find anything that's good. I only come here for the liquid diet: soup and alcohol...and maybe the Big Island too. I'm just not in love with this place at all.

ACPm5mgAAV845XTHLdi74w.text: Tim is an awesome server who deserves corporate recognition the general manager is also super helpful she had put together a catering order for me that was absolutely delicious and on point as well as economical. The ultimate compliment was many guests felt that thought that it was a home cook meal.

J16Aw7tNYjtglv2dmIVDsw.text: Amazing experience and pricing better than restaurants  on the strip! I liked the island music and the relaxed vibe! I felt like I was on a tropical vacation. Lobster Mac and cheese was delicious and the drink in the pineapple hit the spot. I recommend.

Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Mac &amp; Cheese

OH7UYncAuXNssNklZFH2ig.text: I'm reviewing this place mostly for their amazing happy hour!  First of all it's a bahama themed restaurant for eating island favorites, tapas, and even drinking. I'm a big fan of their appetizers alone. During happy hour, all appetizers are half off so that's what my friends and I usually do. They also have a to-go menu for those on a tight schedule and wanna grab and go.   This is to get an idea of their schedule: Store Schedule // Sunday - Saturday: 11AM - 12AM Happy Hour // Monday - Friday: 4PM - 6PM Late Night Happy Hour // Sunday - Thursday: 9PM - 12AM  Happy Hour includes these appetizers to much on (and the portions are pretty big): -Beef Empanadas -Firecracker Shrimp -Chicken Quesadilla -Firecracker Shrimp Street Tacos  -Pork Carnitas Street Tacos  -Adobo Chicken Street Tacos  -Lobster & Shrimp Quesadilla  -Skillet Simmered Jerk Shrimp  -Coconut Shrimp -Jumbo Lump Crab Stack  -Warm Spinach Dip and Chips  -Jamaican Chicken Wings Tostones with Chicken  -Crispy Onion Rings  -Habanero Chicken Wings  SO MUCH VARIETY HONESTLY. GOOD PRICE FOR GREAT QUALITY!  The place is clean, especially their bathroom, and I've heard their drinks are pretty amazing (they also have hand-crafted drinks for happy hour).  I recommend this place if you're hungry at night and looking for something cheap for big amounts to fill you up! Also, just go to their happy hour!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great for happy hour!

zXN161rHeMtDamRF20pPpA.text: A little Caribbean in the desert. This is one of my favorite restaurants since I moved to Vegas. The restaurant has a relaxing feel and good music. They have a great selection of tropical drinks. I love the food and have probably ordered everything on the menu. My last visit I had the smothered pork chop lunch special and it was delicious!

MFbpf-c8NjhhNrsyeCgGLQ.text: Went for a birthday during late night happy hour and the place was great! The happy hour menu is definitely a bonus, not many places you can find $5 specialty cocktails. I ordered coconut shrimp, which was way too crunchy for my liking, but the lobster quesadilla was good and both dips were great as well. Someone in my party ordered the Rum Flight, said it wasn't worth it drink wise, but for the price it was right.

-WwB89VdOVnm0AZzL_HeQQ.text: Great place to eat off the Vegas strip. Huge portion for the price. Would be coming back whenever I am in Vegas again.

MrUpA8t7WBMBbVk3LCfOxA.text: This place is fantastic. Everything has a complex flavor profile. The meat melts in your mouth. My favorite part of the meal were the beef empanadas. They are MUST try. I ordered "taste of Jamaica", jerk chicken pasta, curry goat  bowl, beef empanadas, and the chocolate island. The service was good. There wasn't a wait and we were seated immediately. The only thing I disliked was the plantains. They were too sweet and tasted just like bananas, which I also dislike. I cannot wait to return.

eJdO4swtTjVvreMVFvzzFw.text: We love this place! Food is always great, especially the shrimp firecracker, staff is friendly and the atmosphere makes you feel like you're not in Vegas anymore. Their alcoholic drinks are always awesome! I definitely recommend this spot especially lunch time on a Sunday afternoon! Just relaxing to sit in the patio with a drink in your hand and great food in front of you!

EgRUGjVHl8voA2BAJejeIQ.text: I have been to this restaurant many many years ago and did not enjoy my experience. Fast forward I decided to try it again for the heck of it. Went there to celebrate my mother's and niece's birthday. the restaurant was lively, bright and inviting. On  One side of the restaurant it appears that they were setting up a live band. But we got seated on the opposite side of the restaurant so I did not get to experience that. I told the waiter that we were celebrating 2 birthdays. The 1st thing he told me was we don't offer a free dessert but you and more than welcome to purchase. O...k..Never in my life has any restaurant  Ever said that to me .   The menu was filled with options. May be a little too much. Multiple multiple tropical drink selections but I still ended up ordering just a plain old red stripe beer. As a Jamaican family, we had high hopes. We hoped that they had changed their recipe from many years ago and was excited to order mostly Jamaican items. Beef empanada ( ) . I'm assuming their version of a beef patty....nope.  Oxtail nope , mutton..nope.  No rice and peas. ! No spice ! Sigh...  Not for me.  The lobster shrimp quesadilla was nice though

jVXq1AgGcp9I8e0FXkUU-w.text: Maybe 3 stars isn't nice, but not all places deserve 4 or 5. I'm getting picky.  My husband loves this place and we've eaten here nearly every day this week. And that's ok.  He likes the Cobb Salad with jerk chicken added, plus feta cheese,  no bacon.  This time I got a grilled honey chicken dish with mashed potatoes.  It was fine.  Not incredible. We like to sit at the bar, you always get better service when you sit at a bar. The staff here is always great and the various drink options look tasty!

2gG-KBjMDnNv4sjg8f0Gjg.text: Terrible service. Our server, Pierra, had no personality and very short and abrupt. We had a party 13 reserved for a birthday, but there wasn't a table ready, nor was there a table big enough to have our party sit together. So we were split into two tables. I ordered a applewood bacon and cheese burger, it came with no bacon or cheese. They did get the no onion correct though. When I informed the server about my burger, she didn't take my burger back, but later brought me a plate with a piece of cheese and bacon melted on it! And said, "this is hot." Another one in our party had hair in his. Yet another ordered a salad that was supposed to come before the meal but came after the main portion. I would NOT recommend this restaurant.

D-sd4ijYoMgT6kpMUyJPrg.text: If yelp would let me give 3.5 stars, then this would be the perfect example of a place that has met this criteria. When you walk in, the aura is very inviting and open. Not too loud music, or bright lights, or busy. The hostess was very kind and helped us get seated promptly (went around 9pm). Overall our stay wasn't horrible, nor too great. For the cons, they're only 2; upon getting our food selections, the portion was way too small or the price was way high. All dishes are approximately $20, not including tax or tip. I get this is a mid-tier restaurant, but I was hoping for a section with smaller portions that's backed up with a smaller price. Granted, there is a "half portion" option for most food items, but it's only $2/$3 cheaper...my rationale was might as well get the full portion. Best bang for your buck. Also, number two, our waiter never checked up on us until we had to flag him down just to get our check and let him know that we were ready to leave. Nevertheless the atmosphere is wonderful and the food is delicious. If you can overlook that most of the food is on the pricier side for what you're given, then give this place a shot for big gatherings.

6Dafc2t4OPCQKHtfYc3_uQ.text: - Nice place, definitely have a friendly staff food is pretty good, and  prices are average. I've been here twice already but it's not my favorite place. I'd have to be in the mood to eat here . The drinks are bomb though aha.

vIivvgsZ2TGsaqKYGBxW1Q.text: Really nice place. My friend always visit this place and requested me to come. Nice coctails. Blue one is semi sweet refreshing. Salad with shrimps was good too. And we ordered salmon. We left this place satisfied.

4Aw9d-RrItQ70vqjHSjdKw.text: Aww SNAP, go visit LUIS at the outside bar.    Yep, that's how I'm starting this review.  So, me and some friends were looking to have a GREAT margarita since it was Cinco De Mayo (you know being in the spirit of the 'holiday'.  We found ourselves at Bahama Breeze, to to grab a drink or two and listen to the band.  I'm glad we went, it's always the nights that are NOT planned that you have the MOST fun.  We seat ourselves at the outside bar, there was an island band playing that night.  FYI: There's a live band every Friday...ok, so at the bar get the menu and see that they have a special for the night $5 Margaritas (Mango, Classic, Strawberry and 2 other flavors).  6 Margaritas and a chicken quesadilla later we were SAUCED and that's when the night got live.  The band was cool, it was a Caribbean themed band that week.    This review is not about the food or the band, even though BOTH were great, this review is about the BARTENDER LUIS @ the outside.  Out of this world customer service, he was definitely in charge of his bar that night.  Not only assisting in making the drinks for the servers, he still maintained a great quality of service that he provided to us at the bar.  Very attentive to all, even took a moment to crack a joke or two with the folks at the bar.  I LOVE service like this, it makes me come back on the regular.  I will definitely be back soon, no need to wait for the hostess to seat, I walking straight to the outside bar to go hang with LUIS!  Go visit him, he's really cool.  I promise this is not personal review, I did not know Luis until last week.  Good thing I was looking for a great margarita because I found one and it was accompanied by an AWESOME person/bartender.

MNGkCvzYSFKgJkadZNxd6A.text: It's a fun hang-out, as long as your expectations are managed.  It's basically TGIFridays or Applebee's, but with a more exotic menu.  The service is hit or miss. But if you just want a bite after work and you are nearby, you could do worse.  Stick to the basics, and don't be too adventurous, and you'll be alright.

Fcrox1uYGk81hQbF57ZD1g.text: We were there last night  The dinner came out while we were still eating the appetizer. We specifically asked that they wait.  Food was just OK. The happy hour Margarita was awful. Tasted sweet and sugary.

NOZhkgOinqCLGOsDxICW1Q.text: This more than a food review.  On May 4 I went here to go to dinner with two friends.  Well without going into a long story --I had an diabetic episode with very low blood sugar.  These symptoms are similiar to a stroke so needless to say I was not in good shape. I would just like to give great THANKS to the staff who helped me and my friends with it.  They handled everything with professionalism and kept the situation calmed -- which could not have been easy on a busy Sat night. After the EMTs left I was able to stay for dinner which was great.  So THANKS to the crew who worked this night.  You all rock!!  As usual the food and atmosphere is great.

6YE7FjkFMPaWLKDKHsfj7Q.text: I had a voucher for $25 for Darden Restaurants and from the choices available, I opted to try Bahama Breeze.  I arrived about 5:15 and was seated in a rather empty restaurant except for a private party in one room.  I was seated immediately and my server, Mike, came over and ask for drink order and let me know if I had any questions about the menu to ask.  He got my iced tea.  I ordered a cup of black bean soup and the coconut shrimp.  The bean soup was brought in a short time drizzled with a back and forth with a cilantro-crema.  The crema didn't really give the soup any flavor.  It seems it was more decorative than functional.   The main course--coconut shrimp--was brought with the correct amount of break between appetizer and main.  The shrimp were good and it had been quite awhile since I had coconut shrimp which I like.  It was served broccoli and yellow rice.  The shrimp were good but I think it would be better as an appetizer than a main.    For dessert, I got the chocolate island, a dessert the menu describes as "rich chocolate mousse on a fudge brownie island in chocolate sauce and vanilla bean anglaise."  It was a very good dessert and the best part of the meal.  Mike's service was very good.  My iced tea was refilled without asking.  Bahama Breeze was an OK place.

oApB-FdS95X-VA31NUWViQ.text: Alicia and Rj took great care of our big group tonight with kids and it wasn't easy but they made it look easy. So grateful for the experience

CvNN5DZsaWTQkloJODM8TA.text: At Bahama Breeze with ky mom. The food is great and the Happy Hour. Our server JD is great. 15 years of service.

6byVhWQ7MA_EzkTjxdAQSw.text: Located next to the Marriott Residence Inn. If you're a patron of the hotel, you can get 25% at this restaurant which is why I'm giving this place 4 vs. 3 stars. Cute, chill, island ambiance. Good service. Just missed the mark with the food. Crabstack- so, the wording "premium crab" got me salivating. Sadly, both the shrimp and crab we're tasteless and you can taste that it was probably defrosted as the shrimp was a bit soft. The mango and avocado added to it was the best part.  Stuffed plantain bowl- we requested adobo chicken instead of beef. Mixed with rice , beans, onion, peppers, mushroom, rice, etc. It had a good flavor, but we could've done without the onions and peppers. Key lime pie- definitely tart which is why they have a thick layer of meringue on top to offset the tartness which I didn't really care for. I liked the berry and passionfruit(?) Sauces on the side to eat the pie with.

So-O56aOanh5laRneuvMuA.text: The Service was great!  We went to lunch with two first timers that turned 21 year olds. The drinks were good and appetizers and entrees were tasty. I would recommend the empanada, the jerk chicken wings, the jerk chicken pasta and the oxtails. Everything was seasoned well. We will be back!

SOz5f0DXttmlZlP2lEek_Q.text: Love the salad variety here and the seafood. The first time we ate here it was raining and for some reason the water started dropping from the roof to our table. We had to move to a diff table halfway to our lunch - the waiters tried to add buckets  in between our seats. Overall I would come back.

_W6l_uk4xNv_ZyIUrzdXiw.text: This is not the first time I visit the Bahama Breeze. A very good casual restaurant with decent food and good service. This time, I actually get to write a review and it is quite a pleasant one. Ordered a Cubano sandwich that came with fries and lots of ham and sauces that the sandwich had. A very substantial portion, by the way. Will definitely bring more people to this place as it does deliver the Bahama Breeze experience.

RNTcQiOX3AZvNg40VuUfWg.text: Bahama Breeze has foods from all over the Caribbean and has generous portions too. The food is fresh and flavorful and so delicious. The dessert was amazing and enough to feed 2 or 3 people (I had the key lime pie). They also have happy hour from 4-7 pm where appetizers are 1/2 off. Great place to go any day of the week.

Uo0vJSAoI-Skw8CZeSfZHw.text: Hearty food, good flavor and good quality.   I wasn't dazzled but I left full. The Jerk chicken pasta was great but Huge! Service was good and ample free parking.   I kinda felt like I was in an all inclusive resort in the Bahamas. Anyway, I would eat here again but I wasn't blown away.

OiuLIz2STu_lDoklvo8SyA.text: Food was delicious! Atmosphere was great! Greeters were nice & quick to seat us...we saw the waitress twice: 11 minutes after we were seated (took out drink order & food order) and at the end of the meal when we asked for our check. Unless there was a party outside we didn't know about it wasn't busy...where was she?

qadzAGXYIeA_AbRtKEXxJw.text: Absolute worst service ever. I was dining alone light night. I woke up out my sleep craving jerk chicken wings. My waiter was so rude. I should have never tipped him. I believe his name was Marcus. Light skin black guy with a short curl. I felt as if he was purposely ignoring me. He got my order wrong was very arrogant. He checked on other tables but only stopped at my table to take my order and deliver my check. Another waiter actually brought out my food. "Marcus?" Checked on his other tables multiple times while passing my by & not making eye contact his attitude sucked.

pSxbaIE4vGVi43OOnq8HDw.text: Amazing service, great cocktails and very good food. Our wonderful waitress Sarah L. was so gracious and so very helpful with the menu and with the cocktails selections.  We can't wait to stop by and to enjoy this place on our next trip to Vegas. Ample free parking. Romantic dining. Your favorite other will be very happy. We would love to have this Bahama Breeze in Riverside, California.

Bz7a2U9T7li6-VeJsZk7kA.text: Went with two other couples. This was my first time here. The noise level is LOUD especially the music. It was almost impossible to carry on a conversation. We ordered drinks which were ok. I ordered paella. Ugh. It tasted like they opened a can of Spanish rice and tossed in some seafood and sausages. My spouse ordered a fish dish which was pretty much like the paella was unimaginative. This is a place I'd drop in for drinks and a appetizer but sitting down for a main meal I wouldn't recommend. The server was very attentive and the service was good.

TdzvdYCzJnlfmnp3fvraAA.text: I'm a Caribbean girl that cannot get enough of sweet Bahama Breeze. I always make an extra effort, to dine in here when I visit Vegas. Another 5 Star visit on a warm Saturday night. I made a reservation a couple days ahead, for myself and a few of my girlfriends. I was just a little disappointed that they didn't have the Reggae band playing.   Overall the service was outstanding. Our waiter was very attentive & efficient.  Now to the delicious food. Here's what we opted for: Taste of Jamaica -  Awesome jerk pork, jerk chicken, beef empanada, callaloo, sweet plantains, white rice and black beans. Respek the flavor. Love, loved it.  My very favorite is the Lobster & Shrimp quesadillas. This is a must try. There's no other like it. Two thumbs up! Caribbean style lobster Mac&Cheese -  Lightly fried lobster tail with Bahamian mac & cheese. AMAZING!   Drinks Goombay Smash - very strong but good.  Yaka Hula - Bacardi Black Rum, pineapple juice for a tropical tribute to Island romance. This sweet cocktail was inspired by a Hawaiian love song. Excellent drink. One of my favorites. Pineapple Coconut martini- This is one Sexy drink. Loved it.  My fellow yelpers, I would not steer you wrong, if you're tired of buffet food, fancy expensive hotel dining, come to Bahama Breeze. Prices are very reasonable. Trust me, you won't be disappointed. I will always be a returning customer.

7UR7t0LVZQW8ZVqzNcx-Ng.text: Happy hour is from 4-6 or 9-11p weekdays. There are plenty of $5 drinks and $5 appetizers as well. Food/drinks are tropical inspired delicious. Cajun shrimp and pina colada were my favorites. Very fun atmosphere. Try to get there early since it will get very busy. Huge parking lot and staff so friendly.
