Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5uVPfjyxCFKb9kSGs3SpyA.text: So second time here.. our server LJ was amazing! He had great energy! Even though we weren't his original table he decided to help us out since no one has came around, and I'm glad he did! He was very attentive. The drinks were on point this time! I feel like my first time it was a new bartender who didn't know her drinks very well..  I ordered the chicken quesadilla, and it wasn't the best.. I did just get it plain which could do a lot with it, but I just wasn't a fan of the chicken. Overall this time was way bette than the first. I'm glad I decided to go back because the cocktails are delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One Love cocktail and happy hour tequila shots! (:

kr_6YI20GthDSZYInlGcRw.text: I usually hit this place up while in Vegas. Solid and tasty food, decent happy hour and the drinks are pretty spot on (though, they do batch everytjing which is kind of meh)  Service has always been borderline, but edges into decent once they warm up to you. I have no delusions--it is Vegas and people are s****y on the regular, so I never expect any server or bartender to be amazingly personable right off the cuff.  If you are in Vegas and looking for a break from the smoke and the sounds of gambling machines, hit this place up!

xN0vcN9wXhgVMi-56jHHig.text: If You Like Pina Colada...  Stopped by "BB" during a quick lunch break and was was extremely impressed how quick service was considering the decent amount of guest dining.   I ordered the Skillet Jerk Shrimp and it was delicious and flavorful. I enjoyed dipping the bread into the skillet to soak up the jerk flavor! Yummy!  The firecracker shrimp was pretty good as well. Golden brown fried to perfection.  I wish I could have added a little rum in my Pina Colada but for a virgin it was still pretty fruity and refreshing.  $25.00 later I'm satisfied!  Of course I'll return especially for Happy Hour

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Firecracker Shrimp (mild) $11.49
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet Simmered Jerk Shrimp $12.29

70IxFXgeSBUDP07KmD8bGg.text: This place never disappoints. I eat here every time I come to Vegas. Thia trip I had a crab cake with cilantro lime dressing. It was delicious as I expected! The almond crusted salmon was fresh, flaky, and cooked just right.   I can drink their coconut mojitos over...and over...and over!!   Our waiter, Jessie, was the best! He was helpful in referring foods to my friend and kept us laughing the entire time we were there.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best waiter ever!
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab cake with delicious cilantro lime dressing

N0g281O1DAFllXwQkCnfMA.text: Highly disappointing! I'm a researcher and please believe I did my due diligence to see what was popular, and what everyone loves here. I had the Beef empanadas (they were ok) shrimp pasta (super bland and watery so I sent it back) and my friend had the fried chicken (plate was super cold and we had to send it back). I then got the jerk shrimp appetizer and it was fine but nothing to write home about.  Not authentic Caribbean in any way shape or form. I did like the music and the ambiance as cool. Also my server was very nice so those are the two stars! Not coming here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xtm35QAKpRpb7ScAzJWcuA.text: This place was a 10/10 I came here with my sister and my mom (they ate here before in Florida) and I have never been! It was so good i got the chicken with mashed potatoes and cilantro sauce! It was to die for! The service was great too! Our waiter was friendly and nice, always checked up on us! Loved it here!

MM0b_GVeHc6C2Au3Wbo7uA.text: Great service, the cocktail sampler is a fantastic idea (try it!), the food is good but don't expect crazy Caribbean flavors - I'd say this place is 80% American (with a matching quantity-priority) and 20% Caribbean both in its selection and its flavors. Nevertheless, a good experience for the moderate price.

pee7O5Qt1j_yjVBI5Ro4WA.text: We went for happy hour and it was pretty good. Service was good and drinks and food were great. Between two people we got three drinks and 4 appetizers and it was way too much food, especially since we were traveling.   We got the carribean wings and they were larger than expected, so we should have ordered 4 instead of 8.   Overall I liked this place but I would not have ordered so much.

-p_Csn97hWmGO4PpTBiz-g.text: This is a great restaurant to take friends visiting from out of state, since it's near the strip. The food is Caribbean style, so it's something a bit out of the ordinary. I love the jerk chicken pasta! The jerk seasoning is very close to the flavor I have had while in Jamaica. It has a creamy alfredo type sauce with bow tie pasta. They also have amazing cocktails.  The mojitos are deliciously made with fresh fruit. But be careful, these drinks are strong! For the non alcoholic side, try the strawberry lemonade. It comes hand made, fresh and delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spinach dip
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Indoor patio

LI3SC80myV35qVemFE_lKQ.text: the service was good at the bar and the waiter was helpful through a lot of questions by the group. I had the crab and avocado salad. It was very flavorful and enjoyable. very fresh, great option for a menu. it was a bit on the pricey side for the portion, but I wouldn't want the quality to be any less. the pumpkin seeds were a great add to the dish. everyone's food looked appetizing in the group and the drinks were also enjoyed by those having alcohol. we also had one person order the jalapeno mojito and the spice was overpowering. they did the right thing and took it back, making a new drink.

YsmuxvrXZm8TefnD9dLaMw.text: First time here for happy hour and got coconut shrimp and jumbo lump crab stack, soooo good! Definitely coming back for more Mon-Fri 4-6pm

OLb6aXoT4uNTx_Fc1cen0A.text: Food was very good. I checked out the drink menu and was amazed at how many cocktails they have. I was still recovering from the night before of drinking, so I did not order a drink.

6cxS_dbxq58crOrUyzdb4g.text: Tried this spot out this week and was pretty good except the steak didnt have any flavor but the jerk wings were good the firecracker shrimp was good .. would come back again to try some other stuff here lots of selections on the menu

POIlu1atMRkRbXYi__xCkw.text: Delicious food. I had the chicken tortilla soup and the jerk chicken sandwich. My husband had shrimp tacos and asparagus. Everything was perfectly seasoned, and the lunch portions were just right.

V4tkNaCSSiN3o-h0hzv32w.text: Love this place.    Awesome drinks and food.   Coconut shrimp app was great.   Salmon tostada also great.    Super fresh and salmon cooked perfectly.   Christine B was a great server very helpful and quick and anticipated out needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Key lime pie
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon tostada salad

26_E5TrfD-1ItRahpL2_Hw.text: I actually really like the food and drink here. 5 stars for that! Liked it so much that I have been trying to bring my wedding party and guests here for our rehearsal dinner.  But 3 strikes for me is enough however.  Trying to book this has been the worst experience of planning our entire Vegas wedding. We have been put on hold for 10/20 min a time only to get someone that can't help us, doesn't want to help us, nor doesn't seem like they have any interest in working with us. Rude, don't care, unhelpful, constant runaround. Not a problem, we'll take the business of 25 guest we were going to come in with and enjoy food and drinks elsewhere. A little foolish on their end if you ask me... good luck with that attitude

9hKgscKYAvEHCDhSQ8O9JQ.text: We went to happy hour there yesterday afternoon. We used to go quite often and just fell out of the habit. We had forgotten how good the food and service was. I had a well made Manhattan. Food was great. We will be back soon.

g6K2TNHbocKR_nOsBWNF_w.text: The portions are so huge for a happy Hour menu and they are half off. The drinks are only $4.. I ordered the Skillet Simmered Jerk Shrimp -  large  shrimp in a garlic-thyme butter with warm Cuban bread for dipping. It was good and I wanted to get more but found out the portion was big enough for me. I had the frozen Bahamarita that has  Cuervo Gold Tequila, strawberry, kiwi and mango ices. My friends liked their food too. Richard our server was great, very attentive and made sure we were good. The place has a tropical feel and very airy, spacious. It is great for parties and you get tables for happy hour menu, it's not only at the bar.

HUmwbGXIDrqYpNsucfhWSA.text: Drinks were good. Food was overrated and over priced. I really do not understand the raving reviews regarding the shrimp and lobster quesadilla. Mediocre is being generous. Firecracker shrimp was decent. Not sure if I will return based on the food. Outside enclosed patio area is super cute though.

Ix8IGIdEhzxi_UvlpT5cpA.text: This restaurant is so beautiful on the outside and inside. The aesthetic of the place is so calm and peaceful. Now the food is amazing. The taste is so authentic and makes me want to go back for more!

84NKRbYc-i5XCWjv_U0Phg.text: Nice place! Christine B was an amazing server. I will return. If you want to come for a nice casual dining experience with great drinks, you should come here. The food is served at a decent pace, it come out nice and fresh and they make sure to keep you satisfied. I loved my server and the food was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Habanero wings. They were amazing.
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KuetBdSMujvn408P1mAwfA.text: Good food and a pretty friendly staff, but they were very aggressive about asking us over and over again if we were ready to order. We had our own server as well as another server who didn't seem t to like the pace at which we read the menu and made our choices. Good restaurant, but the service was a little too corporate and too focused on turning our table around, rather than on hosting a good meal.

3w5GBSYMHn4T1SDy9Zb5lA.text: The extra star is for our excellent service- To be honest the food was "alright".  Alexis was very personable and informative. I was so pleased to have observed her equally attentive and welcoming service to all customers. My husband and I often go out and its rare and rewarding to get great service. Thank you.

K5zSvCxv74uBo7YRib6G5Q.text: Located a little south of the strip but a True hidden gem. The prices were reasonable. We went during lunch. The Cuban sandwich was delicious. The house salad was amazing. My sister recommends the beef empanadas. Coconut shrimp were cooked to perfection. The drinks...they were amazing. Very tropical and fruity and you cannot taste the alcohol. Indoor and patio seating. It was great to be able to enjoy the warm weather. This will be a place we definitely will be coming back to and sharing with our friends.

YYal5L32M0cEdTnkpORqyQ.text: What a great experience we had here tonight. After being seated, our knowledgeable server Margo pointed out some great starters and  answered any questions about the menu. We started with salads that were crisp and fresh with a chunky and creamy blue cheese dressing. The pepitas on top gave some extra crunch.I had the jerk shrimp off the appetizer menu as my main course. It was a generous portion cooked in a savory broth with plenty of spice and diced tomatoes on top. Hubby enjoyed his ribs with a tasty and unique sauce. It was served with a slaw that had jicama, cilantro, and probably jalapeno, yum! Great food, great service, great atmosphere! Can't wait to come back!

Yn7zb2QNhmWsv7g49z-wWA.text: Food was good, Beef empanadas were fabulous with the pineapple chutney. I like the Caribbean decor, makes me want a vacation away from this desert scenery.

mBqkXUF8_xYVYAiT68Mw_A.text: Not what it used to be. Ghetto, bad service, gross food. And I used to love coming here, my last visit was very disappointing, I won't be returning anytime soon.

59Arr9vlUOZWMvICdDbLkQ.text: LOVE the beachy island vibe here! Live reggae band on saturdays & they aren't just ok, they are amazing!!! The delicious cocktails are just 7.99! We got appetizers & salads, everything was yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oepzo8hXM1eAlZ02f98pvg.text: This was my first time in this restaurant. I went on Sunday and it was pretty calm , not too many people inside. I had drinks, an appetizer, entree, and desert.   Drinks: Frozen Bahamarita - delicious Ultimate Pina Colada - just OK. I wish it was in a bigger class  For an appetizer I had the Adobo Chicken Taco. It was good. I liked how it had a little crunchiness to it. It was a little cold though  My entree was the Island Hopper and included onion rings, conch fritters, coconut shrimp, and Jamaican jerk wings.  I ate half an onion ring, nothing special about those since I cannot stand the taste of onions. The conch fritters should really be called conch balls. I love fried conch from this local place in Miami so that was the main reason why I decided to go with this meal, I was disappointed. They were not horrible but could have been seasoned more and they barely had any conch in them. The coconut shrimp was standard though most of the seasoning was on the outside and not the shrimp itself. Being Jamaican I always go for things that are jerked. These wings were not jerked at all. No spice or kick to them. The sauces that came with the food were soooo good!!!  For desert I had the Banana Nut Bread Supreme. It was delicious. The only negative was the stale, warm, soggy banana slice.  I will definitely be returning

KWX_GOhps9lJrMkyOQw4ow.text: The next time you're in Vegas, (particularly on E. Flamingo) don't fool yourself into thinking that Bahama Breeze is some run-of-the-mill, cookie cutter restaurant, a la Applebee's, Chili's etc...   Simply put: Baham Breeze is the sh*t... mon! I wasn't even hungry and I almost finished my big ass plate of Calypso Shrimp Linguine. Might I add that they use 'Gulf Shrimp' in their shrimp dishes, which if you don't already know ,are not not small shrimp. My wife had the Wood Grilled Tilapia, my son had the Wood Grilled Chicken and my sister had the Jerk chicken and every single one of their dishes were excellent. For appetizers we had the Artichoke dip and the Jerk Shrimp, again both delicious.   So the next time you're in Vegas, get out of your fancy hotel and treat yourself out to something different and worth your money!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk chicken
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wood Grilled Tilapia
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wood Grilled Chicken

4GbneGXe15aA4RAidrqb9g.text: BEST happy hour in Vegas!! $3 for a pint of blue moon (and they have a selection of beer) $5 martini (totally delicious) and their appetizers like Jamaican jerk chicken, empanadas and burger sliders are around $5 as well.  A definite must-try if you've never been!

Cr6sA0D0ywpklJpCtm_ppg.text: Food is great but customer service is terrible here. I am regular customer and call in phone orders weekly. This week I tried to pay over the phone with my card because I left my purse at the office, and they refused to take payment this way. I have done in the past regularly but Dan the general manager says they no longer take credit cards via phone- which apparently changed from the week before. When I told them I was a regular customer and this has never been issue before Dan didn't have the courtesy to come out from back to speak to me in person. When they took my payment because I had my assistant bring my purse they didn't even look at ID- Hello what's the difference? Although I like there food not sure I would go back since experience was so bad.

yGQ7Hmr_dUsWJ5PgF9eRAg.text: Jason and Bob at the bar are awesome people. They make you laugh and offer drinks you may like. They made my decision to sit at the bar every time I go to Bahama Breeze.

wA13xb7gy0vksKz0HgZW5g.text: For a chain restaurant Bahama Breeze was not spectacular nor amazing. Food was good, nothing to write home about. I had jerk chicken which was not as spicy as I'd like but the side of rice and their plantains were very good. Service at lunch time was great, food came quickly, definitely a good spot for grabbing  lunch during a workday. If you're looking for real traditional Caribbean, don't come here. But if you want a chain style Caribbean version, Bahama Breeze is great.

dhoL899HLZ35H3fslIib1w.text: Caribbean Chicken Jerk pasta is good.  Service:  The person that was with me ordered something outside of the menu and the waiter happily searched for it and came thru.   They close at 11pm.

zUykf7zy4kHzaFudbsG9Jg.text: I love the easy going style and comfort of the decor.   A big menu full of choices but no scallops which I was in the mood for.   My wife and I each choose a different fresh fish which came with rice or mashed potatoes and green beans.  We specifically asked to have our veggies cooked and not served crunchy like so many restaurants serve.   The meal did not come with soup nor salad not even bread.  We asked about bread but was told we could order a loaf for extra charge.  I did added a side lobster tail for an extra $9.99.   When our meal came the green beans were not cooked hardly at all.  They did offer to bring more.  Our mash potatoes were warm but not hot.  The fish was good but not great and they forgot my side lobster tail.  The manager came over and apologized which was nice but did not offer anything other than his apology.  I would have declined a free dessert but that would have been appropriate. I have eaten here before and it was better but will probably not go back for a while.

ymFxkyVA9pssL6C1yV6ZLg.text: Went here for a friend's Bday get together and was also my first time here.  Cool, chill, island theme restaurant with very friendly servers.  It's a casual, family style restaurant and not really somewhere you would like to take someone out on a date if you are looking for something quiet to converse because it's pretty loud inside. It's pretty huge inside also, but I don't know how busy this place usually gets.  I doubt you need to call for reservations unless you're planning to come with a big group.  I ordered the coconut shrimp and calamari.  Pretty good but I can't tell you about the other dishes since this is the only one I ordered.  But I'm sure if you come in a big group, you'll end up trying other stuff also.

WWX4qQMrGYgyQVxn37ZVUQ.text: Don't care for this place. Went once, never to return. Service is blah-

wnXpJLLlJb7-iuNmP7J11w.text: I only had time for a beer and appetizer. Unfortunately for me i had tickets to criss angel(wish i had skipped the show and enjoyed a full dinner and a few more beers) i had a pint of aruba red and the buttermilk chicken sliders. Both went very well with eachother and look forward to having again some day. I really hope this chain makes its way over to the east coast.

-zCqMp66iWNGToWfK16HJw.text: We absolutly LOVED this restaurant!! From the beef empanadas, to the baby back ribs, buttermilk fried chicken, seafood paella, and the chocolate island  chocolate mousse!!!!  Yummmmmmmmmm we are definetly going back

0Om4Lr1M18iMd0EiHglAhA.text: It's a typical Darden Restaurant. The server was friendly but not very attentive. A manager approached every table but ours. Our appetizer was missing the sauce and no one stop by our table in between the delivery of the appetizer and the entree. I probably won't return to this location.

15P4MMfdcvKFqraEYYV8kA.text: Good food and great service. Server Jon D was great, had a lot of helpful information and really knew the menu. Came here expecting good jerk chicken but it was just OK. This place has "Caribbean influenced" cuisine. I had the chicken (jerk style) with the roasted corn over potatoes and what i think was a cilantro cream sauce, the dish was very good. I would prefer more of the roasted corn. The combination of the cilantro cream and corn work very well together. The Chicken wings are quite good as well. The food was ok and a star just for the service.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk chicken w/ cilantro cream and corn
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BdB_O3ev3fhJXaQqOsEBrw.text: love the feeling bahamamamabreezetaculars give me. brings me back to when i lived in hawaoo. mood lightened up with the quickness.  i started off with the layered pina coolada. and best brain freeze i ever had immediately ocurred. amaazing.  to feel like a non fatass i started with the tropical salad w mixed greens and veggies and all that bs.. and the chicken by itself was superbilicious!!  wasnt enough so i ordered my fat ass a burger with extra bacon. bada bing!  oh i love the vibe here but i def hate myself after i get out everytime  MUST START: with the layered pina colada  MUST TRY: tropical salad (this by itself is enough for the faint stomached)

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. rd 1
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. rd 2

azEqm8nC94ybIPnf3c4yAw.text: I took my out of town guests here on a Monday evening for dinner. The service was absolutely terrible! There were only a few people in the place and it took them over 15 minutes to sit us. Then it took them more than 20 minutes to get someone to get outer drink orders. No one even spoke to us during that entire time. People were walking past us, but no one even noticed that five people were sitting at a table in the middle of the room. When some one finally did speak to us, she did not know much about the menu items. It took us three hours (that's right, you read that right) to get out of that place! Never again. They may have been short staffed, but I can't believe they would be that rude and ignore their customers. No excuse for this.

9jVv-YjcbE2vXColHwy6ig.text: Had a party of 30 on 6/27 and they were able to accommodate us as a normal reservation. Drinks and food were great! I had a bahama mama drink and was so tasty. Ordered the calypso pasta with shrimp and it was the best tasting shrimp pasta I've ever had even my 3 year old chowed it down. Thank you for your great hospitality and service.

69Bys5XvZiUt-Wlkcz0V5w.text: I will start by saying this place is great I made a reservation for my girlfriend's birthday the staff there is very nice very friendly they even go through the menu with you if you're a first time customer they offer you drinks right off the top and the service is very fast and friendly the food came out shortly after we received our appetizer very presentable on the plate very tasty and exactly what we ordered because it was my girlfriend's birthday they found a man in there who actually has a very nice voice to sing her happy birthday and bring out the pie that she ordered I would definitely recommend anybody coming to Vegas that's never ate at Bahama Breeze to stop in and definitely try their food everything on the menu is very appealing and looks very good our waiter was kind very friendly and definitely deserves a tip that we left him I would say for locals this restaurant is perfect tourist as well it's right near the strip

wrQGz-yKLRVHqHQJgtsHFA.text: I do love Bahama Breeze even if it is a bit of a walk from the Main Strip, Its a Caribbean Style Restaurant which just looks like you've stepped into the Caribbean in Las Vegas, All the staff are really friendly and willing to help, We went on a Sunday evening when it was happy hour 9pm until close they also have it Monday through till Friday from 4pm-6pm and Sunday through to Thursday 9pm until close, I had a 20z Beer in an iced cold glass for $3!!!! They have a great selection of beers and cocktails in the happy hour! No wonder this place was soooo busy! They also have a great selection of appetisers half price so we choose the massive Crispy Onion rings! they were huge and so tasty!!! For the mains i had the Jerk Chicken pasta which was good!!! And my partner had the one of the Burgers which was also huge! The portions here are not small so come on a empty stomachl!! The whole place was buzzing and had a great feel to the place and it was nice to escape from the Strip for a while, They also have live entertainment on some nights including some great Reggae and Caribbean tunes so you can just pretend youre in the Caribbean. If youre planning on taking a visit here  from the Strip i would recommend taking a taxi as it is a bit of a walk and the area can be a little sketchy.

zrdqNDR7RamDYRkU-YJFBQ.text: Best key lime pie EVER!  The coconut shrimp are legendary.  Great service and wonderful cocktails.  I had a small mahi and shrimp rice bowl.  Delicious and left enough room for the pie. Very extensive menu with something for everyone.

O8VGOXvZU4EkXV-AbOx_2w.text: This was the best restaurant I ate at this week. Was better than Gordon Ramsey steak earlier in the week. Plus it only cost me 50 bucks instead of 300. The specialty drinks were delicious. The shrimp tacos were excellent.

BDdOrPKh6GD9UZFmrkm86g.text: I grew up in the South, so I've had some great ribs. When I saw the rum and coke sauce ribs on the menu here I thought it sounded interesting and I gave them a try. They were phenomenal! Seriously like the best ribs I've ever tasted.  The key lime pie was also tasty and my husband and I enjoyed great cocktails, as always. All in all, a wonderful meal!

5nzpFQrTzqoIFELbc37IYQ.text: This restaurant reminded us of another Caribbean style restaurant we enjoyed on the East Coast.  The hostess greeted us right away and there was no wait when we arrived around 5pm on a Sunday. We were looking forward to live music but the musician didn't arrive until we were having dessert.  Service was great. Food was good. The jerk chicken wings and conch fritters came with really good sauces. The chicken adobo street tacos weren't the best. It had a lot of guacamole (I love guac) and it had Crispy tortilla strip at the bottom but there was barely any meat. We ended with a rum cake, which was pretty good. We ordered the Bahamarita cocktail and the sangria. Sangria tasted horrible even after they added more juice to it.  They have a happy hour during the week where they have discounted cocktails and half - off most of their appetizers. We will probably end up going back during happy hour to try the other appetizers.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jerk chicken wings
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken adobo street tacos
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Conch fritters

AnBJ2PtvaQV0cQfZffkP1w.text: My favorite place to come eat in Vegas! The food is just amazing, can't go wrong with the coconut shrimp tacos. Service and ambience was great loved the classic reggae playing. Thanks guys.

LzrIuVKzYVjPYuHX8pbHTQ.text: I love this restaurant  When I want to treat myself or have guests come in to town this is the place that I take them   I found this jewel many years ago and actually had thought about it over the years but could never find it again, after being here a week or two I happened upon it by mistake  A fortuitous drive by  Yay   Now they are always BUSY and it's first come first serve so the wait can be very long  If there's a bar stool empty, we opt for that as there is no wait  Now service at the bar is extremely slow but again, this establishment is extremely busy so I get it  In my opinion the food is worth the wait   I always get the same thing, lobster and shrimp pasta  NEVER disappoints  I'm a garlic addict so I ask the chef for extra every time, it's perfect   Was there last week and first time I've ever gotten a table !! Lol  The waiter was very good, I had friends in town from France and he made them feel very welcomed  Serving them first which I thought was just EXTRA !! ;)   I will be back, and when I get visitors in town, even though this is 18 miles away (in Vegas there's a bazillion restaurants) this is the one we head to. And all my friends love it as much as I do   Nice Ambiance, my only suggestion is to train their staff better  When you check in at the door each time the staff of 3 that are there look overwhelmed and confused....  pretty much every time I go there however, they also informed me there's usually a 2 hour wait for a table, so I guess you can't blame them for feeling overwhelmed   Cocktails and are very good, and in comparison to other establishments here in Vegas near the strip, these prices are very reasonable

aKci2c1WOuK0KIpYvk1amw.text: The food was just ok.  Had a salad and onion rings.......we did order spinach dip for the group and that was solid.   Service was really bad tho........our server was too busy paying attention to others.......he screwed up a few times.....but the big one was when I told him no cucumber since I am allergic.

IwadGDwkqnbPfYRsykRe2w.text: We probably make it here two to three times a year. The restaurant is large enough to accommodate our larger party if our family decides to go there last minute without reservation. Overall, the food is OK, nothing really has ever been mind blowing and nothing has ever been a fail. We like to come here because the restaurant is spacious with a laid back island feel and atmosphere. Service has never been an issue either and we have sat in all areas including the main dining area, the bar area, and in the indoor patio area.  The firecracker shrimp street tacos, the Jamaican chicken wings, and the ahi tuna stack are pretty decent starters. The whole wing is served as the appetizer so be ready to share. For entrees, the paella and the steak oscar have been satisfactory. But the last few visits I have ordered something from the fresh fish menu.  Our last visit was on a Saturday night and we sat in the indoor patio area. They had a gentleman playing live music for our entire stay. The music did not drown out our conversation, but you should request another seat if you would like a more peaceful environment.   For drinks, we had the Yaka Hula Hickey Dula and the Painkiller. Both cocktails were strong but nice mixes with kick from the rum. They were too strong for my wife, so that meant two dinner cocktails for me. I had the sauteed tilapia with chimichurri sauce as my entree. My wife had a turkey burger. My fish was cooked perfectly, moist and flaky with the chimichurri being a nice accompaniment. For dessert, the chocolate pineapple upside down cake was enjoyed by both of us.  As long as Bahama Breeze continues to be consistent, we will keep coming back.

8PmGb08qHKkPoNBxXHAeUw.text: We went here today for lunch (Sunday) and sat out in the indoor patio. The place was not crowded at all and so we got a lot of attention from our AWESOME server, Gerald. He was really silly and down to earth; he didnt have to try to impress us to make us like him! I got a salad with fruit and shrimp and it was heavenly! Got the top shelf margarita as well - it was a little more sour than im used to but was still pretty good. Overall, beautiful restaurant for a calm weekend lunch. We both felt like we were far away from the Vegas desert dining in there!

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Top shelf margarita
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad with fruit and shrimp

9g4w8o8c9aOlFeDpkO15ew.text: While service and the waiter were very friendly and helpful the food was subpar. We just came from the islands and I have to say Bahama Breeze was a total fail. They fried and breaded my wife's lobster and my shrimp  was not very fresh I hardly could even taste the coconut it was stale or old. While the please has the Island vibes it fails to deliver on the food . Sure presentation is well thought but flavor leave a lot to be desired. It's just not comparable.

g67Cqg8cFKiMllCPIVoDwg.text: We had a gift card that was good for one of several different restaurants, including the Yard House and Olive Garden. But the one that looked the most appealing (mostly, since we'd never heard of it) was Bahama Breeze. Seeing that the closest location was the one in Vegas, we saved the gift card for our trip to the Strip.  Walking in this place was like entering into a different world. It was amazing. They don't commit to theme so blatantly like Rainforest Cafe or places like that, but in a natural and organic way where it still feels homey.   The lady who sat us down spent a couple minutes explaining to us what she liked best on the menu. Then, our waiter, Eamon, got over to us and he, too, gave us his take on the menu, breaking down each section, since he knew we had never been there before.   I'm the type of guy that likes to get what's popular at any restaurant, so he informed me that the Jerk Chicken was their best item.   I was hesitant about it, because jerk chicken has not really ever been my style. But with risk comes reward, and this reward was worth it.  The meal ($17) came with three large pieces of bone-in chicken, black beans, rice, and plantains. The chicken was some of the most moist I've ever eaten, and the spices on the chicken loaded it with some amazing flavors without ever being too spicy. You'll definitely remember the taste more than the spiciness. The black beans were probably the best I've had. And the plantains were great (if you like plantains), especially when dipped in the Caribbean salsa that they put there on the plate. The rice was a little too saffrony for me and I wasn't a big fan, but my fiancee loved it.  She ordered the Skillet Jerk Shrimp ($12), which was amazingly tasty! It was jam-packed with flavor, and came with a garlic-thyme butter sauce that I couldn't stop dipping the bread in (her dish came with a roll of bread).   Altogether, this place will now be a mainstay on our trips into town, much like the Peppermill has become. The waiter was amazing and so was all of the food and the atmosphere. The prices, also, were very reasonable--especially considering what town we were in.

gZFO3GHp-7sv6o_sDGAulg.text: I came in for lunch today. Service was exceptional. The pasta dish was delicious. Will definitely be going back. Will probably visit after work for Happy Hour to enjoy the libations.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp &amp; Lobster Linguine

0KrI17j86J7O7_UOORDwcA.text: 5 stars for the customer service but the food just brought I  down to two.. we all go to restaurants for the food, not the workers so I have to be super honest. The food has gone downhill since the last time I've eaten here. Menu looks FABULOUS, great photos, but the food tasted freezer burn/from a box and bland. Very unexpected and disappointing. I literally lost my appetite after trying my dish, it was a rice bowl with mahi and shrimp. So NASTY! I recommend the chicken quesadilla instead, those are tasty. The environment was nice but out dated, I feel it is due for a remodel. When we sat down the dining room was very hot, I noticed many people outside on the patio but I prefer eating indoors. It seemed like they turned off the AC since customers weren't sitting inside(weird). I would give it a try again but stay inside my box and only order items that are safe and hard to ruin. The cocktails and drinks looked great.

SlGLtXFhv8hcBZZtQySIcw.text: This was my first time in Vegas, and the first restaurant, and one of the BEST restaurants we attended while on trip. I kept it simple and ordered the quesadillas, my friend had the shrimp which were big and a generous amount. The food was good and flavorful, BUT the drinks were AMAZINGGGGG!! I'm really into the fruity-tooty, frozen and mixed type drinks, and their menu had plenty of options that were right up my alley. Loved it so much, we made it our last stop before we boarded our rescheduled flight back home.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend had the pineapple. I had the one of the right, may have LITERALLY been the BEST drink I&#39;ve ever tasted!!
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chicken quesadilla

iz3DymkHuvNgczVxBxpwxQ.text: I have been here many times and had one very bad experience. I spoke with Dan the manager and he assured me it wouldn't happen again. We went back last week and Brandon was our waiter. I must say he was awesome. Drinks and food all came in a timely manner and he checked on us many times. This is what I'm used to getting at Bahama Breeze.  I highly recommend this place.  I will be back. Thank you Dan and Brandon.

NC6F3BA5vSbuN6zqVdYK5w.text: We had an all over amazing experience here! Amazing food, great drinks, and the best service we had received anywhere in Vegas! Amazing and fun atmosphere, and friendly staff

Jpu61MmWRH2XEOVdDtRBxw.text: Had a great meal at Bahama Breeze while In Vegas. We had such a great time. But it was mostly due to the great team of Jarrod and Raven. They were the best servers EVER!!   We got there just in time for a GREAT happy hour. We all ordered the pineapple coconut martini. It was the best!! And then got 2 orders of the best coconut shrimp I have ever had. Loved the crunch and the coconut was cooked perfect. The dipping sauce made it taste even better.   We then ordered a bunch of apps and they were all delish too. We also ordered the coconut mojitos. It was like a dessert. Sooooo good.   But our servers Jarrod and Raven made our night even better. They took such great care of us!! They were just amazing. They really know their stuff.   I just wish Bahama Breeze was in California. I have to come all the way to Las Vegas to eat there.

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What&#39;s left of the best coconut shrimp around.

hBH0-B9mfciVGe9nY4TCaA.text: Went here last night & I absolutely enjoyed the food and drinks! Friendly waiter as well

COwlpbnU__nfrSiLTVEK-Q.text: Went here for lunch today after a long day at the Convention Center for the builder's show.  It's approximately two miles away and conveniently located on Paradise and Flamingo.  You walk in and definitely get the vibe of being in the Bahamas.  Fresh water flowing, tropical decor everywhere and many choices of rum mixed drinks with flavors that bring you back to paradise at sea.  Items Ordered: - Firecracker Shrimp (Appetizer) - Jerk Chicken Fettucini (Entree)  My initial appetizer was quite good and I'm not sure what the sauce was made from, but it was very flavorful.  Was definitely in the caliber for bang bang shrimp from Bonefish Grill.  The jerk chicken Fettucini definitely had a nice kick after each bite and made my taste buds crave more.  The portions for both entree and appetizer were extremely generous and I'm so glad I split my meal with my wife.  I really wanted to try the pineapple mixed drink, but unfortunately I was in working hours.  I'd definitely like to come back for happy hour and try other items on the menu.

dsZxbs-3Q0Ge79GyRBZo9g.text: The place really took care of my gluten and dairy intolerances. Service is just excellent. Great ambience for a cozy dinner. Not a crowded place but close to the strip. Good selection of drinks, I got high with just one of their strawberry mojitos. Huge quantities of food too.

ZdKRHTWz_h1KPg-sZ7LdcQ.text: I am a big fan of this place! The restaurant itself is pretty huge and they do a terrific job maximizing the space and setting a great environment. There's a very diverse drink menu for anyone's needs. The Bahamarita is the way to go in my opinion. After two or three, you can't really feel your face. They have an awesome menu as well that has something for just about everyone. My girlfriend never orders anything but the Caribbean Jerk Chicken Pasta, which comes in a huge portion that can be shared or taken home for a second meal. I myself love the Steak Oscar, which is an 8 oz sirloin topped with buttery crab meat. How can you beat that?! They also have a great happy hour for those who are lucky enough to work close to the Strip but luckily, there is a reverse happy hour that starts at 9 as well.

BKtSYHDzgVBjdHZipGYwcQ.text: Seriously one of my favorite restaurants! Always seated right away and the environment reminds me of home  I don't think I'd actually get an entree here but almost all their appetizers are big enough for 2 people to share. Of course, you should always come during their happy hour. Half off appetizers and drinks.  All the times I've been here, our server is always friendly and funny. I also love how it's near the strip but away from the madness. Definitely taking my family and friends here when they come to visit.

4BMizzxTkpGDKJi_ZHj9Wg.text: Our evening didn't start here, my husband and I were out to take my daughter to dinner for her 18th birthday, she decided on Hamada of Japan (DO NOT GO HERE, the service is HORRIBLE). Needless to say we ended up at Bahama Breeze we were seated in the area where there have some steel drums set up and a gentleman playing on them.  We were greeted by our server Ivan who was awesome...GREAT Lobster and Shrimp Linguine and Cuban Sandwiches...OOOH and the house Pina Colada!!!!

xL2fm4BF1VFOigzhBzXr4w.text: My family and I were staying in Vegas for the week and we decided to have my aunts birthday there. This place is hands down amazing! Great selection, cheap drinks and the best service I've had in years!!! The burgers, pasta, and banana supreme is Delicious.  Gerald and Tina were our waiter's. We will definitely be coming back. They also came out with writing on my aunts desert for her bday

photos.caption: Photo of Bahama Breeze - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pLPFDuGYZ4ZKAjRrXOZStQ.text: Bahama Breeze is amazing for happy hour! The prices are so cheap for both drinks and appetizers. They don't just have happy hour on crappy drinks no one wants, you'll definitely want these drinks! I The appetizers are delicious as well, for a good price. Customer service is also great.

Wfaw107A31dN824g2siqzQ.text: We had Isha as our server and she was awesome! Great customer service and awesome food! I would definitely recommend this place ecsepcially for happy hour!

s91KVAa_gaN51WRG5Q9OTA.text: Met up with a friend for Happy Hour.  Service was great!  The place is so much fun, live music, delicious margaritas and appetizers are 1/2 price!  Coconut shrimp, onion rings, street carnitas tacos, spicy jerk shrimp and Empanades all delicious!

BQ8Z0eIpY6nKPruUaQDEuA.text: Had a retirement party for a friend, 20-25 people were there, they shoved us in a small room with the fire pit in the center, some ppl had to stand due to the lack of chairs and tables, the service was absolutely terrible, very slow, some ppl had to go to the bar for their own drinks. My drink was basically a slushy with shot of tequila on the side , I had to drink some of the slush in order to get the tequila to fit in the glass .. Knowing how many ppl were there they only had two servers and one bus boy .. You could tell the girls were over whelmed and it showed in their service and attitude.. Some of the appetizers were bland , such as the spinach artichoke like dip was extremely watery and had ZERO flavor, the smoked wings were tough , the only good thing were the coconut shrimp.. I use like eating there , but after this , I probably won't return .. Party or not !!

sZExZvMj9nHC8uxEY7XxsA.text: I was seriously so disappointed by this place, we are locals and decided to try something new and hit up Bahama Breeze. They had a happy hour special so we got some half off appetizers, the carnita street tacos were good but that was the only good thing about this meal. My mans steak was filled with grissle and his mashed potatoes were generic. My jerk chicken pasta had nothing jerk about it and also very bland. So disappointed we spent $70 there!!!

GALYpU9ciCLzmuUdGbXLaw.text: Cool place to hang out with the family ... Especially if I'm picking up the tab! The place makes you feel like you've escaped to the Caribbean. Cool thing is they have live reggae music at night.

Acx9U_tHffxO5E_AMshX4Q.text: By far this has been one of our favorite places to eat and drink in Vegas.  We come to town about 3-4 times a year for a extended weekend, and Bahama Breeze has always been our most anticipated stops. Something went astray this time.  I ordered my usual ( Cuban Black Bean Soup, and Jerk Chicken Wings), my wife ordered the Portabella Mushroom Burger.  When he explained it was a hamburger, with a mushroom on top, my wife requested just a "burger" made with the Portabella mushroom as the burger.  I guess the special request was just to complicated.  First she got a open faced bun with a mushroom and veggie mix on it.  She requested the same thing again, and this time it came out as she requested, at about the start of the second bite, a small black bug crawled out from under the lettuce and casually walked across the corner of her sandwitch.  We called the waiter, pointed out the intruder, and he promptly took it back. He then asked us if we wanted any desert.  We didn't quite understand the question, so we said no.  He brought us our bill.   We didn't understand.  My wife had had nothing to eat at this point.  We didn't ask for anything else we just thought he would replace her un-eaten sandwich.  The manager did come over and apologize, and told us how sorry he was, but her sandwich was not replaced.   As we were leaving, I told the hostess the story, she hailed the manager who apologized again, but didn't seem to understand when I explained that my wife was leaving your establishment Hungary.  People shouldn't leave a restaurant Hungary.   Not sure if we will try again, just kinda sad that our favorite place, now has a scar.

x0SAQPIqVvxx25PVZueAgA.text: Had a great experience at happy hour except for one thing.  The waitress up sold the group into having our pina coladas in hallowed out pineapples.  But she failed to mention it cost $8 more.  Guess caveat emptor right???  But we all felt she should have mentioned the additional cost as we were ordering off the happy hour menu.  Other than that great service and ambiance the apps were all tasty the jerk chicken wings especially phenomenal

dtK2BP7GV_5a0qM9iWjfjg.text: I've eaten at this restaurant a couple of times and there food is pretty good overall. I like the theme of the place...makes me feel like I'm on a tropical island. I absolutely love their bathrooms...I feel bathrooms say a lot about a restaurant. They were very clean, nicely decorated, full size doors for every stall, big size stalls, and they have mouth wash with individual cups so you can be minty fresh as you leave.  The food:  Lobster and Shrimp Quesadilla- It was good but I imagined something different so it was tasty but I felt it was missing a bit more flavor. Glad I tried it but I'll probably go with something else next time.  Seafood Chowder- That was delicious, had a good amount of shrimp and vegetables and was creamy, I loved it.  Cobb Salad- It was big and came with the usual fixings but I've had better cobb's in my life.   Coconut Shrimp- Mmm...mmm...mmm...a must if you eat at this restaurant. Perfectly fried and packed with flavor.  Chocolate Pineapple Cake- I don't like chocolate but I do love pineapple and this dessert called to me. It was warm, rich, and melted in my mouth. I suggest sharing because it's very decadent...I needed a glass of water when I finished.   They have a large menu so there's something for everyone and they have a good selection of tropical alcoholic drinks.

TaugoRZsbXYAXX3IzJHEOQ.text: Always a must when we come to Vegas from LA. Great atmosphere, great service and great food

s4dSYsn5cbpoB4IsojBQNw.text: I used to work for Bahama Breeze, St. Louis, so I looked forward to going in and critiquing how this one was run.  The salmon I ordered was delicious, they have taken off the island rice, don't like the new rice.   Service was good as usual, the servers are always very knowledgeable about the menu and they did not charge me to make a weird substitution.   The garlic mashed potatoes recipe has clearly changed and they were very....well...shiny? If that makes sense, it was clear to me that they were not handmade or fresh like the used to be, so sorry, you lost a star over my potatoes.  Overall, enjoyable, they have very good specialty drinks. Bill was about $55.00 dollars before tip for three people, with one specialty drink on the bill and no desserts.

nqGI_omjmf37Rxlws6lLUw.text: Almost perfect. The service was super slow. I still tipped 10%. I was at the bar. So no excuse there. The food tasted  excellent and alcohol are awesome. Price is neck breaker on regular days!!! Go at happy hour!!!

43RRSbN9Bv4J7sELVRulbw.text: I ate here for the first time the other day, and I have 0 complaints! I was a little skeptical because I've never eaten at a Caribbean restaurant before but the food here is so so good!!! The waitress that we had was amazing as well, she was so funny and genuine. I would definitely recommend this place, and I can't wait to eat here again!

awwOJMsJ4eqV3rH3yFrylg.text: I love the Calypso Pasta with shrimp so much, that I learned to make it myself. West Indies Patties are soo good as well.

ltfDnKsWrG6FSAgGsau7_g.text: My family and I really enjoyed our first visit to Bahama Breeze. I have been meaning to try it for some time. We went in on a Saturday afternoon and they were not too busy. The food was pretty good, but the best part of the visit was the staff. When we first walked in, one of the servers walked up to my kids who were looking and the fountain and pulled two pennies out of his own pocket for them to throw into the fountain. When we were first sat it took a couple minutes for our waiter to come to the table and two of the other servers (who had just gotten off) noticed and without us having to ask went and found our server. Our server was also very friendly and did a great job. My family and I will definitely be returning to this restaurant in the future.

C-hAfCF8DvMObeEt2Y8pbQ.text: I Enjoy their drinks and the indoor/outdoor patio area. Fun relaxing place. Go a couple times a year whenever in town.

dW_M2Wvfe7zbNntPYnr-MA.text: Great service by nicky! Shes very sweet and attentive waitress ! But horrible attitude by maya the host. Very nasty attitude since we arrived till we cashed out like shes in a bad mood . Your a host your suppose to greet people girl not have a "I have diarrhea face"  . But everytime i visit vegas this place is a must go ! Great food.
